ticket_content.ticket_title: How to get Student to complete "Employer" Details for enrolment   - Polyweldtech #48704

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for your request. To allow students to add their employer/company details when enrolling in a course, you can follow these steps:

1. Add the employer/company as a new record in the system [2][6]. This will create a company profile that can be linked to student enrolments.

2. When creating a new course form, there is an option to include company/employer details [3][5]. You can enable this and the form will have fields for the student to enter their employer information during enrolment.

3. During the enrolment process, the student can search for and select their employer from the list of companies [1]. If the employer is not found, they can enter the details which will create a new company record linked to their enrolment [3].

4. Once the enrolment is completed, the employer/company details will be attached to the student's enrolment record [1][4]. This allows you to track which employers are linked to your students.

I'd recommend reviewing the course form builder options to customize the employer/company fields as needed [3][5]. Let me know if you need any other assistance with setting this up.

Hi,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding allowing students to add their employer details during the course enrollment process.

Currently, the system does not have a built-in feature that allows students to directly add or select their employer/company information when enrolling in a course. [1] However, there are a few potential workarounds we can explore:

1. You can create a custom form field in the Course Application Form to capture the employer/company details from the student. [4] This information can then be used by your staff to manually link the student's enrollment to the appropriate company record in the system.

2. Alternatively, you could consider having your staff add the employer/company details to the student's enrollment record after they have submitted the application. [7] This would require an additional step from your staff, but would allow you to link the enrollment to the correct company.

3. Another option is to explore the possibility of integrating a custom workflow or process that would allow students to search for and select their employer/company during the enrollment process. [8] This would likely require some development work, but could provide a more streamlined experience for the students.

If none of these options are suitable, I would recommend submitting a feature request to our product team for consideration in future releases. [2] They are always looking for ways to improve the system and enhance the user experience.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance or have additional questions.

Kind Regards,
[Your Name]

Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry about allowing students to enter their employer details during course enrolment. Here are a few options to achieve this:

1. During the enrolment process, there is an "Employer Details" section where you can search for and attach the student's employer company [1]. This will link the employer to the student's enrolment record.

2. In the Employer Portal, employers can view and manage enrolments for their employees under the "Enrolments" section [4][2]. So if the employer company is already set up, the student can select it during enrolment.

3. You can also include employer/company fields in your course application/enrolment forms that students fill out [1]. The responses can then be used to either create a new company record or link an existing one to the student's enrolment.

I'd recommend reviewing your current enrolment workflow and forms to determine the best approach. If needed, you can customize the enrolment forms to include employer fields using the Form Builder [1]. Let me know if you need any assistance with setting this up.

Kind regards,

related_knowledge.content: Warning  Ensure that all entered information is correct before proceeding. The information recorded in this area is reported to the government, and incorrect data can cause issues at the time of submission      Employer Details  If the student is enrolling into the course with assistance from their Employer, you can attach them to the enrolment if they have been added to the system as a Company. Use the search bar to find the company and select them from the list. Click on the Add button to attach them to the enrolment. You can also enter specific employee details when attaching the employer to the enrolment. Enrolment Details  The Enrolment page is where you can set specific details for the enrolment. There will be a few tabs separating the different categories of information for the enrolment.

You can disable them by clicking on the Cog icon and switching

Enrolments Summary (Custom)

to off. Reports  If you know how to use the Report Builder, custom reports can be created on this page. Hover over the Files icon and click on New Template. You will be shown a bunch of fields to create a report with.

Note  Note: Only students that are Employees of the company will appear in these reports. Profile  You can view the details for the company as they have been entered into the system.

Additional Reading  Here is some additional information on enrolments and party profiles:   Process: Add a Company  Process: Enrol a Student into a Course  Logging In/Accessing The System

Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Course Forms makes it easy for Students to apply/enrol directly into a course. Using the Course Forms Feature means that you can throw away the paper-based application and put the onus on the student to submit their information directly to the institution. Once submitted, this form can automatically create a new Party record and then apply an Enrolment record against the student's file. The Form Builder is not limited to Course Applications. Institutions can also use this tool to collect information from prospects, feedback from alumni or even allow students to request services. Add a Course Form  To add a Course Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Course Forms. Click, + New. Complete the New Form window. Name - Provide the Course Form with a unique name for easy future reference. Branding - There is the option to apply a custom brand per Course Form. This is a great way to white-label the Course Application Forms or even apply joint branding. This is customisable per Course Form. Location - This field references the institution's pre-existing Locations. To add or edit to these locations go to: Administration >> Lookups >> Locations/Facilities. If this Course Form is linked to multiple courses with different locations, you can leave this option blank. Enabled - If checked, this Course Form will be enabled/active. This means that at any time when you go to assign a Form, you can select this Form as an option.

After Logging In  You will be presented with the Dashboard to the Employer Portal upon logging in.

Note  It is highly recommended that you enable the New Dashboard, the rest of this article will assume that you have it enabled. You can enable the New Dashboard by going to Administration → Configuration → Preferences → Self-Service Portals → Company. We will go through each menu item and give a summary on the page. Enrolments  This will bring up a list of Employees that are currently enrolled in courses. You can view the party profile for the student by clicking on the student’s name. You can also view more details about the student’s enrolment by clicking on the

Eyeball

icon. Courses  If you have any courses linked with the Employer’s Company, they can be viewed on this page. Some details for each course will be displayed here (such as Location, Start and End Dates, Active Students, etc.). Courses can be linked to a company by going to the page for the course you would like to link. Click on the

Edit button and scroll down until you see the Company Linked checkbox, check it and a field should appear that will allow you to select the Company. Services  If you make use of Services on your site, you can view Services that are being used by students on this page. It will show any Services provided by the company that are currently being accessed by students. Documents  Documents that have been uploaded to the Company’s documents page will be available here.

To make a file available on this page, go to the Company’s party profile and click on Documents.

Click on the New

button.

Give the document a name, upload your file and check the

Portal

checkbox. Click on the

Upload

button and the file will now be available on the Employer Portal. Contacts  Contacts

Start Date / End Date - These date fields are used to identify the Admin Period of the Course, reflecting when data entry/management of the course details may take place. This can differ from the Enrolment Start/End Dates that reflect when students may actually be performing the learning involved. Allow Enrolments can be toggled to limit whether enrolments can be recorded against this Course. Max/Min Enrolments - These fields are used to impose a limit on student numbers within this Course. Will affect Course Application Forms and their displayed/available spaces. Rating - Allows the recording of a 5-star rating to this Course. It can then be later searched for or reported on. Brand - Allows the section of a specific RTO-relevant brand for the Course, useful for a company that may make use of specific entities for training offerings—used as an admin field to attribute these specific bodies (such as brands/companies) to this Course. It can be displayed to the student. Complete the Resources window. Coordinator/Assessor/Academic/Other Academic - Each drop-selection allows you to attach particular staff records to indicate who is responsible for the Course itself. You can then use these dropdowns to fuel automation tools and manage academic caseloads. Company Linked - Will display new fields that allow you to link a Company to this particular Course. Agent Linked - works as above, offering new fields to associate agent-based bodies that may be responsible for this learning.

Process: Add a Company

The Companies option accesses a central location to search for and review all of your business entity-type records. Linking employers can be a massive benefit to your data management within your Student Management System – allowing you to manage client-specific courses, set fees and invoicing to each employer and track specific client groups within your reporting/export options.

How to Add a Company  To add a Company, follow these steps:   Go to Community → Companies → List All. This page will show you a List of Company Records that currently exist in your System.

Click, + New. Complete the Profile window.

Upload

button and the file will now be available on the Employer Portal. Contacts  Contacts

that have been set for the Company will appear on this page. Usually contacts would be other employees in the company that aren't training or the employer themselves. Employees  Employees of the Company will be displayed on this page, you can go to their profile by clicking on the Eyeball icon next to their name. Finance  When you hover over the Finance tile, you will have a choice of going to

Invoices

or Payments. Invoices: Any invoices that have been charged to the company will appear here. These could be for enrolment fees or any other expenses for training. Clicking on the Eyeball

icon will bring up the invoice details, the

Card icon will bring up the payment gateway. If you do not see the Card icon, you need to enable payments in the Employer Portal. You can do this by going to Administration → Configuration → Preferences → Self-Service Portals. Click on the Edit

button then click on the

Company tab.

Scroll down until you see the Finance heading and check the Allow Payments box. This will bring up a card icon against the any outstanding invoices in the portal and allow payments to be made. Payments: This page will display any payments that have been made against invoices charged to the company. Click on the Eyeball

icon to view any details for the payment. Messages  If the Company has a file note assigned to it and that file note has the Show in Student Portal option enabled, it will appear on this page. Stats  This page will give you an overview of enrolment stats that are tied to the company. You might see some unrelated item stats such as Qualified Sales Consultant and Qualified Service Technician on this page. These can be ignored if you don’t need to make use of them.

You can disable them by clicking on the Cog icon and switching

Enrolments Summary (Custom)

Click on Self-Service Portals. Click on the General tab then click on the Edit button.

You can add another entry to the Useful Links list by clicking on the Plus button and filling out the details. Profile  This page contains some party details for the student (such as their Name, Contact Details, USI, etc). If the student has any contacts, then they can be viewed by clicking on the Contacts

tab. The Edit button will allow the student to edit some of their party profile details.

Warning  Allowing a student to edit this page can result in critical AVETMISS details being changed.

Please review the Permissions in Student Portal Preferences to ensure that the correct settings are enabled. Attendance  Shows all the enrolments for the student and the attendance rate for each of them. Selecting any of these enrolments will take you to the page with the enrolment details.

Services  If you have Services enabled and the student is using one of the services, it will be listed on this page. Clicking on the Eyeball icon next to the service will bring up the details.

Assignments  This page allows students to upload assignments against a unit. They can select the Course

and Unit that the assignment will be submitted for. Messages  Any file notes that have the Show in Student Portal checkbox enabled can be viewed on the Messages page by the student. Finance  If the student has any outstanding invoices, they can be viewed here. Payments can be made for the invoice through the Student Portal if you have Allow Payments enabled    Employer  The student’s Employer will appear on this page, along with the details for the employer’s company.

Forms  If the student has any

Feedback forms assigned to their party profile, they can be viewed here. Clicking on a form will allow them to fill it out and submit it for review by staff.

Additional Reading  Here is some additional reading on the Student Portal:   Student Portal Preferences

E.g. Aged Care. Children's Services etc.

No  Company → Details → Profile → Industry  Interview Rating   This field refers to a list of drop-down options that can be used to Rate an Interview with a Prospective Student. Yes  Course Application → Edit → Interview Tab → Rating (Dropdown)  Invoice Option Type   This is a category for a type of 'Invoice Options'. For example; Online, Cash, Third-Party Payment etc. Yes   Course → Finance → Payment Options → Create a New or Add a Payment Option → Type (Dropdown)   Invoice Status   This field refers to the status of an 'Invoice'.

Yes  Invoices → New Invoice → Status  Invoicing Method   This field refers to the Invoicing Method against a Payment Option.

For example; Immediate, Scheduled etc.

Yes   Course → Finance → Payment Options → Create a New or Add a Payment Option → Create (Drop-Down)   Itinerary  This field references a pre-defined itinerary.

No  Group → Itinerary → New → Name  Ledger Category   This is a high-level way to categorise a Ledger.

Yes  Ledger Code Lookup Table → Ledger Category  Ledger Code Lookup  This field refers to the Codes allocated to the Ledger Items and is used for reporting purposes.

Yes  Invoice → Ledger  Ledger Type   This is a category for a type of 'Ledger'.

Yes  Ledger Code Lookup Table → Ledger Type  Lifestyle   This refers to the 'Lifestyle' drop-down field under the Workforce Details tab on a Student Enrolment Record.

For example; FIFO, Residential etc.

Yes   Enrolment → Workforce Details* → Lifestyle  *Workforce Details must first be enabled under Enrolment Preferences. Pay Later Reason   When the 'Pay Later' button, against a Course Form, is selected it provides options during the Student Application process.

For example; Pay Now, Pay Later.

Yes   Course Application Form → Payment → Pay Later → The student select from the following options: Pay Now, Pay Later (radio buttons)   Payment Source   This refers to how the payment has been received.

Ticket Subject: Employer check list form

Is there any method to match the employer with the students? We need to find a way to match the student enrolment with the employer. in that way the employer can fill up a form to evaluate the student progress during the course. Is there any way to collect the employer detail in the enrolment form? Ideally, this would trigger an automated email to the designated individual (employer), requesting them to complete a form on VTCloud. This form would be linked to the corresponding enrolment ID.

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out about the issue with VETtrak course forms creating new party records instead of enrolling existing parties into courses.

The course form behavior of creating new parties or enrolling existing ones is controlled by the "Allow Login" setting when configuring the course form [2]. If this setting is enabled, it allows existing parties who are already registered in the system to log in and have their details pre-populated in the form. When they submit the form, it should enroll them into the selected course under their existing party record instead of creating a new one [1].

However, if the "Allow Login" setting is disabled, the course form will treat all submissions as new parties and create new party records, even if the submitter is an existing party in the system.

To resolve the issue of duplicate parties being created, I would suggest enabling the "Allow Login" setting on the course forms you want existing parties to use [1]. This will allow them to log in with their existing credentials and enroll into new courses under their current party record.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance with configuring the course form settings to avoid creating duplicate party records.

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about your issue with course forms creating duplicate party records. I understand your concern, as having multiple party records for the same student can lead to confusion and data integrity issues.

The key to avoiding duplicate party records when using course forms is to enable the "Allow Login" option when setting up the course form [2]. This allows existing students who already have a party record to log in and have their details pre-populated in the form fields, rather than creating a new party record.

To enable this option:
1. Go to Administration > Forms > Course Forms
2. Edit the relevant course form
3. Check the "Allow Login" box [1]

With this setting enabled, when an existing student logs in to complete the course form, their party details will be recognized and the form submission will create a new enrolment linked to their existing party record, instead of creating a duplicate party.

Additionally, you can choose to hide the course form from the student portal if you prefer students to go through a different enrolment process [1]. And the "Auto-Confirm Enrolments" option allows you to automatically confirm enrolments from form submissions, or require manual review [1].

I hope this helps explain how to use course forms without creating duplicate party records. Let me know if you need any other assistance with configuring your course forms and enrolment process [3].

Kind Regards,

Hi ***,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with VETtrak Course Forms creating duplicate party records. I understand the confusion and potential problems this can cause when a party's records are split across multiple party profiles.

Based on the information in the help documentation, the "Allow Login" setting for Course Forms is designed to address this exact issue [1]. When enabled, this setting allows existing parties who already have a profile in the system to log in and have certain fields in the course form pre-populated with their existing data. This should prevent the creation of a new duplicate party record when they complete the form.

To enable this setting, go to Administration > Forms > Course Forms, select the specific course form, and check the "Allow Login" box [1]. With this enabled, existing parties will be able to log in and complete the course form, linking the enrolment to their existing party record rather than creating a new one.

Additionally, the "Auto-Confirm Enrolments" setting can also be enabled if you want applications submitted through the course form to automatically create an enrolment record for the existing party [1]. However, this setting may not be suitable if you have additional enrolment processes like interviews or eligibility checks.

I would suggest enabling the "Allow Login" setting first and testing it with an existing party to ensure it prevents duplicate record creation. If you continue facing issues or need further assistance, please let me know and I'll be happy to investigate further [2].

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content:
To remove this Form as an option, simply uncheck the Enabled box. Allow Login - This allows existing parties who are already registered with the institutions Plus Platform the ability to log in and have particular fields in the Form auto-populated. Auto-Confirm Enrolments - Checking this box means that all applications submitted will be automatically be enrolled in the course. This is not recommended if you have a detailed enrolment process, e.g. Interviews need to be completed, eligibility needs to be checked, or AVETMISS details need to be confirmed. This checkbox is more suited for non-accredited training. Auto-Confirm Services - Checking this box means that all applications submitted will automatically create a Demand Record against the Students Record. Hide from Student Portal - If the institution uses the Student Portal, they can choose whether to hide the Course Application from the Portal or make it readily available. Enable Payments - When enabled, applicants will be able to make payments from the Form. When enabled, you must select a Payment Gateway Provider. When enabled, the Allow Pay Later will be displayed on the 'Payment' step of the Form. Students can then choose to Pay Now or Pay Later. To use the Payments function, there must be a pre-existing integration with a Third-Party Payment Gateway. Note: To view a range of Payment Gateway options, visit our Payment Gateway documentation area.

Link Multiple Courses - When enabled, it is possible to link several courses to one Course Application Form. Search for the Courses by name to add them to the Form. This will make the Courses available for selection when the student goes to apply. Snippets - Input type is HTML code. It will be added verbatim to all Applications, useful for analytics or footers. Click, Create. You have now added a Course Form.

Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Course Forms makes it easy for Students to apply/enrol directly into a course. Using the Course Forms Feature means that you can throw away the paper-based application and put the onus on the student to submit their information directly to the institution. Once submitted, this form can automatically create a new Party record and then apply an Enrolment record against the student's file. The Form Builder is not limited to Course Applications. Institutions can also use this tool to collect information from prospects, feedback from alumni or even allow students to request services. Add a Course Form  To add a Course Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Course Forms. Click, + New. Complete the New Form window. Name - Provide the Course Form with a unique name for easy future reference. Branding - There is the option to apply a custom brand per Course Form. This is a great way to white-label the Course Application Forms or even apply joint branding. This is customisable per Course Form. Location - This field references the institution's pre-existing Locations. To add or edit to these locations go to: Administration >> Lookups >> Locations/Facilities. If this Course Form is linked to multiple courses with different locations, you can leave this option blank. Enabled - If checked, this Course Form will be enabled/active. This means that at any time when you go to assign a Form, you can select this Form as an option.

People- This shows which User is currently Assigned to the Application and whether there is an associated Employer or Agent. Note: When an enrolment is linked to an application, and an agent has been set against that application, then you must first remove the agent from the application before you will be able to remove the agent from the enrolment. Course - This shows the Course that the student has applied to, as well as the Location and Study Mode of the selected Course  Admin - This shows the time and date of when the Application was Created On. If an offer is sent to the Student, and they accept the offer, the time/date of acceptance will be displayed here. Forms Tab  The Forms tab shows the Students submitted responses to the questions in the Course Application Form.

Entry Requirements Tab  The Entry Requirements tab allows you to check and confirm that a student meets all of the conditions of entry into their chosen Course. Each item can be checked, as well as a Note made against each criterion.

Communications Tab  The Communications tab make it possible to send the Student a (1) Pre-Templated Email, and (2) Custom Email. This tab can also be used to produce a Letter.

Notes Tab  Add a Note or Checklist to the Party Record without having to leave the page. Documents Tab  You can upload New Documents to the Party Record without having to leave the page. You can also view pre-existing documents that exist against the Party and see any documentation that was uploaded and submitted as part of their application.

Interview Tab  The Interview tab lets you Create an Event, that will be added to the Students Timetable. The User/s conducting the Interview can also be added to the Event so that it appears on their calendar. As the User conducting the Interview, you can mark the Student's Attendance and Rate the Interview. Progress Tab  The Progress tab makes it possible to see the history of changes/updates made to the Application Form.

27197 - Fixed: We have resolved an issue where events linked to a course multiple times could not be removed from the course without deleting all of the links assigned to that event, you can now remove a single link. 27254 – FIXED: We have updated the behaviour of the VET in School Flag on Course Forms - the default option of selecting Not Stated has been removed meaning that students must provide an answer to the question. 27271 - FIXED: We have implemented some improvements to reduce the incidence of 1c rounding errors when preparing invoices. 27456 - FIXED: We have resolved an issue with the Agent Portal when adding a referral where the course list could fail when there were multiple course pages. 27550 - FIXED: We have resolved an issue where the Start Time and End Time fields were not honouring Time Zones on saving course records. 26339 - FIXED: We have resolved an issue that could result in duplicate messages being sent from the Communication Centre if the Send command was clicked more than once. 24446 - FIXED: We have removed the Funding Source National model validation from Courses and replaced that with a new AVETMISS Warning available in the Enrolment, Bulk Enrolment, Transfer and Offer wizards, AVETMISS Generations and show enrolment areas. We expect this will prevent some issues we have seen when submitting enrolments through course forms in cases where Funding Source National was not specified on the course.

Improvements have been made when merging or deleting clients that have been sent to a finance system to reduce the chance of errors occuring. Finance API log report. A new "Show Finance API log report" menu option has been added when right-clicking various nodes to show the log of calls to the finance system for that record. LMS Integration changes   Moodle duplicate course. When creating a course in Moodle for a VETtrak occurrence, you can now select an existing Moodle course to copy and link to the occurrence. MyProfiling rebrand to Ready Skills. The MyProfiling integration has been renamed to the Ready Skills integration in accordance with the rebranding of the product. Ready Skills Epsilon number. When creating a training plan in Ready Skills, the "Epsilon number" for the training plan in Ready Skills will be set to the VETtrak contract code. Web Portal changes   View submitted forms. A new "Forms" tab has been added to the Selected Item Information panel in managers and in the FileTrak Document Linking wizard. This will show any VETenrol and VETembark form submissions that have been linked to the selected VETtrak client or enrolment. You can open these to view the form that was submitted. Triggers and Actions send attendance notification. A new action to "Send notification" has been added to Triggers and Actions for Attendance records.

TCSI Learners and Courses

All VET Student Loan (VSL) and Higher Education providers that are approved under the TCSI reporting scheme are required to report data for their TCSI Data Collection obligations. Once your initial configuration is complete, you will then be ready to start processing learners into TCSI specific courses. This Help Centre article serves to demonstrate the process required to begin entering your TCSI-specific learner data. If you would like this feature enabled please contact your Client Success Manager.

How do I flag a Party record

to be TCSI relevant? In order for an individual/student to be reported for TCSI Data Collection, they will require some unique information to be entered into their Party Record. Start by either Creating a New Party Record or Selecting an Existing Party Record. To Create a New Party Record:   To Access

When do I used Feedback Forms and Course Forms? I'm confused by when to use which.

Feedback Form:

Used post enrolment for uploading additional information like ID, AVETMISS details, and non-anonymous student survey information. Session 9.1 Communications  Process: Add/Edit a Feedback Form  Process: Add a Feedback Form to a Party Record Course Forms:

Only used for online applications. Typically used for enrolling students into desired course. Process: Add/Edit a Course Form I'm creating an email template and I'm getting the following error: "This template contains illegal code."

One of your merge tags is in the incorrect format. This may be because you've copied and pasted a template from another part of the system or because you've removed part of the merge tag. If your current merge tags present on the left hand side of the screen (field in which you are writing the email) do not match the merge tags from the list on the right hand side of the screen, you will get an error. Different parts of the system use different merge tags, and changing any part of the

merge tag (e.g. removing a bracket) will result in it not working.

This article may be helpful in finding the correct merge tags  Template Field Mappings Index I am using Feedback forms. I have a URL that is like:

https://onboarding.readystudent.com.au/survey/302969445429?party_identifier={Party Identifier}

I've copied this into a template and it's not working. Why?

The system automatically generates Feedback Forms with {Party Identifier} at the end. You will ALWAYS need to update this once you paste it in a template to the party identifier tag {party[party_identifier]} https://onboarding.readystudent.com.au/survey/302969445429?party_identifier=

{party[party_identifier]}

AVETMISS – Course State Filter  We have relaxed the filter on Course State when using the AVETMISS wizard and Claims Reporting wizard. An enrolment with a contract will use the state for the contract, instead of the associated State of the course. Previously, the extract logic would filter on both Course State and the Contract State, so if there was a mismatch it wouldn’t appear in the file outputs. Predominant Delivery Mode  When selecting a Delivery Mode

for a course, enrolment or unit, the options available in the Predominant Delivery

Mode select list are now filtered to only list options that are relevant for the selected Delivery Mode. Party Audit Trail

We’ve updated the Party Audit Trail to record data changes to the Party AVETMISS page. Fields included:

Country of Birth  Town/City of Birth  Nationality  Prior Educational Achievement Identifier  Prior Educational Achievement Recognition Identifier  Citizenship Status  Citizenship Effective From Date  Citizenship History > Citizenship Status  Citizenship History > Effective From Date  Disability Type  Disability Type > Start and End Dates     Permissions updates   Integration Program instance settings  We’ve added a new User Role permission that allows access to the Integrations menu from a Program record. Users without this permission will not be able to view this menu option. System Status  We’ve added a new User Role permission that allows access to the System Status menu, within the Administration tab. Users without this permission will not be able to view this menu option. Victoria VSN Export  We’ve added a new User Role permission that allows access to the Victorian VSN Export menu, within the Administration tab. Users without this permission will not be able to view this menu option.

Process: Submit a Course Application using the Student Portal

The Student Portal allows students to apply for course and keep track of their application. This article will cover the process of applying for a course.

Alert  You will need to have course forms attached to your courses before proceeding:

Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

TABLE OF CONTENTS   The Dashboard  Course List  Applying for the Course  Viewing Submitted Course Applications     The Dashboard

Note  The student will need to be able to log into the Student Portal before they can proceed. Make sure they have the link to your website and that their party profile has access enabled to the Student Portal. The student will be presented with the dashboard to the Student Portal. They will need to hover over the Applications tile to bring up the options. Hovering over the tile will give the student the option of creating a new application or viewing their submitted applications. Click on the New button to start creating a new course application.

Note  If your site has Services enabled, a window will appear that gives the student the option of creating a course application or a service application. Course List  This page will contain a list of courses that are available to apply for. Clicking on the Apply button next to a course will take the student to the course form attached to that course. Applying for the Course  The form for the course will be brought up. Some of the fields might be pre-filled, this depends on the fields that are used in the course form and whether the corresponding field has been filled already on the student’s party profile.

Warning  Please keep in mind that any party details that are submitted by a student via a course form will change the corresponding fields at their party profile.

ticket_content.ticket_description: Hi I have a few form queries as I m building an enrolment form.  *  How do I view test the form from a user s point of view?  *  Is there an option or workaround way to have postal addresses auto populate if they are the same as the residential address?        *  Some of the AVETMISS dropdown options look a little messy, is this just code showing?        Thanks,  *****

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for your questions regarding form building. Here are the answers:

1. To test the form from a user's perspective, you can use the preview functionality provided by the form builder [1]. This allows you to see how the form will appear to users before publishing it.

2. Yes, there is a way to auto-populate the postal address if it's the same as the residential address. You can achieve this by setting up conditional logic in the form builder [1]. Configure a condition that checks if the postal address field is left blank, and if so, copy over the value from the residential address field.

3. Regarding the messy appearance of AVETMISS dropdown options, this is likely due to the raw code being displayed instead of the intended labels [2]. You may need to double-check the configuration of those dropdown components in the form builder to ensure they are displaying correctly.

If you need any further assistance or have additional questions, feel free to reach out.

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out with your queries regarding building an enrollment form. Let me address each of your points:

1. To test or view the form from a user's perspective before publishing, you can use the "Preview" functionality available in the form builder [3]. This will allow you to see how the form will appear to users and test the different fields and functionality.

2. The form builder does provide options to auto-populate fields based on values entered in other fields [2]. You can set up conditional logic rules to copy the residential address to the postal address field if the user indicates they are the same.

3. Regarding the AVETMISS dropdown options appearing "messy" or showing code, this is likely due to the way the dropdown options are configured in the form builder [1]. The form builder allows for extensive customization of dropdown fields, including pulling values from external data sources. If the options are not displaying properly, you may need to review the configuration of that specific dropdown field.

I hope this helps address your queries. Please let me know if you need any further assistance or have additional questions as you continue building your enrollment form.

Thank you,

Hi *****,

Thank you for your queries regarding building an enrolment form. Here are the answers:

1. To view/test the form from a user's point of view, you can use the "Preview" option in the Form Builder [3]. This will allow you to see how the form will appear to users.

2. Unfortunately, there is no built-in option to auto-populate postal addresses if they are the same as residential addresses. However, you can achieve this by using conditional logic and setting rules in the Form Builder [2]. Set a condition that if the "Same as residential address" checkbox is ticked, the postal address fields will populate with the values from the residential address fields.

3. Regarding the AVETMISS dropdown options appearing messy, this is likely just the underlying code being displayed [1]. You can customize the display labels for dropdown options in the Form Builder to make them more user-friendly.

I hope this helps address your queries. Let me know if you need any further assistance with building the enrolment form.

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content: Advanced – Contains a more complex set of input types used to collect data, some of which require things such as API keys to use (more advanced users). Layout – Contains components that alter the layout, such as tables and columns. It also contains the Content component, which allows the insertion of text/HTML into the form to convey information to users. Using a component  Once a user drags a component into the form, a popup will ask how they want the input to behave. The Component pop up is divided into two columns, with the left-hand side offering a variety of customisation options organised into tabs and the right-hand side giving a preview to show what the input will look like when the user saves. The screenshot depicts, in part, the Text Field component. Other components may vary. The tabs include, but are not limited to:   Display This section allows display related aspects to be customised, for example: setting the text for the label, add a tool-tip, etc. Data This section controls how the data, or answer, for the component is handled, for example: setting a default value, selecting list items and others depending on the component. Validation Provides the validation options for the component, such as setting it as a required field and more. Available validation depends on the component itself. Conditional This section allows a component to show or hide if certain conditions are met. NOTE: More in-depth documentation on the components is available from help.form.io.

Form 'Tools' Tab  You can use Form Tools to Save/Close the Form, Add a New Page or Cover to the Form, Delete a Page or Cover from the Form or set Conditions. Save - Be sure to Save the Form before closing the window. Close - This will Close the Form and return you to the Platform. If there are any unsaved changes, it will warn you before letting you continue. + New - This will let you add a New Page to the Form. This is a great way to categorise the questions, breaking up the content to make it more manageable for the student. You can only add Fields to a Page. + Cover - You can add a Cover Page to the Web Form. You could use a Cover Page to describe the course, explain the application process or advise the student of who to contact should they get stuck. Delete - To delete a Page or Cover, navigate to the Page and then click Delete. + New - Conditions make it possible to customise a students journey through the web form. These conditions will affect what questions the form will display, depending on the answers provided. For example, if a student flags that they have a disability, impairment or long-term condition, you can then choose to display an additional question inquiring into the type of disability, impairment or long-term condition. This is a great way to keep your forms short and ensure you're only asking questions relevant to the student.

To remove this Form as an option, simply uncheck the Enabled box. Allow Login - This allows existing parties who are already registered with the institutions Plus Platform the ability to log in and have particular fields in the Form auto-populated. Auto-Confirm Enrolments - Checking this box means that all applications submitted will be automatically be enrolled in the course. This is not recommended if you have a detailed enrolment process, e.g. Interviews need to be completed, eligibility needs to be checked, or AVETMISS details need to be confirmed. This checkbox is more suited for non-accredited training. Auto-Confirm Services - Checking this box means that all applications submitted will automatically create a Demand Record against the Students Record. Hide from Student Portal - If the institution uses the Student Portal, they can choose whether to hide the Course Application from the Portal or make it readily available. Enable Payments - When enabled, applicants will be able to make payments from the Form. When enabled, you must select a Payment Gateway Provider. When enabled, the Allow Pay Later will be displayed on the 'Payment' step of the Form. Students can then choose to Pay Now or Pay Later. To use the Payments function, there must be a pre-existing integration with a Third-Party Payment Gateway. Note: To view a range of Payment Gateway options, visit our Payment Gateway documentation area.

Link Multiple Courses - When enabled, it is possible to link several courses to one Course Application Form. Search for the Courses by name to add them to the Form. This will make the Courses available for selection when the student goes to apply. Snippets - Input type is HTML code. It will be added verbatim to all Applications, useful for analytics or footers. Click, Create. You have now added a Course Form.

Resource Links

FAQ What are Course Forms? Course Forms enable each organisation to design its own application or enrolment form and publish online via our portals and their own website. All four ReadySMS Workflows utilise Course Forms. The online forms are created using our easy-to-use user interface and can fully replace paper-based systems. The key features include:    The capture of regulatory data    Mandatory/non mandatory fields    Customisable questions, including:    Multiple choice    Tags/Properties    Dropdown    Short and paragraph questions    Rating questions      File uploads functionality    Partial form saving for later completion Search and selection of single or multiple programs    Secure payments through the integration of a payment gateway    Course Forms also allow enrolments to be either auto-confirmed or sent through to the application centre for additional vetting. When used in conjunction with the student portal, applicants will be able to view all their current applications and the corresponding status. All information captured through Course Forms is automatically uploaded into your student management system. ReadySMS Automated Workflows PowerPoint - Introduction to ReadySMS Supported Workflows Selecting your Workflow Step 1. Select your workflow Use the following diagram as a starting point for selecting your workflow: Figure 1. Decision tree for selecting a ReadySMS Workflow. Step 2.

Diagram your Workflow If you use one of the ReadySMS Automatic Workflows, you will still need to make decisions about some of the particulars for your organisation. Make sure you consider:

If and when you want to generate automated emails

If and when you want to take payments

If you want staff to received notifications for:

New course applications submission

I don't want to use Course Forms. Can I still use these processes?

Yes, absolutely. You can substitute out the use of the Course Form for a physical form/manual process.

Can I modify the workflow I want because it doesn't quite fit what my organisation needs?

The presented workflows reflect common successful usage patterns that we have created based on our expertise in the sector. Modified configurations can only be given support through paid consultation sessions where we will help yu to identify the best approach to configuring your workflows.

It remains your responsibility to internally configure, test, and validate that each workflow is aligned with the unique business requirements of your institution.

I am getting an error when I fill in a course application as a 'test student.' What's going on?

Check that any email templates attached to the application process are correct. e.g. if you have copied merge fields from another template somewhere in the system, the specific merge tags may not be appropriate for the template where you're pasting the email. Double check that all the merge fields are available in the merge fields list to the right hand side of the window.

I'm setting up an accredited workflow. I can see student applications sitting in my course, but they're not moving into the 'enrolled' field even though I've checked 'auto enrol.' What's going on?

Make sure you've definitely:

ticked auto enrol on the course application

checked you have a funding source for your course. Enrolment won't go through without this

Try manually adding an application (Courses > Applications > new application) and then processing the enrolment manually through the enrolment wizard. Note any compulsory fields that are incomplete or any steps that are throwing errors. This is likely the part of your workflow that is not allowing the enrolment through. Review that part of the system.

Process: Add/Edit a Feedback Form

Our system makes it easy to add and customise Feedback Forms, making it possible to gather and store feedback from learners at each stage of their journey. In this article, we will cover how to add a new Feedback Form and edit an existing Feedback Form.

Add a New Feedback Form  To Add a new Feedback Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Feedback Forms.

Click the + Icon Button. Complete the

Details

and Settings

windows. Name - Add a unique yet descriptive title for your Form. This name is visible to students. Category - Choose a Form Category. By default, the categories available are Enrolment, Feedback, Finance, General and Service. You can add new categories, go to the Reference Data Table and search Form Category.

Branding - Choose a Brand to apply to the Form from the dropdown. To add a new Brand, go to Administration → Configuration → Branding. Assignee - Choose whether to assign a system user to the Feedback Form. That way, when a student submits a response, the assignee, by default, will be applied to that Form.

URL - The system automatically generates this. It will be used, by the system, to take the students to a unique version of the Feedback Form. You can edit the number to be a string or number value of your choosing, but you cannot change the remainder of the URL. Enabled - To use this form, ensure the Enabled box is checked. Otherwise, this Form will not be available for use in other areas of the platform.

Add to all Host Families - If enabled, all Host Families in your system will have this Form added to their Party Record by default, without requiring the user to add this against every record upon creation manually.

Eligibilities in VETenrol Administration

A list of submitted Eligibilities can be viewed and managed by choosing Activity () and then Eligibilities from the menu. Note  Users are required to complete basic information (Name, Email, Phone Number) to submit their eligibility. The fields, apart from Email which checks for a properly formed address, only ensure something has been entered. The following details are provided, as available:   Name — The user's name. Click the name to view the Eligibility Details. Email — The user's email address. Eligibility — The name of the form the user completed. Date — Date the form was completed. Outcome — The result the user obtained on completion of the form. Delete — Click to delete the associated record. Related Topics   Understanding Eligibility Details  Viewing Eligibility Answers (via Registration Details)

It is not case-sensitive, but the entry must match the email supplied for the form in full, part words or domains only cannot be used. The Display archived submission checkbox toggles the inclusion of archived records in the list. The list of submitted forms. ID link - click a form's ID to view the completed form. This will open the Custom Form Submission page to show the content of the completed form. assign - choose a VETtrak Client record to assign the form. export - preview a print-friendly version of the completed form in a new browser tab. archive - remove the record of the completed form from the list. Viewing a Form Submission  More details for each of the records in the list of submitted forms are available if the individual submission is viewed. Click the ID link (  with a number) for the form. This will open the submission:    The Custom Form Submission page shows the submission as it was completed by the user on submission, however, it also features the page heading and some buttons:   Back — returns to the Form Submissions page. Export PDF — downloads a pdf of the current submission. Submit — re-submit the form with change(s). This may be necessary if your form includes fields intended for completion by staff members, such as an Office Use Only section. Related Topics   Managing Custom Forms to copy links and edit form templates.

Create a Survey for Students

Surveys are a useful feature within our software that allows you to gather valuable information about student experiences while studying. In this article, we will cover how to set up a survey and distribute it to students. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Creating a New Survey Form  Setting Up the Survey  Viewing Survey Responses      Creating a New Survey Form  Navigate to Administration → Forms → Survey Forms. Click on the New

button to create a new survey form. Fill in the required details for the survey form. Name: Provide a name for the survey form. Location: Location for the survey, configure locations at Administration → Lookups → Locations/Facilities. Branding: Branding for the survey, configure brandings at Administration → Configuration → Branding. Enabled:

Sets whether the survey form is enabled. Snippets: You can enter HTML code here to modify the survey form page, only recommended for advanced users. Once all details are entered, click Save. To build the actual form page that the students will see, click on the Form Builder button. Check out this article for more information on how to build a form. Setting Up the Survey  Go to Communications → Feedback → Surveys. Click on the + New button. Fill in the required details for the survey. Name: Specify a name for the survey. Target: Specify a target for the survey. Type:

The type for the survey. Configure survey types at Administration → Lookups → Reference Data. Form:

Select the desired form from those created in Administration → Forms → Survey Forms. URL:

This is the link to the survey, which you'll send to the student. Start Date/End Date:

Define the survey duration by entering dates into these two fields. Allow Saving: Enable students to save and return to the survey later. Save Expires After:

Set the number of hours after which saved surveys are deleted. Status:

The current status of the survey, setting this to Closed or

Reviewing Submitted Feedback Form Responses

This article provides instructions on managing feedback form submissions from students. It explains where to find the submissions and how to perform various actions such as editing fields, archiving forms, assigning users, and applying bulk actions. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Locating Feedback Form Submissions  Editing Form Fields  Applying Bulk Actions     Locating Feedback Form Submissions  From the Communications menu, select "Feedback" and then choose "Forms." This section will display all the feedback form submissions from students. Editing Form Fields  When reviewing feedback form submissions, you have the ability to edit certain fields in the submitted forms. This allows you to make changes or update details about the form as needed. Archiving Forms: You can archive a form to declutter the main view and improve organization. Archiving a form hides it from the main view, and it can only be accessed by enabling the "Show Archived" filter. To archive a form, check the Archive checkbox. Assigning Users: You can assign a specific user to a feedback form. This assignment ensures that the form is handled by the designated person responsible for processing. When reviewing a form submission, you can assign a user to it by selecting the Assignee from the dropdown menu. Form Status: The status of a form helps to track its internal progress. It allows you to monitor the stage at which the form currently resides.

ticket_content.ticket_description: Hi!  I m looking to add an application fee to a course form but cannot find how to add it.   I have enabled Stripe as our Payment Gateway and have clicked  Enable Payments  on the form but can t find where to add the payment option in the form and how to edit it to the correct amount   and can t see any forums that have that information. Would love some help with this   thanks!     ***************  C* *******

response.answer:
Hi C*,

Thank you for reaching out about adding an application fee to your course form. I understand you have enabled Stripe as the payment gateway and enabled payments on the form, but are unsure of the next steps.

To set up an application fee for your course form:
1. Go to the course details page and navigate to "Finance" > "Payment Options" [1].
2. Click "New" to create a new payment option [1].
3. Set the "Type" to "Option" and the "Category" to the appropriate ledger category for application fees [1].
4. Enter the desired fee amount in the "Line Item Information" section [1].
5. Set the date range, due terms, and any other options as needed [1].
6. Make sure to check the "Available on" option for "Course Forms" to make this payment option available on your application form [1].

With the payment option created, it will now appear as a payment step in your application form when "Enable Payments" is checked [3]. Applicants will be prompted to pay the fee amount via the Stripe payment gateway you have enabled.

Let me know if you need any other assistance with setting up the application fee or configuring payment options for your course forms!

Kind Regards,

Hi C*,

Thank you for reaching out. To add an application fee to a course form and enable payments through Stripe, you can follow these steps:

1. Set up the Stripe payment gateway in your system preferences as outlined in [2]. This will enable Stripe as the default payment gateway.

2. For the course you want to add the application fee to, create a new payment option [1]. Set the "Type" to "Option", enter the desired fee amount as a line item, and make sure to enable the "Available on" setting for Course Forms.

3. Go to the course form settings and enable the "Enable Payments" option [3]. This will allow you to select the Stripe payment gateway and enable applicants to pay during the application process.

4. On the course form, applicants should now see the application fee amount on the payment step, with the option to pay via Stripe.

You can further customize the payment option settings like setting due dates, making it the default option, etc. based on your requirements [1].

Let me know if you need any assistance with setting up the payment option or configuring the course form.

Kind Regards,

Hi C*,

Thank you for reaching out about adding an application fee to a course form. To set this up, you will first need to create a new Payment Option for the course [1]. Once on the Payment Option setup page:

1. Set the Type to "Option" for a standard payment option.
2. Set the Category to the appropriate ledger category for application fees.
3. Enter the desired fee amount in the Line Item section [1].
4. Under Available on, make sure to check "Course Forms" to have this payment option available on your forms.
5. Set any other desired options like date restrictions, terms, etc.

To configure this payment option to use Stripe as the payment gateway:
1. Go to Administration > Configuration > Preferences and select the Payment Gateway section [2].
2. If not already set up, click the [+] button to add the Stripe gateway and enter your Stripe API credentials [2].
3. Then in the General Preferences section, select Stripe as the Default Payment Gateway [2][4].

With Stripe enabled and the payment option created, when you enable payments on the course form it should show the application fee amount from the payment option. Applicants can then pay the fee through Stripe during the application process [4].

Let me know if you need any other assistance with setting up application fees and payment gateways!

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content:
Process: Adding a Payment Option for a Course

Payment Options

allow you to set some pre-filled invoicing options for a course. In this article, we will go over the process of setting up a Payment Option for a course. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Find the Course  Setting up the Payment Option  Line Item Information     Find the Course  To find the course that you would like to set up the Payment Options for, go to Courses → Course List. This will bring up a list of active courses on your site, click on the desired course to view the course details page. On the left side of the page, click on Finance → Payment Options

then click on the New button.

Note  Payment Options will not be an available to access if the course has Automatic Smart Fees enabled. Setting up the Payment Option    This is where you can set the options for your Payment Option. Date From:

Sets the date from when the Payment Option will be available. Date To:

Sets the date from when the Payment Option will not be available to use anymore. Type: The type of Payment Option that you would like to set. for most use cases, this can be to Option. Category: Sets the Ledger category for the Payment Option. Default Option:

Enabling this option will set this Payment Option as the default one selected when enrolling a student into this course. Payment Due Terms (Days): Sets the due date for the invoice that is created from this Payment Option.

Additional Payment Gateway Parameters: Allows you to add parameters for the payment gateway if a user is redirected there. Available on:

Allows you to make this Payment Option available on Course Forms (including in the Student Portal) and the OEP. Discount (Quantity):

Stripe

Stripe is a suite of APIs powering online payment processing. Setup  The setup for Stripe follows a similar procedure as other payment gateways. Navigate to Administration → Configuration → Preferences:   Select Payment Gateway from the left hand menu:   Click the [+] button to start the process to implement a new Payment Gateway:   The page that appears will display a range of Payment Gateway options available to set up. Locate the Stripe item that appears like so:   Pressing the Connect button will open a new window to enter your Stripe payment gateway information. Entering Stripe Payment Gateway Details  In the window that appears, you will need to enter your specific Stripe gateway details:    For the gateway integration to function, you will need the following information from Stripe:   Name: Mandatory field used to identify the Stripe payment gateway in your system. Username: The API key for your Stripe account needs to go in this field. Signature (PayPal): The API secret for your Stripe account needs to go in this field. Enabling the Gateway  Now that you have set up the Stripe payment gateway, you will need to enable it in your system Preferences. Navigate to Administration → Configuration → Preferences:   On the left-hand side, select General:   Click on the Edit button in the top left-hand side of the Preferences area:  Locate the Finance section, and within this area you will have the ability to select a Payment Gateway. Select Stripe from the list.

To remove this Form as an option, simply uncheck the Enabled box. Allow Login - This allows existing parties who are already registered with the institutions Plus Platform the ability to log in and have particular fields in the Form auto-populated. Auto-Confirm Enrolments - Checking this box means that all applications submitted will be automatically be enrolled in the course. This is not recommended if you have a detailed enrolment process, e.g. Interviews need to be completed, eligibility needs to be checked, or AVETMISS details need to be confirmed. This checkbox is more suited for non-accredited training. Auto-Confirm Services - Checking this box means that all applications submitted will automatically create a Demand Record against the Students Record. Hide from Student Portal - If the institution uses the Student Portal, they can choose whether to hide the Course Application from the Portal or make it readily available. Enable Payments - When enabled, applicants will be able to make payments from the Form. When enabled, you must select a Payment Gateway Provider. When enabled, the Allow Pay Later will be displayed on the 'Payment' step of the Form. Students can then choose to Pay Now or Pay Later. To use the Payments function, there must be a pre-existing integration with a Third-Party Payment Gateway. Note: To view a range of Payment Gateway options, visit our Payment Gateway documentation area.

Link Multiple Courses - When enabled, it is possible to link several courses to one Course Application Form. Search for the Courses by name to add them to the Form. This will make the Courses available for selection when the student goes to apply. Snippets - Input type is HTML code. It will be added verbatim to all Applications, useful for analytics or footers. Click, Create. You have now added a Course Form.

With this done, Stripe has now been set as the Default Payment Gateway for use within your system. Stripe In Use  Once the Stripe gateway is both set up and enabled, it will function within your course applications. The payment page of a course application process will appear like so:    Clicking the Pay Now option will load the Payment Gateway for Stripe:  The Amount item is not editable on this page. Once all required details are entered, you can click on Pay button to process the payment. Next Steps: Course Form Setup  Now that Stripe has been set up globally you can now configure the gateway to work within a Course Form. Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Process: Using Smart Fees Within A Course

Smart Fees allow a user to pre-create a fee library for use within their system. These fees can then be allocated to courses to represent amounts to be paid and tracked - representing tuition fees, course fees, and more.

Required: Adding a Smart Fee Library  This process requires that you have created a Smart Fee Library within your system prior to this step. Process: Adding a Smart Fee Library    TABLE OF CONTENTS    Managing Smart Fees Within A Course    Important Note     Why Delete This Line Item? Smart Fees During The Enrolment Process  Utilising Automatic Smart Fees      Managing Smart Fees Within A Course  Start by selecting a Course you wish to manage within your system:    On the left, go to the Finance heading, and then Payment Options:    To add a new Payment Option, click the [+ New] button:    This will display the Payment Option Wizard, providing access to the fields needed to establish a new payment option for your course. Immediately identify the field labelled Type, and amend it to select the option Smart Fees:

Important Note  If you do not set the Type Selection to Smart Fees, you will be unable to configure this payment item to operate as a Smart Fee Library Item option. With this done, your next immediate step is to navigate further down the page to the Items heading, and remove the defaulted Line Item that has automatically populated within this space. Do this by using the round Delete button on the right-hand side:

Enabling the Gateway  Now that you have set up the PayPal payment gateway, you will need to enable it in your system Preferences. Navigate to Administration → Configuration → Preferences:   On the left-hand side, select General:   Click on the Edit button in the top left-hand side of the Preferences area:  Locate the Finance section, and within this area you will have the ability to select a Payment Gateway. Select PayPal from the list. With this done, PayPal has now been set as the Default Payment Gateway for use within your system. PayPal In Use  Once the PayPal gateway is both set up and enabled, it will function within your course applications. The payment page of a course application process will appear like so:    Clicking the Pay Now option will load the Payment Gateway for PayPal:  The Amount is not editable on this page. The customer can either log into their PayPal account or enter all of the required details to make the payment.

Next Steps: Course Form Setup  Now that PayPal has been set up globally you can now configure the gateway to work within a Course Form. Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

To allow Live Payments, both Enable Payment Mode

and Enable must be checked. Enabling the Gateway  Now that you have set up the Eway payment gateway, you will need to enable it in your system Preferences. Navigate to Administration → Configuration → Preferences:   On the left-hand side, select General:   Click on the Edit button in the top left-hand side of the Preferences area:  Locate the Finance

section, and within this area you will have the ability to select a Payment Gateway. Select Eway from the list. With this done, Eway has now been set as the Default Payment Gateway for use within your system. Eway In Use  Once the Eway gateway is both set up and enabled, it will function within your course applications. The payment page of a course application process will appear like so:    Clicking the Pay Now option will load the Payment Gateway for Eway:  The Amount and Currency items are not editable on this page. Pressing Go Back will navigate back to the course application. Once all required details are entered, you can Submit to process the payment.

Next Steps: Course Form Setup  Now that Eway

has been set up globally you can now configure the gateway to work within a Course Form. Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Navigate to Administration → Configuration → Preferences:   On the left-hand side, select General:   Click on the Edit button in the top left-hand side of the Preferences area:  Locate the Finance section, and within this area you will have the ability to select a Payment Gateway. Select QuickStream from the list. With this done, QuickStream has now been set as the Default Payment Gateway for use within your system. QuickStream In Use  Once the QuickStream gateway is both set up and enabled, it will function within your course applications. The payment page of a course application process will appear like so:    Clicking the Pay Now option will load the Payment Gateway for QuickStream:  The Amount and Currency items are not editable on this page. Once all required details are entered, you can click on Make Payment to process the payment. Next Steps: Course Form Setup  Now that QuickStream has been set up globally you can now configure the gateway to work within a Course Form. Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Enabling the Gateway  Now that you have set up the SecurePay payment gateway, you will need to enable it in your system Preferences. Navigate to Administration → Configuration → Preferences:   On the left-hand side, select General:   Click on the Edit button in the top left-hand side of the Preferences area:  Locate the Finance section, and within this area you will have the ability to select a Payment Gateway. Select SecurePay from the list. With this done, SecurePay has now been set as the Default Payment Gateway for use within your JR Plus system. SecurePay In Use  Once the SecurePay gateway is both set up and enabled, it will function within your course applications. The payment page of a course application process will appear like so:    Clicking the Pay Now option will load the Payment Gateway for SecurePay:   The Amount and Currency items are not editable on this page. Pressing Go Back will navigate back to the course application. Once all required details are entered, you can Submit to process the payment. Next Steps: Course Form Setup  Now that SecurePay has been set up globally you can now configure the gateway to work within a Course Form. Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

This only applies if you have fees set up for any units in the course. Note  The Fees page will only be accessible if there are fees for units that are in the course. The Fees tab also needs to be enabled at the course level. Payments  The Payment page allows you to set a Payment Option for the student if they have been set up for that course. Selecting a Payment Option on this page will create an invoice upon enrolment creation. Confirmation  The last page will have you confirm all the major details for the enrolment before it is created. You may see some AVETMISS warnings, they will not prevent you from creating the enrolment but should be addressed soon as they can lead to problems with reporting. Double check that all the details on this page are correct before clicking on the Create button. You have now enrolled the student into the course. response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reporting this issue with the course start date displaying incorrectly on the application form. I can understand how frustrating and confusing this would be, especially when trying to enroll students before the course start date [2].

Based on the details provided, it seems there may be a configuration issue causing the incorrect start date to display specifically on the application form, even though it is showing correctly in other areas like the event series and course record [2][3].

A few suggestions to try troubleshooting this:

1. Double check the course form settings to ensure the correct course and start date are selected [2]. Sometimes linking the wrong course or having stale caching can cause incorrect data to display.

2. Try clearing your browser cache and cookies, then reloading the application form page. Caching issues can sometimes cause stale data to display [3].

3. As a temporary workaround, you could consider adding clarifying text on the form to indicate the correct start date until we can resolve the display issue [1].

I've logged a bug report with our development team to investigate why the start date is not pulling through correctly to the application form. They will work on getting this fixed as soon as possible given the urgency [2][3][1].

In the meantime, please let me know if the issue persists after trying the troubleshooting steps above. I'm happy to further investigate or escalate this to get it resolved quickly so it doesn't continue impacting your enrollments [2][3][1].

Thank you for your patience, and please let me know if you need any other assistance.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. I understand the urgency, as an incorrect course start date on the application form can cause confusion and hinder the enrollment process.

The issue you're experiencing with the course start date displaying incorrectly on the application form seems to be a known bug that was recently fixed [3]. We have updated the behavior of the course start date on application forms to ensure it pulls the correct date from the course and event series settings [1].

To resolve this, I would suggest clearing your browser cache and trying again. If the issue persists after that, please let me know the specific course ID, and I can look into it further to ensure the fix is applied properly.

In the meantime, as a workaround, you can temporarily update the course start date field on the application form settings to match the correct date from the course and event series. This should allow applicants to see the right start date until we can confirm the fix is working as expected [1].

Please let me know if you have any other questions or concerns. Ensuring accurate course information on application forms is crucial, and I want to make sure this gets resolved promptly.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. I understand the urgency given the strict enrollment deadline for this course.

Based on the information provided, it seems there is an issue with the course start date not displaying correctly on the public application form link, despite being correct in other areas of the system [4]. This can indeed cause confusion for potential students trying to enroll.

To troubleshoot this, I would first suggest clearing your browser cache and trying again, as sometimes cached data can cause display issues on webforms. If that doesn't resolve it, please let me know and I can look into it further [1].

In the meantime, as a workaround, you could consider adding a note on the application form clarifying the correct course start date. Or you may want to temporarily unpublish the form and direct students to enroll through your staff instead until we can get this issue resolved.

I've flagged this with our development team as a high priority issue to investigate and fix as soon as possible. Ensuring accurate course information on application forms is critical, especially during peak enrollment periods. Please keep me updated if you notice any other abnormalities, and I'll do the same regarding progress on a fix.

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Kind Regards,
