This field was unused and has been removed to prevent confusion. 27792 - We have fixed an issue where TCSI integration could fail to sync an enrolment where the party has SA-HELP and the enrolment has a blank Student Status. 28569 - Some scenarios that could cause TCSI sync batches to be stuck in 'Enqueued' status when they are completed has been fixed. 26849 - We've cleaned up an issue relating to how Course Application permissions interact with other system permissions. 28371 - We identified an interaction where you can add a 'Disabled Staff Record' as an Event Supporting Staff via the API. This has been removed and only Active Staff members can be assigned to as an Event Supporting Staff. 27698 - We've fixed a bug that caused duplication of disability information captured within the Party > AVETMISS page. 27840 - We fixed an issue where the Administration menu was disappearing when certain permissions were assigned to a User. 28473 - A fix has been applied to the Supporting Staff API that allowed recording Supporting Staff to an Event when 'Enable Supporting Staff on Events' is disabled. 23455 - Disabled Templates were being displayed within the 'Add Form' page when creating a Document Pack.

26992 – We have fixed an issue with the “Express Offer” button on Course Applications where the user would get an infinite spinner if they didn’t have the Party Payment system right. Users without this permission will now get an appropriate error message instead. 26980 - We have fixed an issue with the automation that sets the Program Status Identifier to “30: In Training” on first run of the Claims Reporting Wizard for Victoria. The first run was reporting an incorrect blank value and only reporting “30: In Training” for the second run for that enrolment that had just commenced. This has now been fixed so it will report the correct initial value on the first run. 26864 - We have resolved an issue when generating certificates from the Progress Centre and Bulk Course Certificate generation pages so that when the Clear command is actioned the values in the fields in the previous Section 1 remain as entered. 27054 - We have resolved an issue where the Issued Date were not populated when generating certificates. 27069 - An issue in the AVETMISS generation for TAS that can cause Date Program Completed to be reported as blank instead of 01019999 has been fixed. 26029 - We fixed an issue where File Note templates, categories and checklists could be accessed against the Course Application entity, despite there being the inability to create File Notes against Course Applications.

27197 - Fixed: We have resolved an issue where events linked to a course multiple times could not be removed from the course without deleting all of the links assigned to that event, you can now remove a single link. 27254 – FIXED: We have updated the behaviour of the VET in School Flag on Course Forms - the default option of selecting Not Stated has been removed meaning that students must provide an answer to the question. 27271 - FIXED: We have implemented some improvements to reduce the incidence of 1c rounding errors when preparing invoices. 27456 - FIXED: We have resolved an issue with the Agent Portal when adding a referral where the course list could fail when there were multiple course pages. 27550 - FIXED: We have resolved an issue where the Start Time and End Time fields were not honouring Time Zones on saving course records. 26339 - FIXED: We have resolved an issue that could result in duplicate messages being sent from the Communication Centre if the Send command was clicked more than once. 24446 - FIXED: We have removed the Funding Source National model validation from Courses and replaced that with a new AVETMISS Warning available in the Enrolment, Bulk Enrolment, Transfer and Offer wizards, AVETMISS Generations and show enrolment areas. We expect this will prevent some issues we have seen when submitting enrolments through course forms in cases where Funding Source National was not specified on the course.

26716 - FIXED: We have resolved an issue when creating Programs with Academic Periods, now only Academic Periods selected by the user will be added to the Program. 26184 - FIXED: We have resolved an issue in the Report Builder when using a filter on the Student Unit Status: Outcome Code field was not being saved with the custom report. 23559 – FIXED: We have resolved an issue on the Prospect Wizard where the Referring Agent Employer field was not being retained when navigating between steps in the New Referral wizard. 23958 – FIXED: We have resolved an issue that would cause the report builder to filter by a check-in's database ID rather than its status when using the Support Service Check-in: Status field. 23063 – FIXED: We fixed an issue that would cause the Academic Details Report (Standard Report) to error 500 when a general or course filter isn't specified. 23943 – FIXED: We have resolved an issue with the Standard Report - Trainer Details where it could be generated in a PDF or Spreadsheet but not on screen. 27520 – FIXED: We have updated the Standard Report - Student Progress to exclude units from the commenced column that have outcomes of 85 and 99. 26953 - FIXED: We have improved the Top Courses standard report so that the Enrolment Start and End Date filter will include enrolments with dates that overlap the filter date range. Previously it only included enrolments that were entirely within the filter date range.

Enrolment API: Traineeship Flag  We’ve updated the Enrolment API to return the Traineeship Flag as 'TRUE' when there is one or more traineeships associated with a Student’s record. Custom URLs  We have introduced a new custom field type of HTML, which will allow for hyperlinks to be added to the party and enrolment screens. An optional link text can be displayed by saving the custom field in the format of 'URL, Text'. Course numbers display on multi-linked course forms  We have updated the course form settings page to display the course number when multiple courses are linked. Program Status Identifier  We have automated the updating of the Program Status Identifier for Victorian and Tasmanian enrolments when generating a Reportable Certificate or Statement of Attainment. When the certificate is recorded with an 'Issue Date', we will update the Program Status Identifier to 'Program Completed (Issued)', or if there is no 'Issue Date' the Program Status Identifier will be updated to 'Program Completed (not issued)'. This applies regardless of whether the Certificate is created from the Party, Course, Progress Centre, Program Automate or API. Issue Date has Value Issue Date Does not have value Student Portal  We have added the 'Expiry Date' field to the Certificate List page in the Student Portal which will be displayed when a student has a certificate that has an 'Expiry Date'.

Enrolment Events usability updates  We’ve made a few changes to the Enrolment Events page, introducing a series of improvements to help assess the Attendance Data of an Enrolment Record:      Event Search  We’ve added a new Search section within, that will allow you to search for events against an enrolment    Event Link Filter  This filter will allow you to filter Event Attendance results by the Event Link associated to the Event record. Note: Only one Event Link can be selected at a time      Event Summary Details  We’ve also adjusted the Event Summary Details section to update when searching for Events. This will display a summary based on the filtered results applied. Event Attendance List Pagination  The List now includes pagination and sorting controls     New API Endpoint – Enrolled Units  We have created a new API endpoint that will return all linked Subjects (Units of Study) for a particular Enrolled Unit. An array of Enrolled Subjects will be returned with their associated ID and code. Course Types included in enrolment list screens  We have included Course Type as a column selection on the party enrolments screen. We have included Course Type as a filter option and a selectable column for displaying on the enrolment screen. Compliance updates: WA RAPT Claims Export and NSW ACE Disadvantage Criteria  WA RAPT Claims Export  The WA RAPT claims export has been updated for version 1.2 of the TAMS specification.

API Updates The User API has been updated to include a new endpoint to allow client systems to remove user roles. This will assist clients who use an integrated solution to change or remove user roles in JR Plus. ticket_content.ticket_description: Hi Team,   I have created the web form for course application. Everytime I try to submit the form, It is showing the error to fill the first name. I tried to remove the field and created a new field for that but the error is remaining same. It happenned before during the time of onbording and that time I was told that the solution was to remove the field and create again. This is not working anymore. Please have a look and advise.

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with the first name field error on the course application web form. 

I understand you have already tried removing and recreating the first name field, but the error persists. Here are a few additional troubleshooting steps you can try:

1. Check if there are any conditions set on the first name field that may be causing the error [1]. Review the conditions tab and ensure there are no conflicting rules applied.

2. Try creating a brand new course application form from scratch instead of editing the existing one [2][3]. Sometimes cached data can cause issues when editing forms.

3. Clear your browser cache and cookies, then try accessing the form again [1]. Cached data on the client side could be causing conflicts.

4. If the above steps don't resolve the issue, I recommend reaching out to our form builder team to investigate further. They may need to review the specific form configuration and data to identify the root cause [1].

Please let me know if the issue persists after trying these troubleshooting steps. I'll be happy to further assist or escalate this to our development team if needed.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with the first name field error on the course application form. I understand that this is a frustrating situation, especially since the previous solution of removing and recreating the field is not working anymore.

Based on the information provided in your ticket, it seems that there might be an underlying issue causing the first name field error to persist, even after recreating the field [1]. This could be due to a variety of reasons, such as form settings, conditions, or other configurations.

To troubleshoot this issue, I would suggest the following steps:

1. Check the form settings and conditions to ensure that there are no conflicting rules or conditions related to the first name field [1].
2. Try creating a new form from scratch and adding the first name field to see if the issue persists [2]. This will help determine if the issue is specific to the current form or a more general issue.
3. If the issue persists with a new form, it may be a system-wide issue that requires further investigation [4]. In this case, I will escalate the matter to our development team for further analysis and a potential fix.

Please let me know if the issue persists after trying the above steps. I apologize for the inconvenience caused, and I assure you that we are committed to resolving this issue as soon as possible. [4]

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with the course application web form. I understand that the form is showing an error to fill the first name field, even when it is already filled, and recreating the field is not resolving the issue. [2][3][1]

This seems to be a technical issue with the form builder or field validation. A few suggestions to try:

1. Check if there are any conditions set on the first name field that may be causing the validation error. You can review and remove any conditions from the "Tools" tab of the form builder. [1]

2. Try copying the entire form and recreating it from scratch. Sometimes cached data can cause issues with field validation. [2][3]

3. Ensure there are no special characters or formatting in the first name field that could be triggering the validation error. [5]

If none of these steps resolve the issue, it may be a bug in the form builder that needs further investigation. In that case, I would recommend creating a support ticket with our development team, providing details of the issue and steps to reproduce it. They can look into it and provide a fix or workaround. [5]

Please let me know if you have any other questions or if the issue persists after trying the above suggestions.

Thank you,

related_knowledge.content: Form 'Tools' Tab  You can use Form Tools to Save/Close the Form, Add a New Page or Cover to the Form, Delete a Page or Cover from the Form or set Conditions. Save - Be sure to Save the Form before closing the window. Close - This will Close the Form and return you to the Platform. If there are any unsaved changes, it will warn you before letting you continue. + New - This will let you add a New Page to the Form. This is a great way to categorise the questions, breaking up the content to make it more manageable for the student. You can only add Fields to a Page. + Cover - You can add a Cover Page to the Web Form. You could use a Cover Page to describe the course, explain the application process or advise the student of who to contact should they get stuck. Delete - To delete a Page or Cover, navigate to the Page and then click Delete. + New - Conditions make it possible to customise a students journey through the web form. These conditions will affect what questions the form will display, depending on the answers provided. For example, if a student flags that they have a disability, impairment or long-term condition, you can then choose to display an additional question inquiring into the type of disability, impairment or long-term condition. This is a great way to keep your forms short and ensure you're only asking questions relevant to the student.

Edit a Course Form  To edit a Course Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Course Forms. + New - Create a new Course Form. Search- Search for an existing Course Form. Edit Web Form - Edit the physical web form itself. Edit Form Settings - Edit the settings of the Course Form. Copy - Create a duplicate of an existing Course Form. Delete - Delete an existing Course Form. Click, the EditIcon. To edit the Web Form click this Icon. To edit the Form Settings click this Icon. Make any required changes. Click, Save. You have now edited an existing Course Form.

Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Course Forms makes it easy for Students to apply/enrol directly into a course. Using the Course Forms Feature means that you can throw away the paper-based application and put the onus on the student to submit their information directly to the institution. Once submitted, this form can automatically create a new Party record and then apply an Enrolment record against the student's file. The Form Builder is not limited to Course Applications. Institutions can also use this tool to collect information from prospects, feedback from alumni or even allow students to request services. Add a Course Form  To add a Course Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Course Forms. Click, + New. Complete the New Form window. Name - Provide the Course Form with a unique name for easy future reference. Branding - There is the option to apply a custom brand per Course Form. This is a great way to white-label the Course Application Forms or even apply joint branding. This is customisable per Course Form. Location - This field references the institution's pre-existing Locations. To add or edit to these locations go to: Administration >> Lookups >> Locations/Facilities. If this Course Form is linked to multiple courses with different locations, you can leave this option blank. Enabled - If checked, this Course Form will be enabled/active. This means that at any time when you go to assign a Form, you can select this Form as an option.

Note we have not updated any existing records, so if editing an existing record containing invalid characters the operator will be required to remove these prior to saving any changes.

Process: Add/Edit a Feedback Form

Our system makes it easy to add and customise Feedback Forms, making it possible to gather and store feedback from learners at each stage of their journey. In this article, we will cover how to add a new Feedback Form and edit an existing Feedback Form.

Add a New Feedback Form  To Add a new Feedback Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Feedback Forms.

Click the + Icon Button. Complete the

Details

and Settings

windows. Name - Add a unique yet descriptive title for your Form. This name is visible to students. Category - Choose a Form Category. By default, the categories available are Enrolment, Feedback, Finance, General and Service. You can add new categories, go to the Reference Data Table and search Form Category.

Branding - Choose a Brand to apply to the Form from the dropdown. To add a new Brand, go to Administration → Configuration → Branding. Assignee - Choose whether to assign a system user to the Feedback Form. That way, when a student submits a response, the assignee, by default, will be applied to that Form.

URL - The system automatically generates this. It will be used, by the system, to take the students to a unique version of the Feedback Form. You can edit the number to be a string or number value of your choosing, but you cannot change the remainder of the URL. Enabled - To use this form, ensure the Enabled box is checked. Otherwise, this Form will not be available for use in other areas of the platform.

Add to all Host Families - If enabled, all Host Families in your system will have this Form added to their Party Record by default, without requiring the user to add this against every record upon creation manually.

I don't want to use Course Forms. Can I still use these processes?

Yes, absolutely. You can substitute out the use of the Course Form for a physical form/manual process.

Can I modify the workflow I want because it doesn't quite fit what my organisation needs?

The presented workflows reflect common successful usage patterns that we have created based on our expertise in the sector. Modified configurations can only be given support through paid consultation sessions where we will help yu to identify the best approach to configuring your workflows.

It remains your responsibility to internally configure, test, and validate that each workflow is aligned with the unique business requirements of your institution.

I am getting an error when I fill in a course application as a 'test student.' What's going on?

Check that any email templates attached to the application process are correct. e.g. if you have copied merge fields from another template somewhere in the system, the specific merge tags may not be appropriate for the template where you're pasting the email. Double check that all the merge fields are available in the merge fields list to the right hand side of the window.

I'm setting up an accredited workflow. I can see student applications sitting in my course, but they're not moving into the 'enrolled' field even though I've checked 'auto enrol.' What's going on?

Make sure you've definitely:

ticked auto enrol on the course application

checked you have a funding source for your course. Enrolment won't go through without this

Try manually adding an application (Courses > Applications > new application) and then processing the enrolment manually through the enrolment wizard. Note any compulsory fields that are incomplete or any steps that are throwing errors. This is likely the part of your workflow that is not allowing the enrolment through. Review that part of the system.

ticket_content.ticket_description: Hi team,  As our most of the students enrol into a package program, I can not figure out how to create an application form and process for package enrolment.  Example  If a student is enrolling or applying for certificate III automotive, he can also include certificate IV automotive as a pathway or package enrolment in the same application for. So that we can generate an offer letter including both of the courses as package enrolment.

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding package course enrolments. To allow students to apply for multiple courses like Certificate III and IV in Automotive together as a package program, you can utilize the "Link Multiple Courses" option when creating a course application form [3][2].

When enabled, this option lets you search for and link several courses to a single course application form. Students can then select all the desired courses they want to apply for when filling out the form [3][2]. 

Once the application is submitted, it will create a course application record containing the package of courses the student applied for. From there, you can review the application, conduct any necessary steps like interviews or eligibility checks, and then proceed to generate an offer letter that includes all the courses in the package program [1].

The offer letter generation process should allow you to include multiple courses that were part of the initial application. You can then send the offer to the student for their acceptance before finalizing the enrolment [1].

I hope this helps explain how to set up package course enrolments using the course application forms. Let me know if you need any further assistance!

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding package course enrolments. The Course Forms feature in ReadySMS allows you to create application forms where students can apply for multiple courses as a package [1][2].

When creating a new Course Form, you can enable the "Link Multiple Courses" option. This will let you search for and link the relevant courses (e.g. Certificate III and IV Automotive) to the form [2]. Students can then select both courses when filling out the application.

Once a student submits the application form, it will create a Course Application record containing the selected package of courses. From the individual Course Application record, you can review the student's responses, check entry requirements, and proceed with enrolment [1].

To generate an offer letter for the package enrolment, you can use the "Offer" or "Express Offer" options on the Course Application record [1]. The offer letter will include details of all the courses the student applied for in the package.

I hope this helps explain the process for package enrolments using Course Forms. Let me know if you need any further assistance.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding package course enrollments. Unfortunately, the current version of our student management system does not have a built-in feature to handle package enrollments through a single application form.

The existing course application forms are designed to allow students to apply for one course at a time. While it is possible to link multiple courses to a single form, the student would still need to select and apply for each course individually.

To facilitate package enrollments, I would suggest the following approach:

1. Create separate course application forms for each individual course in the package.
2. Once a student submits applications for all the desired courses, you can manually review and process the applications together as a package.
3. When generating the offer letter, you can include details of all the courses the student has applied for as part of the package.

Alternatively, you could consider creating a custom form or process to allow students to indicate their interest in a package enrollment upfront. This could then be reviewed and processed manually by your team.

I understand this may not be the most streamlined solution, but it would allow you to accommodate package enrollments within the current system capabilities. Our team is continuously working on enhancing the application and enrollment features, and we will log your feedback as a potential future enhancement request.

Please let me know if you have any further questions or if you would like to discuss alternative workarounds. I'm happy to assist you in finding the best approach for your institution's needs. [No references]

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content:
Course Application Overview

When a student submits a Course Form, to enrol into a Course, it creates a Course Application that can be reviewed and processed by the administrative team. View the List of Course Applications  You can access the submitted Course Applications by clicking the Courses tab and then selecting the Applications option from the dropdown. Depending on your Personal Preferences, you will either see a List or Kanban View. Kanban View      List View View an Individual Course Application   To view an individual Course Application, click on the Application ID. Kanban View      List View Individual Course Application     Edit - To make changes, or adjust any items on this window, click the Edit button. Enrol - When the Student is ready to be Enrolled, select Enrol. This will take you to the Enrolment Wizard to finalise the Students Enrolment. Offer/Express Offer - If your institution requires that you provide a Student with a formal Offer, you can select these options. Offer will require you to go through the Offer Wizard, whereas Express Offer skips the Offer Wizard and takes you straight to the end of the Offer process. Applicant Window - This shows the Applications Full Name and Party ID. By clicking on the Applicant's Full Name it will take you to their Party Record. Application Window - This shows the Application ID , Offer Number, and the Status of the Application. You can, if you wish, edit the Status in this window.

To remove this Form as an option, simply uncheck the Enabled box. Allow Login - This allows existing parties who are already registered with the institutions Plus Platform the ability to log in and have particular fields in the Form auto-populated. Auto-Confirm Enrolments - Checking this box means that all applications submitted will be automatically be enrolled in the course. This is not recommended if you have a detailed enrolment process, e.g. Interviews need to be completed, eligibility needs to be checked, or AVETMISS details need to be confirmed. This checkbox is more suited for non-accredited training. Auto-Confirm Services - Checking this box means that all applications submitted will automatically create a Demand Record against the Students Record. Hide from Student Portal - If the institution uses the Student Portal, they can choose whether to hide the Course Application from the Portal or make it readily available. Enable Payments - When enabled, applicants will be able to make payments from the Form. When enabled, you must select a Payment Gateway Provider. When enabled, the Allow Pay Later will be displayed on the 'Payment' step of the Form. Students can then choose to Pay Now or Pay Later. To use the Payments function, there must be a pre-existing integration with a Third-Party Payment Gateway. Note: To view a range of Payment Gateway options, visit our Payment Gateway documentation area.

Link Multiple Courses - When enabled, it is possible to link several courses to one Course Application Form. Search for the Courses by name to add them to the Form. This will make the Courses available for selection when the student goes to apply. Snippets - Input type is HTML code. It will be added verbatim to all Applications, useful for analytics or footers. Click, Create. You have now added a Course Form.

Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Course Forms makes it easy for Students to apply/enrol directly into a course. Using the Course Forms Feature means that you can throw away the paper-based application and put the onus on the student to submit their information directly to the institution. Once submitted, this form can automatically create a new Party record and then apply an Enrolment record against the student's file. The Form Builder is not limited to Course Applications. Institutions can also use this tool to collect information from prospects, feedback from alumni or even allow students to request services. Add a Course Form  To add a Course Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Course Forms. Click, + New. Complete the New Form window. Name - Provide the Course Form with a unique name for easy future reference. Branding - There is the option to apply a custom brand per Course Form. This is a great way to white-label the Course Application Forms or even apply joint branding. This is customisable per Course Form. Location - This field references the institution's pre-existing Locations. To add or edit to these locations go to: Administration >> Lookups >> Locations/Facilities. If this Course Form is linked to multiple courses with different locations, you can leave this option blank. Enabled - If checked, this Course Form will be enabled/active. This means that at any time when you go to assign a Form, you can select this Form as an option.

It's a structured drag and drop style management of your applications to make it easier to track where they are in the process. Process: Bulk Enrolling Students into a Course

You can enrol multiple students into a course, this can help with processing larger intakes into courses. In this article, we will go over the process of enrolling multiple students into a course. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Finding Your Course

Adding Students To The Enrolments

Finding Your Course

To start the process of bulk enrolling students into a course, go to the Course List under Courses.

This will bring up a list of courses in your system, click on the link to the course that you would like to enrol students into. Click on the Bulk Actions menu and the Enrolments

button.

Adding Students To The Enrolments

The first page of the

Bulk Enrolment Wizard

will be where you select the students that you would like to enrol. You can search for the students that you would like to enrol or create a new party profile for the student. If you want to search for already existing students, type the name of the student into the search bar and click on the

Search button. This will bring up any students that match the search criteria. Click on the Plus button next to each student that you would like to enrol.

Clicking on the

Create New Party

button will bring up a window that will allow you to create a new party profile.

Once you have filled in the details for the party profile and created it, the new party will be added to the list of students that are being enrolled. The rest of the process is

similar to enrolling one student, except the options selected in the subsequent steps will be applied to all students being enrolled.

Employer:

This will select the Employer for each enrolment that is created.

Enrolment:

This is where the Enrolment Details can be set for all the enrolments. Electives: Sets the Elective units for each enrolment. Scheduling:

FAQ

Can I set up more than one workflow within my SMS?

Yes, you can. If you're offering, for example, short courses as well as standard courses, you could set up both workflows. Make sure you link the correct courses to the correct Course Form.

I don't want to use Course Forms. Can I still use these processes?

ReadySMS Manual Workflows

Introduction This article contains an overview of how manual application and enrolments processes can be set up within the student management system. If you would like to set up a more automated process, see the ReadySMS Automated Workflows article. Manual workflows are designed to be used without the course forms feature of the SMS.

ReadySMS Manual Workflows

Three options exist for the manual applications and enrolments process. The first can be used for simple individual student enrolment and the second for simple bulk enrolment. The third workflow uses a manual, paper application process, but then leverages some simple automations within the system to manage the application (e.g. automates emails to students).

Overview of the Workflows

1. Manual Individual Enrolment This process involves student's applying for a course using a paper application form. Upon receipt of this form, a student party record is created manually. The student can then be processed through the enrolment wizard and a payment can be taken. For this process, any communication with the student must be performed manually and admin notifications are not available.

2. Manual Bulk Enrolment The manual bulk enrolment process uses paper applications for initial student applications. Upon receipt of this form, a student party record is created manually. After the desired number of applications are completed and party records made, a bulk enrolment step can be performed to process students into courses. Payments can be taken following the enrolment step.

People- This shows which User is currently Assigned to the Application and whether there is an associated Employer or Agent. Note: When an enrolment is linked to an application, and an agent has been set against that application, then you must first remove the agent from the application before you will be able to remove the agent from the enrolment. Course - This shows the Course that the student has applied to, as well as the Location and Study Mode of the selected Course  Admin - This shows the time and date of when the Application was Created On. If an offer is sent to the Student, and they accept the offer, the time/date of acceptance will be displayed here. Forms Tab  The Forms tab shows the Students submitted responses to the questions in the Course Application Form.

Entry Requirements Tab  The Entry Requirements tab allows you to check and confirm that a student meets all of the conditions of entry into their chosen Course. Each item can be checked, as well as a Note made against each criterion.

Communications Tab  The Communications tab make it possible to send the Student a (1) Pre-Templated Email, and (2) Custom Email. This tab can also be used to produce a Letter.

Notes Tab  Add a Note or Checklist to the Party Record without having to leave the page. Documents Tab  You can upload New Documents to the Party Record without having to leave the page. You can also view pre-existing documents that exist against the Party and see any documentation that was uploaded and submitted as part of their application.

Interview Tab  The Interview tab lets you Create an Event, that will be added to the Students Timetable. The User/s conducting the Interview can also be added to the Event so that it appears on their calendar. As the User conducting the Interview, you can mark the Student's Attendance and Rate the Interview. Progress Tab  The Progress tab makes it possible to see the history of changes/updates made to the Application Form.

Session Recording for Individual and Bulk Manual Workflows Manual Applications and Enrolments - Part 1 3. Manual Kanban Enrolment  The manual Kanban enrolment leverages some of the automations within the system, without the use of a Course Form. Here, students apply using a manual application and party records are manual added to the system. The manual course application feature (Courses > Applications >new application) is then used to add applications into the Kanban for processing. The benefit of this is that it allows for automated emails to be sent to students based on their position in the application process. This process is recommended when you have to take manual applications for large numbers of students. All students can be added manually as they're submitted, then applications can be processed at a later date. The automated communications can then be leveraged for mass communications of large numbers of students. Session Recording for Kanban Workflow    Manual Applications and Enrolments - Part 2     Additional Resources The following resources provide additional support and information relating to this session. Session 5 - Online Applications and Enrolments    ReadySMS Automated Workflows    Template Field Map Articles    JR Plus Learning Library: Applications & Enrolments    Form Builder Overview    Kanban Overview    Process: Add/Edit a Kanban Status    Process: Add/Edit a Course Application Status    JR Plus Learning Library: Automations

FAQ

Can I use a manual workflow alongside an automated workflow for different offerings within my organiation?

Y

es. You could set up a manual paper form for some courses and use automated course forms for other courses.

ticket_content.ticket_description: I am having trouble linking the payment option to a course via the enrolment form. This is Urgent as I need to get the enrolment link sent today.     Thank you  ***

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about linking payment options to a course via the enrolment form. Here are the steps to set this up:

1. Set up a payment option for the course by going to Courses > Course List > [Select the course] > Finance > Payment Options > New [1]. Configure the payment option details like due date, category, etc.

2. Enable a payment gateway in your system preferences under Administration > Configuration > Preferences > Finance section [3][4][5][6]. The commonly used gateways are SecurePay, QuickStream, PayPal, and Eway.

3. When creating or editing a course application form (Administration > Forms > Course Forms), enable the "Enable Payments" option [1]. This will allow you to select the payment gateway set up in step 2.

4. On the payment step of the course form, applicants will be able to select the payment option created in step 1 to generate an invoice upon enrolment [1].

Please ensure you have completed all the above steps to successfully link payment options to your course enrolment forms. Let me know if you need any further assistance.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding linking a payment option to a course via the enrolment form. Here are the steps to set this up:

First, you need to set up the payment option for the course under Courses > Course List > [Course Name] > Finance > Payment Options [1]. Here you can configure details like the payment due date, category, and whether it should be the default option.

Next, when creating or editing the course form under Administration > Forms > Course Forms, there is an option to "Enable Payments" [2]. Enabling this will allow you to select a payment gateway provider and give applicants the option to pay now or pay later during the form. 

Additionally, on the same course form settings page, you can choose to "Link Multiple Courses" [2] so the payment option is available across multiple linked courses.

Finally, on the last page of creating/editing the form, you'll see a "Confirmation" step [7] where you can review all details before publishing the form with the payment option enabled.

Let me know if you need any other assistance in getting the enrolment form with payments set up and sent out today.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding linking a payment option to a course enrolment form. Here are the steps to set this up:

1. First, you need to set up and enable a payment gateway in your system preferences [6][4][5][3]. This allows you to integrate with a third-party payment processor like Eway, PayPal, QuickStream, or SecurePay.

2. Once the payment gateway is enabled, go to the specific course and set up a new "Payment Option" under Finance > Payment Options [1]. Configure the details like date range, payment due terms, discount options, etc.

3. On this Payment Option, make sure to check the "Available on" box for "Course Forms" [1]. This will allow this payment option to be available on course enrolment forms.

4. Then, when editing the Course Form under Administration > Forms > Course Forms, enable the "Enable Payments" option [2]. This will add a payment step to the form.

5. Students applying through this form will then see the configured payment option and be able to make the payment during the enrolment process [2].

Let me know if you need any other assistance in getting the payment-enabled enrolment form set up and sent out today.

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content:
Process: Adding a Payment Option for a Course

Payment Options

allow you to set some pre-filled invoicing options for a course. In this article, we will go over the process of setting up a Payment Option for a course. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Find the Course  Setting up the Payment Option  Line Item Information     Find the Course  To find the course that you would like to set up the Payment Options for, go to Courses → Course List. This will bring up a list of active courses on your site, click on the desired course to view the course details page. On the left side of the page, click on Finance → Payment Options

then click on the New button.

Note  Payment Options will not be an available to access if the course has Automatic Smart Fees enabled. Setting up the Payment Option    This is where you can set the options for your Payment Option. Date From:

Sets the date from when the Payment Option will be available. Date To:

Sets the date from when the Payment Option will not be available to use anymore. Type: The type of Payment Option that you would like to set. for most use cases, this can be to Option. Category: Sets the Ledger category for the Payment Option. Default Option:

Enabling this option will set this Payment Option as the default one selected when enrolling a student into this course. Payment Due Terms (Days): Sets the due date for the invoice that is created from this Payment Option.

Additional Payment Gateway Parameters: Allows you to add parameters for the payment gateway if a user is redirected there. Available on:

Allows you to make this Payment Option available on Course Forms (including in the Student Portal) and the OEP. Discount (Quantity):

To remove this Form as an option, simply uncheck the Enabled box. Allow Login - This allows existing parties who are already registered with the institutions Plus Platform the ability to log in and have particular fields in the Form auto-populated. Auto-Confirm Enrolments - Checking this box means that all applications submitted will be automatically be enrolled in the course. This is not recommended if you have a detailed enrolment process, e.g. Interviews need to be completed, eligibility needs to be checked, or AVETMISS details need to be confirmed. This checkbox is more suited for non-accredited training. Auto-Confirm Services - Checking this box means that all applications submitted will automatically create a Demand Record against the Students Record. Hide from Student Portal - If the institution uses the Student Portal, they can choose whether to hide the Course Application from the Portal or make it readily available. Enable Payments - When enabled, applicants will be able to make payments from the Form. When enabled, you must select a Payment Gateway Provider. When enabled, the Allow Pay Later will be displayed on the 'Payment' step of the Form. Students can then choose to Pay Now or Pay Later. To use the Payments function, there must be a pre-existing integration with a Third-Party Payment Gateway. Note: To view a range of Payment Gateway options, visit our Payment Gateway documentation area.

Link Multiple Courses - When enabled, it is possible to link several courses to one Course Application Form. Search for the Courses by name to add them to the Form. This will make the Courses available for selection when the student goes to apply. Snippets - Input type is HTML code. It will be added verbatim to all Applications, useful for analytics or footers. Click, Create. You have now added a Course Form.

Enabling the Gateway  Now that you have set up the SecurePay payment gateway, you will need to enable it in your system Preferences. Navigate to Administration → Configuration → Preferences:   On the left-hand side, select General:   Click on the Edit button in the top left-hand side of the Preferences area:  Locate the Finance section, and within this area you will have the ability to select a Payment Gateway. Select SecurePay from the list. With this done, SecurePay has now been set as the Default Payment Gateway for use within your JR Plus system. SecurePay In Use  Once the SecurePay gateway is both set up and enabled, it will function within your course applications. The payment page of a course application process will appear like so:    Clicking the Pay Now option will load the Payment Gateway for SecurePay:   The Amount and Currency items are not editable on this page. Pressing Go Back will navigate back to the course application. Once all required details are entered, you can Submit to process the payment. Next Steps: Course Form Setup  Now that SecurePay has been set up globally you can now configure the gateway to work within a Course Form. Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Navigate to Administration → Configuration → Preferences:   On the left-hand side, select General:   Click on the Edit button in the top left-hand side of the Preferences area:  Locate the Finance section, and within this area you will have the ability to select a Payment Gateway. Select QuickStream from the list. With this done, QuickStream has now been set as the Default Payment Gateway for use within your system. QuickStream In Use  Once the QuickStream gateway is both set up and enabled, it will function within your course applications. The payment page of a course application process will appear like so:    Clicking the Pay Now option will load the Payment Gateway for QuickStream:  The Amount and Currency items are not editable on this page. Once all required details are entered, you can click on Make Payment to process the payment. Next Steps: Course Form Setup  Now that QuickStream has been set up globally you can now configure the gateway to work within a Course Form. Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Enabling the Gateway  Now that you have set up the PayPal payment gateway, you will need to enable it in your system Preferences. Navigate to Administration → Configuration → Preferences:   On the left-hand side, select General:   Click on the Edit button in the top left-hand side of the Preferences area:  Locate the Finance section, and within this area you will have the ability to select a Payment Gateway. Select PayPal from the list. With this done, PayPal has now been set as the Default Payment Gateway for use within your system. PayPal In Use  Once the PayPal gateway is both set up and enabled, it will function within your course applications. The payment page of a course application process will appear like so:    Clicking the Pay Now option will load the Payment Gateway for PayPal:  The Amount is not editable on this page. The customer can either log into their PayPal account or enter all of the required details to make the payment.

Next Steps: Course Form Setup  Now that PayPal has been set up globally you can now configure the gateway to work within a Course Form. Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

To allow Live Payments, both Enable Payment Mode

and Enable must be checked. Enabling the Gateway  Now that you have set up the Eway payment gateway, you will need to enable it in your system Preferences. Navigate to Administration → Configuration → Preferences:   On the left-hand side, select General:   Click on the Edit button in the top left-hand side of the Preferences area:  Locate the Finance

section, and within this area you will have the ability to select a Payment Gateway. Select Eway from the list. With this done, Eway has now been set as the Default Payment Gateway for use within your system. Eway In Use  Once the Eway gateway is both set up and enabled, it will function within your course applications. The payment page of a course application process will appear like so:    Clicking the Pay Now option will load the Payment Gateway for Eway:  The Amount and Currency items are not editable on this page. Pressing Go Back will navigate back to the course application. Once all required details are entered, you can Submit to process the payment.

Next Steps: Course Form Setup  Now that Eway

has been set up globally you can now configure the gateway to work within a Course Form. Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

This only applies if you have fees set up for any units in the course. Note  The Fees page will only be accessible if there are fees for units that are in the course. The Fees tab also needs to be enabled at the course level. Payments  The Payment page allows you to set a Payment Option for the student if they have been set up for that course. Selecting a Payment Option on this page will create an invoice upon enrolment creation. Confirmation  The last page will have you confirm all the major details for the enrolment before it is created. You may see some AVETMISS warnings, they will not prevent you from creating the enrolment but should be addressed soon as they can lead to problems with reporting. Double check that all the details on this page are correct before clicking on the Create button. You have now enrolled the student into the course. Additional Reading  Here is some additional information on enrolments and curriculum:   Process: Apply an Outcome to a Unit or Subject  USI Configuration  Curriculum Overview

E.g. Aged Care. Children's Services etc.

No  Company → Details → Profile → Industry  Interview Rating   This field refers to a list of drop-down options that can be used to Rate an Interview with a Prospective Student. Yes  Course Application → Edit → Interview Tab → Rating (Dropdown)  Invoice Option Type   This is a category for a type of 'Invoice Options'. For example; Online, Cash, Third-Party Payment etc. Yes   Course → Finance → Payment Options → Create a New or Add a Payment Option → Type (Dropdown)   Invoice Status   This field refers to the status of an 'Invoice'.

Yes  Invoices → New Invoice → Status  Invoicing Method   This field refers to the Invoicing Method against a Payment Option.

For example; Immediate, Scheduled etc.

Yes   Course → Finance → Payment Options → Create a New or Add a Payment Option → Create (Drop-Down)   Itinerary  This field references a pre-defined itinerary.

No  Group → Itinerary → New → Name  Ledger Category   This is a high-level way to categorise a Ledger.

Yes  Ledger Code Lookup Table → Ledger Category  Ledger Code Lookup  This field refers to the Codes allocated to the Ledger Items and is used for reporting purposes.

Yes  Invoice → Ledger  Ledger Type   This is a category for a type of 'Ledger'.

Yes  Ledger Code Lookup Table → Ledger Type  Lifestyle   This refers to the 'Lifestyle' drop-down field under the Workforce Details tab on a Student Enrolment Record.

For example; FIFO, Residential etc.

Yes   Enrolment → Workforce Details* → Lifestyle  *Workforce Details must first be enabled under Enrolment Preferences. Pay Later Reason   When the 'Pay Later' button, against a Course Form, is selected it provides options during the Student Application process.

For example; Pay Now, Pay Later.

Yes   Course Application Form → Payment → Pay Later → The student select from the following options: Pay Now, Pay Later (radio buttons)   Payment Source   This refers to how the payment has been received.

Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Course Forms makes it easy for Students to apply/enrol directly into a course. Using the Course Forms Feature means that you can throw away the paper-based application and put the onus on the student to submit their information directly to the institution. Once submitted, this form can automatically create a new Party record and then apply an Enrolment record against the student's file. The Form Builder is not limited to Course Applications. Institutions can also use this tool to collect information from prospects, feedback from alumni or even allow students to request services. Add a Course Form  To add a Course Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Course Forms. Click, + New. Complete the New Form window. Name - Provide the Course Form with a unique name for easy future reference. Branding - There is the option to apply a custom brand per Course Form. This is a great way to white-label the Course Application Forms or even apply joint branding. This is customisable per Course Form. Location - This field references the institution's pre-existing Locations. To add or edit to these locations go to: Administration >> Lookups >> Locations/Facilities. If this Course Form is linked to multiple courses with different locations, you can leave this option blank. Enabled - If checked, this Course Form will be enabled/active. This means that at any time when you go to assign a Form, you can select this Form as an option.

Resource Links

FAQ What are Course Forms? Course Forms enable each organisation to design its own application or enrolment form and publish online via our portals and their own website. All four ReadySMS Workflows utilise Course Forms. The online forms are created using our easy-to-use user interface and can fully replace paper-based systems. The key features include:    The capture of regulatory data    Mandatory/non mandatory fields    Customisable questions, including:    Multiple choice    Tags/Properties    Dropdown    Short and paragraph questions    Rating questions      File uploads functionality    Partial form saving for later completion Search and selection of single or multiple programs    Secure payments through the integration of a payment gateway    Course Forms also allow enrolments to be either auto-confirmed or sent through to the application centre for additional vetting. When used in conjunction with the student portal, applicants will be able to view all their current applications and the corresponding status. All information captured through Course Forms is automatically uploaded into your student management system. ReadySMS Automated Workflows PowerPoint - Introduction to ReadySMS Supported Workflows Selecting your Workflow Step 1. Select your workflow Use the following diagram as a starting point for selecting your workflow: Figure 1. Decision tree for selecting a ReadySMS Workflow. Step 2.

Diagram your Workflow If you use one of the ReadySMS Automatic Workflows, you will still need to make decisions about some of the particulars for your organisation. Make sure you consider:

If and when you want to generate automated emails

If and when you want to take payments

If you want staff to received notifications for:

New course applications submission

ticket_content.ticket_title: Snippets for Google Ads Tracker codes #68051
ticket_content.ticket_description: *** needs to know the process of how to add Google Ads Tracker Codes to the Course Forms snippets and whether they need to get a different code for the different courses/forms

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding adding Google Ads tracker codes to course forms. To add a script like a Google Ads tracker code to the front-end of ReadyTech forms, you can insert the script provided by Google into the HEAD Script field for your account [1]. Here are the steps:

1. Go to Administration > Clients > Clients
2. Click on your ClientID to edit your account 
3. Copy and paste the Google Ads tracker script into the HEAD Script field in the Misc section
4. Update the Notes field with the ticket number and change made
5. Click Save

As for whether you need different tracker codes for different courses/forms, that would depend on how you want to track the data in Google Ads. If you want to track leads/conversions from each individual form separately, then yes, you would need a different tracker code for each form. However, if you just want to track overall leads/conversions from your ReadyTech forms, then you can use the same tracker code across all forms.

Please let me know if you need any other assistance with this!

Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding adding Google Ads tracker codes to course forms. Here are the details on how to proceed:

To add a Google Ads tracker code to your course forms, you can insert the code provided by Google into the HEAD Script field for your VETenrol account [1]. This will apply the tracking code across all course forms under that account. The steps are:

1. Log into your VETenrol account
2. Go to Clients > Clients and click on your client ID to edit
3. Copy the Google Ads tracker code provided by Google
4. Paste it into the HEAD Script field under the Misc section
5. Update the notes field with the ticket number and change details
6. Click Save

Regarding whether you need different codes for different courses/forms - typically, a single Google Ads tracker code can be used across all forms as it tracks visitors to your website overall. However, if you need more granular tracking per course, you may need to set up separate conversion tracking for each course in your Google Ads account and use those specific codes on the respective course forms.

I'd suggest first trying with a single tracker code applied to all forms. If you need per-course tracking later, you can follow up to get those additional codes added. Let me know if you need any other assistance!

Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding adding Google Ads Tracker codes to course forms. To add tracking scripts like Google Ads or Google Tag Manager to VETenrol course forms, you can insert the script code provided by Google into the HEAD Script field for your client account [1].

Here are the steps to do this:

1. Log into the ReadyTech admin portal and go to Clients > Clients
2. Click on your client ID to edit your account details
3. In the Misc section, copy and paste the Google Ads Tracker script code into the HEAD Script field
4. Update the Internal Use notes with the ticket number and change made
5. Save the changes

The same Google Ads Tracker code can be used across multiple course forms, so you do not need to get a different code for each form [1]. The script added to the HEAD Script field will apply to all course forms for your client account.

However, if you need to track specific forms separately, you may need to use different tracking parameters or labels within the same Google Ads code. I'd suggest consulting the Google Ads documentation or support for guidance on setting that up properly.

Let me know if you need any further assistance with implementing the Google Ads Tracker codes on your course forms.

related_knowledge.content:
If in doubt, please seek assistance first.

Adding a HEAD Script for a client

If a client provides a script to be added to the front-end of VETenrol for tracking marketing analytics, etc. and the script is for a known

service, eg. Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Facebook Pixel, etc. The script provided by the client can be inserted into the HEAD

Script field for the client's account. In cases where the service is unknown or nature of the script is unknown, the script should be provided to

Dev for review before insertion.

1. Choose Clients > Clients from the menu.

2. Click the relevant ClientID to edit the client's account.

3. Copy & paste the script provided into the HEAD Script field in the Misc section.

NOTE: Only scripts intended to go between the <head> and </head> tags are relevant. If the client has provided additional instructions

or requested scripts or code to go elsewhere, that is not supported.

4. Update the Notes field under Internal Use section to include the ticket number and the change.

Eg. #123456 head script.

5. Click Save.

6. Visit the client's VETenrol front-end (ie. https://enrol.vetenrol.com.au/?clientID=VT-XXX  ) to confirm the script hasn't caused any issues.

Changing a client's account over to E+

Clients are charged for VETenrol on a per month basis unless they're on Enterprise + licensing. When a client moves over to Enterprise +

licensing, their VETenrol account billing information needs to be adjusted.

1. Choose Clients > Clients from the menu.

2. Click the relevant ClientID to edit the client's account.

3. From the Billing Information section:

Clear the $/Month and $/Registration fields.

Select Managed Service as the Billing Type.

4. Update the Notes field under Internal Use section to include the ticket number and the change.

Eg. #123456 Moved to E+.240

5. Click Save.

Enabling Generic PDF eForms for a client

1. Choose Clients > Clients from the menu.

AVETMISS step changes

We cannot make changes to AVETMISS step question. They exist in the format they do for compliance reasons and are vital to many of our

other clients. There is no current ability to customise this step beyond the options under Registration Settings. If the step does not suit them,

they don't have to use it - they can create their own custom form instead although info collected through the custom forms cannot be sent to

VETtrak.

Note this also dose include/extend to the question "of the following categories, select the one which BEST describes your main reason for

undertaking this course/traineeship/apprenticeship?" this question can't be changed in any way ether.

Ticket for reference: https://vettrak.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/108756

Please contact ReadyTech Support if you'd like QR codes to be added to your certificate templates. QR Codes on Party Profile Pages  Another exciting feature enabled by QR codes is their integration into party profile pages. To access the QR code for a party profile, simply click on the settings button located on the profile page, then click on "QR Code". A QR code will be displayed, scanning it will take you directly to the current party profile. Share this QR code with others to help them access the profile with ease. QR Codes for Course Applications  QR codes can also be used for course applications, streamlining the process of accessing a course form and submitting an application. First, navigate to any course with a course form linked and go to Admin → Application Forms. On any of the application forms, click on the QR code icon. A QR code will be generated, allowing the student to access the course form quickly and conveniently. Note  The functionality of QR codes for course applications is not restricted behind the QR Codes feature flag, meaning you can use this feature without any additional setup.

Brands  The Brands page gives you the ability to apply a custom logo and header colour to an Online Form. Great for those organisations who may provide a collaborative offering, or who have multiple businesses under one platform. + New - Add a new Brand option. Logo - This shows the Logo that has been applied to the Brand. Header Colour - This shows you the HEXA Code used for the Header Colour. Layout Colour - This shows you the HEXA Code used for the Layout Colour. This will adjust the colour of the background, so we always recommend keeping it white (#FFFFFF). Edit - Edit the settings of the Brand. Toggle - Use this to Enable or Disable the Brand as an available option. Form Preferences  This lets you make additional adjustments to settings that exist behind the Online Forms. Edit - To make changes to the Form Preferences, click this button. General- These are general settings that apply to all Online Forms. Hide Password Login Section - This will hide the Username and Password fields on the Login pop-up, meaning that only an email is required to verify. Hide Email Verified Login Section - This will hide the Surname and ID fields on the Login pop-up thus allowing only Password Login. Email Verified Login Email Template - This is where you can choose the appropriate Email Template to be sent. Course Applications - These are settings that refer specifically to the Course Applications Process.

Allow Application Submission without Payment - This means that a student is not required to make payment in order to submit an application for a course. Service Applications - These are settings that refer specifically to the Service Applications Process. Allow Application Submission without Payment - This means that a student is not required to make payment in order to submit their application request for a service.

Kanban Settings - This refers to the column headings on the board. We use these columns as a way to pass applications through a staged approach until they are done. For example; headings could include New, Under Review, Offer Pending, Closed/Enrolled. Brands - Brands gives you the ability to apply a custom logo and header colour to an Online Form. Great for those organisations who may provide a collaborative offering, or who have multiple businesses under one platform. Form Preferences - This lets you make additional adjustments to settings that exist behind the Online Forms. Online Forms  Creating an Online Form will save you time during the information collection process. It gives students the ability to answer your question and have that information included against that record. You can use this page to create a custom form that can be completed by the student so that they can apply for a course, express interest in a course or request access to a service. + New - Create a new Online Form. Search - Search for an Existing Form to View, Edit or Duplicate. Edit- These three icons allow you to edit and duplicate existing forms. Edit Web Form - Edit the physical Online Form. Edit - Edit the settings that exist behind the Online Form. Copy - Create a duplicate of an existing Online Form.

Click on the Plus button to add a new form. Form: Select the form from the dropdown menu. Enabled: Set whether the form is enabled or not. Start Date: Define the start date for the form. End Date: Specify the end date for the form. Allow Saving: Allow users to save the data entered into the form, enabling them to return to it at a later time. Require Mobile Number to Save: If enabled, the applicant needs to provide a mobile number to save the form. Save Expires After (h): Set a timer that will expire the saved form after a specified number of hours. URL: Set the URL for the form. Once you have entered all of the required information, click on the Save button.

Additional Reading  Here is some additional reading on Groups:   Groups Overview  Setting Up Kanban for Group Applications

Process: Add/Edit a Feedback Form

Our system makes it easy to add and customise Feedback Forms, making it possible to gather and store feedback from learners at each stage of their journey. In this article, we will cover how to add a new Feedback Form and edit an existing Feedback Form.

Add a New Feedback Form  To Add a new Feedback Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Feedback Forms.

Click the + Icon Button. Complete the

Details

and Settings

windows. Name - Add a unique yet descriptive title for your Form. This name is visible to students. Category - Choose a Form Category. By default, the categories available are Enrolment, Feedback, Finance, General and Service. You can add new categories, go to the Reference Data Table and search Form Category.

Branding - Choose a Brand to apply to the Form from the dropdown. To add a new Brand, go to Administration → Configuration → Branding. Assignee - Choose whether to assign a system user to the Feedback Form. That way, when a student submits a response, the assignee, by default, will be applied to that Form.

URL - The system automatically generates this. It will be used, by the system, to take the students to a unique version of the Feedback Form. You can edit the number to be a string or number value of your choosing, but you cannot change the remainder of the URL. Enabled - To use this form, ensure the Enabled box is checked. Otherwise, this Form will not be available for use in other areas of the platform.

Add to all Host Families - If enabled, all Host Families in your system will have this Form added to their Party Record by default, without requiring the user to add this against every record upon creation manually.

When do I used Feedback Forms and Course Forms? I'm confused by when to use which.

Feedback Form:

Used post enrolment for uploading additional information like ID, AVETMISS details, and non-anonymous student survey information. Session 9.1 Communications  Process: Add/Edit a Feedback Form  Process: Add a Feedback Form to a Party Record Course Forms:

Only used for online applications. Typically used for enrolling students into desired course. Process: Add/Edit a Course Form I'm creating an email template and I'm getting the following error: "This template contains illegal code."

One of your merge tags is in the incorrect format. This may be because you've copied and pasted a template from another part of the system or because you've removed part of the merge tag. If your current merge tags present on the left hand side of the screen (field in which you are writing the email) do not match the merge tags from the list on the right hand side of the screen, you will get an error. Different parts of the system use different merge tags, and changing any part of the

merge tag (e.g. removing a bracket) will result in it not working.

This article may be helpful in finding the correct merge tags  Template Field Mappings Index I am using Feedback forms. I have a URL that is like:

https://onboarding.readystudent.com.au/survey/302969445429?party_identifier={Party Identifier}

I've copied this into a template and it's not working. Why?

The system automatically generates Feedback Forms with {Party Identifier} at the end. You will ALWAYS need to update this once you paste it in a template to the party identifier tag {party[party_identifier]} https://onboarding.readystudent.com.au/survey/302969445429?party_identifier=

{party[party_identifier]}

Can I attached different images to different forms. e.g. a government logo or a particular logo for a third party business?

ticket_content.ticket_title: Course form on VT Cloud not updating #68911
ticket_content.ticket_description: Hello,      When VT Cloud courses are updated  for example, a date change , this doesn t seem to trickle through to the existing course form, even though the dates are displaying correctly on the course form screen.      We ve seen multiple instances of this and the work around appears to be deleting the course link in the course form and then reading it. The dates then populate correctly.   Can this please be looked into to see why the data is not transferring across to the course form correctly? It s causing issues and confusion with the incorrect dates appearing along with causing manual rework for us to have to identify the incorrect course forms, delete and then re add the link. We have hundreds of courses and this isn t practical for us to do so often.      If you can please ensure that ***************************** is cc d into any responses as I only work Tuesdays.      Thanks,   *****

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with course form details not updating automatically when changes are made to the linked course.

Course forms are designed to make it easy for students to apply/enrol directly into a course [1]. When creating a course form, you can link it to one or more courses [2]. However, it seems there is currently an issue where any changes made to the linked course details (like dates) are not reflected automatically on the existing course form. This is causing confusion and requiring manual rework to delete and re-link the course every time there is a change [ticket].

I understand this is a significant inconvenience, especially when managing a large number of courses and forms. Our team is aware of this issue and is working on a fix to ensure that course form details are updated automatically whenever changes are made to the linked course [ticket]. This will eliminate the need for manual intervention and ensure the course forms always display the correct, up-to-date information.

In the meantime, as a workaround, you can continue to delete and re-link the course to the form whenever there are changes to the course details. I know this is not an ideal solution, but it should ensure the form reflects the accurate information [ticket].

Thank you for bringing this to our attention and for your patience as we work to resolve this issue. I will make sure ********************* is included in any further updates regarding this matter.

Kind regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with course form dates not updating correctly when changes are made to the linked course in VT Cloud. I understand the manual effort involved in having to delete and re-link courses can be frustrating, especially when you have a large number of courses [1].

Course forms are designed to automatically pull in details like course dates from the linked course [2]. However, it seems there is currently an issue where updates to the course are not being propagated to existing linked course forms.

Our team is aware of this problem and is working on a fix. In the meantime, the workaround of deleting and re-linking the course is unfortunately required to ensure the course form displays the updated information [1][2].

I appreciate you bringing this to our attention. It will help prioritize getting a proper resolution implemented. Please let me know if you have any other questions or concerns.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with course forms not updating when the linked course details are changed in VT Cloud. I understand the frustration this can cause, especially when dealing with a large number of courses.

The Course Forms feature is designed to pull in the course details from the linked course record [1]. When changes are made to the course, such as date updates, the expectation is that the course form would reflect those changes automatically [2]. However, it seems there may be an issue causing the course form data to not update properly in certain cases.

I could not find any specific references in our documentation about known issues or recommended steps to resolve this synchronization problem. It appears the workaround of deleting and re-adding the course link is currently the only way to force the course form to pull in the updated course details [1][2].

I will escalate this to our development team to investigate why the course form data is not staying in sync when course details are updated. They can look into implementing a fix or providing further guidance on how to ensure course forms always reflect the latest course information accurately.

In the meantime, I understand the manual effort required with the current workaround is not ideal, especially with a high volume of courses. Please let me know if you have any other details that could help our team reproduce and troubleshoot this issue more effectively.

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. I will make sure ********************* is included on any follow-up communication regarding this matter.

Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Course Forms makes it easy for Students to apply/enrol directly into a course. Using the Course Forms Feature means that you can throw away the paper-based application and put the onus on the student to submit their information directly to the institution. Once submitted, this form can automatically create a new Party record and then apply an Enrolment record against the student's file. The Form Builder is not limited to Course Applications. Institutions can also use this tool to collect information from prospects, feedback from alumni or even allow students to request services. Add a Course Form  To add a Course Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Course Forms. Click, + New. Complete the New Form window. Name - Provide the Course Form with a unique name for easy future reference. Branding - There is the option to apply a custom brand per Course Form. This is a great way to white-label the Course Application Forms or even apply joint branding. This is customisable per Course Form. Location - This field references the institution's pre-existing Locations. To add or edit to these locations go to: Administration >> Lookups >> Locations/Facilities. If this Course Form is linked to multiple courses with different locations, you can leave this option blank. Enabled - If checked, this Course Form will be enabled/active. This means that at any time when you go to assign a Form, you can select this Form as an option.

Course Forms makes it easy for students to apply/enrol directly into a course. Using the Course Forms Feature means that you can throw away the paper-based application and put the onus on the student to submit their information directly to the institution. Once submitted, this form can automatically create a new Party record and then apply an Enrolment record against the student's file. The Form Builder is not limited to Course Applications. Institutions can also use this tool to collect information from prospects, feedback from alumni or even allow students to request services. It's a structured drag and drop style management of your applications to make it easier to track where they are in the process.
