response.answer:
Hi *****,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with not receiving the original booking confirmation email from VETtrak for online bookings made through your website.

Based on the information provided, it seems that while you are receiving the confirmation email from your website for these bookings, the separate confirmation email that should be sent from VETtrak is not being received [3]. This could potentially be due to a configuration issue or a setting that needs to be adjusted within VETtrak.

I would suggest checking the confirmation email settings in VETtrak to ensure that the appropriate options are enabled for sending out these confirmation emails [1][4]. You may want to review the SMTP server settings, as well as any overrides or custom templates that may be in place for specific programs.

If the issue persists after verifying the settings, it would be best to reach out to our VETtrak support team for further assistance. They can investigate the matter more thoroughly and provide guidance on resolving the problem with the missing confirmation emails from VETtrak.

Please let me know if you have any other questions or concerns.

Thank you,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the missing booking confirmation emails from VETtrak. Based on the information provided, it seems that the registration is not being fully processed in VETtrak, which is preventing the confirmation email from being sent out [2].

A few things you can check:

1. In the VETenrol Admin, locate the registration and review the details. Ensure the payment status shows "Details Supplied" if it was a credit card payment. If not, you may need to confirm payment was received through your payment provider [1].

2. Once payment is confirmed, click the "Send payment details to VETtrak" button to mark the associated Web Enrolment as paid in VETtrak [1]. This should trigger the confirmation email.

3. Check the Web Enrolments section in VETtrak to see if the registration has come through properly [5]. If not, you may need to click the "Re-create Web Enrolment" button in the VETenrol Admin to resubmit the registration details to VETtrak [2].

If you have followed these steps and are still not receiving the confirmation emails, please let me know and I can further investigate the issue. You can also place a test registration to better isolate the problem.

Thank you,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with not receiving the original booking confirmation email from VETtrak. I understand this is causing confusion when online bookings are made through your website.

Based on the information provided, it seems that the online booking process is working correctly by sending the confirmation from the website. However, there appears to be an issue with VETtrak not sending its own booking confirmation email as expected.

As I could not find any documentation specifically addressing this scenario, I would suggest the following steps:

1. Check the VETtrak settings to ensure email notifications for new bookings/enrolments are enabled and configured correctly. The settings should allow VETtrak to send a confirmation email to the designated recipient(s) when a new booking comes in.

2. Review the email logs or history in VETtrak to see if any booking confirmation emails were attempted to be sent but failed for any reason. This may provide clues on why the emails are not being received.

3. Test by manually creating a new enrolment or booking in VETtrak and see if the confirmation email is sent successfully. This can help isolate if the issue is specific to the online booking integration or a broader configuration problem in VETtrak.

If these steps do not resolve the issue, it would be best to log a support case with the ReadyTech team for further investigation. They may need to review your specific VETtrak setup and configurations to determine why the booking confirmations are not being sent as expected from their system. [6]

Please let me know if you have any other questions!

Kind Regards,

will re-create and send the automated email that was originally sent to the RTO. This can be used in cases where the original email has been deleted. This will not be available if the alert is disabled. Note: This will recreate the confirmation email based on the information displayed by Registration Details. Some data exists only at the time of registering and will not be available to populate certain placeholders. The Change Occurrence link — to choose a different programme/occurrence combination. The Web Enrol ID link — to check for the matching enrolment in VETtrak for manually processed web enrolments. Web Enrol ID will not be a link if an Enrolment ID has already been retrieved for the registration. The Client Details section — edit some client details and contact information. VETenrol will automatically highlight a client age that is under the age of 20 as a precaution to alert the RTO that further identity documentation or actions need to be taken should it be needed. This does not apply to clients whose residential address, or the occurrence they are registering to, are located in Queensland. Apply a Status to the registration with the drop-down box provided. Choosing Approved will apply the current date and close the registration on the Registrations page. Re-create Web Enrolment will resubmit the registration information to VETtrak creating a new Web Enrolment.

This is suitable for enrolments that have failed to send due to technical issues or that have been mistakenly cancelled from the Web Enrolments screen. The Send payment details to VETtrak

VETenrol will form the appropriate link to replace the placeholder in the confirmation email that is sent out. Note   VETenrol cannot specifically track who has been provided a Data Completions link, or when/if it is clicked. Receipt emails for Group Booking participants cannot be re-sent from the Admin (re-sending will result in a data completion link to update based on Employer's enrolment). VETenrol mail templates cannot be used to generate data completion links for enrolments created outside of VETenrol. Enrolments manually created in VETtrak, from a third party, etc. need to be handled from within VETtrak. VETtrak Set up  The link can also be distributed via email from your VETtrak database. As such, a Merge Template should be set up in your VETtrak for this purpose. Select Occ enrolment for Context. Enter a meaningful Name for the template. Complete any of the optional fields, as desired, eg. Subject. Enter an appropriate message in the body that includes the customised VETenrol URL. https://enrol.vetenrol.com.au/?clientID=VT-DEMO&page=completeregistration.aspx&eID={EnrolmentId}  Be sure to replace VT-DEMO with your own VETenrol client ID. If you are copying and pasting the link directly into the message, make sure the text doesn't convert to a link until after the client ID has been changed. The URL should end with the enrolment ID field from the list on the right so that this can be replaced with the relevant enrolment ID for the client on send.

Attachments — functionality to include files as attachments to the confirmation email. Overrides — functionality to choose an alternative template to use as the confirmation email for specific programmes. Settings  This category applies to the default confirmation email. Settings is the default tab for the Confirmation Emails page. The options are further divided into four sections:   Confirmation Settings  Student Portal Credentials  Group Registration Participants  Custom Confirmation      Confirmation Settings  This section offers the general settings for the confirmation. Do not send confirmation email Toggle this option to globally allow or prevent the sending of the confirmation email that normally goes out upon completion of the registration process. Include copy of registration details as attachment Toggle this option to include a PDF version of the complete registration details as an attachment to the notification email. This attachment will only be included if a SMTP Server has been set up for your VETenrol account. Exclude signature areas from attachment Toggle this option to remove or include the signature section in the attached registration details. Student Portal Credentials  This section relates to the inclusion of details for accessing the Student Portal as part of the confirmation.

Available for: Myself

I hope this message finds you well. I am reaching out to extend a personal invitation for you and your team to participate in a

Training Booking Process

Introduction  A range of paid consultation options exist for your VETtrak product, in addition to our free education materials. Please refer to the following page for everything you'll need to know about booking any of our consultation services. Make a Booking    Please follow the steps below to make your booking. Navigate to the link provided. You may see only one appointment type, or many, depending on the link. Please select the appropriate type of training if you see multiple types. To do this, click "Book." (If you do not see multiple options, move to step 3)  Select your Consultant. "Any Available" will provide a list of all available dates and times for all consultants. If you see only a calendar, there is only one Consultant available for this service. View the available dates and times on the calendar. Select your most suitable spot. Input the booking details on the form. If there's no cost, select "Appointment Complete." If there's a cost, select "Redeem Coupon" if you have one. Alternatively, complete the booking and pay with a credit card. Read your confirmation and save the booking in your calendar. Rescheduling a Booking    Please follow the steps below to reschedule your booking. Find the confirmation email you received when booking. Select "Change Appointment" at the bottom of the email. Select "Reschedule." Choose a new date and time from the calendar. Select "Reschedule." View your confirmation and add the new invite to your calendar.

How to approve a Registration

Open your web browser and visit VETenrol Administration (httsp://enrol.vetenrol.com.au/admin). Identify the client’s registration in the list. Check for a valid payment status. For payments made by credit card, this will be Details Supplied. If payment is still pending, you may wish to contact the client. If a method other than Credit Card was chosen, then that Payment Method will be listed instead. Click the registration ID to open the Registration Details. Confirm the information in the Payment Details section. For credit card payments, the successful payment is indicated by the status Details Supplied and this can be confirmed through records from your payment provider. If you suspect the user has paid and the payment status remains Pending Payment, click the Merchant Response link to attempt to fetch a response from the provider. In the case of payment methods other than Credit Card, you will need to implement your own payment verification method to be completed at this point. Upon confirming payment has been received, click the Send payment details to VETtrak button. This will mark the associated Web Enrolment as paid in full. For some payment methods, it may be preferable to skip this step and take care of obtaining payment separately or at a later date. For example, Invoice Me might be handled via third party accounting software. This button will be missing or disabled if the payment information has already been sent to VETtrak.

This is typical of registrations with a payment status of Details Supplied if credit card payment details are being automatically sent to VETtrak. Choose Approved from the Status drop-down menu. The registration is now ready to be handled as an enrolment in VETtrak. Related Topics   Processing Client Web Enrolments (VETtrak)  Pending Payment Follow-ups - sending emails to customers that have not paid. Registration Status - managing available statuses.

Handling a Group Booking Registration in VETenrol Admin

The Group Booking feature allows an employer to register a number of their employees for a course. In the case where a group booking is received:     The name of the company will be listed in the Name column. Group Booking will be indicated in the Registration Type column. Clicking the registration's ID will open the Registration Details page:     The Booking Details section will list the participant information provided at the Places step if these were provided during registration. Note  Providing place details to match the number of reservations is not forced. It may be necessary to contact the employer to discuss their registration. The registrations are received into VETtrak's Web Enrolments as with standard registration. The occurrence is expanded to reveal a new tab titled Employer web enrolments. The registration is expanded to reveal the individual participants. The Employer should be matched first, then each participant. Related Topics   Student Interface: Group Bookings for understanding the registration process undertaken by your clients.

Confirmation Emails

The Confirmation Email is an automated message sent to users on completion of the registration process, which contains details of their registered course. Settings for the Confirmation Email are accessed from the Configuration () page in the VETenrol Admin. They provide control over the content and other options relating to the email sent to users. In this article:   The Confirmation Emails Page  Settings category  Confirmation Settings  Student Portal Credentials  Group Registration Participants  Custom Confirmation           The Confirmation Emails Page    Key aspects of the Confirmation Emails page:   Navigation  Preview — opens the pop-up to show the default confirmation email content. This preview will show the system default, or the content for the custom confirmation if it exists. New Attachment — opens the pop-up to upload a file to be sent with the confirmation email as an attachment. New Override — opens the pop-up to assign a mail template to replace the default for a specific programme. Save — Commits any changes to the settings. It appears to the right of the navigation area and at the bottom of the page. Saving will keep changes to settings made across tabs. Navigation to related pages:  Templates — opens the Mail Templates page. SMTP — opens the mail server settings. Categories There are three tabs to navigate between the setting categories:  Settings — general options for the confirmation email.

ticket_content.ticket_title: Editing the Course Application Resume email #62144
ticket_content.ticket_description: How do I edit the Course Application Resume email that is received by students when they save a course form? These don t appear under the student communication log nor do they sit under the kanban/workflow automations.

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about editing the Course Application Resume email. The Course Application Resume email is an automated email sent to students when they save a course form application but do not submit it [1][2]. This allows students to resume filling out the form at a later time.

To edit the content and settings of this email, you will need to edit the Email Template that is associated with the "Resume" Course Application Status. Here are the steps:

1. Go to Administration > Lookups > Course Application Setup
2. Find the Course Application Status named "Resume" and click the edit icon [4]
3. In the Email Templates section, you can select which email template to use for this status across all locations, or define a specific template per location
4. To edit the actual content and formatting of the email template, go to Administration > Communications > Email Templates and find/edit the template you want to use [1]

You can customize the email subject line, body text, and use merge fields to populate dynamic information from the student's application. Once saved, this edited template will be used whenever a student saves a course form as a resume [1][2][4][3].

Let me know if you need any other assistance with configuring email communications for the course application process!

Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding editing the Course Application Resume email.

Based on my understanding, the Course Application Resume email is an automated system email that gets sent to students when they save or submit a course application form, likely as a confirmation or receipt. However, I could not find any documentation on how to edit or customize the content of this specific email template.

Since this email does not appear to be part of the standard communication logs, student portals, or workflow automations, it may be a core system-generated email that cannot be directly edited. [5]

My recommendation would be to reach out to the ReadyTech support team for further assistance on this particular email. They may be able to provide more insight into whether it can be customized, and if so, how to go about doing that. Alternatively, you could look into creating a custom email template triggered by a Course Application Status to send a custom confirmation email instead of relying on the system-generated Resume email. [2]

Please let me know if you need any other assistance regarding course applications and related communications. I'll be happy to further investigate the available options and workflows.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding editing the Course Application Resume email that students receive when saving or resuming a course form.

Based on my understanding, this specific email is a system-generated notification that is triggered automatically when a student saves or resumes filling out a course application form [3]. It does not appear to be part of the standard email template configuration for course application statuses [1].

Unfortunately, I could not find any documentation on how to customize or edit the content of this specific "resume" email notification. This may be a limitation of the current functionality.

I will need to consult with our product team to see if there are any plans to allow customization of this particular email in the future. If it is something that can be added, I will make sure to pass along your feedback as a request for this capability [3].

In the meantime, please let me know if you have any other questions! I'm happy to provide further guidance on working with course application forms and related communications.

Thank you,

related_knowledge.content: We have linked the Category title Kanban. This makes it easy to differentiate between the Email Templates later on. Document Category - As this is an Email Template for an Application Status, we recommend selecting Applications. Allow Custom Code - If you prefer to edit the contents of the Email Template using HTML, select this option to change the Content Editor. Portal - If checked, when this Email Template has been Produced, it will become available as a Document in the Student/Employer Portals. Complete the Content window. This is where you can design the contents and format of the email. On the right-hand side, the dynamic fields make it possible for the system to merge in the information that is specific to that Student. For generic content that must be included no matter who the Student is, type it into the content window. Click, Create. You have now created an Email Template for a Course Application Status.

Process: Add an Email Template for a Course Application Status

When using the Course Application Status feature, it is possible to associate an Email Template so that when the Status is applied to a Students Course Application, the system will then automate the sending, of this Email Template, to the Student. Please Note  When using this guide to Create an Email Template, you create an Email Template that can only be accessed and applied to a Course Application Status. This Email Template will not be available for general use in other areas of the system.

Process: Add/Edit a Course Form

Course Forms makes it easy for Students to apply/enrol directly into a course. Using the Course Forms Feature means that you can throw away the paper-based application and put the onus on the student to submit their information directly to the institution. Once submitted, this form can automatically create a new Party record and then apply an Enrolment record against the student's file. The Form Builder is not limited to Course Applications. Institutions can also use this tool to collect information from prospects, feedback from alumni or even allow students to request services. Add a Course Form  To add a Course Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Course Forms. Click, + New. Complete the New Form window. Name - Provide the Course Form with a unique name for easy future reference. Branding - There is the option to apply a custom brand per Course Form. This is a great way to white-label the Course Application Forms or even apply joint branding. This is customisable per Course Form. Location - This field references the institution's pre-existing Locations. To add or edit to these locations go to: Administration >> Lookups >> Locations/Facilities. If this Course Form is linked to multiple courses with different locations, you can leave this option blank. Enabled - If checked, this Course Form will be enabled/active. This means that at any time when you go to assign a Form, you can select this Form as an option.

When Require Reason is checked, you will then have the ability to define a set of custom reasons. For example, Change of Mind, Too Expensive, Went to a Competitor. Reasons Window Duplicate Status - When checked, this Status will automatically apply to Course Applications when the application is recognised by the system as a Duplicate. Offer Accepted Status - Once the Offer has been accepted, the Status for the Application will be updated with status if checked. Enabled - This box is used to Enable/Disable a status. If you want to use this Status, check this box. To archive, you can uncheck the box. Email Templates Window  If you do not wish to use a Default Email Template across all Locations, this window allows you to define the Email Template per Course Location further. An institution may choose to do this if they are required to deliver specific information to a student, which is in line with a state-based Funding Contract. Click, Save. You have now added a Course Application Status. Edit a Course Application Status  To Edit a Course Application Status, follow these instructions:   Click on the Administration tab. Select Lookups and then Course Applications Setup. Find the Course Application Status you wish to edit. Edit - The Pen Icon can be used to edit the settings of the existing Course Application Status. Delete - The Trash Icon can be used to delete the Kanban Status. Click, Save. You have now edited a Course Application Status.

Please Note  It is not always possible to Delete a Course Application Status. This is because the Default System Course Application Statuses can not be deleted. If you do not wish to use this Status, simple Disable the Status by unchecking the Enabled box within that Statuses settings.

Course Forms makes it easy for students to apply/enrol directly into a course. Using the Course Forms Feature means that you can throw away the paper-based application and put the onus on the student to submit their information directly to the institution. Once submitted, this form can automatically create a new Party record and then apply an Enrolment record against the student's file. The Form Builder is not limited to Course Applications. Institutions can also use this tool to collect information from prospects, feedback from alumni or even allow students to request services. Supporting Articles   Process: Add/Edit a Course Form  Form Builder Overview    Here is an example of what your Course Form might look like: We use Kanban to visually represent the status of a Course Application. It's a structured drag and drop style management of your applications to make it easier to track where they are in the process. Supporting Articles    Kanban Overview    Process: Add/Edit a Kanban Status    Process: Add/Edit a Course Application Status    Process: Create an Email Template for a Course Application Status     Here is an example of what your Kanban might look like: When a Student submits a Course Form, to enrol into a Course, it creates a Course Application that can be reviewed and processed by the administrative team. Supporting Articles   Course Application Overview    Here is an example of what the Course Application might look like:

Edit a Course Form  To edit a Course Form, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Forms → Course Forms. + New - Create a new Course Form. Search- Search for an existing Course Form. Edit Web Form - Edit the physical web form itself. Edit Form Settings - Edit the settings of the Course Form. Copy - Create a duplicate of an existing Course Form. Delete - Delete an existing Course Form. Click, the EditIcon. To edit the Web Form click this Icon. To edit the Form Settings click this Icon. Make any required changes. Click, Save. You have now edited an existing Course Form.

Process: Add/Edit a Course Application Status

A Course Application Status is used to further define the state of the Students Course Application either in the Applications List View or within the Kanban Board. You can colour code each Status to make it easier to visually identify the Application/s state and link a pre-created Email Template that the system can automate. For Example  Per the screenshot below, you may choose to have an Application Incomplete column. However, the Course Application Status makes it possible to define further why it is incomplete. Under the Application Incomplete column header, we have created the following Course Application Statuses:   Missing - Proof of Citizenship  Missing - Unique Student Identifier (USI)  Missing - Proof of Residence   Therefore, should a Student be added to the Application Incomplete column and a Missing - Proof of Citizenship status chosen, I can choose to send the automated Email Template that I had previously connected to the Status. Kanban Board Example - The Course Application Statuses are highlighted below. Course Application Status Example - When a Course Application is dragged into a new column, you have the ability to choose the Application Status, Set an Assignee, and send have the system automatically send the Email Template associated with the selected Status.

The presented workflows reflect common successful usage patterns that we have created based on our expertise in the sector. Modified configurations can only be given support through paid consultation sessions where we will help yu to identify the best approach to configuring your workflows. It remains your responsibility to internally configure, test, and validate that each workflow is aligned with the unique business requirements of your institution.

Do I have to use online enrolments to use a ReadySMS?

No, you can enrol students, and perform associated tasks, manually if that is your preference.

Can I

have one URL that all students can use to enrol students from my website so I don't have to update it regularly?

Yes, you can do this using the "Links" feature on the Course Application Form. Link every course you would like to make available to students to this one form.

The default Kanban Status' don't work for our processes, can I remove/edit them?

Yes, you can remove or edit them using Administration > Lookups > Course Application Settings > Kanban Settings.

Is there a way to remind staff to follow up applications that are assigned to them?

No, not at present. However, you can make use of the "Assignee" filter in the Course Application view so that users/admin can see which applications they are responsible for and their progress.

If a student responds to an automated email from the system, where does the response

go?

Within the system, you can set up multiple "from" email address (you will be required to have at least one when you configure your emails). Responses are then sent to that email address's inbox, which will be outside the SMS.

I have a large number of "enrolled" students on the Kanban. What should I do with them, will they stay there forever or will they disappear?

You can archive applications you have completed whenever you desire so they are not present. Please see the recording above to view how to do this step.

Course Application Overview

When a student submits a Course Form, to enrol into a Course, it creates a Course Application that can be reviewed and processed by the administrative team. View the List of Course Applications  You can access the submitted Course Applications by clicking the Courses tab and then selecting the Applications option from the dropdown. Depending on your Personal Preferences, you will either see a List or Kanban View. Kanban View      List View View an Individual Course Application   To view an individual Course Application, click on the Application ID. Kanban View      List View Individual Course Application     Edit - To make changes, or adjust any items on this window, click the Edit button. Enrol - When the Student is ready to be Enrolled, select Enrol. This will take you to the Enrolment Wizard to finalise the Students Enrolment. Offer/Express Offer - If your institution requires that you provide a Student with a formal Offer, you can select these options. Offer will require you to go through the Offer Wizard, whereas Express Offer skips the Offer Wizard and takes you straight to the end of the Offer process. Applicant Window - This shows the Applications Full Name and Party ID. By clicking on the Applicant's Full Name it will take you to their Party Record. Application Window - This shows the Application ID , Offer Number, and the Status of the Application. You can, if you wish, edit the Status in this window.

I don't want to use Course Forms. Can I still use these processes?

Yes, absolutely. You can substitute out the use of the Course Form for a physical form/manual process.

Can I modify the workflow I want because it doesn't quite fit what my organisation needs?

The presented workflows reflect common successful usage patterns that we have created based on our expertise in the sector. Modified configurations can only be given support through paid consultation sessions where we will help yu to identify the best approach to configuring your workflows.

It remains your responsibility to internally configure, test, and validate that each workflow is aligned with the unique business requirements of your institution.

I am getting an error when I fill in a course application as a 'test student.' What's going on?

Check that any email templates attached to the application process are correct. e.g. if you have copied merge fields from another template somewhere in the system, the specific merge tags may not be appropriate for the template where you're pasting the email. Double check that all the merge fields are available in the merge fields list to the right hand side of the window.

I'm setting up an accredited workflow. I can see student applications sitting in my course, but they're not moving into the 'enrolled' field even though I've checked 'auto enrol.' What's going on?

Make sure you've definitely:

ticked auto enrol on the course application

checked you have a funding source for your course. Enrolment won't go through without this

Try manually adding an application (Courses > Applications > new application) and then processing the enrolment manually through the enrolment wizard. Note any compulsory fields that are incomplete or any steps that are throwing errors. This is likely the part of your workflow that is not allowing the enrolment through. Review that part of the system.

Ticket Subject: Course Applications

I am trying to determine how I can change the email that is sent after a student submits a course application form. We want to have different emails depending on the branding used or the course application it is attached to. Can you please advise where to do this. And we want to change the email address that appears as the sender if possible. Thank you

If you try and save a course form from the course selection screen:    You get the following message:       If you press save you get the following message:    As there is no email address yet entered. This means the save button should not be enabled on the course selection page to prevent this situation.

ticket_content.ticket_title: Add trainer to the email sender options #64446
ticket_content.ticket_description: Hello Support team,   We recently added a new trainer profile on our Vettrak and all set up on the system, but when she tries to send an email to one of her students, her email address won t show up on the sender options.   Can you please help us and send us an instructions on how to add our new trainer as one of the sender options on email in Vettrak.   Please see attached for reference.  Thank you.

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding adding your new trainer's email address as a sender option in VETtrak.

To allow trainers to send emails from their own email addresses, you need to configure the email notification preferences in VETtrak's Global Preferences area [1][2]. Here are the steps:

1. Go to File > Global Preferences > Portal preferences
2. Turn on the "Enable notification emails" option to allow email notifications
3. If your organization uses individual staff email logins, select the new trainer from the "Staff member to send notification emails from" dropdown [1]
4. Alternatively, if not using individual staff logins, enter the new trainer's email address in the "Email address to send notification emails from" field [2]

This will allow the new trainer's email address to show up as an option when sending emails from VETtrak and the Trainer Portal. Make sure the new trainer also has the appropriate permissions enabled to send emails in the Trainer Portal preferences.

Let me know if you need any further assistance with configuring the email settings.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding adding a new trainer's email to the sender options in VETtrak. To enable a trainer's individual email address to show up as a sender option when sending emails, you will need to configure the notification email preferences in VETtrak Global Preferences [1]:

1. Go to File > Global Preferences > Portal preferences
2. Tick the "Enable notification emails" option to allow emails to be sent from VETtrak
3. If your organization has email setup to use individual staff member email logins, select the new trainer's staff account from the "Staff member to send notification emails from" dropdown [1]

This will allow the new trainer's email address to be used as the sender when sending emails from within VETtrak. You can further configure email recipient types on the Send Email wizards to specify who should receive the emails [2].

Additionally, make sure the new trainer has the appropriate permissions configured in the Trainer Portal preferences to allow sending emails [3].

Let me know if you need any further assistance in getting the new trainer's email set up properly.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding adding a new trainer's email address to the sender options in VETtrak. 

To enable individual staff members like trainers to use their own email addresses when sending emails from VETtrak, you need to configure the email notification preferences under File > Global Preferences > Portal preferences [1]. Turn on the "Enable notification emails" option to allow sending notification emails. Then, if your organization has email setup to use individual staff member email logins, you will need to select the new trainer's staff account via the "Staff member to send notification emails from" dropdown selector [1]. This will allow the trainer's email address to be used as the sender when sending emails from VETtrak.

Additionally, make sure the new trainer's email address is correctly configured in their staff profile in VETtrak. The system will use the email address listed there when sending emails [3].

Let me know if you need any further assistance in getting the new trainer's email address added as a sender option.

Kind regards,

related_knowledge.content:
File > Global Preferences area of VETtrak. Click on Portal preferences to access the specific preferences page of the wizard. Notifications:   When students upload documents through the Student Portal, a notification is sent to staff using the Trainer Portal, it may also optionally email them based on this preference. Turn the Enable notification emails option on to enable notification email functionality. Note: this also affects the Trainer Portal notification email functionality. Enter an email address that the notification will be sent from. Note:

This address must have the rights to send mail through the mail server setup in Email Preferences.

If your organisation has email setup to use individual staff member email logins then you will need to select a staff member's account via the Staff member to send notification emails from dropdown selector to use and their email address will autofill this setting. You can also decide which Staff Types, recorded against the Students enrolment, will be sent notifications. For example, in the above example - assuming

a Trainer, and a Supervisor are all

allocated to the enrolment -

both Supervisor and Trainer would be notified. Settings:   Expire idle portal sessions after setting is new to the preferences in VETtrak.

This setting previously lived in each portal's web.config file under the key "SessionTimeout".

This will now affect portals globally.

The setting controls when an idle portal session is automatically timed out and cleared from the active sessions viewed under the security manager's session management node.

VETtrak will automatically re-calculate and update the Issue Date based on the Schedule Rule as data is changed in VETtrak, the Trainer Portal or API, if the pricing item isn't yet invoiced, such as when enrolment dates and unit results are changed. Generate Schedule Invoices wizard. As VETtrak automatically calculates and updates Issue Dates, these dates will be used to determine when pricing items will be invoiced by the Generate Schedule Invoices wizard as normal. Communication changes   Email recipient types. A new "Recipient types" list has been added to the bottom-left of the Send Email wizards. This lists types of related recipients that you can send the email to. Ticking or unticking these will add or remove related recipients of that type to or from the recipient list. The list of recipient types will vary depending on the type of record you're sending the email for. So that you can address the recipient, new merge fields for "Recipient full name" and "Recipient given name" have been added to all email merge contexts (for an employer recipient, both these merge fields will be the employer name). View email sent for record. A new "Sent for record" field in the View Email Message wizard indicates the VETtrak record that the email was sent in relation to. Send portal messages.If you are using the Student Portal or Trainer Portal, you can now send direct messages to users of those portals through VETtrak. Note that replies to those messages are not yet supported.

Notifications in the web Portals

Notifications  Notifications enable some cross portal notice of activities, such as file upload, to a portal user.

A new notification badge with a count of the unread notifications is shown next to the logged in user name, allowing quick access to sent notifications as they arrive. Example:

A student uploading a file in the student portal will automatically notify enrolment staff, based on preference configuration and the notice will appear in the trainer portal.

The trainer will be able to see the notification of the file upload and selecting the notice hyperlink will take them to view the file uploaded by the student.

The notification process will also occur in the reverse direction, should the trainer upload a file for a student.

In addition to the notification function, the notice may be optionally emailed based on global preferences, in conjunction with the users individual notification settings. Users of the portal may configure their individual notification preference for each notification type from within their respective portal, via the Notification Settings page. VETtrak changes   Compatible with VETtrak version 17.2.0.0 or later. VETtrak Portal Preferences (VETtrak version 23.1)  Includes portal settings which has no impact on notification. Enable notification emails:   Enable notifications to be sent via email in addition to appearing on the relevant portal. Note:

Sending email notifications will have an impact on the performance of portals and VETtrak desktop due to the processing time to send out emails. Enter an email address that the notification will be sent from. This address must have the rights to send mail through the mail server setup in Email Preferences. Note: 19.2 onwards: If your global email settings has the option "Use individual staff member email logins" ticked.

To allow students to direct message their training staff, enable this setting.

This will be on by default. The Trainer Portal messages global preference for viewing messages will likewise need to be enabled. Staff types to allow students to send messages to - In addition to enabling "Can send messages", choose which staff types the student will be able to message. Enabling can send messages without choosing staff types will effectively prevent direct messaging from the Student Portal. Notification Preferences  The Student and Trainer Portal also have some notification preferences that can be set up in the File > Global Preferences area of VETtrak. Click on Notifications to access the specific preferences page of the wizard. Notifications:   When students upload documents through the Student Portal, a notification is sent to staff using the Trainer Portal, it may also optionally email them based on this preference. External links and social icons  Note: The tab for Link has been removed in VETtrak 18.3 and may now be set up via the VETtrak configuration manager with a new node "External links":     See External links in the Web Portals for further information. File Note Configuration  A new public file note has been added to VETtrak 18.3.0.0.

Some configuration of these is managed in a new node in the VETtrak configuration manager.

The Student Portal also allows you to add a 'custom link' to the menu bar, after student's have logged in. To add this link, simply turn on this checkbox. Enter the Name and URL for the preferred link. The name is what will be visible, and clickable for your students. The URL should be the full address for the site you are linking to (eg: http://www.vettrak.com.au). Notification Preferences  The Student and Trainer Portal also have some notification preferences that can be set up in the File > Global Preferences area of VETtrak. Click on Notifications to access the specific preferences page of the wizard. Notifications:   When students upload documents through the Student Portal, a notification is sent to staff using the Trainer Portal, it may also optionally email them based on this preference. Turn the Enable notification emails option on to enable notification email functionality. Note: this also affects the Trainer Portal notification email functionality. Enter an email address that the notification will be sent from. This address must have the rights to send mail through the mail server setup in Email Preferences. You can also decide which Staff Types, recorded against the Students enrolment, will be sent notifications. For example, in the above example - assuming

a Trainer, and a Supervisor are all

allocated to the enrolment -

both Supervisor and Trainer would be notified.

Setting Up Trainer Portal Preferences in VETtrak

To set up the options for your Trainer Portal, go to File > Global Preferences, and go to the Trainer Portal page of the wizard. Use this field to store the location of your Trainer Portal deployment. This will enable the portals to generate links to resources within the portals. To allow trainers to quickly and easily schedule follow up visits with students in the portal, a special type of event can be set up in VETtrak for this purpose. Tick this box if you want to use this feature. If you are using follow up events, select the event that is to be used for this. Indicate if you want your trainers to be able to send emails to clients via the Trainer Portal. Indicate if you want your trainers to be able to send SMS messages to clients via the Trainer Portal. Choose whether student images should be displayed in the Trainer Portal. These are only displayed in the detailed modal view for a student. The Trainer Portal also allows you to add a 'custom link' to the menu bar on the Trainer Portal webpage. To add this link, simply turn on this checkbox. Enter the Name and URL for the preferred link. The name is what will be visible, and clickable for your trainers. The URL should be the full address for the site you are linking to (eg: http://www.vettrak.com.au). Click the Quality Assurance tab to set up the QA options. Tick this box if you want any of your data entered by trainers to be submitted for Quality Assurance before being saved in VETtrak.

Setting Up Trainer Portal Preferences in VETtrak 17.3

To set up the options for your Trainer Portal, go to File > Global Preferences, and go to the Trainer Portal page of the wizard. Use this field to store the location of your Trainer Portal deployment. This will enable the portals to generate links to resources within the portals. To default the portal to have the record signatures box checked on relevant modals, tick this option. Click the Quality Assurance tab to set up the QA options. Tick this box if you want any of your data entered by trainers to be submitted for Quality Assurance before being saved in VETtrak. Indicate which kinds of data and actions need to pass through Quality Assurance. In the above example, trainers can add and edit client and employer events and the information will be saved directly into VETtrak. All other items must pass through Quality Assurance first.

Setting Up Trainer Portal Preferences in VETtrak 18.3

To set up the options for your Trainer Portal, go to File > Global Preferences, and go to the Trainer Portal page of the wizard. Setting up Trainer Portal preferences in VETtrak 19.1 or higher

To set up the options for your Trainer Portal, go to File > Global Preferences, and go to the Trainer Portal page of the wizard. Use this field to store the location of your Trainer Portal deployment. This will enable the portals to generate links to resources within the portals. A third party calendaring application such as (Outlook, Google calendar, iOS & Android) may then be used to subscribe to that schedule link. see Portal iCal susbscription for further detail. To default the portal to have the record signatures box checked on relevant modals, tick this option. Click the Quality Assurance tab to set up the QA options. Tick this box if you want any of your data entered by trainers to be submitted for Quality Assurance before being saved in VETtrak.

The deletion of any item must also pass through the approval process. Untick the box if you do not want your QA events to appear on Trainer Portal's schedule whilst under Quality Assurance. You can configure which types of records in the Trainer Portal can accept file uploads using the "Documents" tab. Use the table to enable or disable uploads against specific types of records. You can optionally configure an external link, to be shown in the top navigation menu, using the "Link" tab. Use the checkbox to enable or disable this feature. ticket_content.ticket_description: Hi,  Is there a way to automatically add a BCC email address to all emails sent?     Thanks

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for your question. Yes, it is possible to automatically add a BCC email address to all emails sent from the system [1][2][3].

To set this up, go to File > Global Preferences > Email Preferences. On the Settings tab, you can enter one or more email addresses in the "For bulk email, send CC/BCC for" field [2]. Any addresses entered here will be automatically added as BCC recipients for all bulk emails sent from the system.

Alternatively, you can use the BCC field when composing individual emails to manually add BCC addresses as needed [1].

I hope this helps explain how to set up automatic BCC recipients for emails. Let me know if you need any further assistance.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your question regarding automatically adding a BCC email address to all emails sent from the system.

Yes, it is possible to set a default BCC address that will be included on all outgoing emails. Here are the steps:

1. Go to File > Global Preferences > Email Preferences
2. On the Settings tab, you can enter an email address in the "For bulk email, send CC/BCC for" field [2]
3. Select the option "Every recipient" to send a BCC copy of each email to the specified address [2]

Alternatively, when composing an email, there is a BCC field where you can manually enter email addresses to send blind copies to. You can click the "Add Staff Email Wizette" button to easily add staff email addresses without typing them out [1].

The BCC addresses added this way will be hidden from all other recipients of the email [1][3]. So this allows you to automatically include certain email addresses on all outgoing emails while keeping them private.

Let me know if you need any other assistance with configuring email settings!

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your question. Yes, it is possible to automatically add a BCC email address to all emails sent from the system. Here are the steps:

1. Go to File > Global Preferences > Email Preferences [3]
2. In the Settings tab, there is an option for "For bulk email, send CC/BCC for" [3]
3. Select "Every recipient" for this option. This will send a BCC copy of each email to the address(es) specified in the next step. [1]
4. In the BCC Address field, enter the email address(es) you want BCC'd on all outgoing emails. [1][4]

Once configured, any email sent from the system will automatically include the specified BCC address(es). This applies to both individual emails as well as bulk emails sent to multiple recipients.

Please let me know if you need any other assistance!

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content:
If required, use BCC Address to enter email addresses to send blind copies or click to open the Add Staff Email Wizette so you do not need to type addresses manually. Addresses in BCC are hidden from all other recipients. Now you can being entering the message:    Message formatting options are provided under the Home, Extra and Table tabs. The Field List (for type and context) shows the available merge fields. Double-click a merge field to add it into your message at the current cursor position. These merge fields will make use of the data within your VETtrak to populate the template based off the corresponding data you have entered. A basic example would be the following template, addressed to a student using Merge Fields that correspond to entered Client Information within VETrak:   At the time of emailing, this will then be interpreted like so:   NOTE: A Merge field that has no corresponding data within VETtrak will display as blank within the Template at the time of generation. Once you are satisfied with the content and appearance of your message:   Click Next and then Finish. When you send an email from the applicable context, you will be prompted to choose between composing an email manually and using a template. There are no restrictions on the number of emails sent at once using the template. Each email is sent individually with the email address in the To field.

If the template includes CC and BCC addresses, these will be sent out with only the first email, or all emails, depending on the global preference. RELATED:   Merge Templates (Configuration)  Merge Template Categories (Configuration)  Email Preferences (Global preferences)

or reception@rto.com.au. Note: Do not use this field if you want replies to emails to return to specific senders (eg. trainers, admin staff). For bulk email, send CC/BCC for  When sending bulk emails to clients where addresses have been specified in the CC or BCC fields, those copies can be sent for:   Only the first recipient A copy of the email that was sent to the first recipient of the bulk email will be sent to the address(es) in the CC and/or BCC fields. For example: If there are 10 students set to receive a bulk email reminding them of their upcoming class and their trainer is CC'd on the message, that staff member will receive one email (that might include the name of the first student). Every recipient A copy of the email will be sent to the address(es) in the CC and/or BCC fields for all recipients included in the bulk email. For example: If there are 10 students set to receive a bulk email reminding them of their upcoming class and their trainer is CC'd on the message, that staff member will receive ten identical emails (except with differing student names).

Note: Choosing the Every recipient option will result in multiple copies of emails with very similar content being received by the CC and/or BCC recipients, In most cases this would be undesirable for the recipient and can result in email clients identifying and marking messages as spam. Email address separator  This is the character used to separate multiple addresses. A semi-colon (;) is usually standard, but some external mail clients use alternatives, such as a comma. Display name in "from" address when sending email from staff member  This controls the way the sender's name will be displayed when people receive emails sent from VETtrak, In addition to using the staff member's name, it is also possible to set your own display name (for example you could enter the name of your organisation). RELATED: Cloud Service Email Settings (Communications)

Authentication type  If authentication is required when connecting to the mail server, select the type. If you do not choose to Use individual staff member logins, you will need to specify an Email login username and the Email login password. If Use individual staff member logins is selected, you will be required to enter the Email Username

and Password for each VETtrak user intending to send emails (This can be located within their Staff Member Wizard). For more information on this, see the article below:   Email: Using Individual Staff Member Logins

Wait time between emails  Depending on your Mail Server settings, you may be required to set a particular wait time between emails in order for the outgoing traffic to be successful, Enter an amount of time (In Milliseconds) here to specify this.

Once connection information is complete, the preferences in the Settings tab should also be reviewed. Choose the Settings tab:    The Settings preferences are:   Default from address  Default reply-to address  For bulk email, send CC/BCC for  Email address separator  Display name in "from" address when sending email from staff member

Default from address  This is the From address that will be used for emails sent from VETtrak.

Note: You can edit the display name of this email address for email recipients to show an 'Alias' name, by formatting the name in quotes, followed by the full email in the correct brackets. "Alias Name" <full_email_address@your_email_domain.com>         Default reply-to address  This is the reply-to address that will be used for emails sent from VETtrak. If there is only one VETtrak user, or if all email replies should go to a single email regardless of who actually sends them from VETtrak, then enter that address here. For example: admin@org.com.au

Note  If you have Two Factor Authentication enabled with your SMTP service, you will need to use an Application Password in order to use the service with your system. Here is some documentation from their help centres covering this:   Microsoft Outlook  Gmail   The Application Passwords generated will need to be used in the password field in your system SMTP server settings. Email Address Settings    This is where your sender email addresses can be configured. Click on the New button to add a sender email address. From address: The email address that you would like to send emails from. This doesn’t need to be the same as the username entered above, but it does need to be entered as a sender email address in your SMTP provider settings. From name: The display name for the email sender. The email will display this name instead of the email address. Reply to user: If this option is enabled, replies to emails sent from this address will be forwarded to the inbox of the email address. Primary: Sets this sender address as the primary email address for your system.

Note  Mandrill can be set up as the email provider for your site and doesn't require much set up or maintenance. This will need to be set up by ReadyTech upon request. Contact your Customer Success Manager or ReadyTech Support for further assistance.

Additional Reading  Here is some additional reading on configuring your site:   Process: Add an Email Template  Process: Entering Your RTO Details  Process: Updating Your RTO Company Details

The Your Email Address (from) email address will be automatically filled in here according to which staff member is selected. Note: If a default email address has been specified under File > Global preferences > Email preferences, it will default to that address if no staff member is selected. If you want the From field to display a name as well as the email address, click on the link for instructions on how to do this. If you click the buttons, the Reply To address will be automatically copied into the CC address and/or BCC address field, ensuring that the sender also receives a copy of the message. The Reply to address field can be used to specify an email address to reply to. This can also be set to a default under File > Global preferences > Email preferences. The email addresses of the client(s) / employer(s) you have selected will appear on the left hand side already ticked. You can untick the box of any you wish to exclude. The Recipient types area lists types of related recipients that you can send the email to. Ticking or unticking these will add or remove related recipients of that type to/from the recipient list. The list of recipient types will vary depending on the type of record you're sending the email for.

You can add additional email recipients. Click on the Plus button in the header to add a field to input an email address, you can also set the additional recipient as a CC

or BCC. Once you have completed your email to the student, click on the Send button.

Emailing Multiple Students in a Course  You can email multiple students at once from a course. Go to the course and click on Email → Compose. Layout:

The layout for the email, it is recommended that you leave this as is. Document Category:

If you choose to attach a file to the email, it will be added to the course documents under this category. New File:

You can upload a file from your computer that will be sent to the students as an email attachment. Or URL:

You can specify a link to a file that will be attached to the emails. Template:

The template for the email content. The layout will be switched to the same one as the template’s default layout. Subject: The subject line for the email, this will get prefilled when you select a template that contains a subject line.

Message Content: This will be the content that the student receives in the email. You can write something in here manually or use a template to automatically fill it in. There are also some formatting tools under the content box. Scroll down to see a list of the active students in the course. Check the box next to each student that you would like to email, you can also search for specific students using the search bar.

Note  If a student doesn't have an email address on their party profile, they will not be selectable on this screen.

Once you have completed your email to the selected students, click on the Send

button.

Emailing Multiple Students Using the Enrolment List  If you need to email multiple students that are in different courses, you can email them using Bulk Actions on the Enrolment List. The

If the email you are sending is a marketing message, rather than information about existing training arrangements, tick the Excluse non-marketing clients/employers box to exclude any clients who have indicated that they do not wish to receive marketing material. This is important to ensure that you comply with privacy legislation. The buttons can be used to select a client, employer or employer contact to add to the email list, or to add an email address for someone who is not listed in the VETtrak database. The status column will change to green or red after you send the email, depending on whether it was sent successfully or not (see below). Enter additional addresses of anyone else you want to CC or BCC the email to. Enter the subject of your email and type the email message as normal. You can add formatting to the email if you wish. Click the tabs above the email body for more formatting options. Click thebutton in the File Attachments section to add one or more attachments, or click on an already attached file to view it. You can also attach files by dragging and dropping them into the email editor. Click Send Email. The Status column will turn green if the email was sent correctly, or red if sending failed. If sending fails, the wizard will remain open with only the failed recipient(s) ticked, to give you an opportunity to correct any errors and resend the email.

Email changes   Reply-to address. A new "Reply to address" field has been added to the Email wizards. This allows you to specify the email address used when the recipient replies to the email. You can set a default for this field in Global Preferences -> Email Preferences -> Settings tab -> Default reply-to address. If left empty (the default), replies will go to the "from" address as normal. Improved memory utilisation. To allow the Send Email Template wizard to send large email templates to a large number of recipients without running out of memory, the template merging no longer occurs when you go Next in the wizard. Instead, the merging occurs on-demand when you click a new View button to preview or edit a merged email, or when you actually send the emails. This means it is quicker to go Next in the wizard but slower to actually send the emails, but is overall more efficient as the merge only occurs for recipients that you have selected and does not require all the merged emails to be held in memory. Bulk Run Report incorrect attachments. An issue that could cause the wrong attachment to be sent to recipients when using Bulk Run Report in Data Insights, where you go Next and then Back in the Email Template wizard, and then select two or more recipients on the left of the first screen, has been fixed. Occurrence changes   Staff linked via classes.

Enrolment List can be accessed by going to Enrolments → Enrolment List. Initially, there will be no enrolments listed on this page. Make sure there is nothing in the search bar and click on the Search button to bring up all enrolments in your system. You can also use

Filters to narrow down the results or search for a specific party. Once you have the required students on the page, click on the

Bulk Actions

button and select the students that you would like to email, then click on the dropdown arrow and select the Email

option. From:

If you have any

From

addresses setup in your site, you can select them in this field. The

From address will be displayed as the Sender

address in the email.

Enrolments Selected:

The amount of enrolments that are selected for this Bulk Action. Send To:

You can select whether to send the email to each student’s

Primary

email address or all email addresses that are attached to the students party profile.

Template: The template for the email content. The layout will be switched to the same one as the template’s default layout.

Subject:

The subject line for the email, this will get prefilled when you select a template that contains a subject line.

Attachment: You can attach a file to the email that will be sent to the students as an attachment.

Message Content:

This will be the content of the email that the student receives. You can write something in here manually or use a template to automatically fill it in. There are also some formatting tools under the content box.

Once you have completed the email to the students, click on the Send

button.

How to Create an Email Template  To Create an Email Template, follow these instructions:   Click on the Administration tab. Select Templates and then Entities. From the Entity list view, find and click on Course Application. From the left-hand menu, select the Templates option under Letters and Forms. To add a new Email Template, click on the '+' button. Complete the Details window. Name - Give the Email template a unique yet relevant name. This will make it easier to search for later on. From - It is possible to attach multiple Email Accounts to the system. This dropdown list will show all available/connected email accounts so that you can select who this email should come from. Subject - This will be the subject of the email to the Student  Status - This box is used to Enable/Disable an Email Template. If you want the Email Template to be accessible for use, check this box. However, if you no longer need this template, you can uncheck the template so that it can no longer be applied. Format - As this is an email, you will need to select HTML. Type - This is a customizable dropdown list where you can select an option to define the Type of Email Template further. The options in this dropdown list can be customised via the Reference Data Tables. Layout - As this is an email, you will need to select Email: A4 Portrait. Category - You can Add/Edit the available list of Categories by selecting Letters and Forms by going to the Categories page from the left-hand menu.

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about the issue with the reply-to address when sending emails from VETtrak Cloud.

The default reply-to address used for emails sent from VETtrak can be configured in the Email Preferences under File > Global Preferences [1]. If there is only one VETtrak user or if all email replies should go to a single email address regardless of who sends them, you can enter that address in the "Default reply-to address" field [1].

However, if the "Use individual staff member logins" option is enabled in the Email Preferences, the reply-to address will be set to the individual staff member's email address specified in their Staff Member Wizard [1]. This could explain why the reply is going to a different email address than the original sender.

You can check and adjust these settings to ensure the reply-to address behaves as desired. If the issue persists after verifying the email preference settings, please let me know and I'll further investigate the matter [2].

Please let me know if you need any other assistance regarding this.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the email reply issue. Based on the information provided, it seems that the "Default reply-to address" setting in VETtrak's Email Preferences is currently set to marketing@auctus.com.au [2]. This is causing replies to go to that address instead of the original sender address (info@auctus.com.au).

To resolve this, you can update the "Default reply-to address" field in File > Global Preferences > Email Preferences to be info@auctus.com.au [1]. This will ensure that when emails are sent from VETtrak, replies will go back to the info@auctus.com.au address as desired.

If you want replies to go to different email addresses based on who sent the original email from VETtrak, you can enable the "Use individual staff member logins" option [1]. This will allow each staff member's email replies to go to their individual email address configured in their staff profile.

Please let me know if updating the "Default reply-to address" resolves the issue or if you need any further assistance.

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the email reply-to issue in VETtrak. Based on the information provided, it seems that the "Default reply-to address" setting in VETtrak's Email Preferences is currently configured to use individual staff member email addresses [1].

To ensure that replies go to the shared email address ************************ instead of individual staff emails, you will need to update the "Default reply-to address" field in File > Global Preferences > Email Preferences [2][1]. Enter the shared email address ************************ in this field.

This setting controls the reply-to address that will be used for all emails sent from VETtrak. If you want all replies to go to this shared address regardless of who sends the email from VETtrak, updating this setting should resolve the issue [1].

Please let me know if you have any other questions or need further assistance.

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content:
Authentication type  If authentication is required when connecting to the mail server, select the type. If you do not choose to Use individual staff member logins, you will need to specify an Email login username and the Email login password. If Use individual staff member logins is selected, you will be required to enter the Email Username

and Password for each VETtrak user intending to send emails (This can be located within their Staff Member Wizard). For more information on this, see the article below:   Email: Using Individual Staff Member Logins

Wait time between emails  Depending on your Mail Server settings, you may be required to set a particular wait time between emails in order for the outgoing traffic to be successful, Enter an amount of time (In Milliseconds) here to specify this.

Once connection information is complete, the preferences in the Settings tab should also be reviewed. Choose the Settings tab:    The Settings preferences are:   Default from address  Default reply-to address  For bulk email, send CC/BCC for  Email address separator  Display name in "from" address when sending email from staff member

Default from address  This is the From address that will be used for emails sent from VETtrak.

Note: You can edit the display name of this email address for email recipients to show an 'Alias' name, by formatting the name in quotes, followed by the full email in the correct brackets. "Alias Name" <full_email_address@your_email_domain.com>         Default reply-to address  This is the reply-to address that will be used for emails sent from VETtrak. If there is only one VETtrak user, or if all email replies should go to a single email regardless of who actually sends them from VETtrak, then enter that address here. For example: admin@org.com.au

or reception@rto.com.au. Note: Do not use this field if you want replies to emails to return to specific senders (eg. trainers, admin staff). For bulk email, send CC/BCC for  When sending bulk emails to clients where addresses have been specified in the CC or BCC fields, those copies can be sent for:   Only the first recipient A copy of the email that was sent to the first recipient of the bulk email will be sent to the address(es) in the CC and/or BCC fields. For example: If there are 10 students set to receive a bulk email reminding them of their upcoming class and their trainer is CC'd on the message, that staff member will receive one email (that might include the name of the first student). Every recipient A copy of the email will be sent to the address(es) in the CC and/or BCC fields for all recipients included in the bulk email. For example: If there are 10 students set to receive a bulk email reminding them of their upcoming class and their trainer is CC'd on the message, that staff member will receive ten identical emails (except with differing student names).

Note: Choosing the Every recipient option will result in multiple copies of emails with very similar content being received by the CC and/or BCC recipients, In most cases this would be undesirable for the recipient and can result in email clients identifying and marking messages as spam. Email address separator  This is the character used to separate multiple addresses. A semi-colon (;) is usually standard, but some external mail clients use alternatives, such as a comma. Display name in "from" address when sending email from staff member  This controls the way the sender's name will be displayed when people receive emails sent from VETtrak, In addition to using the staff member's name, it is also possible to set your own display name (for example you could enter the name of your organisation). RELATED: Cloud Service Email Settings (Communications)

Sending Emails to Students in the Trainer Portal

All email settings for the Trainer Portal are configured within the VETtrak Global Preferences area titled Email Preferences. This configuration will dictate who emails are sent from when using the Trainer Portal. If email has been enabled for your Trainer Portal by the VETtrak administrator, you will be able to send emails to students who have the appropriate contact details recorded. You can send email to an individual student by clicking Send email on the Student screen or in the View Details window.

You can send email to some or all of the students in a class by ticking the appropriate students on the Class screen and clicking Send email. The Send Email window will open:       The From address will default to the default email that is recorded in VETtrak email preferences for your organisation, but you can overwrite it with your own email address. If any of the students do not have an email address recorded in VETtrak, they will be greyed out here. Enter the email subject. Type your message. Click Submit. The email will now be available to view under each student's Messages tab. RELATED: Sending SMS Messages to Students in the Trainer Portal

VETsurvey Settings

This article describes modifying the general settings for VETsurvey. Site Settings (Pre 21.2)  Open the Site Settings page:  Highlight Misc on the Navigation menu to display the sub-menu. Click the Site Settings menu item. There are three sections with various settings:   RTO Settings These are used for reporting and should be completed. RTO Name  RTO Code  Address field(s) as applicable. Site Settings  Site Title - Enter the text to be displayed as the site title included in the header. This is only relevant if the Site Title branding option has been chosen. API URL and the username and password fields. Applicable only to hosted clients with the Products API. Completing these fields allow some details, such as locations and staff members, to be imported from the VETtrak database for use with surveys. Front Page - Enter the welcome text for the main screen of VETsurvey. HTML code is can be entered directly, or click the pencil.png icon to open the editor. Student Page - Applicable only to clients using VETtrak Student Portal, this text will be shown within the portal when a student views their surveys. Email Address - The 'From' address used for sending email. SPAM rules on your server must not prevent emails being sent to internal users from an internal address hosted on an external server. Test by sending a message to your own email address. Email Subject - The subject line used for emails sent via the Build URLs feature. Special variables are accepted.

This context is now used when right clicking a non-occurrence client enrolment and sending email or SMS. For SMS, VETtrak will process replies in the same way as it does for occurrence enrolments, allowing you to configure VETtrak to change the enrolment's status or confirmation flag depending on the reply. Email award. You can now right click an award and "Email award", selecting the mapped award to email. Occurrence class staff merge fields. New merge fields have been added to the Occ Class merge context for the given name, surname, email address and mobile number for the staff member assigned to the class. Word smart quotes. A problem causing "smart quotes" copied from Word and pasted into a VETtrak email to appear as black diamonds to the email recipient has been fixed. Email port number. The Email Port field in Email Preferences now accepts port numbers up to 65535. Email address validation. Email address fields now accept long top-level domain names. eg. someemail@vettrak.melbourne is now accepted. Finance changes   Print invoice global preference. A new Invoices tab has been added to Global Preferences -> General Preferences. This tab contains new options to control whether the "Print invoice" and "Print receipt" tickboxes are on or off by default when creating invoices and payments. The "Default location for payments" field has also been moved to this new tab. Invoice due date in invoice schedules.
