[VT_Error] Portal Error and Troubleshooting

54

[VT_Error] Trainer Portal Email Troubleshooting

Trainer Portal email errors typically do not give any information as to what causes them, there are a few things that can be checked in order

to get to the bottom of the issue quickly.

First, the email preferences will need to be checked within VETtrak, within there you’ll be able to check whether the SMTP server details are

misconfigured. If the customer is using Office365 or Gmail, you can compare the details they’ve got configured with the examples in the

Cloud Service Email Settings article to see whether anything is off. In the majority of cases you would expect that either an Office365 or

Gmail server setup would adhere to the details listed in that article as they are standardised.

In cases where a customer is using an SMTP Relay or a mail service other than Gmail or Office365, it is hard to tell whether the details they

have configured are correct. This usually calls for getting their IT team or Mail server admin involved but there are a few things you can in

order to troubleshoot this.

The example below shows an SMTP relay set up for Office365, typically a set up like this would be sending from port 25, port 587 usually

requires the SSL/TLS connection method to be set to explicit and also requires the mail to be authenticated.

55

In essence, even without standardised details it is worth keeping an eye out for anything that may be off within an SMTP configuration as a

first point of call.

If everything seems to be in order with their SMTP details, the next step is to send a test email from within VETtrak - this will bring up an

161: SMTP protocol error. 554 5.2.0

'Submission.Exception:SendAsDenied'   This indicates that someone has attempted to reference an email address that is different to the configured 'Send As' email account in the preferences. Essentially unless the mail server has been configured in a specific way, you can't Send as one user, and then try and specify a Reply Address as someone else. Commonly this is fixed by using Individual Staff Member Log Ins or making sure the Reply To address is the same as the Sender email address. 161: SMTP protocol error  Service unavailable, Client host [103.102.118.1] blocked using Spamhaus. This indicates the authentication settings may be missing within VETtrak. Check the settings entered in 'File', 'Global preferences', 'Email preferences'. You will need to ensure the SSL/TLS connection method is 'Explicit', and change the Auth type to username/password and enter a valid email address and password that is accepted by your email server. 161: SMTP protocol error. 534 5.7.14  Username and Password not accepted  This usually indicates that you may be unable to email through Gmail. If comfortable, test enabling “Access for less secure apps” (which just means the client/app doesn’t use OAuth 2.0 - https://oauth.net/2/) for the account you are trying to access.

It's found in the account settings on the Security tab -> Account permissions. https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/6010255  535-5.7.14  Follow on Error   This is usually a follow on from the above error ^  Go to

https://accounts.google.com/DisplayUnlockCaptcha

and click Continue. Then you can authenticate your Additional Email Address from your Gmail Account. 552 5.2.3

Portal preferences

Notifications tab  Within our VETtrak Portal Products, you can turn on the ability for Notifications to be automatically sent to particular staff members. When students upload documents through the Student Portal, it is possible to have an email automatically sent to staff members related to the enrolment. Turn the Send Notification emails option on to enable this functionality. Enter an email address that the notification will be sent from. This address must have the rights to send mail through the mail server setup in Email Preferences. If your global preferences for email setting is set to "Use individual staff memeber email logins" then choose from the "Staff member to send notification emails from" drop down instead of typing an email into the "Email address to send notification emails from" setting. This will be auto populated from the drop down. You can also decide which Staff Types, recorded against the Students enrolment, will be sent the notification. For example, in the above example - assuming an Administration officer, a Trainer, and a Supervisor are all allocated to the enrolment - only the Supervisor and Trainer would receive a notification stating that a new file had been uploaded. When a trainer uploads a non-distributed file against and enrolled unit or task, the enrolled student will receive the notification in the Student Portal and optionally by email. Settings tab  A global setting for portal idle session expiration is found under the Settings tab.

This setting controls the interval for when all portals timeout their idle sessions from being active, as well an opt-in option to allow Google Web Services to display online document viewing.

VETtrak can automatically update certain data based on the reply content, and the context in which the message was sent. For example, you can configure VETtrak so that, when you send a message for an occurrence or class, recipients can reply with YES or NO, which can automatically set the confirmation flag to "Confirmed" or "Declined" on the client's occurrence enrolment or class the message was sent for. If a client replies with UNSUBSCRIBE, VETtrak can also automatically update the client's marketing flag to say that the client does not wish to receive marketing messages. Use the File menu -> Global Preferences -> SMS Preferences screen to configure what VETtrak should automatically update for certain replies in certain contexts. The "Accept replies" option can also be ticked in SMS message templates, so that you can define that certain templates usually require a reply. SMS delivery receipts. The new Utility menu -> SMS Replies and Delivery Receipts option can also receive and update into VETtrak any delivery receipts for SMS messages sent from VETtrak. This allows you to know which messages are confirmed as being delivered or were unable to be delivered. Note that mobile carriers treat delivery receipts with low priority (and some do not use delivery receipts at all), and they are not guaranteed to be received within any particular timeframe or at all, so a lack of receipt does not mean that the message was not delivered. ticket_content.ticket_description: Hi there,      Is there an option in our VETtrak to increase the delay in emails being sent? Ideally, we would like the email to be sitting in the queue for a bit longer, giving us a chance to cancel if needed.      Thank you!

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for your request regarding delaying the email queue in VETtrak. Unfortunately, VETtrak does not have a built-in option to increase the delay or hold time for emails in the outgoing queue before they are sent [1]. The emails are processed and sent out immediately after being generated.

However, I would suggest using a third-party email client like Microsoft Outlook to manage and schedule your outgoing emails from VETtrak. Most email clients have a feature to delay or schedule the delivery of emails, giving you time to review and cancel them if needed before they are sent out [1].

If you have any other questions or need further assistance, please let me know.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your request regarding delaying the sending of emails from VETtrak. Unfortunately, VETtrak does not have a built-in setting to increase the delay time before emails are sent from the queue [1]. The emails are typically sent immediately after being generated.

However, there are a few potential workarounds you could consider:

1. Set up rules or filters in your email client to hold or delay delivery of emails from VETtrak for a set period of time [2]. This would give you a window to cancel emails before they are sent to recipients.

2. Explore third-party email delay software or services that could integrate with VETtrak's email functionality to add a delay buffer.

3. Implement a manual review process for emails before they are sent from VETtrak, though this may not be practical depending on your email volume.

I understand the need to have more control over when emails are delivered. While VETtrak does not have this capability built-in, I'm happy to discuss any of the workaround options further or explore other potential solutions with you. Please let me know if you would like me to investigate this further or if you have any other questions.

Hi there,

Thank you for your request regarding delaying the sending of emails from VETtrak. In the Email Preferences [1], there is a setting called "Wait time between emails" that controls the delay between successive emails being sent out from VETtrak's built-in email client.

This wait time setting is intended to prevent overloading mail servers when sending out bulk emails. However, it can also provide a short window to potentially cancel emails before they are sent [1]. The Notifications feature also has an option to enable notifications to be sent via email in addition to appearing in the relevant portal [3]. So adjusting the wait time between emails could give you a bit more time to cancel notifications before they get emailed out.

Unfortunately, there is no built-in way to hold emails in a queue for an extended period of time before sending in VETtrak. Emails get processed and sent out relatively quickly based on the wait time setting [1]. VETtrak also does not have the ability to recall or cancel emails after they have already been sent out from the system.

If you need a longer delay window to review and approve emails before sending, one potential solution could be to set up a third-party email service or mail server that can queue up emails first. Then you could configure VETtrak to send emails through that external mail server [1]. That would allow you to review the queued emails on the third-party system before releasing them to send out. However, this would require additional setup and configuration.

I'll bring up your request for a longer email queue delay window to our product team for consideration in future VETtrak updates. In the meantime, please let me know if you need any other assistance with configuring VETtrak's email settings to best meet your needs. [4]

related_knowledge.content:
Email Preferences

The Email preferences section allows users to configure how VETtrak sends emails - this includes additional products that make use of the same email settings, such as the Trainer Portal.

It is possible to use a third-party email client (the default email client for the operating system, such as Microsoft Outlook), or to specify mail server settings for VETtrak to connect to and send without involving another email client. Note: If a third-party email client is used, mail server settings will need to have been configured in that program. Choose File

> Global Preferences. Select Email preferences from the Preference items list. The primary setting is Outgoing Email Preferences, which allows the choice between using VETtrak's built-in email client or an external mail client. If the Use built-in VETtrak email client option is disabled, all other settings will be disabled with the exception of the Email address separator, which is the only applicable setting for external email clients. When Use built-in VETtrak email client is enabled, further preferences can be configured within two tabs:   Mail server  Settings     The Mail server

tab will be chosen by default:    The Mail server preferences are:   Mail server address (SMTP)  Email port  SSL/TLS connection method  Authentication type  Wait time between emails   Note: when configuring Mailserver settings it may be useful to direct your IT team to the Cloud Service Email Settings page: Cloud Service Email Settings. Mail server address (SMTP)  The address used to connect to the mail server needs to be entered here.

Email port  This is the port used. It defaults to the standard 25.

SSL/TLS connection method  If a secure connection is required to the mail server, select the method. Note: The Implicit method has been depreciated and is not recommended for use.

Notifications in the web Portals

Notifications  Notifications enable some cross portal notice of activities, such as file upload, to a portal user.

A new notification badge with a count of the unread notifications is shown next to the logged in user name, allowing quick access to sent notifications as they arrive. Example:

A student uploading a file in the student portal will automatically notify enrolment staff, based on preference configuration and the notice will appear in the trainer portal.

The trainer will be able to see the notification of the file upload and selecting the notice hyperlink will take them to view the file uploaded by the student.

The notification process will also occur in the reverse direction, should the trainer upload a file for a student.

In addition to the notification function, the notice may be optionally emailed based on global preferences, in conjunction with the users individual notification settings. Users of the portal may configure their individual notification preference for each notification type from within their respective portal, via the Notification Settings page. VETtrak changes   Compatible with VETtrak version 17.2.0.0 or later. VETtrak Portal Preferences (VETtrak version 23.1)  Includes portal settings which has no impact on notification. Enable notification emails:   Enable notifications to be sent via email in addition to appearing on the relevant portal. Note:

Sending email notifications will have an impact on the performance of portals and VETtrak desktop due to the processing time to send out emails. Enter an email address that the notification will be sent from. This address must have the rights to send mail through the mail server setup in Email Preferences. Note: 19.2 onwards: If your global email settings has the option "Use individual staff member email logins" ticked.

Email Alerts

Settings for Email Alerts are accessed from the Configuration () page in the VETenrol Admin, via the link under VETenrol Admin Preferences. These settings relate to automated email notifications for staff members regarding user activity. Features of the Email Alerts page:   Mail Server button — Navigate to the Integration page for SMTP Server details and mail settings. Save button — Click to commit changes made to the settings. The settings are divided into the following sections:   Registrations  Enquiries  Eligibilities   Each section has an option to enable email alerts for the activity type related to the section. When enabled, the email address where the alert should be sent must be entered. Multiple email addresses for the one type can be included by separating each address with a semi-colon. In the case of the Registrations section, there is also an option for Staff Member Alerts where an email will be sent to the staff member(s) assigned to the occurrence in VETtrak each time someone registers.

Open Ticket Handling

Support Officers should generally aim to respond to each of their open tickets within 24 hours from the customer’s last response. If a ticket is

complex and requires involved testing the Support Officer should allocate uninterrupted time to investigate the issue, seek help where

needed and identify the next steps to continue the ticket.We need to be clear with the customer that we are expecting a response from them, otherwise they may misunderstand and expect

us to continue working on their request without their input. This can cause delay and frustration from both parties and we want to

avoid this. It may also cause some confusion when they receive the Pending email notifications prompting them to respond to the

ticket.

Complex tickets should not be left without action for extended periods of time in favour of simple tickets.355

[VT_Process] VETtrak Template Enquiries Handling Process

Customers will contact VETtrak Support to enquire about custom reports. VETtrak Support Officers have different levels of custom report

writing experience however all Support Officers are expected to follow the process below to support customers with these types of enquiries.

The VT categories for these tickets should be set to Education\VETtrak\Template Enquiry.

There are different types of template enquiries and these have been detailed below.

ETA on Template Request

Customers may call or send a follow-up email requesting a time frame on their Template Request.

1. The Support Officer will review where the ticket sits in the VT Support - Unassigned Report Requests ticket view in Freshdesk.

[VT_Process] Support Team Ticket Handling Process | Unassigned Ticket Handling

2. The Support Officer will communicate what number in the queue the customer’s request sits. On average we complete 4 template

Ensure that when messages are provided and require a direct response from a relevant CSM they are addressed with the @name

scheme within the request body; if the relevant CSM is inactive, away or sick ensure that this message is directed to another CSM

to handle instead if urgent.361

[VT_Process] VETtrak Support Team Ticket Triage Process

This is now documented here

ReadyTech EWP Support Team Ticket Triage Process

362

Process is now included in the ReadyTech Support Team Space

ReadyTech EWP Support Team Phone Call Process

363

VETtrak Support Phone Roster

Phone Roster

As of: 22/01/2024

Phone Queue Etiquette

The phone roster indicates which Support Officers are expected to be signed into the VETtrak Support Queue at given times. There will be

times when a Support Officer is not signed into the queue or able to take a call. We aim to have 2-3 Support Officers in the phone queue

between 9am - 5pm. The below examples aim to provide a guide as to when and how long it is appropriate for a team member to sign out

of the queue or bounce a call to the next Support Officer.

Absent / on Leave when a Support Officer is on leave or absent they won’t be able to service phone calls and should not be

signed into the phone queue

support officers are responsible for signing out of the phone queue at the end of each of their phone roster

shifts

if a support officer is still signed into the queue when they are absent contact the Client Support Team Leader

to have them signed out

Coffee/Toilet Break do not sign out of the queue

post in the vt-support_phone Slack channel to alert others that you will be absent for a short time, posting

‘brb’ (be right back) is a quick indication to the rest of the team that you will be away for a short amount of time

generally this is a short break of 5-10 minutes

any phone calls directed to your line during this time will bounce to the next support officer and he next

correct, avoid rushing or skimming over the ticket, this can cause more harm than good.

Priority Under the ticket Properties the ticket Priority will need to be set appropriately. The below page can be

used as a guide to set the priority.

Product and Support Incident Priority Management ProcessAction Description175

Some examples of high priority tickets are…

customer cannot log into the product

customer has expressed urgency on the ticket

customer has expressed that they are unhappy

product issues that have potential to impact a wider range of customers

VT Categories and Tags Under the ticket Properties the JR L1 Category and any L2 and L3 categories will need to be set

appropriately based on the content of the ticket.

Freshdesk Category and Tag Setup

Type Under the ticket Properties the Type will need to be set appropriately.

Question - this will be used in most cases during triage and indicates that the Support Officer is to

provide education to the customer to resolve their query

Problem - used in Ticket Trackers, tickets of this nature are created internally by a Support Officer so

this would not be set during triage

Incident - used in tickets linked to Ticket Trackers, tickets of this natures are a part of a larger issue

affecting many customers

Feature Request - is NOT currently used by VETtrak, customer are to be directed to our community

forum for feature requests

Service Requests - used on Plus for template tickets and data update tickets.

Group and Product Under Properties the Group and Product will need to be changed if the ticket is intended for another

group within ReadyTech.

Contact Company Under Contact Details the Contact will need to be checked to ensure they have a Company set.

Without company

Portal SMTP override options

Must be running VETtrak version 18.3.0.x (or higher)  and Trainer Portal v18.3.0.2 (or higher)  or Student Portal v18.3.0.2 (or higher)  It is important that an experienced IT resource is available to manage this process. Version 19.2 (or higher) of the portals and onwards will not need this over-ride, unless using NTLM email. Feature summary  As from version 18.3.0.2 there is an option to override the VETtrak configured SMTP provider. The override allows configuration to be sourced from the Web.config file, instead of the settings stored in VETtrak. Note: The default configuration set up in VETtrak is generally sufficient for most customer's email needs, and this override option covers some edge cases for where the VETtrak configuration works for VETtrak desktop software but does not work with the Trainer Portal such as NTLM with individual account authorisation. Web Config options explained. OverrideSmtpSettings  Enables or disables mail server settings configured in this file. The SMTP Settings:   SmtpServerHostname,  SmtpServerPort,  SmtpServerSslMode,  SmtpServerAuthType, SmtpServerUsername and SmtpServerPassword   must be provided if this option is set to "true". true: The SMTP server settings in the web.config file will be used for sending email false: The SMTP server settings configured in VETtrak will be used for sending email  <add key="UseLegacySmtpClient" value="false" /   SmtpServerHostname  The hostname of the SMTP server for sending email.

In this article:   Deferred Payment Workflow  Configuring VETenrol for Deferred Payments  Handling Registrations with Deferred Payments in VETenrol Admin  Student Interface (User experience)       Deferred Payment Workflow  The workflow for Deferred Payments leaves completion of the registration on hold while the training organisation deals with pre-enrolment paperwork for the potential student. The user registers. Admin reviews the registration in VETenrol Admin  views identity documents and other files submitted as part of the registration process. checks answers to custom questions, LLNs and other details completed during the registration process. follows up with user as required to determine eligibilities for suitability, funding, etc. Admin sets the appropriate pricing and sends the Pay Now request. The user receives the email, clicks the Pay Now link and completes payment for the Registration. Admin processes the Web Enrolment in VETtrak. Configuring VETenrol for Deferred Payments  After the initial request to Support to activate the feature, the setting for Deferred Payments will be available from the VETenrol Admin. Your VETenrol account will have a generic Pay Now mail template available for use, however this should be customised to your organisation at a minimum. Additionally, there may be pricing items to publish in VETtrak for your occurrences that also need to be excluded from displaying for VETenrol. See also: Email Templates, Exclusions.

QR Coded Invoices  If you would like QR Codes on your invoices to allow recipients to make payments, please submit a custom report request. QR Coded invoices can be sent via email or posted. This method is typically most useful when the payee will receive a printed invoice, however, a combination of an emailed link with a QR Coded invoice attached may also be desirable for the convenience of your students.

VETtrak Invoice Payment Settings    Settings for the VETtrak Online Payments service are accessed from the Configuration page () in your VETenrol Admin. This configuration setting will only appear if a Payment Gateway has been set for your VETenrol account    There are two key settings:   Minimum Amount This payment setting determines the minimum a user can pay off an invoice when making a payment. Automated Confirmation Email The settings in this section control the content for the automated email notification sent out to users on successful payment. Subject - The subject line of the email. Body - The content of the email message. To edit the default, click the Default button to insert it into the Body field and then click

to open the Editor. If any changes are made it is important to click the Save button.

Related Topics   Video: VETtrak Online Payment Collection

ticket_content.ticket_description: Hello,     We ve just noticed that the system isn t sending out emails. We first noticed that it hadn t sent automated emails and then did a test of a single email  composed within party record  and got the following error:  OpenSSL::SSL::SSLError  ************* *******  hostname  **************  does not match the server certificate .   As far as we know, no settings have changed with regards to our email server and out emails are still functioning normally outside of VETtrak. Any ideas on what might be causing the error and how we can fix it?

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about the email issue in VETtrak. The error "OpenSSL::SSL::SSLError: hostname does not match the server certificate" indicates that the SSL/TLS certificate received from your email server does not match the hostname entered in VETtrak's Email Preferences [1].

This often occurs due to one of the following reasons:
- The hostname entered in the 'Mail server address' field does not match the one on the certificate
- The certificate has expired
- The certificate is a self-signed certificate, which VETtrak does not accept (it only accepts certificates signed by a trusted certificate authority) [3]

To troubleshoot this, you can use the "Check TLS" service at https://www.checktls.com/TestReceiver to verify the certificate being sent by your mail server. Enter the hostname as entered in VETtrak's Email Preferences, and if you're using a different port from 587, also enter the port in the 'MX Port' field. This will show the certificate given to VETtrak when connecting [1]. If a verification error occurs (e.g., due to a self-signed certificate), then VETtrak will not work either.

If the certificate is valid and matches the hostname, double-check the other Email Preferences settings, such as the SSL/TLS Connection Method and Authentication Type. Refer to our Cloud Service Email Settings article for recommended settings based on your email provider [2].

Please let me know if you need any further assistance in resolving this issue.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about the email issues you are experiencing in VETtrak. The error "OpenSSL::SSL::SSLError  ************* *******  hostname  **************  does not match the server certificate" indicates that the hostname entered in the 'Mail server address' field in VETtrak does not match the one on the certificate provided by your mail server [1].

This error often occurs when:
- The hostname entered is incorrect or does not match the actual mail server hostname [1]
- The certificate has expired [1]
- The certificate is a self-signed certificate, which VETtrak does not accept (it only accepts certificates signed by a trusted certificate authority) [1]

To troubleshoot this issue, you can use the "Check TLS" service at https://www.checktls.com/TestReceiver to verify the certificate being sent by your mail server [1]. Enter the hostname as entered in the Email Preferences in VETtrak, and if you use a different port from 587, click 'FULL version' and enter the port in the 'MX Port' field [1]. This will show the certificate given to VETtrak when connecting, and if a verification error occurs due to a self-signed certificate or mismatch, VETtrak will not work either [1].

If the issue persists after verifying the certificate, you may need to check the authentication settings entered in 'File', 'Global preferences', 'Email preferences' [2]. Ensure the correct details are entered, and if 'Use individual staff member email logins' is ticked, verify the details listed against 'Email username' and 'Email password' in the Client Wizard for the affected staff members [2].

Additionally, you mentioned that emails are still functioning normally outside of VETtrak. This message is typically issued by email providers like Gmail when authentication fails [2]. If you are certain the details are correct, you may need to enable less secure apps in your email settings, as per the instructions in our Cloud Service Email Settings guide [2].

Please let me know if the issue persists after trying these troubleshooting steps. I'll be happy to further investigate and provide additional assistance.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about the email issue in VETtrak. The error "OpenSSL::SSL::SSLError hostname does not match the server certificate" typically indicates that the hostname entered in the 'Mail server address' field in VETtrak's Email Preferences does not match the hostname on the SSL certificate from your mail server [3].

A few potential causes and troubleshooting steps:

1. Verify that the hostname you have entered for the 'Mail server address' matches the actual hostname of your mail server. An IP address entered here instead of a hostname can cause this error [3].

2. Check if the SSL certificate from your mail server has expired or is self-signed. VETtrak only accepts certificates signed by a trusted certificate authority [1][3].

3. You can test your mail server's certificate by using the "Check TLS" tool at https://www.checktls.com/TestReceiver. Enter the hostname from VETtrak's Email Preferences and check if any verification errors occur, which would prevent VETtrak from connecting [1].

4. If the certificate appears valid, try changing the 'SSL/TLS Connection Method' setting in Email Preferences to either 'None (no SSL)' or 'Explicit' instead of 'Automatic' [1].

5. Ensure the other settings like Authentication Type, Email Port, etc. are correct for your mail server [2].

If you continue to have issues after verifying the settings, please let me know and we can investigate further. Providing the specific settings you have configured in Email Preferences would also be helpful.

provide them with the IP address: 103.102.118.1. Note that email from VETtrak is relayed directly via their mail server by VETtrak - there is

no intermediary mail server involved (though some customers may assume there is).

Recently migrated customers

New customers who are using the hosting service, or have recently migrated to the hosting service may initially try to use details for their

local mail server. As out hosting servers are located on a different network to their mail server, this simply will not work. These can usually

be identified by the '11001: [11001] Host not found' error:

Alternatively, their mail server address may be accessible by the Internet but won't allow the user to "relay" email (i.e. deliver email to

a different email server other than itself). This will typically produce the '550 5.7.1: Unable to relay' error message (or similar) when sending

is attempted to any email address outside their own domain. In this case, it's usually possible to simply change the email preferences in

VETtrak to include authentication details for the email server, which will give the user permission to relay.

CODE MESSAGE EXPLANATION/RESOLUTION148

Troubleshooting errors

First steps

Prior to checking anything else, ensure that the following has been carried out:

1. Check 'File', 'Global preferences...', 'Email preferences' and ensure that settings are entered.

2. If the SSL setting is set to 'Automatic', try setting it to either 'None (no SSL)' or 'Explicit'. The automatic setting often chokes and it is

best to set the correct value manually. If you see errors regarding the 'STARTTLS' command - this is probably why.

Email error codes

Below is a list of email errors that can occur when attempting to send email in VETtrak. These take the form of a code and a message. For

server connection problems, you'll get a 5 digit code and a dialog box, for SMTP errors, you'll get a red 'Status' indicator and a 3 digit error

Hosted Customers  If you are hosted with VETtrak, please note that the firewall in our hosted environment only permits email to be sent out of standard SMTP ports (25, 465, and 587). If your mail server is on a non-standard port, please send an email to support@vettrak.io requesting that your mail server be unblocked, indicating the hostname and port number for your mail server. We will only accept unblock requests which specify the mail server hostname in the request. We will not unblock a port to allow connection to all mail servers, apart from the aforementioned standard SMTP ports. Troubleshooting Email Errors  Below is a list of email errors that can occur when attempting to send email in VETtrak. These take the form of a code and a message. For server connection problems, you'll get a 5 digit code and a dialog box, for SMTP errors, you'll get a red 'Status' indicator and a 3 digit error code (and possibly a sub-error code after this). The 'Message' column is an indication only and the actual error returned for a given code will depend on the SMTP server software in use. If your

error matches a code, even if the message is slightly different, it is most likely caused by the same issue as listed in the 'Explanation/resolution' column for that code. Typically, explicit connections use port 587, implicit connections use port 465, and non SSL connections use 25.

the connection. They must contact us and tell us the hostname and port number of the email server, so that it can be

unblocked on our end. We will not add a blanket rule for a specific port number - the hostname must be provided.

Email Preferences

The Email preferences section allows users to configure how VETtrak sends emails - this includes additional products that make use of the same email settings, such as the Trainer Portal.

It is possible to use a third-party email client (the default email client for the operating system, such as Microsoft Outlook), or to specify mail server settings for VETtrak to connect to and send without involving another email client. Note: If a third-party email client is used, mail server settings will need to have been configured in that program. Choose File

> Global Preferences. Select Email preferences from the Preference items list. The primary setting is Outgoing Email Preferences, which allows the choice between using VETtrak's built-in email client or an external mail client. If the Use built-in VETtrak email client option is disabled, all other settings will be disabled with the exception of the Email address separator, which is the only applicable setting for external email clients. When Use built-in VETtrak email client is enabled, further preferences can be configured within two tabs:   Mail server  Settings     The Mail server

tab will be chosen by default:    The Mail server preferences are:   Mail server address (SMTP)  Email port  SSL/TLS connection method  Authentication type  Wait time between emails   Note: when configuring Mailserver settings it may be useful to direct your IT team to the Cloud Service Email Settings page: Cloud Service Email Settings. Mail server address (SMTP)  The address used to connect to the mail server needs to be entered here.

Email port  This is the port used. It defaults to the standard 25.

SSL/TLS connection method  If a secure connection is required to the mail server, select the method. Note: The Implicit method has been depreciated and is not recommended for use.

10060: Connection Timed Out

Confirm with the Customer that the FTP Options are entered correctly, and arrange with the Infrastructure Team to create the Firewall Rule

276: Server certificate verification failed. Connection aborted.Note; these actions are only required for Hosted Customers. Local Customers will have to consult with their IT Team perform these

actions on their end within the Scheduler Service Settings

165

If the Customer uses SSL, and has entered an IP Address into the hostname field, swap this out with an actual hostname. The reason is as

follows;

“An IP is not a valid hostname for a ca issued certificate. Only a self signed certificate would be able to be issued in this scenario, which will

fail as a result of being self-signed.

Have them use a valid hostname (not an IP) and issue a real certificate against it.”

–  Alex Marlin 24/Nov/23 12:15 PM

It's not possible to use both your existing SMTP server and a 3rd party SMTP server at the same time for sending emails  Test your SMTP setup carefully. Send test emails to a variety of email addresses (eg. gmail, hotmail etc) and check with the recipients that they have received the emails and if there any were detected as spam or were delayed. Trainer Portal email errors typically do not give any information as to what causes them, there are a few things that can be checked in order

to get to the bottom of the issue quickly.

First, the email preferences will need to be checked within VETtrak, within there you’ll be able to check whether the SMTP server details are

misconfigured. If the customer is using Office365 or Gmail, you can compare the details they’ve got configured with the examples in the

Cloud Service Email Settings article to see whether anything is off. In the majority of cases you would expect that either an Office365 or

Gmail server setup would adhere to the details listed in that article as they are standardised.

In cases where a customer is using an SMTP Relay or a mail service other than Gmail or Office365, it is hard to tell whether the details they

have configured are correct. This usually calls for getting their IT team or Mail server admin involved but there are a few things you can in

order to troubleshoot this.

The example below shows an SMTP relay set up for Office365, typically a set up like this would be sending from port 25, port 587 usually

requires the SSL/TLS connection method to be set to explicit and also requires the mail to be authenticated.

55

In essence, even without standardised details it is worth keeping an eye out for anything that may be off within an SMTP configuration as a

first point of call.

ticket_content.ticket_description: Good morning,  I am unable to send emails. I have only noticed it when attaching certificates or SOA s.

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with sending emails with attachments like certificates and statements of attainment. There could be a few potential causes for this:

1. Please verify that the SMTP email server settings are configured correctly in VETtrak's Global Preferences under the Email Preferences section. Check the hostname/server address, port number, authentication credentials, and TLS/SSL settings [1][2]. Incorrect settings here could prevent emails from being sent successfully.

2. If you are receiving any specific error messages or codes when the emails fail to send, please let me know. Common errors like 530, 535, 550, etc. can help identify if it's an authentication issue, permission problem, or server connection error [1][2].

3. Ensure that the file size of the attachments you are trying to send is not too large. Some email servers may block or fail to send emails with very large attachments [3].

4. Check if there are any firewall, antivirus or security software settings on your system that could be blocking outgoing emails [2].

5. Try sending a test email without any attachments to see if the issue is specific to emails with attachments or if it affects all outgoing emails.

If you have already checked these points and the issue persists, please provide me with the specific SMTP settings you have configured and any error messages you are receiving. I'll be happy to further investigate and troubleshoot the issue.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about the issue with sending emails when attaching certificates or SOAs. There could be a few potential causes for this:

1. Check your email server settings in VETtrak under File > Global Preferences > Email Preferences. Ensure that the hostname, port, username, and password are correct for your email server [1][2][5]. If you are hosted with VETtrak, do not enter a local address here [4].

2. Verify that the authentication settings are correct, especially if using individual staff logins. Check the "Email username" and "Email password" fields in the Client Wizard for affected staff members [1][2].

3. Your email server may be blocking or restricting emails with attachments. Check with your email server administrator if any filtering or IP restrictions are in place [1][2][4].

4. If you receive error codes like 530, 535, 550, or 276, refer to the troubleshooting guide for those specific errors [1][2]. Issues like authentication failures, relay restrictions, or certificate verification problems could be the cause.

5. Try sending a test email from within VETtrak to see if the issue persists and note any error codes or messages [3].

If the issue persists after trying these steps, please let me know the specific error codes or messages you are receiving, and I can provide further assistance. Additionally, you can try attaching the certificates or SOAs as links instead of file attachments as a potential workaround.

Let me know if you have any other questions or concerns.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with sending emails and attaching certificates or Statements of Attainment (SOAs). There could be a few potential causes for this problem:

1. Check for any error messages or codes displayed when attempting to send the emails with attachments. Common errors like "530 Authentication failed," "535 Authentication unsuccessful," or "550 Unable to relay" often indicate issues with the email settings or server configurations [1].

2. Ensure that the email settings in VETtrak are configured correctly under "File" > "Global Preferences" > "Email Preferences." Double-check the SMTP server address, port, username, and password [1][3].

3. If you're using a cloud email service like Gmail or Office 365, refer to the specific configuration guidelines provided in our help documentation for those services [1].

4. Large file attachments like certificates or SOAs may be getting blocked by your email server due to size restrictions. Try sending a test email without any attachments to rule out attachment-related issues [4].

If you continue to experience issues after verifying the email settings and testing without attachments, please provide me with the specific error messages or codes you're receiving. This will help me better diagnose and troubleshoot the problem. Additionally, feel free to share any other relevant details about your email server configuration or IT environment.

I'll be happy to further assist you in resolving this email sending issue. Please let me know if you need any clarification or have additional information to provide.

Kind regards,

Email Issues and Troubleshooting

Types of Errors  There are two types of errors that you will see when attempting to send emails:   Dialog box

this takes the form of an error dialog that appears after a email has attempted to send. These indicate that the connection with the server was not successfully established. Status error - these show up against each email which could not be sent in the Email Wizard in the form of a red 'Status' indicator. Click the box to determine the error that occurred. If an email in the list appears with a green status indicator, this indicates the email was sent successfully, even if others in the list are marked red. The error code and message are produced by the mail server in this case. The message is provided by the email server and thus messages will vary depending on the SMTP server that is being connected to, even for the same error. When you encounter a Status Error, VETtrak does have the ability to display a more detailed breakdown of the steps your mailserver took when attempting to send the email. This is located in the bottom-right hand side of the wizard, and can be expanded like so:     These details should explain where the process failed, and if you need to send this information to VETtrak Support for troubleshooting you can press the Copy button and paste it into a VETtrak support email.

If you are hosted with VETtrak, and are using a non-standard SMTP port, you must contact VETtrak support to request your mail server be unblocked. See Hosted Customers above for more information. 11011  Host not found  The DNS lookup for the mail server failed. Check the settings entered in 'File', 'Global preferences', 'Email preferences'. This could be due to IP filtering, etc. being applied on the mail server. Check

if your

Contact your Customer Success Manager or ReadyTech Support for further assistance. Finding your Email Settings  To get to your email settings, go to Administration → Configuration → Preferences. Click on the Communications tab on the left side of the page and click on the Edit button. SMTP Server Settings     Hostname: The hostname URL for your SMTP server. Port: The port used by your SMTP server. 25 and 587 are common ports for sending emails. Disable TLS Certificate Verification: Disables TLS verification when making a connection to the SMTP server. Username: The username that you use to log into your SMTP server. Password: The password that you use to log into your SMTP server. Authentication: Sets the authentication method when an email is sent to the server from your system. Auto STARTTLS: If this is enabled, it will attempt to upgrade the connection to your SMTP server to an encrypted connection. TLS: Secures your emails using a TLS layer.

If the email you are sending is a marketing message, rather than information about existing training arrangements, tick the Excluse non-marketing clients/employers box to exclude any clients who have indicated that they do not wish to receive marketing material. This is important to ensure that you comply with privacy legislation. The buttons can be used to select a client, employer or employer contact to add to the email list, or to add an email address for someone who is not listed in the VETtrak database. The status column will change to green or red after you send the email, depending on whether it was sent successfully or not (see below). Enter additional addresses of anyone else you want to CC or BCC the email to. Enter the subject of your email and type the email message as normal. You can add formatting to the email if you wish. Click the tabs above the email body for more formatting options. Click thebutton in the File Attachments section to add one or more attachments, or click on an already attached file to view it. You can also attach files by dragging and dropping them into the email editor. Click Send Email. The Status column will turn green if the email was sent correctly, or red if sending failed. If sending fails, the wizard will remain open with only the failed recipient(s) ticked, to give you an opportunity to correct any errors and resend the email.

Process: Configuring Your Email Settings

Having the ability to email your students is a crucial feature in a Student Management System. In this article, we will go over the process of configuring your email settings. SMTP Information  You will need an SMTP email provider in order to send emails out of your system. Some commonly used options are:   Gmail - Gmail SMTP can be used as an email provider, you will need to follow the instructions in this article on their help centre: Send email with the Gmail SMTP server  Microsoft Outlook - Outlook can be used as an email provider as well, you will need to follow the instructions in this article on their help centre: Enable or disable authenticated client SMTP submission (SMTP AUTH) in Exchange Online Note that SMTP authentication for sending emails is disabled by default and will need to be re-enabled. Alert - Deprecation of Basic Authentication  Microsoft has warned that Exchange Online customers will no longer be able to turn on Basic Authentication starting January 2023. Basic Authentication is a legacy authentication method that involves sending user credentials in plain text to computer systems. It doesn’t support multi-factor authentication (MFA), making it easier for threat actors to steal credentials via sophisticated cyber attacks. Mandrill can be set up as the email provider for your site and doesn't require much set up or maintenance. This will need to be set up by ReadyTech upon request.

Sending Emails to Students in the Trainer Portal

All email settings for the Trainer Portal are configured within the VETtrak Global Preferences area titled Email Preferences. This configuration will dictate who emails are sent from when using the Trainer Portal. If email has been enabled for your Trainer Portal by the VETtrak administrator, you will be able to send emails to students who have the appropriate contact details recorded. You can send email to an individual student by clicking Send email on the Student screen or in the View Details window.

You can send email to some or all of the students in a class by ticking the appropriate students on the Class screen and clicking Send email. The Send Email window will open:       The From address will default to the default email that is recorded in VETtrak email preferences for your organisation, but you can overwrite it with your own email address. If any of the students do not have an email address recorded in VETtrak, they will be greyed out here. Enter the email subject. Type your message. Click Submit. The email will now be available to view under each student's Messages tab. RELATED: Sending SMS Messages to Students in the Trainer Portal

Sending an email (from a template)

Clients can be emailed via the Registrations or Registration Details, Enquiries or Enquiry Details, Data Completion Details and Eligibility Details pages using the icon. On the Registrations and Enquiries pages, the icon is situated in the list to the far right of the record. In the case of the Registration Details page (as with other Details pages), the icon is located near the client's email address. To send an email to the user:   Click the email icon. For example It is found toward the bottom of the Client Details section on the Registration Details page. This will open the Email Client pop-up:     Select the Template to be sent. This will update the subject and message and determine the attachments (if any). The templates available in the list are determined by the record type, such as Enquiry or Registration. The From field will be pre-filled with the RTO's email address (as entered in the Organisation Details section of Account), however it can be changed. The To field will be pre-filled with the client's email address, however, it can be changed. Optionally, enter an email address for a blind copy to be sent to in the Bcc field. The Subject will be pre-filled from the template. This can be changed. Attachments can be included, these will be in addition to any already assigned to the template. This is the message that will be sent to the customer. Any variables in the template will be substituted for the appropriate value.

Changes can be made to the text and formatting if desired. Click the Send button when the message is ready to go. Related Topics   Email Templates  Registrations  Registration details

VETtrak Desktop

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the requirement to flag students who have come through an Outreach Support Officer (OSO) for ACE DESK reporting.

After reviewing the request, it appears that this is a new requirement that is not currently supported in the system. [2] However, I will raise this with our product team to evaluate the feasibility of implementing a new flag or indicator to identify OSO students for ACE DESK reporting. [1]

In the meantime, I would suggest exploring the use of custom fields or tags to manually track which students have come through an OSO. [3] This could be a temporary solution until a more permanent solution is implemented.

I will keep you updated on the progress of this request. Please let me know if you have any other questions or concerns.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the need to flag students who have come through an Outreach Support Officer (OSO) for ACE DESK reporting.

For ACE DESK reporting, the Disability Flag and Disability Type Identifier fields are used to capture a student's disadvantage criteria, such as low literacy, numeracy, and digital skills [1]. The Funding Source - State field is used to indicate the funding source, such as CSD for ACE CSO Disadvantaged Student [4].

Currently, there is no specific field to flag a student as having come through an OSO. However, we can look into adding a custom field or extending an existing field to accommodate this requirement.

One potential solution could be to add a new custom field of type "Yes/No" or "Dropdown" to the client record, specifically for capturing the OSO status. This field could then be included in the ACE DESK reporting extract.

Alternatively, we may be able to extend the existing Disability Type Identifier field to include a new code representing the OSO status, in addition to the existing disability codes.

I will raise this request with our product team to explore the best approach for implementing an OSO flag for ACE DESK reporting while maintaining the existing disadvantage criteria and funding source fields. Once we have a proposed solution, I will follow up with you to discuss the details and timeline.

Please let me know if you have any other specific requirements or considerations regarding this request.

Thank you,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the need to flag students who have come through an Outreach Support Officer (OSO) for ACE DESK reporting.

I understand the requirements are:
1. The student's existing ACE Disadvantage Criteria should remain unchanged.
2. The student's existing Funding Source State should remain unchanged.
3. There needs to be an additional flag or identifier to indicate that the student has come through an OSO.

Unfortunately, I could not find any existing functionality or data element in our system that allows for specifically flagging OSO students for ACE DESK reporting while retaining their existing disadvantage criteria and funding source. This appears to be a new requirement that is not currently supported.

I will raise this with our product team as a potential enhancement request. They will evaluate the requirement and prioritize it accordingly in our development roadmap. In the meantime, I would suggest exploring alternative methods to track or identify these OSO students, such as using custom fields or tags within the system [5].

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. I will keep you updated on any progress or decisions made regarding this feature request.

Kind Regards,

Disability Flag

Elem ent description

A flag to indicate whether a student considers themselves to have a disability, impairment or long-term condition.

File

Client (NAT00080)

Purpose

To provide information to support the analysis of VET participation by students declaring a disability.

Business rules

General:

The training organisation normally collects this information via a standard question on the student’s enrolment form. For

more information, go to Appendix 1: Standard  enrolment  questions .

If a student has indicated that he or she has a disability, impairment or long-term condition then the Disability Flag  must

be Y regardless of whether the specific nature of the disability has been stated.

Specific :

If the specific nature has not been stated, then the Disability Type Identifier  on the Client Disability (NAT00090) file would

be 99 - NOT SPECIFIED .

If the Disability Flag  = Y, one or more records describing the student's disabilities must be provided in the Client Disability

(NAT00090) file.

If the Disability Flag  = N, there must be no records for this student in the Client Disability (NAT00090) file.

This field must  not be blank.

Field format

Value  Description

Length  1

Type  Alphanumeric

Justification  None

Fill character  None

Field value

Value  Description

Y Yes - the student  has a disability, impairment  or long-term condition.

N No - the student  does not have a disability, impairment or long-term condition .

@ Not stated - question asked of the student  but no answer provided.

VET Student Loans (Income Contingent Loan) Indicator

Element description

A flag to indicate that the student has an income contingent loan as financial support.

File

Training Activity (NAT00120)

Purpose

To facilitate VET Student Loans, (formally VET FEE -HELP) monitoring and reporting.

Business rules

General:

Income contingent loans are available only to students enrolling in VET programs at Diploma level or above.

Specific:

The indicator must be set to Y if the student  has an income contingent loan. These students would be enrolled in a program

where:

(a) The Program Level of Education Identifier  in the Program (NAT00030)  file is coded:

411 - Advanced Diploma

421 - Diploma, or

(b) The program is offered at the following levels:

Vocational Graduate Certificate

Vocational Graduate Diploma

The indicator should be coded N for all other records.

This field must not be blank.

Field format

Value  Description

Length  1

Type  Alphanumeric

Justification  None

Fill character  None

Field value

Value  Description

Y Yes, training is being provided under VET Student Loans .

N No, training is not being provided under VET Student Loans .

26716 - FIXED: We have resolved an issue when creating Programs with Academic Periods, now only Academic Periods selected by the user will be added to the Program. 26184 - FIXED: We have resolved an issue in the Report Builder when using a filter on the Student Unit Status: Outcome Code field was not being saved with the custom report. 23559 – FIXED: We have resolved an issue on the Prospect Wizard where the Referring Agent Employer field was not being retained when navigating between steps in the New Referral wizard. 23958 – FIXED: We have resolved an issue that would cause the report builder to filter by a check-in's database ID rather than its status when using the Support Service Check-in: Status field. 23063 – FIXED: We fixed an issue that would cause the Academic Details Report (Standard Report) to error 500 when a general or course filter isn't specified. 23943 – FIXED: We have resolved an issue with the Standard Report - Trainer Details where it could be generated in a PDF or Spreadsheet but not on screen. 27520 – FIXED: We have updated the Standard Report - Student Progress to exclude units from the commenced column that have outcomes of 85 and 99. 26953 - FIXED: We have improved the Top Courses standard report so that the Enrolment Start and End Date filter will include enrolments with dates that overlap the filter date range. Previously it only included enrolments that were entirely within the filter date range.

A new 'Residency Status' will be reported in the Student extract file. This field is reported using the new 'WA TAMS Residency Status' of:   The 'Visa Subtype' or 'Visa Type' of the most recent current 'Visa' entered on the party’s 'International' page, or  The 'Citizenship Status' entered on the party’s 'AVETMISS' page   Visa Subtype     Visa Type     Citizenship Status       NSW ACE Disadvantage Criteria  We have implemented the new 'second level disadvantage criteria' in NSW ACE AVETMISS claiming. This is a new three letter code to be reported in the 'purchasing contract schedule identifier' field in the NAT120 file, for funding source 'CSD' (ACE disadvantaged students) only. There is also a corresponding Compliance preference page to update these values. These changes come into effect from 1st July 2023. User Permissions updates  We’ve introduced a series of permissions that allows you to manage access to the following functions within the Program > Automations page:   Program Automation  Add Program Automation  List Program Automations  Edit Program Automations  Delete Program Automations          Disable Course Enrolment Hold  We’ve extended our 'Disable Course Enrolment Hold' behaviour to course applications, so that when a student has an active hold, users cannot enrol the student from the course application.

Note: This setting can only be applied to non-completion reportable outcomes (i.e. 40 – Withdrawn, 70 – Continuing Enrolment)       CAN Notice Automation Condition  We’ve added a new Automation Condition that is called Group by Student and Census Date. Now only one Task Instance/Email will be created for Enrolment Subjects with the same census date and group them together to be placed into a generated CAN Notice. Notes:

Enrolment Subjects with different dates will have their own Task Instance/Email  Updating the census date for one or more Enrolment Subjects to a date that has already been processed for other units will result in one new Task Instance/Email for that date  Updating the census date for an Enrolment Subject that has already been processed will result in a new Task Instance/Email for that date  If you are interested in adding this condition to your environment – please contact our support team for assistance. USI Exemption Improvements  On a Course’s Student page, students with a USI exemption code of INTOFF or INDIV will now appear with a green tick in the USI column. These students will also not appear as an error on the USI Manager screen. Claims Reporting  Claims Reporting will no longer consider a contract set at the course level to determine whether an enrolment should be included in reporting. Only contracts set at the enrolment or unit level will be considered. Report Builder  We have added the ACE Disadvantage Criteria field to Report Builder. Queensland Claims Payment Importer  Additional logic has been added to the Queensland Claims Importer to show when payments are declined. In the Queensland Claims Payment import file, any rows with an N in the student_pay and ts_pay columns will result in a warning when importing to the SMS. When ‘Import with warnings is selected, these rows are imported as Declined payments.

Start Date, End Date, Scheduled Hours and Result Type will be reported from the placement, and a new VIC enrolment identifier will be generated for it. All other NAT120 fields will come from the enrolment linked to the placement. Note you can report multiple placements for a VIC program enrolment (even with different host employers) by creating multiple placements and linking them to the VIC reportable enrolment. Only Placements assigned to enrolments will be used for Placement reporting. Placements assigned to a contract will be ignored. You must not use this feature on any existing enrolments where you're already reporting a practical placement by manually entering and reporting a PRAC000001 or PRAC000002 unit. You should use placements for this reporting on new enrolments going forward. NSW reporting changes   ACE reporting. NSW ACE reporting support has been added. Various ACE NSW state funding sources have been added. Ticking the new "NSW ACE reporting" tickbox in the Generate State AVETMISS wizard for NSW will produce AVETMISS files for ACE reporting. These files don't apply any of the NSW Smart and Skilled rules, instead they include all state and nationally-reportable enrolments in NSW. A "Fee exemption" field has been added to the NSW AVETMISS page in the Enrolment wizard for use with ACE reporting - this is only reported for NSW enrolments when performing an ACE generation. NSW Smart and Skilled Provider Calculator fields.

Update provider details to enable the CRICOS feature    Add CRICOS details to Program    Update party's international details    add all agents (company and person)    Create an enrolment with all the CRICOS details entered    Create a report based off a business question    Take a look at the importer and exporter    Additional Resources  The following resources provide additional support and information relating to this session. PowerPoint (download)    Knowledge base article links   Process: Entering Your RTO Details   Process: Add a New Program   Curriculum Overview   Process: Add a New Course  The Australian Commonwealth Register of Institutions and Courses for Overseas Students (CRICOS)   CRICOS - frequently asked questions (FAQs) | Tertiary Education Quality and Standards Agency Registration on CRICOS What is an ESOS provider? Guide to reporting obligations for CRICOS providers   PRISMS Modernisation Project   General Factsheet FAQ    How do I note a student is at risk? You can highlight a student is a risk through the uses of Tags within the system. How do I record evidence of what we have done to follow up with at risk students? Notes and/or Checklists is a good way to record what is happening. I can’t see the CIRCOS features To see the CRICOS fields within the system you need to add your CRICOS ID against the provider details, then logout and log back in for the changes to take affect. Is there an integration between the SMS and PRISMS?

No, There is currently no integration however the Government is currently working on the PRISMS Modernisation Project which will bring changes to the way the two talk to each other. How do I get reports about attendance? You can make use of the custom reports features to create the reports you need around attendance.

Enrolment API: Traineeship Flag  We’ve updated the Enrolment API to return the Traineeship Flag as 'TRUE' when there is one or more traineeships associated with a Student’s record. Custom URLs  We have introduced a new custom field type of HTML, which will allow for hyperlinks to be added to the party and enrolment screens. An optional link text can be displayed by saving the custom field in the format of 'URL, Text'. Course numbers display on multi-linked course forms  We have updated the course form settings page to display the course number when multiple courses are linked. Program Status Identifier  We have automated the updating of the Program Status Identifier for Victorian and Tasmanian enrolments when generating a Reportable Certificate or Statement of Attainment. When the certificate is recorded with an 'Issue Date', we will update the Program Status Identifier to 'Program Completed (Issued)', or if there is no 'Issue Date' the Program Status Identifier will be updated to 'Program Completed (not issued)'. This applies regardless of whether the Certificate is created from the Party, Course, Progress Centre, Program Automate or API. Issue Date has Value Issue Date Does not have value Student Portal  We have added the 'Expiry Date' field to the Certificate List page in the Student Portal which will be displayed when a student has a certificate that has an 'Expiry Date'.

ticket_content.ticket_description: HI ****  Hoping for some assistance please.  I have an error that keeps coming up for new student **************, preventing me from submitting my ** day report in STS Online.     ERROR:    NAT*****   Training Activity Error   ****   Outcome Identifier   National   Invalid Outcome Identifier   National  **   I have tried unticking Smart and Skilled reporting for this student, but it still includes her anyway.  I have removed her contract etc, but she still comes up with an error.       Any ideas what the problem could be please?     Regards  *******

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the Smart and Skilled reporting error. The error "Invalid Outcome Identifier National" indicates that the Outcome Identifier National value reported for the student's enrolment is not a valid code [1].

For Smart and Skilled reporting, the valid Outcome Identifier National values are:
- 20 (Competency achieved/pass)
- 30 (Competency not achieved/fail) 
- 40 (Withdrawn/discontinued)
- 41 (Withdrawn/discontinued due to RTO closure)
- 61 (Superseded subject)
- 70 (Continuing activity expected to end after collection year)
- 71 (Continuing activity expected to end in collection year)
- 81 (Non-assessable enrolment - satisfactorily completed)
- 82 (Non-assessable enrolment - withdrew/not satisfactorily completed) [1]

Please review the student's enrolment and ensure the Outcome Identifier National value is one of the valid codes listed above. If it is not a valid code, update it to the correct value based on the student's enrolment status [3].

If the issue persists after updating the Outcome Identifier National, please let me know the specific value you have entered, and I can further investigate the cause [2].

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the Smart and Skilled reporting error for the new student. Based on the information provided, the error "NAT***** Training Activity Error **** Outcome Identifier National Invalid Outcome Identifier National **" indicates that the Outcome Identifier National code reported for the student's training activity is invalid [1].

The valid Outcome Identifier National codes for Smart and Skilled reporting are listed in reference [1]. Some common codes are:
- 20 (Competency achieved/pass)
- 30 (Competency not achieved/fail) 
- 40 (Withdrawn/discontinued)
- 61 (Superseded subject)
- 70 (Continuing activity expected to end after the collection year)
- 71 (Continuing activity expected to end in the collection year)

Please review the Outcome Identifier National code reported for this student and ensure it is one of the valid codes listed. If an incorrect code was reported, you will need to update the student's training activity record with the correct code [1].

If you are still unable to resolve the error after updating the Outcome Identifier National code, you can try the following:

1. Ensure the student has a valid Commitment ID linked to their enrolment [2]. The Commitment ID links the student's enrolments for Smart and Skilled reporting.

2. If the student should not be reported for Smart and Skilled, you can cancel or remove the Commitment ID from their enrolment record [2]. This will exclude them from Smart and Skilled reporting.

Please let me know if the error persists after trying these steps. I'd be happy to further investigate and provide additional guidance.

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the Smart and Skilled reporting error for the student. The error "Invalid Outcome Identifier National" indicates that the Outcome Identifier National code reported for the student's enrolment is not a valid code as per the Smart and Skilled guidelines.

The valid Outcome Identifier National codes for Smart and Skilled reporting are listed in reference [1]. Some common valid codes are:
20 - Competency achieved/pass
30 - Competency not achieved/fail 
40 - Withdrawn/discontinued
61 - Superseded subject
70 - Continuing activity (expected to end after the collection year)
71 - Continuing activity (expected to end in the collection year)

Please review the student's enrolment and ensure the Outcome Identifier National code is one of the valid codes mentioned above [1]. If an incorrect code was entered, update it to the correct code based on the student's enrolment status.

If the code is correct but the error persists, you can try the following troubleshooting steps outlined in reference [2]:

1. Ensure the student's details like name, date of birth, etc. match the details in the Training Contract (if applicable).
2. Check if there are any duplicate enrolments for the same qualification for the student in the same time period. If so, remove the duplicates.
3. Confirm if the student is enrolled in the correct qualification as per the Training Contract.

If none of the above steps resolve the issue, please let me know. We may need to investigate further or consider excluding the student from Smart and Skilled reporting for this submission if the error cannot be resolved [2].

Let me know if you need any further assistance.

Kind Regards,

Overview of eReporting

What is eReporting?

eReporting is located within the Department’s secure portal, STS Online. It is the mechanism that you will

use to report student and Training Activity Data to the De partment for programs administered by the Smart

and Skilled Contract.

Training Activity Data is reported through the successful submission of Australian Vocational Education and

Training Management Information Statistical Standard (AVETMISS) compliant dat a files.

Objectives of eReporting

eReporting is designed to:

enable your organisation to meet its reporting obligations under the Smart and Skilled Contract Terms and Conditions and Smart and Skilled Operating Guidelines

allow the Department to monitor training activity under Smart and Skilled

enable the Department to make payments for Smart and Skilled training delivered, where due.

The process for submitting Training Activity Data

The Commitment ID will link the 2 Enrolments together for Smart and Skilled reporting, this can be found on Page 12 of the Smart and Skilled eReporting Technical Specifications and Business Validations documentation.

You can adjust the Commitment ID by right-clicking on the new

enrolment

and selecting

Edit Enrolment, the Commitment ID can be found on the AVETMISS

page. Paste the Commitment ID of the Superseded Enrolment in this section to link the 2 Enrolments.

Warning  You will only need to link the 2 Enrolments through the Commitment ID if you are reporting Superseded Units, if you are not reporting any Superseded Units, you will need to generate a new Commitment ID for the Current Enrolment and the Superseded Commitment ID will need to be cancelled on the STS Portal. This is in line with

Page 12

of the Smart and Skilled eReporting Technical Specifications and Business Validations documentation on STS Online. With this, your Superseded Enrolments should be ready for reporting!

the first class is not reported except in the case where the subject has been superseded and the

training activity has transitioned to the replacement subject in which case the enrolment in the

superseded subject should be reported with national outcome ‘61’. Training activity (NAT00120)  Section 2 - File definit ions

Page 36 WAVEDS 8.0.C12

Subject-only enrolment:

A subject -only enrolment  occurs where a client enrols in a subject which is not part of an

enrolment in a program. In this case the Commencing program identifier  must be  ‘8 - Subject -

only training ’ and the Program identifier - local in the Training activity ( NAT00120 ) file must be

blank. The Associated course identifier  must not be blank where Funding sou rce - national  is

‘11 - Commonwealth and state general purpose recurrent ’.

Continuing enrolment:

All enrolments reported in AVETMISS collections are expected to be brought to account  with a

final outcome at some point in time.

For interim reporting during the year , where the Activity end date  is within the current year and

where an enrolment is in progress after some participation by the student , the Outcome

identifier - national  value of ‘71 - Continuing activit y (expected to end in the collection year) ’

must be used.

Enrolments where the Activity end date  is within the current collection year  must be given a

definite out come ( ‘20’, ‘30’, ‘40’, ‘41’, ‘61’, ‘81’ or ‘82’) before the final reporting point for the

collection year. Outcome identifier - national  values of ‘71 - Continuing activity (expected to end

in the collection year) ’ are not permitted in the final collection.

For the final reporting point of the current collection year, only enrolments that have an Activity

end date  in a subsequent year may be reported with an Outcome identifier - national  of ‘70 -

Continuing activity (expected to end after the collection year) ’.

I need some help with the below error report received from STS. Dear Mrs ****  Your training activity data for the following student s  has been reviewed:    C*********, ***************  Your data has been rejected for the following reason:    TNC or D must be reported if the student has discontinued/deferred from training. Please rectify and submit updated training activity data for the above student s . To enable successful lodgement of data please wait * business days from receipt of this email before submitting new data. For further information on how to report TNC/D, please refer to page ** of the Smart and Skilled eReporting Technical Specifications and Business Validations. The PDF is located on STS Online under the Support Documents tab.

Errors

In doing claiming last week we received the *** of the following error from Training Services NSW  Disability / Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander status reported in eReporting (NAT***** file) and the status provided on the Commitment ID do not match. (Error ID: ****)   We have been advised by TSNSW that this is a new code in their system. If there is a students self-declared disability this may be getting picked up in the NAT**** file when reporting to them. They have advised that we need to ensure the NAT**** does not support Disability status if the student does not have the evidence required to be enrolled under Disability for Smart and Skilled. They said we will need to contact our Student management system to reconfigure.

Were you guys aware of this change? How can this be amended in our system? Is there a way to bulk update?
