response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with the learner's enrolment not being picked up correctly while lodging data in JobReady.

Based on the information provided, it seems that the enrolment in question has a target end date from the previous year, which is causing JobReady to exclude it from the current reporting year [2]. This can happen if the target end dates against ongoing enrolment units are not configured for the intended reporting year.

To resolve this, I would suggest reviewing the enrolment units for this learner and ensuring that the target end dates are set to a date within the current reporting year [3]. Once the target end dates are updated, JobReady should correctly include the enrolment when lodging data.

If the issue persists after adjusting the target end dates, please provide me with the specific error message you are receiving, and I can further investigate the root cause.

In the meantime, you can also try validating the enrolment by going to the Enrolment > Claims/Funding tab and checking if the "Claimable" field is set to "Yes" [3]. If it is set to "No", there may be an issue with the reporting flag or contract setup that needs to be addressed.

Please let me know if you have any other questions or if you need further assistance.

Thank you,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with reporting the learner's enrolment data in JobReady. Based on the information provided, it seems that the system is unable to include the learner's enrolment data from the previous year, which is causing an error [2].

One potential reason for this issue could be related to the enrolment end date [1]. If the enrolment end date doesn't have a year within the activity year, it may not appear in the reporting files, leading to errors. I would suggest checking the enrolment end date for the learner's previous year enrolment and ensuring that it falls within the appropriate activity year.

Additionally, please verify the funding source information for the learner's enrolment [1]. Incorrect or inconsistent funding source selections at the enrolment or unit level can also result in reporting errors. Double-check the funding source national and funding source state fields at both the enrolment and unit levels.

If you have already checked these aspects and are still encountering the error, please provide me with the specific error message or error code you are receiving. This will help me investigate further and provide more targeted assistance.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with the learner's enrolment not being included in the reporting data. This can happen due to a few potential reasons:

1) Ensure the enrolment end date falls within the reporting period/activity year you are trying to report on [2]. If the end date is in a different year, it may not be picked up correctly.

2) Check that the funding source codes are correct at both the enrolment and unit level [1]. Incorrect or mismatched funding sources can lead to errors and exclusions from reporting.

3) Verify that any qualification or statement of attainment completion details and issue dates are accurate, as discrepancies here can also cause reporting issues [1].

I'd suggest double-checking those key fields for the learner's enrolment you mentioned. If everything looks correct based on the potential issues outlined above, please let me know the specific error you're receiving and I can further investigate.

In the meantime, you can try refreshing the reporting data by going to Administration > Data Exchange > AVETMISS Reporting and clicking the "Refresh Data" button. This will re-process all enrolment data against the current reporting rules.

Please let me know if you have any other questions!

Kind regards,

related_knowledge.content:
If the enrolment End Date doesn't have a year within the Activity Year, it will not appear in the NAT files and can lead to errors. Funding Source Errors Funding Source errors can occur if the incorrect ones are selected, they can be applied at the enrolment level or at the individual unit level. If you get any errors relating to Funding Source, check the Funding Source National and Funding Source State fields at the enrolment level and the unit level. Parchment and Date Completed Errors There could be some issues with how Qualification completions and Issue Date. This can occur when a Statement of Attainment is being included in the AVETMISS files as part of a Qualification completion. Uncheck the Reportable tickbox for the SOA if it does not need to be reported. Contacting Support For More Assistance  If you are still getting errors back and aren’t sure on how to resolve them, you can contact our helpful support team. When making a request, it will be very helpful to include the following:   Details on the AVETMISS errors that you may be receiving AVETMISS Error list, these are usually provided to you by the reporting body in the form of a PDF or Spreadsheet  A copy of the NAT files that you submitted Any solutions that you have attempted before submitting the request. F.A.Q  When is the deadline for submitting this data? NCVER recommends that data is submitted by the 28th of February or the last business day of the month. What if I missed the submission deadline?

You will need to contact NCVER client support for directions on what to do next. Contact Us - NCVER  What should I do if I have no data to submit? You will need to submit a ‘nil return’ to NCVER if you don’t have any training activity to report. How to Submit a Nil Return - NCVER

Once you have your file ready to go, navigate to Administration > Funding > Claim Payments Import.

Select the relevant Import type and file, and then click on the Upload button.

103

Wait for the batch to process. It should find if there were any successful matches for claims in the system.

Click on the Confirm button to process the claim payment, which will initiate a batch job to apply the payments to the matches.

Once this has been completed, you should find that the payment has been applied to the enrolment’s claims page, and the status has

been updated to Payment Received.

Enrolment Claims Page Breakdown

This section will details some of the more specifics around what is shown on the Claims page and how certain values are calculated.

Claiming

Claimable: This is tied with the “Reporting” flag at the Enrolment Claims/Funding level. If Reporting is enabled, then this will show as

“Yes”. If this is disabled, this will show as “No”.

Contract: This is the contract that is linked with the enrolment. This is in the form of a hyperlink if the user wants to check how the

contract has been set up.

Predicted Funding: This is a summary of how much funding you are expecting to receive for the entire enrolment, based on the contract

rules that you have set up.

the amount of units that have been completed under the qualification. Also note that the percentage of subsidy is based on what you

have set for the Qualification field.

100

There are other forms of Programs which will create schedules as well, but if you can understand the Smart and Skilled model, then you

can understand the other programs as well.

SEE Program: This is where it starts getting really complicated. I am not going to go into depth on how to use this funding method, but

note that there is a very useful article on how SEE claims can be set up and triggered, over here - SEE Attendance Reports

A summary is that the funding works based on the amount of hours that the student is attending under the SEE program. For every hour

that they attend, the user can set the amount of funding that they receive, under the “Class Attendance Hours - per hour” field.

SA ATIS: I genuinely think that this is currently not functional at all. There is the ability to specify between “on-the-job” and “off-the-job”

but there is nowhere to actually input an expected amount. This will need further investigation. Perhaps SA just have a set amount that

they fund based on those options.

Claims forecasting for enrolments

101

TCSI Learners and Courses

All VET Student Loan (VSL) and Higher Education providers that are approved under the TCSI reporting scheme are required to report data for their TCSI Data Collection obligations. Once your initial configuration is complete, you will then be ready to start processing learners into TCSI specific courses. Once you have created the Individual/Student Party Record

and entered the appropriate information you can now enrol this

Party

into a TCSI Ready Course.

ticket_content.ticket_title: URGENT: AVETMISS NSW eReporting NAT***** Outcome - Training Not Completed (TNC), ****** RTO #***** #69925
ticket_content.ticket_description: Have an urgent need to clarify for our need to clarify the Training Not Completed  TNC  Outcome for New South Wales STS Online Reporting from the AVETMISS Reporting.  I have searched through the documents to see of any:   VETtrak support documents   Training Services NSW   Smart and Skilled Documentation, and    AVETMISS Documents  I am seeking clarification to the National Code Outcome, if you could please clarify this in writing to ******************** that would be greatly appreciated.  This is urgent as we have our data reporting raise with the State Training Authority, and this immediately needs to be corrected in our next STS online upload from a previous outcome that should not have been used being Withdrawn   **.  This will be configuring the new Outcome code to Training Not Completed  TNC to correct this data anomaly.  If you can clarify the from the screen shot ******** NAT***** Outcome TNC.png Reportable Outcome from the Outcomes Types Configuration Edit.  If you need to contact via phone my number is ************.  Kind Regards,  ********************** RTO CEO

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the reporting of "Training Not Completed (TNC)" outcome for NSW AVETMISS reporting.

To report an enrolment as "Training Not Completed" for NSW Smart and Skilled, you need to set the "Training Status" field to "Training not completed" in the Enrolment wizard [1][2]. This will report the value "TNC" in the "Outcome Identifier - Training Organisation" field of the NAT120 file when generating AVETMISS for NSW Smart and Skilled [3].

The "Training Status" field is specifically used to indicate that a student has discontinued all training in the qualification or course, not just a single unit of competency [3]. When this field is set to "Training not completed", VETtrak will report "TNC" for all units in that enrolment during AVETMISS generation [1][2].

To configure the "Training Status" field, go to the Enrolment wizard and on Page 2 under the "Training Status" heading, select the "Training not completed" option [1]. This will ensure the "TNC" outcome is reported correctly in your AVETMISS files for upload to STS Online.

Please note that the "Withdrawn" outcome should not be used for reporting discontinued enrolments to NSW STS. The "Training Not Completed" status is the correct way to report this as per NSW government requirements [3].

I hope this clarifies how to report the "Training Not Completed (TNC)" outcome in VETtrak for NSW AVETMISS reporting. Let me know if you need any further assistance.

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding reporting students who have discontinued training for NSW Smart and Skilled.

For students who are not completing their training, you should set the "Training Status" field to "Training not completed" on their enrolment [1][2]. For any units they have not commenced, leave the result blank but set the start and end dates in the past [2].

When you generate the AVETMISS NAT120 file for NSW Smart and Skilled reporting, VETtrak will then report the value "TNC" (Training Not Completed) in the "Outcome Identifier - Training Organisation" field for that enrolment [1][3]. This indicates to NSW that the student has discontinued all training for that qualification/course enrolment.

Please let me know if you need any other assistance in setting this up correctly for your next NSW Smart and Skilled upload.

Kind regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding reporting the "Training Not Completed (TNC)" outcome for discontinued NSW Smart and Skilled enrolments. 

To report an enrolment as Training Not Completed in VETtrak:

1. In the Enrolment Wizard, on the page where you enter the Commitment ID, there is a "Training Status" field. Select "Training not completed" here [2].

2. For any units the student has not commenced, leave the result blank with the start and end dates in the past [1][2]. 

3. When generating the AVETMISS NAT files, VETtrak will report "TNC" in the "Outcome Identifier - Training Organisation" field of the NAT120 file for enrolments with the "Training not completed" status [3].

This will ensure the "Training Not Completed" outcome is correctly reported for discontinued enrolments in your NSW eReporting upload [3]. Please let me know if you need any further assistance with configuring this.

Thank you,

Warning  It is important that this box is only ticked once you have successfully submitted and finalised the learning information for this individual. Blank Outcomes  For NSW Enrolments, VETtrak allows the recording of Blank outcomes:     This means you can record a Result for a unit within an enrolment, and only record dates for that unit which will report the unit as Not Yet Started (85) in the NAT00120 file. When the student starts or completes the unit, you can then record the Result (such as Continuing or Competent) to reflect that the student has started the unit. When any unit is reported in Generate State AVETMISS for NSW, all units for the enrolment are reported.

Training Not Completed (TNC)  If a student is not to complete their training, you may be asked to report them as Training Not Completed or 'TNC'. This is achieved in the

Students

Enrolment Wizard, on Page 2 - the same page you enter a Commitment ID,

under the Training Status heading:        Selecting this item will report the 'TNC' status as requested by State Training Services.

Apprenticeship/Traineeship Details For Contract Enrolments  For NSW, a recorded TCID or Contract Code MUST contain a forward slash ( / ) to report a Training Contract ID. Within your NAT files, this will be reported in it's entirety within the Training Contract ID field, with the section before the forward slash reported as the STA Client Number, shown below:

NSW Specific AVETMISS Generation Options  There are a couple of options that appear when generating New South Wales NAT files that are worth being aware of, these include:    NSW Smart and Skilled generation:

Only enrolments with a Commitment ID that begin with 'C', 'S' or 'Q' will be included when generating the NAT files.

When reporting a student who has discontinued training, if the student has not commenced training for a particular unit, then it should be left with a blank result, the start and finish dates no longer need to be in the future, and the "Training Status" field for the enrolment should be set to "Training not completed" to report TNC in the "Outcome Identifier - Training Organisation" field in the NAT120. Generate AVETMISS for NSW Smart and Skilled has been changed to allow an empty result with result dates in the past to be reported when the Training Status for the enrolment is set to TNC. Extend NSW unit dates. The Extend NSW Unit Dates wizard will no longer update the dates of any units in enrolments with a "Training Status" of "Training not completed", to avoid changing dates for discontinued training. Changing dates of not started units. In the Enrolment Results and Occurrence Results wizards, for a unit that is NSW Smart and Skilled state reportable and has an empty result, or is WA state reportable and has a "not yet started" result, you can now change the start date of the unit even if the "Result start date being changed" result preference is set to warning or error. Release 4.4.6.2 - 12/04/2016  This minor update fixes the following issues:   In Generate AVETMISS, hyphens and digits are no longer stripped from the "Name for encryption" field in the NAT80 file in any state other than VIC. An error that occurs when assigning events to multiple clients.

For discontinued  students, the value “TNC” (Training Not Completed) should be used; for deferral, the value

As this field indicates a situation which applies to the Qualification or Course enrolment, the same value for this field must appear in ALL UoC enrolments for the Qualification or Course.

related_knowledge.content:
VETtrak 18.2.1 Release Notes

13/07/2018

Important - please read this first  NSW reporting - If you report in NSW, you should upgrade to 18.2.1.0 or later by 1 August 2018. On this date, AVS will no longer accept blank outcome codes in the NAT120. AVETMISS fields update - AVETMISS classification list field values are now being sourced from AVS, instead of local files. A new list of suburbs is also available. After updating to 18.2.1, go to the Utility menu -> AVETMISS -> Update AVETMISS fields -> Update VETtrak button to update these lists in your database. The first time you do this update, it will take some time to run (generally up to half an hour), so please allow sufficient time. Web products - Updates to the Trainer Portal, Student Portal, VTDocs, Progress Portal and VETtrak API are available alongside this release. Version 18.2.1 is a minor update from version 18.2.0. This version introduces a new direct integration with NCVER's AVS (AVETMISS Validation Software) system. Changes in 18.2.1.3 (14/09/2018)   NSW Smart and Skilled training not completed. Generate AVETMISS for NSW Smart and Skilled will now allow a unit start date in the past with an outcome of 85 (Not yet started) if the training status is "Training not completed" (TNC). NSW Provider Calculator Export extra columns. The NSW Provider Calculator Export wizard will now include the new columns "Strategy_Initiative", "Strategy_Code", "Sub_Strategy Code" and "Voucher_No" in the export spreadsheet, so the NSW Provider Calculator will accept it.

NSW Smart and Skilled. The following has been added to the Eligibility pages in the Enrolment wizard for NSW, and included in the NSW Provider Calculator Export wizard:  New Program Stream 42 "Skilling for Recovery Priority Full Qualification"  New Strategy Codes S120, S140, S160, S161, S180, S181 and S200  New Part Qual Parent National Qualification field, allowing a qualification to be selected    Victorian state funding sources. The list of Victorian state funding sources has been updated to comply with 2022 requirements. VIC AVETMISS placement reporting. When reporting placements in VIC AVETMISS, the PRAC000001 and PRAC000002 units in the NAT60 file will now be reported with a field of education of 129999. VIC AVETMISS placement "report as" qualification. VIC Generate AVETMISS will now correctly report the enrolment qualification's "report as" qualification in the NAT120 file when reporting a practical placement. Generate AVETMISS status colour accessibility. The Generate AVETMISS wizard will now show a text indicator along with the grid status colours to improve the accessibility of the information. This will be gradually rolled out to other grids that use status colours in the future. ANZSCO update. There has been an update to the ANZSCO Codes, that applies from 22 April 2022. If you haven't done so already, you will need to update VETtrak with these new values through the wizard available in the AVETMISS menu -> Update AVETMISS fields. TCSI Course Outcome Code.

Generate State AVETMISS for NSW Smart and Skilled will no longer report units that have a result type that has "Report this result type in AVETMISS reports" unticked. Previously, such units were still reported with an empty outcome. Field availability. Each set of NSW Smart and Skilled commitment information is for an individual client. To avoid issues, VETtrak now enforces this by making the Commitment ID field and info/eligibility tabs unavailable when working with an occurrence or booking itself, editing an enrolment in a profile, or enrolling multiple clients at once. AVETMISS changes   Queensland changes.In Queensland, the following AVETMISS data changes have been made:  A new funding source has been added: SQT - Certificate III Guarantee (Skilling Queenslanders for Work). Fee exemption codes E, F and L have been archived, and codes C and N have been renamed. If you need to use the old fee exemption codes, you can un-archive them in the Configuration Manager. State selection. A state field has been added to the Generate State AVETMISS wizard, allowing you to choose a different state to perform the AVETMISS generation for. Warn about incomplete result finishing in the past. The warning "The result is Result Not Available or Continuing but the finish date has passed" in Generate State AVETMISS in Victoria will now also be checked in all other states. Moving units between enrolments.

Currently, due to a lack of information from the NSW government, VETtrak is not able to import the Provider Calculator results spreadsheet. Until this functionality is available, you can go through the results and enter the resultant commitment IDs, expiry dates and pricing into the Enrolment wizard. Not started results. Smart and Skilled requires every unit that has not yet started to have indicative start and end dates, with no result, to be reported. The Record Results wizard now allows you to enter results dated in the future with no result type for this purpose. Training status. To report an enrolment as Deferred or Training Not Completed, record this in the new Training Status field in the Enrolment wizard. VETtrak will report this in the Outcome Identifier - Training Organisation field in the NAT120 file by Generate AVETMISS. AVETMISS generation. To generate your AVETMISS files for Smart and Skilled, in NSW, go to the Utility menu -> Generate state AVETMISS files. South Australia  Support has been added to VETtrak to allow reporting of VET activity for school students to STELA, as requested by the Department of State Development. To do so, in the school student's enrolment, set the funding agreement to VIS (use the Configuration Manager to create it if you don't already have one) and tick the "This is a VET in Schools enrolment" tickbox.

25995 - We have resolved an issue where students could have duplicate disability records after a user changes AVETMISS details in the Enrolment Wizard. This fix ensures that no duplicate values will be reported in any AVETMISS or Claims reporting data.

26420 – We have updated Vic reporting so that If the Commencing Program Cohort Identifier is empty, and the enrolment has a Commencement Date in 2023 or later, report the Commencing Program Cohort Identifier in the NAT130 file, as “NNNNNN”, instead of six spaces.

26263 - We have resolved an issue that was causing AVETMISS Reporting wizard to report warnings for records outside of the currently selected collection parameters.

are now working as expected.

26340 - Students with a single name are now reported correctly in the Enrolment file in the WA RAPT claim export.

25214 - We have fixed an issue that was sometimes preventing you from invoicing

additional

fees through the Create Invoice modal on the Smart Fees Invoicing page.

26381 - SMS messages were not appearing in the activity feed of the

recipients

party profiles when an SMS was sent. This has been fixed and will now appear in the Activity Feed.

You can choose which AVS validation options to apply. AVS will validate your files. VETtrak will show you a notification when the validation is complete. VETtrak can show the results of the AVS validation, with buttons allowing you to directly edit any VETtrak records in error. For more information on how the AVS integration works in VETtrak, refer to the Using the NCVER AVETMISS Validation Service Integration article. Note: Use of the AVS integration functionality is optional; you can continue to save NAT files from VETtrak and upload them manually to AVS if you wish. Each VETtrak user that uses the AVS integration functionality must have their own AVS account, that is registered for the organisation(s) that they upload NAT files for (you cannot use a self-registered AVS account that is not linked to an organisation). If you do not already have an AVS account, information about how to register for AVS can be found on the AVS website. AVETMISS reporting changes   VIC parchment number. For AVETMISS generations in VIC, if you are reporting an award that is not issued, the parchment number will now be reported as empty, as per SVTS rules. NSW empty outcome. From 1 August 2018, AVS will be reactivating validation rule 4742, which will produce an error if you report any unit in the NAT120 with an empty outcome code. To deal with this, VETtrak will now report an outcome code of 85 (Not yet started) for any units with an empty result when generating AVETMISS for NSW.

ticket_content.ticket_description: Hi Team,  If you could please help us with this error.We have some international offshore students with international addresses, so we are claiming them as do not report in the enrolment unticking the  reporting enable  box. However, the units are still being reported due to the VET disable as no. Can ou please advise if there is any bulk action to tick the VET diable box for all units in the same students .  Looking forward to hearing from you.  Thank you

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with international offshore students being reported in AVETMISS despite having the "Reporting Enabled" checkbox unticked.

The root cause seems to be that while the enrolment is marked as not reportable, the individual units are still set to be reported because the "VET Disabled" checkbox is not ticked for those units [2].

To resolve this, you can bulk update the "VET Disabled" checkbox for all units belonging to your international offshore students. The AVETMISS specifications state that if the 'INTOFF' exemption code is used for a student, then their postcode must be set to 'OSPC' and their units should not be reported [1].

You can follow these steps:

1. Go to the Progress Centre and filter for the international offshore students you want to update.
2. Select all the student records.
3. Use the "Bulk Actions" menu and select "Update Units".
4. In the update window, tick the "VET Disabled" checkbox.
5. Click "Update Units" to apply the change.

This will ensure that the units for your selected international offshore students are marked as not reportable. They will then be excluded from your AVETMISS submissions along with the enrolments being marked as not reportable.

Please let me know if you have any other questions! [1]

Hi,

Thank you for your request regarding excluding international offshore students from AVETMISS reporting.

For international offshore students, you can set their Unique Student Identifier (USI) to the exemption code "INTOFF" [2]. When this exemption code is used, the student's postcode must also be set to 'OSPC' (Overseas Postcode) [1].

Regarding the "VET disable" setting for units, this controls whether the unit is included in AVETMISS reporting or not. If "VET disable" is set to "No" for a unit, it will be reported for that student, even if the student is marked as "do not report" in the enrolment [1].

To bulk update the "VET disable" setting for units of your international offshore students, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to the Progress Centre and filter for the units you want to update. You can filter by student attributes like postcode = 'OSPC' to find the international offshore students.

2. Select all the unit records you want to update.

3. From the "Bulk Actions" dropdown, select "Edit Units".

4. In the bulk edit window, tick the "VET disable" checkbox.

5. Click "Update Units" to apply the change.

This will set the "VET disable" flag to "Yes" for all the selected units, ensuring they are excluded from AVETMISS reporting for your international offshore students [1].

Please let me know if you need any further assistance with this process.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with international offshore students' units being reported in AVETMISS. I understand your concern and would like to provide some guidance on this matter.

For international offshore students, you should use the "International Offshore" exemption code in their profile [2]. This will set their USI to "INTOFF" and their postcode to "OSPC" [1]. With this exemption code applied, their units should not be reported in AVETMISS if the enrolment's "Reporting Enable" checkbox is unticked.

However, if the VET disable checkbox for individual units is not ticked, those units may still be reported even for international offshore students. Unfortunately, there is no bulk action available to update the VET disable setting for units [2]. You will need to manually tick the VET disable checkbox for each unit that should not be reported.

I would suggest reviewing the international offshore students' profiles to ensure the "International Offshore" exemption is applied correctly. Then, go through their enrolled units and tick the VET disable checkbox for any units that should not be reported. This should resolve the issue and prevent those units from being included in AVETMISS reporting.

Please let me know if you have any further questions or need additional assistance.

Thank you,

56 December  2018

STANDARD ENROLMENT QUESTIONS

Updated in line with 2019 AVETMISS requirements and version 2 of the Australian Government ’s

National VET Data Policy.

September  2018

GENERAL DOCUMENT UPDATES

Added amendments since publication section.

August 2018

GENERAL DOCUMENT UPDATES

Severa l formatting and consistency edits have been made during the document update, which

include hyperlink fixes, noting that alternative rules may apply when reporting to a state/territory

training authority and updating reporting requirements as per the Austr alian Government ’s

National VET Data Policy.

TRAINING ORGANISATION DELIVERY LOCATION (NAT00020) FILE

Page 23 File relationships – clarified that a record for each combination of Training organisation

identifier  and Training organisation delivery location i dentifier  must exist in the Training activity

(NAT00120) file.

Page 23 Rules – removed sentence that “Address information must be the physical location of the

delivery location…”. Rules on the Postcode field cover this scenario.

CLIENT (NAT00080) FILE

Page 28 Address (all address fields) – added further clarification that a client’s usual residential

address information for international students, studying either onshore or offshore, must be their

international address.

Page 28 Address street name  – removed rule specific to state/territory training authorities.

Page 29 Address street number  – removed rule specific to state/territory training authorities.

Page 30 Unique student identifier  – added rule that if ‘INTOFF’ exemption code is used, then the

client’s Postcode  must be ‘OSPC’.

CLIENT CONTACT DETAILS (NAT00085) FILE

File has been renamed, it was previously Client postal details.

All references to the Client postal details (NAT00085) file – not a client’s actual postal details -

have been updated accordingly.

TRAINING ACTIVITY (NAT00120) FILE

“SHORT” for a short course).

This code would otherwise not be a valid USI. To specify a students' exemption, you can click the

Not Exempt text above the USI fields, and select the option you require.

When “International Offshore” is ticked, the USI field will be set to “INTOFF”, the USI field and Verify Now button will be disabled, and the USI format validation is skipped. Only one exemption

can be ticked at any given time time - ticking one will untick any other. The USI status for a client with this option selected will display as International offshore.

When “Short Course” is ticked, the USI field will be set to “SHORT”, the USI field and Verify Now button will be disabled, and the USI format validation is skipped. Only one exemption

can be ticked at any given time time - ticking one will untick any other. If students already have a USI, RTOs must collect it and verify it. From 1 January 2018, RTOs are required to collect and verify a USI from all students irrespective of course duration(unless the students have a personal exemption) The option will remain in VETtrak for legacy students, but will cause an error during validation. The USI status for a client with this option selected will display as Short course exemption.

When “Individual Exemption” is ticked, the USI field will be set to “INDIV”, the USI field and Verify Now button will be disabled, and the USI format validation is skipped. Only one exemption can be ticked at any given time time - ticking one will untick any other. A Client can only make use of the

“Individual Exemption” if they have filled out the appropriate form provided on the USI website. The USI status for a client with this option selected will display as Individual

exemption. Note: These options are present in the Client Importer, VETtrak API and Process Web Enrolment to allow a USI of “INTOFF” or “SHORT” to be specified for a client    Additional Information  Listed below is additional

We have fixed an issue with the VSL payment importer where the payments were sometimes not getting allocated to the correct invoice items that had VSL deferrals. 23885 – We've fixed an issue where disabled Tags were still displaying as a selectable option when editing a record and being removed when saving a record. Both issues will no longer occur in this update. 30908 – We have fixed an issue where the date of birth field was cleared when an error was returned by the USI verification service. 30803 – Fixed an issue that returned an error when filtering Payment Types of Refunds in the Finance Hub. 30165 – A fix has been made to scheduled invoice reports resolving a bug with blank dates resulting in the report producing an error message. 31122 – Performance improvements have been made to searching in the Progress Centre. A bug has been resolved that may have resulted in an error when searching for a key word across all records. 30839 – On the Electives page, a fix has been applied to when the Units of Study or Subjects headings are displayed. If the Help menu > About > VET Students Loans Capability

field is set to OFF, then Subjects headings are displayed on the Electives page. If set to ON, then Units of Study

headings are displayed on the Electives page.

27197 - Fixed: We have resolved an issue where events linked to a course multiple times could not be removed from the course without deleting all of the links assigned to that event, you can now remove a single link. 27254 – FIXED: We have updated the behaviour of the VET in School Flag on Course Forms - the default option of selecting Not Stated has been removed meaning that students must provide an answer to the question. 27271 - FIXED: We have implemented some improvements to reduce the incidence of 1c rounding errors when preparing invoices. 27456 - FIXED: We have resolved an issue with the Agent Portal when adding a referral where the course list could fail when there were multiple course pages. 27550 - FIXED: We have resolved an issue where the Start Time and End Time fields were not honouring Time Zones on saving course records. 26339 - FIXED: We have resolved an issue that could result in duplicate messages being sent from the Communication Centre if the Send command was clicked more than once. 24446 - FIXED: We have removed the Funding Source National model validation from Courses and replaced that with a new AVETMISS Warning available in the Enrolment, Bulk Enrolment, Transfer and Offer wizards, AVETMISS Generations and show enrolment areas. We expect this will prevent some issues we have seen when submitting enrolments through course forms in cases where Funding Source National was not specified on the course.

TCSI Initial Setup

All VET Student Loan (VSL) and Higher Education providers that are approved under the TCSI reporting scheme are required to report data for their TCSI Data Collection obligations. In order to start entering TCSI relevant information into your system, you will first need to activate the functionality, then establish some essential data. This Help Centre article serves to demonstrate the process required to set up your TCSI-specific configuration. If you would like this feature enabled please contact your Client Success Manager.

How do I enable the TCSI functionality? You first need to set up your RTO record for TCSI functionality. To do this, click on the Administration tab in the top navigation bar. Select Configuration

and then

Preferences. Within this page, press the

'Edit' button next to Preferences. Scroll down to the VFH/VSL section. Check the 'Enabled' box, then enter your unique 'HEP code':      In this same section, configure your Census Date Calculation information. To record this information, at the top of the page click on 'Save'.

You have now enabled TCSI functionality in your system.

Entering TCSI information  Next you need to create your scope to reflect the TCSI training data delivery. All units delivered under TCSI MUST exist in your unit list. For more information on initially entering your Units

to support your Unit of Study information, see the following article:   Creating Units

A

Unit of Study is

part of a

Program leading to a VET award at the diploma, advanced diploma, graduate certificate or graduate diploma level under TCSI. You will need to ensure that all the

Units of Study delivered under TCSI exist in your Unit of Study List. To do this, click on the Administration tab in the top navigation bar. Select Curriculum

and then

Units of Study/Subjects. Click on the

New

The old QLD Claim Summary Rollback wizard has been removed. South Australia   New offshore funding source. A new funding source "Overseas Offshore Students" (OFF) has been added for SA. Outcome 61 for transitioning qualifications. SA now supports the use of the "Superseded subject" result type (outcome 61) to indicate a unit that has been begun by a student when they are to transfer to a new unit. The old unit should be given the "Superseded subject" result and the new replacement unit should be given the final result. Both units must have the same start date. VET Student Loans changes and eCAF integration   Rename of VET FEE-HELP to VET Student Loans. VET FEE-HELP has been renamed to VET Student Loans. The "Invoice Notice" has also been renamed to "Fee Notice". Separate VCC and VCU exports. The VET Student Loans Exporter now allows the VCC and VCU exports to be performed individually. Opt-in to continue old VET FEE-HELP loan. In the Client Course of Study wizard, you can indicate whether it is a VET FEE-HELP loan, and if so, whether the student has opted-in to continue the VET FEE-HELP loan and on what date. All existing courses of study commencing prior to 2017 have been set as being a VET FEE-HELP loan. In the VET Student Loans Exporter wizard, you can choose to include or exclude records based on this new field. New completion date fields. New completion date fields have been added to courses of study and units of study.

Email VET Student Loans unit of study.You can now send email for VET Student Loans units of study:  You can set up email templates for VET Student Loans units of study. These have all the same fields as courses of study, with the additional unit-specific fields name, code, start date and census date. You can right-click a unit of study to send an email, or email the CAN or fee notice. The "Send email" bulk action is now available when finding units of study in Data Insights. The "Email" output option is now available when bulk running a report for units of study in Data Insights. This allows you to query for units of study using any desired criteria and email an individual CAN or fee notice for each. Merge fields for the campus location are now available for course of study and unit of study email merge templates. Data Insights changes   Bulk add staff deliverable units. A new "Add deliverable units" bulk action has been added when finding staff members in Data Insights, allowing you to add a set of deliverable units to a selected set of staff members in bulk. Criteria field length validation. Data Insights will now give a better error message when you attempt to run a query with string field criteria with a value longer than the field's maximum length. VET Student Loans course of study completion date. The completion year field has been removed from courses of study. You can now bulk update the completion date field, instead of the completion year.

ticket_content.ticket_title: Delivery Mode: Course Set up: Settings: Future Skills - Sandbox #66747
ticket_content.ticket_description: Dear Team,  As discussed with our course coordinators, the mode of delivery is blended  Blended  from ASQA definition. Based on JR options please let us know which is the best mode of delivery for blended mode from below available option.   Delivery Mode   Combination of all Modes   Combination of external and workplace  based   Combination of internal and external   Combination of internal and workplace based   ExternalOnly   Internal Only   Not Applicable  RPLor Credit Transfer   Workplace  based only

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding setting the appropriate delivery mode for a blended course. Based on the ASQA definition, blended delivery refers to a combination of internal (face-to-face), external (online/self-paced), and workplace-based delivery modes [1][2].

To set this in the system, you should select the "Combination of all modes" option from the Delivery Mode field [5]. This will accurately represent the blended nature of the course, combining internal, external, and workplace-based components.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance in setting up the delivery modes for your blended course.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding setting the delivery mode for your blended course. Based on the AVETMISS standard definitions [1][2], a blended course that combines internal (classroom), external (online), and workplace-based delivery should be set to the "Combination of all modes" option in JR+. [3]

This option maps to having all three values (Y) set in the Delivery mode identifier field, indicating the course has components of internal, external, and workplace-based delivery. And the Predominant delivery mode should be set to the mode that has the largest component.

Please let me know if you need any other assistance in setting up the delivery modes for your blended course.

Kind regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding setting the delivery mode for a blended course. Based on the AVETMISS data element definitions from NCVER, for a blended delivery mode that combines internal (face-to-face) and external (online/remote) delivery, the appropriate option to select would be "Combination of internal and external" [1][2][4][3].

The "Combination of internal and external" option indicates that the delivery includes both internal components where the trainer and students interact in real-time at a training location, as well as external components where students engage with materials remotely without attending a physical location [1][2][4].

This aligns with the ASQA definition of blended delivery being a combination of face-to-face and online/remote learning components [3].

Please let me know if you need any further assistance in setting up the delivery modes for your blended courses.

Kind Regards,

Predominant delivery mode  ‘E — External delivery’ indicates that external delivery is specified as

one of the values in the Delivery mode identifier  data element and is the largest or only component.

Predominant delivery mode  ‘W — Workplace-based delivery’ indicates that workplace-based

delivery is specified as one of the values in the Delivery mode identifier  data element and is the

largest or only component.

Predominant delivery mode ‘N — Not applicable’ indicates recognition of prior learning or credit

transfer and reported as ‘NNN’ in the Delivery mode identifier  data element.

GUIDELINES FOR USE

Predominant delivery mode  is based on delivery mode details reported in Delivery mode identifier .

Where the training organisation indicates in Delivery mode identifier  that there is more than one

delivery mode, the mode which has the largest component of delivery should be applied as the

predominant delivery mode.

Where the training organisation indicates in Delivery mode identifier  that the training activity has

only one delivery mode, that mode should be applied as the Predominant delivery mode .

Where the training organisation indicates in Delivery mode identifier  that there is no delivery mode,

as is the case with recognition of prior learning or credit transfer, the value ‘N — Not applicable’

should be applied as the predominant delivery mode.

Delivery mode identifier identifies whether or not a subject comprises internal, external or

workplace-based delivery — or a combination of these modes.

whether it is conducted by the training organisation or the employer; for example, industrial/work

at a place of employment.

Where a unit of competency or module is recognition of prior learning or credit transfer, then all

three values must be set to N.

related_knowledge.content:
workplace-based delivery – or a combination of these modes.

CONTEXT

Delivery mode identifier  is used to analyse training activity by training delivery modes. It can also

be used to identify training that is delivered in more than one mode, for example, internal and

workplace-based delivery.

Relational attributes

RULES

Delivery mode identifier  must be ‘NNN’ when Outcome identifier — national  is either ‘51’, ‘52’,

or ‘60’.

GUIDELINES FOR USE

Delivery mode identifier  is a 3-character field composed of ‘Y’s and ‘N’s that identifies the

mode(s) of delivery of a unit of competency or module where each of the three positions indicates

a type of delivery. The field comprises the following structure:

First position indicates internal.

Second position indicates external.

Third position indicates workplace-based delivery.

Technology underpins much training delivery in today’s world so providing additional materials

online or incorporating technology into training that is otherwise face-to-face does not constitute

external delivery.

Internal delivery; e.g. classroom-based  (i.e. first position in field) is where the client  and the

trainer interact in real-time and physically attend training delivery locations organised or managed

by the training organisation. This includes workshop, laboratory, simulator and classroom-based

training even when the training is delivered using video or internet links in real time. The client

and trainer must interact in real-time and must attend a training delivery location to be classified

as internal.

External delivery; e.g. online  (i.e. second position in field) is where the client does not attend a

physical delivery location but instead  undertakes training at a location of their choosing and using

training materials that are provided online or by correspondence. A client learning at home either

by engaging with self-paced materials or interacting with a trainer in real-time would be classified

as external.

Delivery modes. A new Delivery Modes field has been added to the Enrolment wizard, in all states and national. This allows you to select the combination of Internal, External and Workplace delivery modes that apply to the enrolment. All states also require one of the delivery modes to be selected as the predominant mode (in the "Pri" column). A different list of Delivery Modes is used in WA. The selections made in an enrolment apply to all the units in the enrolment by default, but you can change the delivery modes for individual enrolled units in the Edit AVETMISS Values wizard and the Enrolment Results wizard. This field will replace the Delivery Type field (and Delivery Strategy in WA) in 2018, and is mandatory for reportable enrolments starting or continuing into 2018. Date award completed. The "Year completed" field in the Award wizard has been replaced by a "Date completed". As per AVETMISS rules, this field is not defaulted and must be entered. Award parchment length. The maximum length of the award parchment number has been increased from 10 to 25 characters. Fee exemption code length. The maximum length of the fee exemption code field has been increased from 1 to 2 characters. Victoria   VIC program enrolment. A new "VIC program enrolment" section has been added to the Enrolment wizard in VIC. This allows you to set the program enrolment status, which defaults to "In training" (30).

related_knowledge.content: Selecting this item allows further details relating to a School Type Identifier to be recorded if present. Course Information - This text field allows additional details to be recorded that can be used within an automated email if required. Delivery Mode - An AVETMISS relevant field that requires entry to communicate the type of learning delivery method that will be used. Study Reason - Provides the option to set a course-level Study Reason, however, this can be amended/entered on a per-enrolment basis to better communicate individual student reasons. Students can also enter their own Study Reason as part of a self-serve data entry process. Study Periods - Populated from reference data, this area can be used to reflect particular periods or semesters of learning. Start Time / End Time - Use these fields to reflect when the training activity will take place. Ideally for referencing with Class data. Invoice Template - If using finance features within the system, this area will allow an Invoice template to be selected to populate/track pricing information. Close Course - If at the Program creation stage, you checked the Close Course Manually option, this will then display against the Course. Once checked, it will close and archive a completed course. Complete the Claims and Funding window. VET Student Loans - A checkbox indicator if this Course is to utilise any TCSI relevant data. Priority - This allows the flagging of a specific priority flag for the Course.

Once a user has input their Moodle Url and Token they can click this button to ensure all of the relevant endpoints are enabled for the integration. If a cross

shows beside one of the API calls they need to revisit the Moodle site setup document and ensure they have enabled it in Moodle.

If a user gets the above screen when pressing the test connection button their JR+ Moodle2021 integration can talk to their Moodle LMS system.

Once the user has set up the Resulting section they can move on to setting up a course.

Course setup

Now that Moodle2021 has been set up globally the user can add the integration to a course that they are delivering.

To do the user should navigate to the course they are going to add the integration to, expand the Admin section and click Integrations

Next click the settings button below Moodle2021. This will bring the user to Moodle2021 edit which is made up of four sections. These allow for the mapping of

Courses/Subjects/Units to Moodle courses, resulting rules and participant creation and enrolment into Moodle LMS

61

Settings

62

This section controls the integration's ability to push students and enrolments into Moodle as well as pull results.

Enabled: If off this will stop any results from pulling back into this course. It will also stop any students from being exported to Moodle as a new user or

enrolment.

Allow Export: If off Moodle will not export any student as a user or Enrol any student into a course. It will still pull results for users already exported to

Moodle.

Moodle course mappings

This section allows a user to map any of the JR+ Courses, Subjects, or Units to a single Moodle Course.

The section is divided up into

Course

Mapping at this level will allow any Subjects or units that are not mapped to their own Moodle course to use the JR+ Courses Moodle activities as their

resulting method.

ticket_content.ticket_description: Hi ,  We have recently started delivering a funded pre traineeship program in NSW which we need to report in our Smart   Skilled uploads.   When extracting the NAT files, there is no program code appearing in the NAT***  screenshot attached . We also believe that any program code that appears in the NAT*** should be listed in the NAT**, however the program also isn t appearing here  screenshot attached .  If we could please have some assistance it would be greatly appreciated. This is th   e first time we have delivered a part qualification so it s possible we haven t got the settings right at Program and/or course level.  We need to be able to upload this activity to Smart   Skilled by ********** at the latest.     The students who this relates to are:    SR*****  SR*****  SR*****  SR*****  SR*****      Thanks in advance

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding reporting the pre-traineeship program for Smart and Skilled uploads in NSW.

For training that is not nationally recognized, like the pre-traineeship program you are delivering, you must use the Program (NAT00030A) file in your Smart and Skilled uploads [1]. This file is specifically for non-accredited training under programs like Smart and Skilled Targeted Priorities Prevocational and Part Qualification.

In the NAT00030A file, you need to include the following fields for the pre-traineeship program [1]:
- Program identifier
- Program name 
- Program recognition identifier 

The program identifier and name should be the codes/names you have set up for this pre-traineeship program in your student management system. The program recognition identifier indicates it is non-accredited training.

If you are also including any nationally recognized training units in the pre-traineeship program, you only need to complete the program identifier, name, and nominal hours fields in the NAT00030A file for those units [1].

For the NAT00060 file, you would include any subjects/units that are part of the pre-traineeship program, both accredited and non-accredited [4]. Ensure the subject/unit details are correctly mapped.

I'd suggest double checking the setup of the pre-traineeship program in your system to ensure the required fields are populated for the NAT00030A file generation. Let me know if you have any other questions!

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the reporting of your pre-traineeship program for Smart and Skilled in NSW. For training that is not nationally recognised, such as Skills Groups delivered under the Smart and Skilled Targeted Priorities Prevocational and Part Qualification Program, you must use the Program (NAT00030A) file for reporting [1].

In the NAT00030A file, you only need to complete the following three fields for non-nationally recognised training:
- Program identifier
- Program name
- Nominal hours

The other fields can be left blank [1].

As for the NAT00060 file, this is the Subject file which contains details of the individual subjects/units being delivered. For non-accredited training like your pre-traineeship program, the subjects/units would likely not be listed here since they are not drawn from a national training package [1].

To ensure the program details are populating correctly in the NAT00030A file, please double check the following in VETtrak:

1. The program has been set up with the correct Program Identifier and Program Name under the Program Details.
2. The Nominal Hours have been entered for the program.
3. For the specific enrolments, ensure the 'Commitment ID' field has been populated on the NSW enrolment wizard. Only enrolments with a 'C', 'S' or 'Q' prefix in the Commitment ID will be included for Smart and Skilled reporting [2].

If you have verified the above settings and are still not seeing the program populate in the NAT00030A file, please let me know the exact program name and I can further investigate [2].

Let me know if you need any other assistance to meet the Smart and Skilled upload deadline.

Thank you,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with reporting the funded pre-traineeship program in NSW Smart and Skilled uploads.

For training that is not nationally recognized, such as Skills Groups delivered under the Smart and Skilled Targeted Priorities Prevocational and Part Qualification Program, you must use the Program (NAT00030A) file [1]. If you are delivering a mix of nationally recognized and non-nationally recognized training, you should also use the NAT00030A file [1].

In the NAT00030A file, you only need to complete the Program identifier, Program name, and Nominal hours fields for any nationally recognized training included. The other fields can be left blank [1].

For NSW Smart and Skilled reporting, the Commitment ID entered in an enrolment is reported in the 'Contract Number' column, which would normally come from the Purchasing Contract [3]. Please ensure you have entered the correct Commitment ID for these enrolments.

Additionally, make sure you have checked the "state specific NAT data elements" checkbox when generating the NAT files, as this is required for NSW Smart and Skilled reporting [2][3].

If you have followed these steps and the program code is still not appearing correctly in the NAT files, please let me know. I will then reach out to the related team to further investigate the issue.

Thank you,

related_knowledge.content:
TAS AVETMISS Error - "Date Program Complete (01019999) must not be after..."

Error Details  NAT File  Error Code  Error Description  NAT00130  3242    "Date Program Completed (01019999) must not be after date of validation ( xxxxxxxx )"  "Date Progam Completed (01019999) must not be after the Collection Period end date ( xxxxxxxx )"    Explanation  When validating Tasmanian state AVETMISS files through the NCVER AVS (AVETMISS Validation Software) it's expected that you may receive validation errors in the NAT00130 relating to the "01019999" for the Date Program Completed field. Tasmanian requirements for AVETMISS state that "for each unique Program Enrolment Identifier in the NAT00120 file, there must be a corresponding record in the NAT00130". This means that incomplete enrolments can be reported in the NAT00130. These types of records can be seen within VETtrak's AVETMISS Generation Wizard with a warning such as the below example...  "This award has been derived from the data in the NAT 120 file." "Warning : There is no complete date, so the program enrolment status is being reported as 30 (In Training)"   Tasmanian requirements for AVETMISS state that the Date Program Completed must be reported as "01019999" when the enrolment is not yet completed. Skills TAS | Provider Collection Requirements 2021 (Page 11)  The reason the error appears when validating through the NCVER AVS portal is that NCVER doesn't recognise 01019999 as a valid value for a NAT00130 record, however, this is valid for Skills Tasmania.

Importing Data From NAT Files

Introduction  A NAT file import takes the files that form an AVETMISS generation and creates core data within VETtrak such as clients, enrolment and enrolled units. This form of import can serve as a jumping-off point for a much larger migration project, or can stand alone as a means to quickly and efficiently move data from your current student management system over to VETtrak. It's important to be aware of the limitations of such an import, and the purpose of this article is to inform what data is present in a set of NAT files, how much can be imported, as well as advise what data is not present. This article is broken up into the individual files one would find in an AVETMISS generation, and includes a description of the contents of the file as well as what we can retrieve from it. There are variations between files reported to NCVER and those that are reported to state bodies and where relevant, the additional state data is specified. There is also a frequently asked question section that details some of the more common issues with this type of import. File Structure   NAT00010 - Training Organisation  NAT00020 - Delivery Locations  NAT00030 - Program File  NAT00060 - Subject File  NAT00080 - Client Personal Details  NAT00085 - Client Postal Details  NAT00090 - Client Disabilities  NAT00100 - Client Prior Education  NAT00120 - Training Activity  NAT00130 - Program Completed     Frequently Asked Questions   Will my statement's of attainment be imported?

TRAINING ORGANISATION DELIVERY LOCATION IDENTIFIER

This field must not be blank.

This field must be ‘Y’ when data are submitted by Boards of Studies to the National VET in Schools Collection.

Program  completed (NAT00130) file

Definition

The Program completed (NAT00130) file  contains recor ds for which all requirements for the completion of

the qualification, course or skill set, including on -the-job requirements, have been met. Completions for

Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF) qualifications and courses are achieved when the client is eligible

for the award to be conferred.

This file also contains a record for each  unique  Program Enrolment on the Training Activity (NAT00120) file

reported during a collectio n year where the student has not as yet completed their qualification, course or

skill set. No record is required for  subject -only enrolments.

Context

The Program completed (NAT00130) file  provides profile information about clients completing the

requirements of a program of study , either during the collection period or in a prior collection period (where

the completion of the program of study  has not previously been reported). This information is used to

measure successful outcomes from the VET sector.

This file also provides info rmation on the status of each Program Enrolment.

Importing NAT files into Excel

To import the NAT00120 into Excel, follow these steps.

In Excel, select Data > From Text/CSV.

Browse to your NAT file, then click Import.

Update the Delimiter based on the NAT file format listed here.

After updating the delimiter, click the transform data button.

Highlight all the rows then right-click and change the data type to Text. This will ensure any leading

If there are no program completions to report, then the Program completed (NAT00130) file is not

Rules

Only one record per combination of Program identifier , Client identifier  and Date program

completed  in this file.

The Program completed (NAT00130)  file must not contain records that have been reported

previously in the National VET Provider Collection .

The on -the-job component is to be completed before the completion can be reported.

Senior secondary education (Year 11 or Year 12) and junior secondary education (Year 10) are

recognised as program completions attained when delivered in the VET sector and can be recorded

in the Program completed (NAT00130) file.

ticket_content.ticket_description: Hi Team,  We are exploring a QA software solution and they are asking about the generation of a single AVETMISS file that would include both enrolments with claiming enabled and enrolments without a contract. Currently the AVETMISS report makes you pick between these options.  Is this a possibility?  Thanks, *****

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the generation of AVETMISS files. Based on the information in our help documentation, it is possible to include both enrolments with claiming enabled and enrolments without a contract in a single AVETMISS file generation [1][2].

When running the AVETMISS Reporting wizard, there are options to "Include Enrolments Without a Contract" and "Include Only Enrolments With Claiming Enabled". By enabling both of these options, the generated AVETMISS file will contain data from enrolments meeting either criteria [1].

However, it's important to note that including enrolments without contracts may result in additional warnings or errors during the file generation process. It's recommended to review and address any warnings before submitting the final AVETMISS files [2].

Please let me know if you need any further assistance or have additional questions.

Kind regards,

Hi *****,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the AVETMISS file generation. Based on the current capabilities, it does not seem possible to generate a single AVETMISS file that includes both enrolments with claiming enabled and enrolments without a contract [1]. The AVETMISS reporting wizard requires you to choose between these two options when generating the file [1][3].

However, I want to double check if there are any recent updates or configurations that may allow for this combined file generation. I will reach out to the product team for the latest information and get back to you.

In the meantime, please let me know if you have any other questions or if there is any additional context you can provide about your specific requirements. I'll be happy to assist further.

Thank you,

Hi *****,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the AVETMISS file generation. The AVETMISS Reporting wizard in ReadyTech allows you to include or exclude certain types of enrolments when generating the AVETMISS files [1][2].

You can include enrolments without a contract by enabling the "Include Enrolments Without a Contract" option. Similarly, you can include only enrolments with claiming enabled by selecting the "Include Only Enrolments With Claiming Enabled" option [1].

However, based on the information available, it does not appear possible to generate a single AVETMISS file that includes both enrolments with claiming enabled and enrolments without a contract. The wizard requires you to choose one of these options, but not combine them in a single file [1][2].

I would suggest following the standard process of generating separate AVETMISS files for each type of enrolment you need to report. If you require a consolidated file with both types, you may need to manually combine the individual files after generation.

Let me know if you need any further assistance or have additional requirements regarding the AVETMISS file generation process.

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content:
Some of these options also appear in the AVETMISS Reporting wizard, they were added to the Claims Reporting wizard to ensure that reports create by both wizards can extract the same enrolment data.

Include Enrolments Without a Contract:

Enabling this will allow any enrolments that do not have a contract assigned to appear in the extract.

Include Only Enrolments With Claiming Enabled:

Enabling this will only include enrolments that have the Reporting Enabled checkbox ticked in the extract, all other enrolments will be excluded.

Include ONLY Enrolments That Have Claims Due:

Enabling this will only include enrolments with have claims that need to be submitted. If you are unsure on what to select here, leave the options as they are and click on the Next button. The

Warnings

page functions identically to the one in the AVETMISS Extract wizard. Click on the Next button to proceed. Confirm all of the options for the extract and click on the Create button.

This will start the process of generating the extract. When it has finished, click on the link to the zip file to download the extract. You can also view any previously generated reports by going back to Administration → Funding → Claims Reporting.

Other changes  Locks  To prevent possible conflicts and poor site performance we have also enact locks onto the Claims and AVETMISS reporting wizard so that only one user is able to run the AVETMISS/Claims reporting process as a time.

You will be given the option to generate a warnings report for this extract. Click on the Check for Warnings button to start this process. The process for generating the error list is mostly the same as before. The only changes made are some background performance optimisations and the error list will now be generated as a CSV file instead of a PDF file.

CSV files can be opened in Microsoft Excel, which allows you to quickly sort out the data inside and find where to correct any warnings and errors. Once the process is finished, you will see a list of warnings and errors for the extract on the page. You will also be given the option to download all the warnings as a CSV file. Confirmation Page  Once you have confirmed all the settings for your AVETMISS Extract, click on the Export button. This will start the AVETMISS file generation process. When the AVETMISS files have finished generating, click on the link to the zip file to download the AVETMISS extract.

Claims Reporting Wizard  Due to some changes made to the Claims Reporting

wizard, it is now possible to extract the same set of data from it and the AVETMISS Extract wizard. This can allow you to extract the enrolment data using AVETMISS Reporting and check it for errors before you commit to submitting your claims.

To access the Claims Reporting wizard, go to Administration → Funding → Claims Reporting.

There have been some changes made to this page, you will initially be given the option to select the State that you would like to create the extract for.

Once you have selected the State, you will be given the option to select state-specific Report Type that you would like to generate and the Activity Year for the extract. Click on the Next button once you have selected the required options for your extract.

Contracts  The Contracts page will allow you to select the contracts that you would like to include in the Claims Report. You will notice that there are some new checkboxes under the contracts list.

Generation - This option does not display any record detail grids, but still allows CSV and NAT file exports. This can be used to speed up larger AVETMISS generations. Advanced Options: Allows access to tick a particular box to allow filtering via the dropdown list:   NOTE: AVETMISS Generations should contain all relevant data, so do not make use of these items unless instructed to by an official party. Generating National AVETMISS Files  To generate AVETMISS files to report to NCVER, select Generate National AVETMISS 8 files. The following wizard will appear:      Select an alternate Organisation if you utilise the Multi-RTO functionality. Select the Year

for which you are submitting files. If required:

Select what portion of the year you are submitting files for. NOTE: In most cases, Entire Year (January to December)

is the required option. Enforce end of year validation will indicate that this is your final end of year submission. If this box is ticked, VETtrak will apply additional validation rules for your AVETMISS data that can cause errors to appear in an AVETMISS generation where you may not anticipate errors. Tick a particular box to allow filtering by a particular State via the dropdown list. AVETMISS Generations should contain all relevant data, so do not make use of this item unless instructed to by an official party. If you tick this box, the generation of the files will stop if any errors are found, to allow you to fix any errors in that file before proceeding. This can be helpful if you have very large AVETMISS files that take a long time to generate. If the Excluded Quals Warning tickbox is on, at the end of the AVETMISS generation (before any file saving), a screen will appear listing any qualifications/courses that were removed from the NAT30 generation due to the “Exists in training.gov.au” checkbox

being unticked against the course/qualification. Runs a Reduced memory usage

Contract/Enrolment Types

Contract and Enrolment types can be used as a way to differentiate your enrolments. The Type is not reported in your AVETMISS files, so can be used for your own needs. The enrolment type is exported on various Standard Reports so it can be used to filter and categorise your enrolments. Name* - This is your own name for the contract/enrolment type, this will be the name that your administration staff select in VETtrak when categorising the contract or enrolment. Code - This is your own code to differentiate between enrolment types. It can be used to provide a quick reference for the enrolment type, without listing the full name. VETtrak staff will normally ask for this code if producing custom reports based on contract or enrolment Types. Where can this type be used* - Each type can be set to apply only to contracts, only to enrolments or to both contracts and enrolments. Only applicable types will be visible when editing a contract or an enrolment. Options - This type is the default - A separate default option can be selected for both enrolments and contracts. These default options will be automatically entered when you create a contract or enrolment. Do not make this type available for use – Ticking this box will ‘archive’ the contract/enrolment type, meaning it can no longer be selected when creating an enrolment or contract. This will not affect existing records using this type. Description: Area where you can add your own notes for this contract/enrolment type. *

Indicates a mandatory field.

If you report in VIC for 2018 or earlier, the fee exemption field will be reported as just one character, which will be the code for the selected fee waiver if any, otherwise the code for the selected fee concession. The codes of both the fee concession and the fee waiver (if any) will be shown in the "Fee exemption" column in the Enrolments Grid in the Client Manager, the Tuition Fees wizard, and the Recalculate Enrolment Pricing wizard. New South Wales   NSW provider calculator strategy fields. New fields for the Strategy initiative, Strategy code, Sub-strategy code and Voucher number have been added to the Eligibility tabs in the NSW state page in the Enrolment wizard. These will be included when exporting NSW Provider Calculator data. Removed APL reporting. All functionality for NSW APL reporting has been removed from VETtrak, as it is no longer required. Old APL claiming data can still be viewed in the Enrolment wizard. The "NSW claims" menu has been renamed to "NSW utilities". South Australia   Software product name and vendor email. When exporting AVETMISS files in SA for 2019 or later, the software product name and vendor email will now be included in the NAT10 file. Other AVETMISS-related changes   Store AVETMISS files in document database. If you have the VETtrak Document Database, when saving NAT files in Generate AVETMISS, there is a new tickbox to save a copy of the generated AVETMISS files into the document database.

the DOB or USI.

The AVS level of validation will provide a second layer of validation that can compare your data to online reference lists, such as incorrect

qualification or unit codes not listed on Training.gov.au, or incorrect residential address details that don’t match known Australian addresses.

Top Tips for National Reporting Through your SMS- @Sam Wood

Just before I hand over to Nick and we get into the demonstration, I’ll quickly outline what we will be covering.

Generate National AVETMISS Files: We will start by explaining how to navigate the National AVETMISS menu

Fixing Common Warning: We will then show you how your Student management System can identify common errors in your

AVETMISS data, and we will walk you through how to fix these.

Fixing AVS Errors: We will then show you how to fix some common AVS validation errors.

SMS Tips and Trips: And to finish off the demonstration we will then show you a number of features in your Student Management

System to prevent errors and help investing errors.

Please note that All client details in this production are fictitious.

Any resemblance to real persons, places, or products is unintentional.

I will now hand over to Nick to get into the demonstration.

Demonstration @Nicholas jenkins

Activity year: 2023

here most customers would uncheck all contracts and leave I

26992 – We have fixed an issue with the “Express Offer” button on Course Applications where the user would get an infinite spinner if they didn’t have the Party Payment system right. Users without this permission will now get an appropriate error message instead. 26980 - We have fixed an issue with the automation that sets the Program Status Identifier to “30: In Training” on first run of the Claims Reporting Wizard for Victoria. The first run was reporting an incorrect blank value and only reporting “30: In Training” for the second run for that enrolment that had just commenced. This has now been fixed so it will report the correct initial value on the first run. 26864 - We have resolved an issue when generating certificates from the Progress Centre and Bulk Course Certificate generation pages so that when the Clear command is actioned the values in the fields in the previous Section 1 remain as entered. 27054 - We have resolved an issue where the Issued Date were not populated when generating certificates. 27069 - An issue in the AVETMISS generation for TAS that can cause Date Program Completed to be reported as blank instead of 01019999 has been fixed. 26029 - We fixed an issue where File Note templates, categories and checklists could be accessed against the Course Application entity, despite there being the inability to create File Notes against Course Applications.

AVETMISS – Course State Filter  We have relaxed the filter on Course State when using the AVETMISS wizard and Claims Reporting wizard. An enrolment with a contract will use the state for the contract, instead of the associated State of the course. Previously, the extract logic would filter on both Course State and the Contract State, so if there was a mismatch it wouldn’t appear in the file outputs. Predominant Delivery Mode  When selecting a Delivery Mode

for a course, enrolment or unit, the options available in the Predominant Delivery

Mode select list are now filtered to only list options that are relevant for the selected Delivery Mode. Party Audit Trail

subdomain and

recipients
