ticket_content.ticket_description: Dear Support Team,   I m reaching out to inquire whether it s possible to manually change the ID in profile. If so, I d appreciate guidance on the process.     Thanks  *****

response.answer:
Hi *****,

Thank you for reaching out regarding modifying the Profile ID. The Profile ID, also known as the Party Identifier, is a unique alphanumeric value assigned to each party profile in the system [1]. While you cannot directly edit or change this ID, there are a couple of options:

1. If you need to change the ID for an existing profile, you can create a new party profile with the desired ID and transfer over all the associated data from the old profile [1]. This will essentially replace the old profile with a new one having the updated ID.

2. For new profiles being created, you can manually enter the desired ID during the creation process before the system auto-generates one [1][2]. This allows you to set the initial Party Identifier as per your requirements.

Please note that changing or setting Party IDs requires appropriate user permissions. I'd recommend consulting with your system administrator if you need assistance with this process [2].

Let me know if you need any further guidance on modifying profile IDs or managing party profiles.

Kind Regards,

Hi *****,

Thank you for reaching out regarding modifying the Party ID in a profile. The Party ID is a unique identifier that is automatically assigned when creating a new party profile [1]. While you can edit most other details in a party profile, the Party ID field itself is designed to be an immutable value that cannot be manually changed after it is generated [1][2].

If you need to update or correct the Party ID for some reason, the recommended approach would be to create a new party profile with the desired ID, and then merge or re-associate any existing data (enrollments, contracts, etc.) from the old profile to the new one. However, this process can be complex depending on how much data is tied to the existing profile.

I would suggest reaching out to your designated Customer Success Manager or an Implementation Consultant to discuss your specific requirements around updating the Party ID. They can provide further guidance and perform the necessary data updates if deemed appropriate for your situation.

Please let me know if you need any other assistance!

Kind Regards,

Hi *****,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding modifying the ID in a profile.

The Party ID or Profile ID is a unique identifier that is automatically assigned to each profile when it is created in the system. It is generally recommended to leave this ID as is and not modify it manually, as it serves as a unique reference for that particular profile record.

Since the references do not provide any guidance on manually changing this ID, I would suggest leaving it as the system-generated value to ensure proper tracking and identification of the profile within the system.

If you have a specific requirement or concern that necessitates changing the ID, I recommend consulting with our support team to explore potential alternatives or workarounds that maintain data integrity. However, manually modifying the system-assigned ID is typically not advisable.

Please let me know if you have any other questions or concerns.

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content:
Process: Creating a New Party Profile

A Party Profile can be thought of as a representation of a person in your SMS (Student Management System). This person could be undergoing training, a trainer for a course, an administrator in the system, etc. In this article, we will go over the process of creating a new Party Profile.

TABLE OF CONTENTS   Creating your Party Profile  Party Details  Contact Details  Address Details  System Details  Access Details      Creating a Party Profile  There are multiple ways to create a party profile, one of the more straightforward ways is to go to Community → Add New Party. This will bring you to a page where you can enter the details for the party profile. You have two options for entering the information into the party profile form:    Simple Form: This will display only the most important fields for the party profile (such as names, contact details, address details, etc). This form is ideal for quickly creating a new party profile then entering more of their details later. Complete Form: This will display all available fields for the party profile. This form is best used for entering all necessary information for that person, especially if there are reporting requirements for their data. For the purpose of this article, we will be using the Complete Form to create our new party profile. Party Details        Title:

The title that the person goes by (Mr, Mrs, Ms, etc). First Name(s): The person’s given name(s), this is a mandatory field. Surname:

The family name of the person. Middle Name(s): The person’s given middle name(s). Known As:

Any other names that the person goes by (for example, nicknames can be placed in this field). Gender: The gender of the person. Party Identifier: A unique alphanumeric value that is assigned to the party. This field should be left alone, as one will automatically be assigned when the party is created. Profile Picture: You can upload a profile picture for the party. To do this, click on the

Process: Add a User

A user can log in to the Student Management System and is responsible for administering and managing the system's data. For example, Administrators, Academics (Trainers/Assessors), Marketing Managers, Compliance Managers, and Finance Managers. Warning  We do not recommend sharing user access between multiple individuals. This ensures that all changes and updates within the system can be appropriately logged and tracked.

Add a User  To add a New User, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Security → Users. Click the [+ New] button. To add a User, a Party record must first exist.Choose whether to:  Search for an Existing Party Record,  Create a New Party Record. Complete the New User Window      User ID - This value must be unique and will be the user's username. Organisations typically use an individuals email address. Enabled - By default, the system will check this box. If checked, the user can access the system. Academic - If checked, the Available Roles list below will change from Administrative Roles to Academic Roles limiting their access to the system and its data. Password - Set a unique, temporary password for the new user. On the first login, the system will prompt the user to change their password. Clicking on the Reset button will send a password reset email to the user. Start Date - This determines from which date the user can access the platform. It acts as a record-keeping for when a User is provided with access. End Date - This determines from which date the user can no longer access the platform. It acts as a record-keeping for when a Users access is revoked. Leave this field blank if it is indefinite. Access Level - An Access Levels impacts whether a User can make adjustments to another User. For example, if the user is a Level 1, they can adjust the roles and permissions for Level 1, 2, and 3.

Change Your User Preferences

In the User Preferences page, you can tailor the experience of using the system to your own personal taste. In this article, we'll walk you through the ins and outs of the User Preferences pages, helping you unlock the full potential of customisation. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Accessing User Preferences  Tabs and Options  View Tab  Notifications Tab  Security Tab     Accessing User Preferences  To get started, navigate to your user profile located in the top-right corner of the page. Click on Preferences and you'll be taken to the User Preferences page. Here, you'll find a variety of options that allow you to fine-tune your system experience according to your liking. Tabs and Options  On the User Preferences page, you'll notice three or four distinct tabs, each catering to a specific aspect of your experience. Updating your preferences is straightforward. Simply click on the Edit button and navigate to the tab with the preferences you want to modify.

This dropdown list lets you determine how this person prefers to be contacted. For example, SMS, Mobile, Email etc. Do Not Market:

When checked, the system will exclude this person’s record from the marketing reports in the Report Builder. Exported:

Student Access:

This will show the approximate time that the person last logged into their account. Lock Account:

Checking this box will prevent the person from being able to log into the Self-Service Portal.

Note  Extra fields may be present on the party page if you have certain features enabled.

Click on the Enable Multi-factor Authentication button. This will bring up a QR code that you must scan with an authenticator app on your mobile phone.

When you go to scan the QR code with your authenticator app, you will be provided with a 6-digit code to enter into your system.

After entering the provided 6-digit code into your system, click on the

Enable button to switch on MFA functionality for your account.

Now when you log into your account, you will need to provide the 6-digit code from the authenticator app to successfully sign in.

Note  When you log into the system after using MFA, you will only need to provide the 6-digit code again if one of the following is true:   You have manually logged yourself out of the system. 7 days has passed since you last used MFA when logging in. Disabling Multi-Factor Authentication for a User  MFA might need to be disabled on a user account for a variety of reasons. To do this, you need to go to the party profile for the user. You can either search for it using the search bar or go to Administration → Security → Users. Click on the Edit button to go to the edit page for their user account. Uncheck the

MFA Enabled checkbox and save your changes. This will disable MFA for that user and they will not need to provide a 6-digit code to login.

ticket_content.ticket_description: We are performing party merge in our process and we ve noticed a constant display of the error message as below.  the following are the party ID we ve used.  PA******   the secondary to be deleted PA******   the one to be kept  I am merging with the  Admin   Merge Party  under the Party page.  after merging an error message is displayed, which is related to Ruby on Rail.   The secondary partyID has no active enrolment so should be able to be merged.

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the error message you are receiving when merging party profiles. Based on the information provided, it seems that the error is occurring after the merge process is completed successfully [2].

The Ruby on Rails error message could be related to a bug or issue in the system that is triggered after the merge is finalized. This type of error typically indicates an underlying code issue rather than a problem with the merge process itself [4].

I would suggest trying the following steps to resolve this:

1. Clear your browser cache and cookies, then try the merge again.
2. If the error persists, try merging the profiles from a different browser or computer.
3. Check for any recent system updates or changes that may have caused this issue.

If you continue to experience the error after trying these steps, please let me know the exact error message you are receiving. Our team can then investigate further and provide a proper resolution [1].

In the meantime, you can continue merging other party profiles as needed, but be aware that you may encounter this error message after each successful merge.

Thank you for your patience and understanding. Please let me know if you have any other questions or concerns.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the error you're encountering when merging party profiles. Merging party profiles is an important process to keep student data organized, but there can be some issues that arise during the merge [2][3].

Based on the information provided, it seems the error is occurring after the merge has been completed, even though the secondary party profile did not have any active enrollments. This suggests the issue may be related to the system processing the merge, rather than the data being merged itself [1].

Without more details on the specific Ruby on Rails error message, it's difficult to pinpoint the exact cause. However, I would recommend taking the following steps:

1. Ensure you have followed all the pre-merge steps correctly, including selecting the primary and secondary profiles accurately.

2. Check if there are any other data points besides enrollments that could be causing a conflict during the merge, such as duplicate contact information, identification details, or custom fields.

3. Try clearing your browser cache and cookies, then attempt the merge again.

4. If the issue persists, please capture a screenshot or copy of the full Ruby on Rails error message and send it to me. This will help me investigate further and potentially escalate the issue to our development team.

While merging errors can be frustrating, rest assured that our team is committed to resolving any issues promptly. Please let me know if you have any other questions or concerns.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the error you're experiencing when merging party profiles. Based on the information provided, it seems that you are following the correct steps to merge the profiles, but an error related to Ruby on Rails is being displayed after the merge is completed [2][3].

A few potential causes for this error could be:

1. The secondary party profile you are trying to delete contains data that cannot be merged, such as CRICOS data or referrals from the Employer Portal [1]. In this case, the system may throw an error to prevent data loss.

2. There are duplicate values between the two profiles for fields that should be unique, such as client attributes, disabilities, groups, etc. [5] The system will display an error for these fields to indicate that the values could not be merged.

3. There may be an issue with the way the merge functionality is implemented, leading to errors being thrown unexpectedly.

To troubleshoot this further, I would suggest checking if the secondary profile contains any CRICOS data, referrals, or other data that may be causing conflicts during the merge [1]. You can also try merging two different profiles as a test to see if the issue persists.

If the error persists after trying different profiles, please let me know the exact error message you're seeing, and I can further investigate the potential root cause [6]. Providing more details about the error will help us identify and resolve the underlying issue.

Thank you for your patience and understanding. Please let me know if you have any other questions or concerns.

Kind regards,

related_knowledge.content: 26768 We have improved merging functionality so that when attempting to merge party profiles containing CRICOS data and that were been created via referrals on the Employer Portal will no longer result in an error. 26839 - We have resolved an issue when creating a referral via the employer portal where it wasn’t possible to enter an email address for the party record. 27066 - We have improved the layout of the Payment page in the Student Portal to make it easier to understand where the payment had originated from by aligning the From and To fields to the correct origin. 27011 - We fixed an issue where multi-clicking the Save Button in Event Attendance would create duplicate records. 26951 - Fixed an issue where the Account Lock check box changes were not being saved when changing from Locked to Unlocked. 26991- We have resolved an issue in the Progress Centre → Attendance page where sporting in enrolment Status could result in an error. 27197 - We have resolved an issue where events linked to a course multiple times could not be removed from the course without deleting all the links to that event, you can now remove a single link. 26406 - We have improved the breaks functionality on the attendance record page so that fields align, errors are displayed in context and general usability enhancements.

ATTENTION  Merging party profiles cannot be undone and the secondary party profile will be deleted after this process is complete. Please take extreme caution before going ahead with the merge. After clicking on the Select button, there will be a page outlining what data will be merged into the primary party profile. The following data will be merged into the primary party profile that you have elected:   Party details  Addresses  Contacts  Identification  Properties  Pathways  AVETMISS data  Events  Custom fields  Enrolments  Employer  Services  File notes  Academics/Trainers  Documents  Invoices  Email history SMS history  Contacts   Click on the Merge button to go ahead with merging the two parties. This will delete the secondary party profile and move the data mentioned above into the primary party profile. Note  It is not possible to merge party profiles that are classed as Users, due to the fact that Users cannot be deleted once created. For more information on Users, refer to the Add a User article.

Merging Two Party Profiles

There might be times when you need to merge two different party profiles together. In this article, we will over the process of merging two party profiles and what you need to look out for. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Why Would You Need to Merge Party Profiles? Merging Two Party Profiles Together     Why Would You Need to Merge Party Profiles? There are a few scenarios when merging two party profiles would be beneficial:   There are multiple party profiles for one student, which can occur automatically when using course forms. Two party profiles were created for one student by accident. One person has enrolments on multiple party profiles. Ensuring that your system is organised will make it easier to manage your student data. Having duplicate party profiles for the same student can lead to unnecessary complications when using the system. Merging Two Party Profiles Together  Go to the party profile that you would like to keep (the primary party profile) and click on Admin → Merge Parties. From here, you will need to select the party profile (the secondary party profile) that you want to merge into your primary profile. You can either look through the list of parties that are already there or search for a specific party in the search bar.

Merging Profiles

When merging profiles on the system side, care must be taken to ensure that the record which is present within Canvas remains the

Primary Party Profile.

216

When a new profile is created on the system, it is assigned a new party ID. Regardless if other details are the same, If this party ID does

not match the SIS ID of the profile within Canvas, it will no longer be recognized as the same person.

If a profile becomes the subject of a merge and is no longer recognized on Canvas, you will need to locate the students account in

Canvas and update the old SIS ID/Integration ID to match the parties new, updated Party ID. (you can also modify the Party ID on JR to

match the SIS ID)

422 Un-processable Entity

This error can occur if the URL is completely wrong.

This error is caused by an incorrect URL at the preferences level.

Go to Administration > Configuration > Preferences > Integration > Integrated systems > Canvas > confirm and adjust System URL

217

“unexpected character at line 1, column 1 [parse.c:637]” error code

This error can occur if part of the URL is incorrect.

Error is a generic JSON line of code stating that “something is missing” and occurs when attempting to push data into canvas for the first

time.

This error will appear when attempting to push an enrolment. It can be seen via the integration settings of the course (admin >

integrations > Canvas) and will appear in the “Failed” tab.

This can also be seen in the integration logs (Admin > Audit/logs > Integration logs)

The client record after the merge will have the enrolments, contracts, units, results, disabilities, attributes, etc of both the records combined. In tables for which there can be many values, but the same value can only be present once, the following error message will be displayed if both records contain the same value:      These error messages can occur for:   Client attributes  Client disability  Client groups  Client classes  Client prior education   The rest of the merge will continue successfully. These error messages are no cause for concern, as they simply indicate that the merge has not created a client record with the same values duplicated.

You can click on the Merge button to start merging the profiles, you will be required to select one of the party profiles to flag as the Primary party profile. For more information on how this process works, refer to the Merging Two Party Profiles article. Essentially, the primary profile is the one that you wish to keep. The other party profile will be deleted and the data will be merged over to the primary profile. Click on the Merge button once you have selected the primary profile. The party profiles will now be merged together. Criteria for Duplicates to Show Up  The fields used to determine if both party profiles are duplicates carry weighted values. The values contribute to a Match Score, which will flag the profiles as duplicates if it reaches a certain percentage. The fields used to contribute to the Match Score have the following values:   First Name – 30%  Last Name – 20% Email Address – 20%  Birth Date – 30%      Archiving Matches  If you have determined that the party profiles are not duplicates, you can choose to ignore them instead. Click on the Ignore button to remove the match from the list. This will effectively ‘archive’ the match item and prevent it from appearing when you go to search for duplicates again. If you need to find the archived records, you can go to Filters and click on the Archived Only filter, click on the Search button. From here, you will be able to merge the archived duplicate matches as you please.

Warning  Once you have archived a duplicate match, it is not possible unarchive it. Please use this with caution.

‘ID Already in use for this account and authentication provider’

There are a number of different reasons this error can occur, however most of these relate to duplicate mandatory fields being pushed onto

Canvas for different Parties. Check that JR Party ID matches against Canvas party SIS ID and that they are unique.

Full error message: {"errors"=>{"user"=>{"pseudonyms"=>[{"attribute"=>"pseudonyms", "type"=>"invalid", "message"=>"invalid"}]},

"pseudonym"=>{"unique_id"=>[{"attribute"=>"unique_id", "type"=>"taken", "message"=>"ID already in use for this account and

authentication provider"}]}, "observee"=>{}, "pairing_code"=>{}, "recaptcha"=>nil}}

This error can occur when trying to push an entity from Plus into Canvas.

First ensure that Assessor party ID and Canvas sis ID match > retry integration. Then ensure that student party ID and Canvas SIS ID

match > retry integration.

This issue may also stem from the party id in Canvas being archived. To test, go to profile in Canvas > edit > attempt to change SIS ID to

what is found in JR. If error message ‘SIS ID is already in use’, then archived user in Canvas more than likely exists. Suggest to client

that they reach out to Canvas to identify the profile with the sis id and remove it.

This can also be due to two entities of the push (example: the student and the academic) sharing data that is required to be unique such

as an email address. Modifying the email address of either the academic or the student so that it no longer matched the student being

pushed will resolve the error in this situation.

If the above don’t appear to be the issue, then the likely cause is that the email address is already taken in Canvas. Check the failed

party, and see if there is already an instance of this email address in the client’s Canvas site.

403 Forbidden

This error can be caused by a token that has been deleted from canvas or permissions changed. Client should request a new token via

Canvas

Troubleshooting Guide

This article serves to collect known error messages hat may be encountered when using Canvas LMS, with details explaining their origin and methods to try and fix the cause. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Configuration/Setup Errors  "422 Un-processable Entity"  “Unexpected character at line 1, column 1 [parse.c:637]"    General Use Errors  "403 Forbidden"  "Party Name is blank, Party Email is blank, Party Identifier is blank"  "The specified resource does not exist"  "ID Already in use for this account and authentication provider"  “Unexpected error when updating unit: End date can't be blank if the unit is complete:”        Configuration/Setup Errors    "422 Un-processable Entity"   This error can occur if the configuration URL entered is entirely incorrect. Caused by by an incorrect URL at the preferences level. To amend, simply go to Administration > Configuration > Preferences > Integration > Integrated systems > Canvas > confirm to adjust the entered System URL     “Unexpected character at line 1, column 1 [parse.c:637]"   This error can occur if part of your configuration URL is incorrect. This error will appear when attempting to push an enrolment, and can be seen via the integration settings of the course (Admin > Integrations > Canvas) appearing in the “Failed” tab. Ensure that the system URL used to push the data into Canvas is configured correctly, including the path to the API at the end.

Full error message: {"errors"=>{"user"=>{"pseudonyms"=>[{"attribute"=>"pseudonyms", "type"=>"invalid", "message"=>"invalid"}]}, "pseudonym"=>{"unique_id"=>[{"attribute"=>"unique_id", "type"=>"taken", "message"=>"ID already in use for this account and authentication provider"}]}, "observee"=>{}, "pairing_code"=>{}, "recaptcha"=>nil}}    First ensure that Assessor Party ID and Canvas SIS ID match, then retry integration. Then ensure that student party ID and Canvas SIS ID match, then retry integration. This issue may also stem from the Party ID in Canvas being archived. To test, go to the profile in Canvas and choose to edit, then attempt to change SIS ID to what is found in your student management system. If the error reads a message of "SIS ID is already in use", then the archived user in Canvas more than likely exists. You may need to reach out to Canvas to identify the profile with the SIS ID to have it amended/removed. Another causes can be due to two entities being pushed (example: the student and the academic) sharing data that is required to be unique – such as an email address. Modifying the email address of either the academic or the student so that it no longer matched the student being pushed will resolve the error in this situation. If the above don’t appear to be the issue, then the likely cause is that the email address is already taken in Canvas. Check the failed party, and see if there is already an instance of this email address in the your Canvas site.

ticket_content.ticket_description: When I changed the trainers for enrolments, changes made to enrolments  trainer change or delivery method changed  not captured in Activity feed.  Do we have a report to check this?

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about capturing changes to trainer assignments and delivery methods in the activity feed or reports.

Based on the information in the documentation, there does not appear to be a specific report or activity feed that captures changes to trainer assignments or delivery methods for enrolments [1][2]. The activity feed and reports seem to focus more on tracking things like enrolment status changes, results, and course completions.

However, the system does log these types of changes internally. You may be able to get this information by reaching out to the ReadyTech support team to request an audit log report for the specific enrolments you need to track [1]. They should be able to provide a report showing when trainer assignments or delivery methods were changed and by whom.

Alternatively, you could consider implementing custom triggers and actions to send notifications or log changes to trainer assignments and delivery methods as they occur [3]. This would allow you to track these types of changes more proactively.

Please let me know if you need any other assistance with tracking enrolment changes or setting up custom notifications.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding tracking changes to enrolment details like trainers and delivery methods. Based on the information available, there does not appear to be a dedicated activity feed or report that specifically captures these types of changes [1]. However, some relevant details:

- Changes to enrolment details like trainers or delivery methods do not currently trigger updates in an external system like Moodle once the enrolment has been initially pushed [4].

- There are audit logs and other reports that may indirectly show when certain enrolment fields were modified, but not a consolidated report focused just on trainer/delivery method changes.

I would suggest checking the audit logs for the enrolment record to see if the specific fields you need were updated and when. You can also try running an enrolment report for the time period of interest and compare to a previous version to identify any changes [1].

While there is no dedicated report for this currently, I've passed your feedback along to the product team for consideration of better change tracking for these types of enrolment updates in the future. Please let me know if you need any other assistance!

Thank you,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out about the activity feed and tracking enrolment changes. The activity feed is designed to capture certain activities and changes within the system, but it does not currently track changes made to enrolment trainers or delivery methods [1]. 

However, there is a report that can help you track these types of changes. The Audit Log Report shows a detailed log of all changes made within the system, including updates to enrolments like trainer or delivery method changes [5]. To access this report, go to Reports > Summary Reports > Audit Log Report. You can filter and customize the report as needed to view the specific changes you want to track.

While the activity feed does not capture these particular enrolment updates, the Audit Log Report should provide the visibility you need into changes made to enrolment details like trainers and delivery methods. Please let me know if you need any further assistance with running or customizing this report.

Thank you,

4.2         Occurrence edits

Occurrence changes can impact the linked Moodle course:

Changing the start/finish date will change the dates of the linked Moodle course

Changing the status will change the visibility of the course in Moodle.

4.3         Enrolment edits

Enrolment changes do not cause any changes to the enrolment in Moodle once it has been pushed. This is due to limitations with the

Moodle API (does not expose a course update endpoint that can work without a Moodle enrolment ID and we cannot retrieve Moodle

enrolment ID from the current Moodle API as it is never exposed in any endpoint).

4.4         Resulting units/tasks

We categorise results retrieved from Moodle into 3 buckets, Started, Passed, and Failed. A unit/task is considered:

Started – when some mapped activities have a grade greater than or equal to the passing grade in Moodle but not all.

Passed – when all mapped activities have a grade that is greater than or equal to the passing grade in Moodle.

Failed – when any mapped activities have a grade that is lower than the passing grade in Moodle.

When recording results for failed is turned off, units/tasks will be considered started instead of failed.

Results will not show for units/tasks that have already been completed. Additionally, units/tasks will not be started if they are already started.

301

4.5         Course completions

Couse completions will only be shown if the enrolment is still active and Moodle has marked the student as completed the course. Moodle

has a very flexible configuration for course completions. The VETtrak status date will be the date when the latest completion condition was

met in Moodle. E.g.

For a Moodle course that is configured to complete when Activity A, B and C are completed. If a student completes the activities in order A,

B, and then C the status will be set to the date that student completed Activity C.

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for your queries regarding custom fields and reports in JR Plus. 

Regarding adding custom fields to the Party Profile, unfortunately this is not something users can do themselves. You would need to submit a request through our internal Jira ticketing system with details on the specific fields you need added [1]. Our team can then review and prioritize adding those custom fields to the Party Profile section.

As for creating custom reports that only display within JR Plus and don't allow exporting to Excel, this is possible through our Report Builder tool [3]. You can create custom report views tailored to your needs that will only be visible in the JR Plus interface. However, users with the appropriate permissions would still be able to export that report data, so we cannot fully restrict exporting of data.

If you need a more restrictive reporting solution that limits access to sensitive data, I would suggest looking into our Data Insights feature which allows you to create dashboards with controlled access [4]. You can reach out to our team to discuss requirements and potential solutions.

Please let me know if you need any other assistance regarding custom fields, reports or data access controls. I'm happy to provide more details or submit requests on your behalf.

Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding adding custom fields to the Party Profile and creating in-system custom reports [1][3].

To add a new field to the Party Profile, such as a "Cohort" field to capture information like CALD, disability status, youth, etc., you will need to submit a request through our Jira ticketing system. Please create a new ticket with details on the fields you would like added, the purpose, and any other relevant context. Be sure to add the "Support" and "ReportBuilder" labels to the ticket [1]. Our team will then review the request and work on implementing the new fields.

Regarding creating custom reports that are only visible within JR Plus and cannot be exported, this is possible through our Report Builder tool [4]. You can create custom reports with the desired filters, fields, and layouts, and choose to only allow them to be viewed within JR Plus rather than enabling Excel export. To request a new custom in-system report, please submit another Jira ticket with the report details and requirements, and add the "Support" and "ReportBuilder" labels.

Please note that for any calculated or derived fields in custom reports, we may need to add additional database fields to store that data, which can increase the complexity of the request [1].

I hope this information is helpful! Let me know if you need any other assistance with adding custom fields or creating in-system reports.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your queries regarding custom fields and reports in JR Plus. Let me provide some information on the points you raised:

Adding Custom Fields to Party Profile:
JR Plus allows adding custom fields to the Party Profile through the Party Custom Content section [5]. These fields can be used to capture additional details like cohort/demographic information (CALD, disability, youth, etc.) that you mentioned. To add new custom fields, you would need to submit a request through the Report Builder process [5]. Our team can then work on implementing the requested fields.

Creating In-App Custom Reports:
JR Plus provides the ability to create custom reports through the Report Builder [2]. However, these custom reports are designed to be exported or printed, similar to the standard out-of-the-box reports. Currently, there is no functionality to create reports that are viewable only within the application and cannot be exported [2]. This capability would require further product enhancements.

Restricting Data Export:
JR Plus has role-based access controls that allow restricting certain users from accessing specific areas or functions of the system. However, there is no straightforward way to completely prevent data export for a particular user role while still allowing access to reports [2]. This would likely require significant customization efforts.

I understand your goal is to prevent sensitive data from being extracted outside the system. While JR Plus does not have a built-in feature for this currently, I would recommend exploring alternative approaches like:

1. Implementing strict data governance policies and training for users with access to reports.
2. Considering data masking or redaction techniques for sensitive fields in reports.
3. Exploring third-party reporting/analytics tools with better control over data export.

Our team can further discuss potential solutions if this is a critical requirement for your organization. Please let me know if you need any clarification or have additional questions.

Thank you,

Report Builder Additional Field Request

Process Owner: @Nick Jones

Summary

This article details the steps to take when requesting that an additional report builder field be added to the report builder.

To keep in mind when requesting additional fields, we discourage fields that require calculation as this can cause issues with permission

with the report builder. We can still ask them, but these are much more complicated to implement as additional fields might need to be

added to the database to store the calculated data.

Process

A Jira ticket will be created detailing the request. Once the Jira ticket has been created, it will be taken through the normal triage process

and prioritised with the backlog of bugs. If a ticket does need to be escalated raised in the weekly customer escalation meeting.

Submitting the request

Can they use a Standard Report or Data Insights instead?

The Support Officer will promote the use of existing tools in the software if those tools can achieve the outcome for the customer.

VETtrak Standard Reports Overview

Data Insights Manager Overview

Check for existing base template

The Support Officer will check the “Reports by Type” folder from the VETtrak Report Writers Sharepoint folder for any similar custom

reports that can be used as a base for creating the new report.

Create a working folder ready to begin work

Locate the State or Territory the Customer is located, and navigate to the associated folder on SharePoint eg.

C:\Users\PC_USERNAME\OneDrive - ReadyTech\VETtrak Report Writers - Customer Reports\Reports\VIC

Within the State or Territory Folder, locate the Company Name Folder, or create one if there is not one yet located

Similarly, ensure a sub-folder for the current year is created

Then, create a sub-folder within the Year Folder to represent the ticket number, followed by the Report Name to help separate the folder

you are working on from other requests, and create or copy the .fr3 file to work on from there.

Note; It is strongly advised to not store files which do not have a .fr3 file extension in this folder on SharePoint, as these are the only

file extensions Infrastructure would like Support to store. This is to ensure the SharePoint drive retains a reasonable capacity

without regular deletion of files to preserve space. Instead. store logos and documentation on your local PC, and delete upon

closure of the Report Request.533

From there, create a Backup Folder within the ticket Folder, followed by the Date you start work on the report, then store the first copy of

the report within that folder;

(Optional) Then, for any additional changes throughout the course of a request, create a new folder with the date the report is next

ticket_content.ticket_description: Hi Team,  I have identified * profiles that are the same person yet they don t appear in the Duplicates Manager.  They appear to fit the criteria to automatically appear in Duplicate Manager but don t, and I can t search for them either by first name or last name to manually merge the parties.  Please investigate and advise.  Thanks  *****

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the duplicate party profiles issue. The Duplicate Manager is designed to identify and list duplicate party profiles based on matching fields like first name, last name, email address, and birth date [2]. Profiles with a match score of 70% or higher based on these fields are flagged as potential duplicates [2].

However, there could be a few reasons why some duplicate profiles are not appearing in the Duplicate Manager despite seeming to meet the criteria:

1. The matching fields may not have enough similarity to reach the 70% threshold for being flagged as duplicates [2].
2. There could be an issue causing the system to not properly identify those specific profiles as duplicates.
3. The profiles were archived previously and need to be unarchived to appear again [1].

If the profiles truly appear to be duplicates, you can try merging them manually. Go to one of the profiles you want to keep as the primary, then go to Admin > Merge Parties. Search for the other duplicate profile and select it as the secondary profile to merge into the primary [3].

If you are still unable to locate or merge the duplicate profiles through this method, please provide some additional details like the profile names or IDs. I will then investigate further and escalate this issue to our development team if needed to ensure the Duplicate Manager is working as intended.

Please let me know if you need any other assistance with this matter.

Kind regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the duplicate profiles issue. The Duplicate Manager is designed to list pairs of duplicate party profiles based on certain criteria [2]. The fields used to determine if two party profiles are duplicates include:

- First Name (weighted 30%)
- Last Name (weighted 20%)  
- Email Address (weighted 20%)
- Birth Date (weighted 30%)

If two party profiles have matching values in these fields that result in a Match Score of 70% or higher, they should appear in the Duplicate Manager [1]. However, there may be instances where duplicate profiles meeting the criteria do not show up, which could be due to system limitations or issues.

If the duplicate profiles you have identified seem to fit the criteria but are not appearing in the Duplicate Manager, you can try the following:

1. Check if the profiles have been archived previously in the Duplicate Manager. Go to Filters > Archived Only to see if they are listed there [1].

2. As a workaround, you can manually merge the duplicate profiles by going to the primary party profile you want to keep and navigating to Admin > Merge Parties. Then search for and select the secondary party profile to merge into the primary one [3].

If the issue persists after trying these steps, it would be best to raise it with our support team, providing details about the specific duplicate profiles not showing up. We can investigate further and assist you in resolving the issue.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance with merging the duplicate profiles.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the duplicate profiles issue. The Duplicate Manager is designed to detect and list duplicate party profiles based on matching fields like first name, last name, email address, and birth date [2][1]. If two party profiles have specific matching fields, they should appear in the Duplicate Manager to allow merging.

However, there could be a few reasons why the duplicate profiles you identified are not showing up:

1. The matching fields between the profiles may not meet the criteria for being flagged as duplicates. The system uses weighted values for each field, and the combined match score needs to reach a certain percentage threshold to be listed [1].

2. There could be some data inconsistencies or missing values in the key fields that are preventing an accurate match.

3. Occasionally, there may be technical issues or limitations that cause the Duplicate Manager to miss some duplicates.

If the profiles truly appear to be duplicates based on the matching criteria, I would suggest trying a few things:

- Check if any of the key fields (name, email, birth date) have inconsistent formatting or data entry between the profiles.

- Try archiving the current list of duplicates shown, then search again to see if the missing profiles appear [1].

- As a last resort, you can manually merge the profiles by going to one profile and using the "Merge Parties" option to select and merge the duplicate profile into it [3].

If you continue having trouble after trying these steps, please let me know the specific profile IDs or names, and I can further investigate why they are not being detected properly. Ensuring we have clean data with no duplicates is important, so I appreciate you bringing this to our attention. Let me know if you need any other assistance!

related_knowledge.content:
You can click on the Merge button to start merging the profiles, you will be required to select one of the party profiles to flag as the Primary party profile. For more information on how this process works, refer to the Merging Two Party Profiles article. Essentially, the primary profile is the one that you wish to keep. The other party profile will be deleted and the data will be merged over to the primary profile. Click on the Merge button once you have selected the primary profile. The party profiles will now be merged together. Criteria for Duplicates to Show Up  The fields used to determine if both party profiles are duplicates carry weighted values. The values contribute to a Match Score, which will flag the profiles as duplicates if it reaches a certain percentage. The fields used to contribute to the Match Score have the following values:   First Name – 30%  Last Name – 20% Email Address – 20%  Birth Date – 30%      Archiving Matches  If you have determined that the party profiles are not duplicates, you can choose to ignore them instead. Click on the Ignore button to remove the match from the list. This will effectively ‘archive’ the match item and prevent it from appearing when you go to search for duplicates again. If you need to find the archived records, you can go to Filters and click on the Archived Only filter, click on the Search button. From here, you will be able to merge the archived duplicate matches as you please.

Warning  Once you have archived a duplicate match, it is not possible unarchive it. Please use this with caution.

Duplicate Manager Overview

If you have multiple pairs of duplicate party profiles, the Duplicate Manager will list each pair of party profiles in your system. From here you can merge them together if needed. In this article, we will go over the Duplicate Manager and how to use it. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Navigating the Duplicate Manager  Criteria for Duplicates to Show Up  Archiving Matches Note  The Duplicate Manager is only for merging duplicates that already exist. It does not act as a proactive check for duplicates, as there are already features in the system for this. Navigating the Duplicate Manager  The Duplicate Manager can be found in Administration → Audit / Logs → Duplicate Manager. You should see a Find Duplicates button, along with a search bar for finding specific students. Use either option to bring up a list of students that can be merged. By default, any party profile matches with a score of 70% or more will appear when a search is done. This value can be changed in Administration → Configuration → Preferences → Preferences / Settings. Note  If your system has a lot of party profiles that are classed as duplicates, it might take some time to load them all when using the Find Duplicates button. There are certain fields that must match on each party profile for them to appear as duplicates. If both party profiles have specific matching fields, they will be available to merge from the Duplicate Manager.

Merging Two Party Profiles

There might be times when you need to merge two different party profiles together. In this article, we will over the process of merging two party profiles and what you need to look out for. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Why Would You Need to Merge Party Profiles? Merging Two Party Profiles Together     Why Would You Need to Merge Party Profiles? There are a few scenarios when merging two party profiles would be beneficial:   There are multiple party profiles for one student, which can occur automatically when using course forms. Two party profiles were created for one student by accident. One person has enrolments on multiple party profiles. Ensuring that your system is organised will make it easier to manage your student data. Having duplicate party profiles for the same student can lead to unnecessary complications when using the system. Merging Two Party Profiles Together  Go to the party profile that you would like to keep (the primary party profile) and click on Admin → Merge Parties. From here, you will need to select the party profile (the secondary party profile) that you want to merge into your primary profile. You can either look through the list of parties that are already there or search for a specific party in the search bar.

ticket_content.ticket_description: Can you let me know how I can change a user information in the Job Ready system,.  I need to remove one of the administrator and update with someone else. Is that something I can do or do you have to complete that for me.  Thanks  ******

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding changing user information in the Job Ready system. The process for updating an existing user's details, including their roles and permissions, is outlined in the "Process: Add a User" article [1].

To remove an administrator user, you would first need to revoke their access by either:
1) Unchecking the "Enabled" box to disable their account, or
2) Setting an "End Date" for when their access should expire.

Then, to add the new administrator user, you can follow the steps for creating a new user, making sure to assign them the appropriate "Available Role" for administrator access.

Please note that your own "Access Level" may restrict what user roles you can modify. The article states that if you are a Level 1 user, you can adjust roles for Level 1, 2, and 3 users. But if you are Level 3, you can only change privileges of other Level 3 users [1].

So depending on your access level, you may or may not be able to remove the existing administrator and add the new one yourself. If you don't have sufficient permissions, you would need to request this change from someone at a higher access level.

Let me know if you need any other assistance with managing users and roles in the system.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding changing user information in the Job Ready system. The process to add or remove users, including administrators, is covered in our knowledge base article [1].

To remove an existing administrator user, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to Administration > Security > Users
2. Find the user you want to remove administrator access for
3. Uncheck the "Enabled" box to disable their account
4. Remove any "Available Roles" assigned to them, especially administrator roles
5. Click Save to apply the changes

To add a new administrator user:

1. Go to Administration > Security > Users 
2. Click the [+ New] button
3. Search for or create the new user's profile
4. Check the "Enabled" box
5. Assign the appropriate administrator "Available Role(s)"
6. Set their access level if needed
7. Click Save

This will allow you to remove the previous administrator and grant the new user administrator access within the system [1]. Please let me know if you need any other assistance with managing users and permissions.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for your request regarding changing user information in the Job Ready system. References [1][2] provide the steps to add a new user and update their roles and permissions.

To remove an existing administrator user and add a new one, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to Administration > Security > Users in the system
2. Search for the user you want to remove as an administrator and uncheck the "Enabled" box to disable their account
3. Click the [+ New] button to add a new user
4. Fill out the new user details, making sure to select the "Administrator" role under Available Roles
5. Set their access level as needed and click Save

This will remove the previous administrator's access while granting the new user the administrator role and permissions. Please let me know if you need any other assistance with managing users in the system.

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content:
Process: Add a User

A user can log in to the Student Management System and is responsible for administering and managing the system's data. For example, Administrators, Academics (Trainers/Assessors), Marketing Managers, Compliance Managers, and Finance Managers. Warning  We do not recommend sharing user access between multiple individuals. This ensures that all changes and updates within the system can be appropriately logged and tracked.

Add a User  To add a New User, follow these steps:   Go to Administration → Security → Users. Click the [+ New] button. To add a User, a Party record must first exist.Choose whether to:  Search for an Existing Party Record,  Create a New Party Record. Complete the New User Window      User ID - This value must be unique and will be the user's username. Organisations typically use an individuals email address. Enabled - By default, the system will check this box. If checked, the user can access the system. Academic - If checked, the Available Roles list below will change from Administrative Roles to Academic Roles limiting their access to the system and its data. Password - Set a unique, temporary password for the new user. On the first login, the system will prompt the user to change their password. Clicking on the Reset button will send a password reset email to the user. Start Date - This determines from which date the user can access the platform. It acts as a record-keeping for when a User is provided with access. End Date - This determines from which date the user can no longer access the platform. It acts as a record-keeping for when a Users access is revoked. Leave this field blank if it is indefinite. Access Level - An Access Levels impacts whether a User can make adjustments to another User. For example, if the user is a Level 1, they can adjust the roles and permissions for Level 1, 2, and 3.

However, if the user is a Level 3, they can only change the privileges of other Level 3 users. Check an Available Role. You can select more than one if needed. Click, Save. You have now added a new User.

Physical Resources  1  Access to the Student Management System, including URL, username and password  SMS Setup  2  None  Prerequisite Knowledge and Understanding  3  None  Session Outcomes/Action Items  Following the session, we recommend you complete the following action items. This will assist in enabling you to set up your Student Management System correctly, as well as prepare you for the next and future training sessions. Assign all new users to the system (and assign them roles)    Add all staff to the system    Spend some time navigating around your system and searching    Add any companies required    Review the tags in your system and add any you require    Bookmark the knowledge base for future use https://help-education.readytech.io/support/home     Additional Resources  The following resources provide additional support and information relating to this session. Terminology Overview    Logging In/Accessing The System  Process: Add a User  Process: Creating a New Party Profile  Process: Adding a Staff Profile  Tags Overview  Process: Add a Company  Knowledge Base Access  Monday.com User Guide      FAQ   I don't know all my staff now, can I add them later? Yes, you can add staff as you're made aware of them. However, to do some of the following sessions, you'll need at least one staff member in your system. What if I don't know any of my trainers, will I still be able to complete the following sessions? We recommend you add a "Trainer TBA" staff profile.

The new version of the Progress Portal for 19.1 now uses VETtrak's role-based security system. You can set up multiple roles in the Progress Portal application in the Security Manager, configure the permissions for each role, and assign employer contacts to roles. The "Progress Portal access" tickbox in the Employer Contact wizard has been replaced by a "Progress Portal role" drop-down as an alternative means to select which role this contact has (or empty to not allow them access to the Progress Portal). You can choose a default Progress Portal role for new employer contacts in Global Preferences -> Progress Portal. When a user logs into the Progress Portal, they have access to whichever employers they are a contact for (that have a Progress Portal role assigned), so they may have a different role depending on the employer they select. For details of how this works, refer to this article. Progress Portal authentication providers. The ability to set up external authentication providers has been added to the Progress Portal in the Security Manager. Progress Portal file notes. File notes can now be viewed in the Progress Portal. The Configuration Manager now allows you to control which file note types can be viewed in the Progress Portal. Student Portal waitlist. The waitlist functionality available in the Student Portal has been significantly expanded, to allow students to express interest in additional courses, which come into VETtrak as waitlist entries.

Setup – CRICOS  We’ve adjusted the Setup - CRICOS permission to include access to the Administration > Lookups > International Data menu option, within the Setups page. Users without this permission will not be able to access this menu option. Setup – Outcome Types  We’ve adjusted the Setup - Outcome Types permission to include access to the Administration > Outcome Types menu option, within the Setups page. Users without this permission will not be able to access this menu option. Ready LMS rebrand  aNewSpring has now been renamed across the system to reflect its new name. It will now be known as Ready LMS. API - Prior Educational Achievement Recognition Identifier  The Party API endpoint will now default any new prior-education records provided with the appropriate Prior Educational Achievement Recognition Identifier

value. Add/Delete Supporting Staff API

Last release we introduced a new API to pull Support Staff information from an event.

We’ve added another update that now allows you to add or delete Support Staff from an event via the API. Removing or adding a Supporting Staff member will also adjust the Attendee list of an Event. Filter for inactive course forms  We have updated the course form list view to hide inactive forms. Disabled course forms can be added via a filter. Certificate API  We have added the

expiry-date

and

revoked-at

fields to the following Certificate API endpoints:   GET /webservice /certificates

GET /webservice /certificates /{id}   We have added the

expiry-date

Entity based security in the Progress Portal

Must be running VETtrak version 19.1.x. Entity security  The progress portal version 19.1 now uses VETtrak's role-based security system. To adjust these settings open the Security Manager from the VETtrak desktop software. You can set up multiple roles in the Progress Portal application in the Security Manager, configure the permissions for each role, and assign employer contacts to roles. The "Progress Portal access" tickbox in the Employer Contact wizard has been replaced by a "Progress Portal role" drop-down as an alternative means to select which role this contact has (or leave it empty to not allow them access to the Progress Portal). You can choose a default Progress Portal role for new employer contacts in Global Preferences -> Progress Portal. When a user logs into the Progress Portal, they have access to whichever employers they are a contact for (that have a Progress Portal role assigned), so they may have a different role depending on the employer they select. Example: Timmy Trainer with access to two employers. Eddie Employer with Progress Portal Role 1 that is hiding awards and placements:     Eddie employer now has accreditation (awards) and placements hidden and will no longer appear on the dashboard.

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with sending emails to students from VETtrak. The "Authentication unsuccessful" error you are receiving is likely due to the recent change in security settings for your Microsoft email account with multi-factor authentication enabled.

Microsoft and Google are deprecating basic SMTP authentication for Office365 and Gmail accounts. VETtrak currently only supports SMTP authentication, so a workaround is needed to bypass the multi-factor authentication requirement [1].

For Office365 accounts, the recommended solution is to set up an SMTP relay through your IT team or mail server admin [1]. This will allow VETtrak to send emails without being blocked by multi-factor authentication. The steps to configure the SMTP relay are outlined in this Microsoft article: [Link to Microsoft article].

Once the SMTP relay is set up, you can update the VETtrak email preferences with the relay details, such as the SMTP server hostname, port number, and if authentication is required [1].

If you continue to face issues after setting up the SMTP relay, please check the error code details in the "Email Troubleshooting" section of our help documentation [2][3]. Common errors like 535 (Authentication unsuccessful) or 550 (Unable to relay) can often be resolved by verifying the SMTP settings.

Let me know if you need any further assistance in setting up the SMTP relay or troubleshooting the email issue.

Thank you,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with sending emails to students from VETtrak. It seems that after enabling multi-factor authentication for your Microsoft 365 email account, VETtrak is unable to authenticate and send emails using those credentials [4].

Microsoft and other major email providers like Gmail are deprecating basic SMTP authentication that VETtrak currently uses, in favor of more secure authentication methods like OAuth 2.0 [1]. As a workaround, you have two options:

1. Set up an SMTP relay for your email server as per Microsoft's guidelines [1]. This will allow VETtrak to send emails without requiring multi-factor authentication. The exact configuration details need to be provided by your IT team.

2. For Gmail accounts, you can generate an application-specific password and use that as the email login password in VETtrak's email preferences instead of your actual Gmail password [4].

If you continue facing the "Authentication unsuccessful" error (code 535) [3] after trying the above steps, please check if your email server is blocking emails from VETtrak's IP address 103.102.118.1 [2][5]. Your IT team may need to whitelist this IP.

Additionally, ensure you have the correct SMTP server hostname, port number, and SSL/TLS settings configured as per your email provider's requirements [6].

Let me know if you need any further assistance in resolving this issue.

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with sending emails to students from VETtrak after enabling multi-factor authentication for Microsoft email accounts.

Based on the error message "SMTP protocol error. 535 5.7.14 Authentication unsuccessful, the user credentials were incorrect", it seems that the email credentials provided in VETtrak's global preferences are not being accepted by the email server [3].

Microsoft is deprecating basic SMTP authentication for Office365, which VETtrak currently uses. To work around this requirement for multi-factor authentication, you will need to set up an SMTP relay on your email server [1]. This will need to be configured by your IT team or mail server admin following the steps in this Microsoft article: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/mail-flow-best-practices/how-to-set-up-a-multifunction-device-or-application-to-send-email-using-microsoft-365-or-office-365

Once the SMTP relay is set up, you can fill out the VETtrak email preferences similarly to the example given in the article, using the SMTP relay details provided by your IT team [1]. You may also need to create an SPF record as mentioned in the article.

If you continue facing authentication issues after setting up the SMTP relay, please check the troubleshooting steps listed in this article: https://help-vettrak.readytech.io/support/solutions/articles/51000288132 [2]. The error code you are receiving (535 5.7.14) typically indicates that the authentication settings are not correct.

Please let me know if you have any other questions or if the issue persists after trying these steps.

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content:
Email Troubleshooting - Setting up an SMTP Relay

Microsoft and Google are deprecating basic SMTP authentication for Office365 and Gmail. VETtrak and all associated products currently only support SMTP (username and password) authentication so workarounds are needed in order to get past the requirement for Multi Factor Authentication. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Outlook/Office365  Gmail  OAuth 2.0      Outlook/Office365  If you use Office365 as well as the email function within the Trainer and Student Portal/VETenrol, an SMTP relay will need to be set up to get around the need for multi factor authentication. This will need to be configured by your IT team or Mail server admin using the steps in this Microsoft article. Within the article, Option 3 is the easiest to follow, depending on how the relay is set up the VETtrak email preferences can be filled out similarly to the below. SMTP Server: your mx endpoint  SSL/TLS: Automatic  Authentication Type: Not Required          Once this has been set up, you will also need to create a SPF Record, details of this are provided in the article here. Gmail  For Gmail/G Suite users, an application password can be configured within the privacy settings on the admin account, this will allow you to continue using SMTP without having to set up a relay. This is set up within the 2-Step verification options as detailed in this Google article.

filtering, etc. being applied on the mail server. Ask the customer

to check if their email server could be blocking emails or if they

need to enter different details into 'File', 'Global preferences',

'Email preferences' to send mail successfully.

530 5.5.1 O R 530

5.7.14https://support.google.com/mail/answer/14257

(or similar)This message is typically issued by Gmail indicating that

authentication failed. If the user thinks they're details are correct,

they may need to enable less secure apps in their Gmail

settings. See Cloud Service Email Settings for more information

about configuring VETtrak for Gmail.

535 Authentication unsuccessful This indicates the authentication settings are not correct. Check

the settings entered in 'File', 'Global preferences', 'Email

preferences'. If 'Use individual staff member email logins' is

ticked, go into the Client Wizard for the affected staff member

and ask them to verify the details listed against 'Email

username' and 'Email password'.

550 Unable to relay The user does not have permission to send emails to an

external domain. This is usually caused by missing user

credentials in 'File', 'Global preferences', 'Email preferences'.

276 Server certificate failed. Connection Aborted. This error indicates that the certificate received from the mail

server isn't valid. This often indicates one of the following:

The hostname that has been entered in the 'Mail server

address' field in VETtrak doesn't match the one on the

certificate

The certificate has expired

The certificate is a self-signed certificate - VETtrak only

accepts certificates signed by a trusted certificate authority

To check the certificate being sent by the mail server, you can

use the "Check TLS" service at //email/testTo:  - enter the

hostname as entered in the Email Preferences in VETtrak (if you

use a different port from 587, also click 'FULL version' and enter

the port in the 'MX Port' field). This will show the certificate given

161: SMTP protocol error. 554 5.2.0

'Submission.Exception:SendAsDenied'   This indicates that someone has attempted to reference an email address that is different to the configured 'Send As' email account in the preferences. Essentially unless the mail server has been configured in a specific way, you can't Send as one user, and then try and specify a Reply Address as someone else. Commonly this is fixed by using Individual Staff Member Log Ins or making sure the Reply To address is the same as the Sender email address. 161: SMTP protocol error  Service unavailable, Client host [103.102.118.1] blocked using Spamhaus. This indicates the authentication settings may be missing within VETtrak. Check the settings entered in 'File', 'Global preferences', 'Email preferences'. You will need to ensure the SSL/TLS connection method is 'Explicit', and change the Auth type to username/password and enter a valid email address and password that is accepted by your email server. 161: SMTP protocol error. 534 5.7.14  Username and Password not accepted  This usually indicates that you may be unable to email through Gmail. If comfortable, test enabling “Access for less secure apps” (which just means the client/app doesn’t use OAuth 2.0 - https://oauth.net/2/) for the account you are trying to access.

It's found in the account settings on the Security tab -> Account permissions. https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/6010255  535-5.7.14  Follow on Error   This is usually a follow on from the above error ^  Go to

https://accounts.google.com/DisplayUnlockCaptcha

and click Continue. Then you can authenticate your Additional Email Address from your Gmail Account. 552 5.2.3

Email Preferences  To configure VETtrak to send email via Gmail, go to File > Global preferences > Email preferences, and use the following settings:   Mail server address: smtp.gmail.com  Email port: 587  SL/TLS connection method: Explicit  Authentication type: User/Password  Email login username: Your full email address to your Google account  Email login password: Your password to your Google account  Default from address: The same as the Email login username      If you have VETtrak Security and want each VETtrak user to send email using their own Gmail account, you can instead tick Use individual staff member email logins and clear the Default from address:  Then go to the Staff Manager, find each staff member who logs into VETtrak, right-click the Personal node, select Edit staff member, and enter their email username and password on the third page of the Client Wizard:      NOTES:   When sending email, the From address of the email must match the Email Login Username, otherwise Gmail will discard the email as spam. If you are using Google or Microsoft's two-step verification feature (also known as "multi-factor authentication), you will need to generate an application-specific password for VETtrak. You would then use this password as the Email Login Password when setting up your email in VETtrak.

Hosted Customers  If you are hosted with VETtrak, please note that the firewall in our hosted environment only permits email to be sent out of standard SMTP ports (25, 465, and 587). If your mail server is on a non-standard port, please send an email to support@vettrak.io requesting that your mail server be unblocked, indicating the hostname and port number for your mail server. We will only accept unblock requests which specify the mail server hostname in the request. We will not unblock a port to allow connection to all mail servers, apart from the aforementioned standard SMTP ports. Troubleshooting Email Errors  Below is a list of email errors that can occur when attempting to send email in VETtrak. These take the form of a code and a message. For server connection problems, you'll get a 5 digit code and a dialog box, for SMTP errors, you'll get a red 'Status' indicator and a 3 digit error code (and possibly a sub-error code after this). The 'Message' column is an indication only and the actual error returned for a given code will depend on the SMTP server software in use. If your

error matches a code, even if the message is slightly different, it is most likely caused by the same issue as listed in the 'Explanation/resolution' column for that code. Serve     10013  Access denied  VETtrak has been blocked from opening the connection to the mail server. Try disabling any firewall/anti-virus software as this commonly blocks SMTP to prevent viruses mass emailing. If emailing works after having disabled security software, you will likely need to

Portal SMTP override options

Must be running VETtrak version 18.3.0.x (or higher)  and Trainer Portal v18.3.0.2 (or higher)  or Student Portal v18.3.0.2 (or higher)  It is important that an experienced IT resource is available to manage this process. Version 19.2 (or higher) of the portals and onwards will not need this over-ride, unless using NTLM email. Feature summary  As from version 18.3.0.2 there is an option to override the VETtrak configured SMTP provider. The override allows configuration to be sourced from the Web.config file, instead of the settings stored in VETtrak. Note: The default configuration set up in VETtrak is generally sufficient for most customer's email needs, and this override option covers some edge cases for where the VETtrak configuration works for VETtrak desktop software but does not work with the Trainer Portal such as NTLM with individual account authorisation. Web Config options explained. OverrideSmtpSettings  Enables or disables mail server settings configured in this file. The SMTP Settings:   SmtpServerHostname,  SmtpServerPort,  SmtpServerSslMode,  SmtpServerAuthType, SmtpServerUsername and SmtpServerPassword   must be provided if this option is set to "true". true: The SMTP server settings in the web.config file will be used for sending email false: The SMTP server settings configured in VETtrak will be used for sending email  <add key="UseLegacySmtpClient" value="false" /   SmtpServerHostname  The hostname of the SMTP server for sending email.

Sending Emails to Students in the Trainer Portal

All email settings for the Trainer Portal are configured within the VETtrak Global Preferences area titled Email Preferences. This configuration will dictate who emails are sent from when using the Trainer Portal. If email has been enabled for your Trainer Portal by the VETtrak administrator, you will be able to send emails to students who have the appropriate contact details recorded. You can send email to an individual student by clicking Send email on the Student screen or in the View Details window.

You can send email to some or all of the students in a class by ticking the appropriate students on the Class screen and clicking Send email. The Send Email window will open:       The From address will default to the default email that is recorded in VETtrak email preferences for your organisation, but you can overwrite it with your own email address. If any of the students do not have an email address recorded in VETtrak, they will be greyed out here. Enter the email subject. Type your message. Click Submit. The email will now be available to view under each student's Messages tab. RELATED: Sending SMS Messages to Students in the Trainer Portal
