[VT_Error] Portal Error and Troubleshooting

54

[VT_Error] Trainer Portal Email Troubleshooting

Trainer Portal email errors typically do not give any information as to what causes them, there are a few things that can be checked in order

to get to the bottom of the issue quickly.

First, the email preferences will need to be checked within VETtrak, within there you’ll be able to check whether the SMTP server details are

misconfigured. If the customer is using Office365 or Gmail, you can compare the details they’ve got configured with the examples in the

Cloud Service Email Settings article to see whether anything is off. In the majority of cases you would expect that either an Office365 or

Gmail server setup would adhere to the details listed in that article as they are standardised.

In cases where a customer is using an SMTP Relay or a mail service other than Gmail or Office365, it is hard to tell whether the details they

have configured are correct. This usually calls for getting their IT team or Mail server admin involved but there are a few things you can in

order to troubleshoot this.

The example below shows an SMTP relay set up for Office365, typically a set up like this would be sending from port 25, port 587 usually

requires the SSL/TLS connection method to be set to explicit and also requires the mail to be authenticated.

55

In essence, even without standardised details it is worth keeping an eye out for anything that may be off within an SMTP configuration as a

first point of call.

If everything seems to be in order with their SMTP details, the next step is to send a test email from within VETtrak - this will bring up an

provide them with the IP address: 103.102.118.1. Note that email from VETtrak is relayed directly via their mail server by VETtrak - there is

no intermediary mail server involved (though some customers may assume there is).

Recently migrated customers

New customers who are using the hosting service, or have recently migrated to the hosting service may initially try to use details for their

local mail server. As out hosting servers are located on a different network to their mail server, this simply will not work. These can usually

be identified by the '11001: [11001] Host not found' error:

Alternatively, their mail server address may be accessible by the Internet but won't allow the user to "relay" email (i.e. deliver email to

a different email server other than itself). This will typically produce the '550 5.7.1: Unable to relay' error message (or similar) when sending

is attempted to any email address outside their own domain. In this case, it's usually possible to simply change the email preferences in

VETtrak to include authentication details for the email server, which will give the user permission to relay.

CODE MESSAGE EXPLANATION/RESOLUTION148

Troubleshooting errors

First steps

Prior to checking anything else, ensure that the following has been carried out:

1. Check 'File', 'Global preferences...', 'Email preferences' and ensure that settings are entered.

2. If the SSL setting is set to 'Automatic', try setting it to either 'None (no SSL)' or 'Explicit'. The automatic setting often chokes and it is

best to set the correct value manually. If you see errors regarding the 'STARTTLS' command - this is probably why.

Email error codes

Below is a list of email errors that can occur when attempting to send email in VETtrak. These take the form of a code and a message. For

server connection problems, you'll get a 5 digit code and a dialog box, for SMTP errors, you'll get a red 'Status' indicator and a 3 digit error

To allow students to direct message their training staff, enable this setting.

This will be on by default. The Trainer Portal messages global preference for viewing messages will likewise need to be enabled. Staff types to allow students to send messages to - In addition to enabling "Can send messages", choose which staff types the student will be able to message. Enabling can send messages without choosing staff types will effectively prevent direct messaging from the Student Portal. Notification Preferences  The Student and Trainer Portal also have some notification preferences that can be set up in the File > Global Preferences area of VETtrak. Click on Notifications to access the specific preferences page of the wizard. Notifications:   When students upload documents through the Student Portal, a notification is sent to staff using the Trainer Portal, it may also optionally email them based on this preference. Turn the Enable notification emails option on to enable notification email functionality. Note: this also affects the Trainer Portal notification email functionality. Enter an email address that the notification will be sent from. This address must have the rights to send mail through the mail server setup in Email Preferences. You can also decide which Staff Types, recorded against the Students enrolment, will be sent notifications. For example, in the above example - assuming

a Trainer, and a Supervisor are all

allocated to the enrolment -

both Supervisor and Trainer would be notified. External links and social icons  Note: The tab for Link has been removed in VETtrak 18.3 and may now be set up via the VETtrak configuration manager with a new node "External links":     See External links in the Web Portals for further information. File Note Configuration  A new public file note has been added to VETtrak 18.3.0.0.

Some configuration of these is managed in a new node in the VETtrak configuration manager.

Ticket Subject: Error sending emails

Good afternoon, I ve been having trouble sending emails to our students and was hoping you d be able to help get this fixed. Yesterday I tried to send a template email with an editable PDF attachment out to students in an occurrence class and received this error as a result. cid:image***.png@**D*****. *****F** I tried to send the email to the students as a manual email, from the occurrence enrolment and from the client view but they wouldn t send either. Today I tried to send the same template email and another editable PDF attachment out again to see if it had been a temporary issue and received this warning before getting to the main email wizard after selecting to use a template email. cid:image***.png@**D*****. *****F** After saying yes and trying to send the emails out with no luck, I went into my staff profile. I had assumed that my email username and password would be the details I use to log into my Microsoft Office *** account, so I entered those details then tried to send a test email but received an error. I ve attached the error in the attached text document. Do you know why VETtrak is suddenly asking for email account details and why it didn t accept the email and password I provided? I double checked the password to make sure it was correct, but VETtrak still came back with an error. Thanks, **********:***************D*****. *****F**

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the email issue in VETtrak. Based on the details provided, it appears that the staff member is unable to send emails from VETtrak, and the sent emails are not appearing in the Sent Items folder.

Here are a few troubleshooting steps you can try:

1. Ensure that the email settings in VETtrak are configured correctly. Check the Global Preferences > Email Preferences section and verify that the SMTP server settings and the default "From" email address are accurate [1].

2. Check if the staff member has the necessary permissions to send emails from VETtrak. The "Email Preferences" section in Global Preferences allows you to configure email permissions for different staff types [3].

3. Try clearing the browser cache and cookies, and then log back into VETtrak. Sometimes, cached data can cause issues with email functionality.

4. If the issue persists, you can try sending a test email from VETtrak to your own email address to isolate the issue further.

If none of these steps resolve the problem, please provide me with more details, such as screenshots of the error message or any specific error codes you're encountering. I'll be happy to investigate further and provide additional guidance.

Thank you,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with sending non-attendance emails from VETtrak. Based on the information provided, it seems that the emails are being sent successfully but not appearing in the sent items folder.

In VETtrak, emails sent from the system are logged and can be viewed in the Messages tab of the respective student's record [2]. So even though the emails are not appearing in your sent items folder, you should be able to see them under the Messages tab for each student you sent the non-attendance email to.

If the emails are not showing up in the student's Messages tab either, I would suggest checking the Email Preferences in VETtrak to ensure the email settings are configured correctly [1]. Make sure the "From" email address is valid and has permissions to send emails through your mail server.

If the issue persists after verifying the email settings, please let me know and I can further investigate potential causes or workarounds.

Thank you,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with sending emails from VETtrak. Based on the information provided, it seems that the emails you are trying to send for non-attendances are not being delivered successfully. [1]

To troubleshoot this issue, please check the following:

1. Ensure that the email settings in VETtrak are configured correctly. The email preferences in the Global Preferences area of VETtrak should have the correct SMTP server details and a valid "from" email address set up. [2]

2. Check if other users in your organization are facing similar issues with sending emails from VETtrak. If not, the issue may be specific to your user account or workstation.

3. Try sending a test email from VETtrak to your own email address to see if the issue is specific to the non-attendance emails or if it's a general email sending issue.

4. If the test email is successful, there may be an issue with the specific non-attendance email process. In this case, I would suggest checking the email templates and any related configurations for non-attendance emails.

5. If the test email is also not being sent, there may be a connectivity issue or a problem with the email server settings. You can try restarting the VETtrak application and your workstation to see if that resolves the issue.

If the problem persists after trying these troubleshooting steps, please provide the screenshot of the error message as requested, and I'll be happy to investigate further. [2] Additionally, you may want to check the VETtrak log files for any relevant error messages related to email sending.

related_knowledge.content:
Sending Emails to Students in the Trainer Portal

All email settings for the Trainer Portal are configured within the VETtrak Global Preferences area titled Email Preferences. This configuration will dictate who emails are sent from when using the Trainer Portal. If email has been enabled for your Trainer Portal by the VETtrak administrator, you will be able to send emails to students who have the appropriate contact details recorded. You can send email to an individual student by clicking Send email on the Student screen or in the View Details window.

You can send email to some or all of the students in a class by ticking the appropriate students on the Class screen and clicking Send email. The Send Email window will open:       The From address will default to the default email that is recorded in VETtrak email preferences for your organisation, but you can overwrite it with your own email address. If any of the students do not have an email address recorded in VETtrak, they will be greyed out here. Enter the email subject. Type your message. Click Submit. The email will now be available to view under each student's Messages tab. RELATED: Sending SMS Messages to Students in the Trainer Portal

To allow students to direct message their training staff, enable this setting.

This will be on by default. The Trainer Portal messages global preference for viewing messages will likewise need to be enabled. Staff types to allow students to send messages to - In addition to enabling "Can send messages", choose which staff types the student will be able to message. Enabling can send messages without choosing staff types will effectively prevent direct messaging from the Student Portal. Notification Preferences  The Student and Trainer Portal also have some notification preferences that can be set up in the File > Global Preferences area of VETtrak. Click on Notifications to access the specific preferences page of the wizard. Notifications:   When students upload documents through the Student Portal, a notification is sent to staff using the Trainer Portal, it may also optionally email them based on this preference. Turn the Enable notification emails option on to enable notification email functionality. Note: this also affects the Trainer Portal notification email functionality. Enter an email address that the notification will be sent from. This address must have the rights to send mail through the mail server setup in Email Preferences. You can also decide which Staff Types, recorded against the Students enrolment, will be sent notifications. For example, in the above example - assuming

a Trainer, and a Supervisor are all

allocated to the enrolment -

both Supervisor and Trainer would be notified.

link.

see

Portal iCal susbscription for further detail.

Quality Assurance:   Tick this box if you want any of your data entered by students to be submitted for Quality Assurance before being saved in VETtrak. Indicate which kinds of data and actions need to pass through Quality Assurance.

As student (client) information is the only data which can be edited through the Student Portal, the only

controllable options are the Add, Edit and Delete privileges for client data. Files:   When students upload documents through the Student Portal, a checkbox will appear for the student to acknowledge a declaration.

The text of that declaration comes from this preference. Use plain text and keep your text to a brief sentence. The text appearing in an unedited preference will default to "I declare that this file is my own work".

Survey:   Enable VET Survey integration into the Student Portal. Note: requires separate product VETSurvey. To add this link, simply turn on this checkbox. Choose the VETSurvey URL from the drop down list of your available VET surveys (predefined list). Enter a Link Name for the preferred link. The name is what will be visible, and clickable for your students. Link:   Show external link in portal menu

The Student Portal also allows you to add a 'custom link' to the menu bar, after student's have logged in. To add this link, simply turn on this checkbox. Enter the Name and URL for the preferred link. The name is what will be visible, and clickable for your students. The URL should be the full address for the site you are linking to (eg: http://www.vettrak.com.au). Messages:   Messaging permissions - can view messages

To allow the students to view direct messages in the student portal, select this box.

Note:

A complimentary setting in the Trainer Portal global preferences for "can send messages" would also need to be enabled for this functionality to work between portals. This will be on by default. Messaging permissions - can send messages

VETtrak 23.3 Release Notes - 02/08/2023 (updated 8/09/2023)

TABLE OF CONTENTS   VETtrak Desktop 23.3.0.1  Email  Other Changes    VETtrak Desktop 23.3.0.0  Compliance  Email  Relationships  Finance  Enrolments  Importers  Data Insights  General  LMS    VTDocs Portal  VTDocs portal 23.3.0.1  VTDocs portal 23.3.0.0    Student Portal  Student portal 23.3.0.1  Student portal 23.3.0.0    Trainer Portal  Trainer portal 23.3.0.2  Trainer portal 23.3.0.1  Trainer portal 23.3.0.0    Progress Portal  Progress portal 23.3.0.1  Progress portal 23.3.0.0    VETenrol  VETenrol 23.3.0.2  VETenrol 23.3.0.1  VETenrol 23.3.0.0           VETtrak Desktop 23.3.0.1  Version released Aug 25th, 2023. Email   File Attachments for secondary recipients.

An issue where, sometimes, a secondary recipient (on the second level of the recipients grid) was not receiving the set of file attachments being emailed to the related primary recipient, has been fixed. Secondary Email Address. An issue has been fixed where emails were not being sent to the secondary email addresses of clients who were configured to receive them. Other Changes   AVETMISS ACT - NAT85 single name reporting. After clarification from Skills Canberra, we have updated the treatment of single-name reporting for students so that all single names will now be reported in both the Client family name AND Client first given name fields in the NAT85. Catapult LMS. When retrieving unit results from Catapult, any Catapult edition code is now ignored when matching the Catapult unit to a VETtrak unit. Finance integrations - Update contact details. An 'Allow updating contact details' setting has been added to the finance configuration Wizard. This setting can be turned off to stop VETtrak from automatically updating the details of contacts in your finance system. VETtrak Desktop 23.3.0.0  Version released Aug 2nd, 2023. Compliance   ACT

Errors/Warnings  Error/Warning Code  Error/Warning Message  Solution  Error 869  Invalid Contract, qualification or Apprentice/Trainee training contract registration number supplied  Within VETtrak, find the client in the Client Manager, edit their Contract and check that the following values match those detailed in the Delivery Schedule provided by DYJESBT  Qualification selected match the Qualification detailed in the Delivery Schedule  The Learner Unique ID (Client -> Edit Personal Information) matches the Learner's ID from the Delivery Schedule  The Regn. No on the Contract within VETtrak matches what is being reported. Error 32003  Module/Competency End date must be before or equal to today  The Unit Result Finish Date cannot be in the future. If the student is still in training, within VETtrak edit the Unit Result to either Continuing (70) or Not Yet Started (85) in the Unit Results Wizard based on if the unit has been started or not. Otherwise the date should be changed to align with the student's records. Error 34002  Withdrawn with no "Hours Attended" reported  Within VETtrak, marking a student as Withdrawn prompts how many hours had been completed in training. If 0 hours has been recorded, you will need to change that unit result from 'Withdrawn' to either 1) Not Yet Started or 2) No Result (How to: Removing Unit Results) Check with DYJESBT as to how you should report these units.

Error 34009  Invalid Tuition Fees Supplied  (Can also be pre-empted via the following VETtrak Alert)    Within VETtrak, edit the Enrolment and check the Pricing Items, ensuring there is at least one Pricing Item labelled as 'Tuition Fee'. If the above is true, then check the Configuration Manager and edit the Funding Source. Ensure the checkbox "This funding source reports a tuition fee" is enabled against the Funding Source used for that enrolment within the Configuration menu.

Occurrence Importer  A basic occurrence importer has been added which can be accessed from the Import section of the Utility menu. The new importer supports occurrence fields and some relationships. Compliance  Vic   VIC AVETMISS performance. Some performance improvements have been made to VIC AVETMISS generation when calculating client fees to report. NSW   Fee Exemption. An entry has been added for the ‘OS’ code for an outreach officer's engagement for NSW ACE, if it doesn't already exist. Provider Calculator Export - PAS number format. The NSW Provider Calculator Export Wizard has been updated to format the PAS Number as 10 digits padding the value with leading 0's as required. LMS  Unenrol from LMS. When using the unenrol from LMS enrolment menu in VETtrak, the wording of the warning has been modified to make it clearer that proceeding may cause data to be removed from the LMS. Catapult result transfer - Unit start date. The Catapult results transfer has been modified so that a unit start date will only be modified if the unit's existing start date is empty, or the unit's existing result is blank or Not Yet Started (outcome code 85 or 105). Finance  Finance integration. Added configurable default values for including new invoices and payments in finance system transfers. General    Email Template CC/BCC. The positions of the CC and BCC Add buttons have been fixed in the Email Template wizard. Occurrence Results Wizard.

When using the Add Client Email Wizette, you can CTRL or SHIFT click to select and add multiple clients to the email at once. Email report to VETtrak. The Email Report Request to VETtrak Wizard, available by right-clicking a report in the Custom Report Manager, now includes the new email composer. This allows you to add formatted text, screenshots or additional attachments to the emailed report request. CLIENT/EMPLOYER CHANGES   Postal addresses. When entering postal addresses, you can now select whether the postal address is a street address or a PO Box address, and the appropriate fields will be shown. When entering a new PO Box address, the PO Box field is pre-populated to prompt you to enter the full PO Box information. Client and Employer information panels. You can now choose whether to show the residential/business or postal address in the information panel in the Client and Employer Managers. If the client has an international address, it will be shown in the information panel. Client division security access. response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding email functionality in the Trainer Portal.

The Trainer Portal does have the capability to send emails to students [2]. This allows trainers to email individual students or an entire class from within the portal.

Regarding receiving replies from students, the references indicate that the Trainer Portal does not have built-in functionality to receive email replies from students [1]. The notification preferences in the Trainer Portal are focused on receiving notifications within the portal itself when students upload documents or send direct messages, rather than handling external email replies.

So while trainers can send emails to students from the Trainer Portal, any replies from students would go to the trainer's regular email inbox outside of the portal. The Trainer Portal itself does not have a dedicated email inbox to receive those replies.

If being able to have a centralized communication flow between trainers and students via email is a desired functionality, I would suggest submitting a feature request to the product team for consideration in future updates. For now, trainers would need to rely on their regular email clients to communicate back and forth with students via email.

Please let me know if you need any other clarification or have additional questions!

Hi,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding email communication between the Trainer Portal and Student Portal.

The Trainer Portal does have the capability to send emails to students [2]. Emails can be sent to individual students or an entire class from within the Trainer Portal. The 'From' address for these emails is configured in the VETtrak Global Preferences under Email Preferences.

For students to be able to reply to these emails and have their replies received in the Trainer Portal, a few settings need to be enabled:

1. In the Student Portal preferences, the "Can view direct messages" option needs to be enabled to allow students to view and reply to direct messages from trainers [3].

2. In the Trainer Portal preferences under the "Messages" tab, the "Can send messages" option should be enabled to allow trainers to send and receive messages [1].

3. The relevant staff types (e.g. Trainers, Supervisors) that students should be able to message need to be selected in the "Staff types to allow students to send messages to" setting [3][1].

4. Notification preferences may also need to be configured to ensure trainers receive notifications for new messages from students [3][1].

Once these settings are properly configured, students should be able to reply to emails sent from the Trainer Portal, and those replies will be received as direct messages in the Trainer Portal. Please let me know if you need any assistance with configuring these settings.

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the Trainer Portal's email capabilities.

Based on the information available, the Trainer Portal allows trainers to send emails to students who have their contact details recorded in VETtrak [2]. However, there is no explicit mention of the Trainer Portal being able to receive replies from students when they respond to emails sent from the portal.

The Student Portal and Trainer Portal have notification preferences that can be configured to allow students to send messages to trainers [4][5]. These messages appear to be internal direct messages within the portals, rather than external emails.

To summarize, while the Trainer Portal can send emails to students, I could not find any information indicating that it can directly receive email replies from students. The direct messaging functionality within the portals seems to be the intended method for student-trainer communication.

If you require the ability for the Trainer Portal to receive email replies from students, I would suggest bringing this up with the ReadyTech team for consideration in a future update. Let me know if you need any further assistance.

Kind Regards,

The web portals will show these links to users. New streamlined attendance recording. The Trainer Portal can use a new customisable streamlined attendance recording process. To enable this, in the Attendance tab in Trainer Portal preferences, select to use Customisable mode (instead of Legacy mode, which is the default). You can configure which attendance types to use for absent and present, which signatures are required, whether notes can be entered, and whether times can be changed. Furthermore, you can override these global attendance recording settings for individual programmes in the Programme wizard (in the Configuration Manager). Event permissions. In the Event wizard, you can now configure whether events of this type can be viewed or added in the Student Portal or Trainer Portal. View unassociated client events. A new function-type entity to "View unassociated client events" has been added to the Trainer Portal roles, which is off by default in existing roles. If you grant View access to this entity in the Security Manager, trainers in that role will be able to see all events associated with any client they have access to (not just events that the trainer is associated with). checkbox.

Sending as SMS

The trainer has the option of also sending the message as an sms to the recipient(s) this can be done by ticking the Also send as SMS checkbox in the bottom right. Once checked this will calculate the cost of credits and display this to the trainer below. If the Trainer is sending a class message and wants to send an sms to the class too the cost will be calculated as before for each student with a mobile. The receipt of messages and emails can be altered by the trainer using the Notifications settings link in the notification pop up menu. VETtrak Trainer Portal preferences  In the VETtrak global preferences modal, under the Trainer Portal, a new Messages tab has been added to globally control viewing or sending messages from the Trainer Portal.

A similar tab has been provided for the Student Portal and would need complementary settings in each for one portal to message the other.

ticket_content.ticket_description: Good morning,    We are having issues with VETenrol email, when a student enrols we get this email below:    You have a problem with your VETenrol SMTP details and one or more client notifications were not sent. Please check and test your SMTP settings as soon as possible.   For more information please refer to the Mail Summary Report accessible from the Reports menu in VETenrol admin portal.   I went to this page on VETenrol and updated the password.       This is the message that comes up            Please could you advise how the error can be fixed.    Kind regards,        *******

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with VETenrol email notifications. Based on the error message "You have a problem with your VETenrol SMTP details and one or more client notifications were not sent. Please check and test your SMTP settings as soon as possible," it seems there is a problem with the SMTP server configuration in VETenrol [1].

Here are some steps you can try to resolve this issue:

1. Verify that the SMTP server details (server address, username, password, port, SSL/TLS settings) entered in the VETenrol admin portal under Configuration > Integration > SMTP Server are correct. Double-check these details with your email service provider or IT team [1].

2. Check if you have enabled email alerts for new registrations in the VETenrol admin portal under Configuration > VETenrol Admin Preferences > Email Alerts [2]. Make sure the email address specified for receiving alerts is valid.

3. Try sending a test email from the VETenrol admin portal using the "Test SMTP Settings" button [3]. If the test email is not received, there may be an issue with the SMTP server credentials or settings.

4. Check your email service provider's spam or junk folders in case the notifications are being marked as spam [3].

5. If you are still experiencing issues after verifying the SMTP settings and email alerts configuration, you may need to reach out to your email service provider or IT team for further assistance in troubleshooting the SMTP server connection [4][5].

If the issue persists after trying these steps, please let me know, and I can further investigate or escalate the matter to our technical team.

Kind regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the VETenrol email notification issue. Based on the error message "You have a problem with your VETenrol SMTP details and one or more client notifications were not sent. Please check and test your SMTP settings as soon as possible," it seems that there is an issue with the SMTP server settings configured in VETenrol [1].

Here are a few steps you can try to troubleshoot and resolve the issue:

1. Ensure that the SMTP server details (server address, username, password, port, and SSL/TLS settings) entered in the VETenrol Integration page are correct [1]. You can compare these with the SMTP settings in VETtrak to ensure they match.

2. If you are using Office365 or Gmail, refer to the Cloud Service Email Settings article for the recommended configurations [6][4].

3. Send a test email from the VETenrol Integration page using the "Test SMTP Settings" button to verify if emails can be sent successfully [1][3].

4. Check if there are any firewall or email server restrictions that may be blocking emails from VETenrol [4].

5. Ensure that the "Email Alerts" settings in VETenrol are enabled, and the correct email addresses are specified for receiving registration notifications [2].

If the issue persists after trying these steps, there may be an underlying issue with the SMTP server or email service provider [6]. In that case, you may need to consult with your IT team or email service provider for further assistance.

Please let me know if you have any other questions or if the issue is resolved after trying the suggested steps.

Thank you,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with VETenrol email notifications not being sent when a student enrolls.

The error message "You have a problem with your VETenrol SMTP details and one or more client notifications were not sent. Please check and test your SMTP settings as soon as possible." indicates that there is an issue with the SMTP server settings configured in VETenrol [1].

Here are a few steps you can try to resolve this issue:

1. Double-check the SMTP server settings in VETenrol by going to Configuration > Integration > SMTP Server. Ensure that the server address, username, port, and SSL/TLS setting are correct [1]. If you are using Office365 or Gmail, compare the settings with the examples provided in our help article [5].

2. After updating the settings, click on the "Test SMTP Settings" button to verify if the test email is sent successfully [1].

3. If the test email is not received, there might be an issue with your email server or firewall settings blocking the emails from VETenrol. You may need to check with your IT team or email service provider to ensure there are no restrictions in place [2].

4. Additionally, ensure that the email address specified for receiving alerts in VETenrol is correct by going to Configuration > VETenrol Admin Preferences > Email Alerts [3][2].

If you continue to face issues after trying the above steps, please let me know. I'll be happy to further investigate and provide additional assistance [1].

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content:
SMTP Server

SMTP Server is a section of the Integration page in VETenrol Admin, which is available from the Configuration (). These settings are to connect to a SMTP mail server in order to send emails from VETenrol. Click the Mail tab on the Integration page to view them. There are two sections:   SMTP Server — Connection details and credentials for the server. Mail Settings — Shows the from address that will be used for emails sent by the specified server. SMTP Server  Completing these details will enable VETenrol to send all automated notifications via the specified mail server instead of using the VETtrak company mail server (not the details entered in the email preferences of the VETtrak software). Your VETtrak mail server settings may assist with completing the settings for VETenrol. Enter the Server address. For example: smtp.yourcompany.com.au  Enter the Username to access the server. Specify the Port the server uses for sending mail. Tick Use SSL/TLS secure connection, if applicable. Click the Save button for the page to commit the change. Important If your mail server uses a port that is NOT the default 25 or 587, please let us know so we can unblock that port on our firewall. Once the details are saved, a button will appear in the bottom corner of the section. Click the Set Password button. This will open a pop up. Enter your Password. Click the Set Password button. Once the password has been set, the section will include an additional button in the bottom corner.

Email Alerts

Settings for Email Alerts are accessed from the Configuration () page in the VETenrol Admin, via the link under VETenrol Admin Preferences. These settings relate to automated email notifications for staff members regarding user activity. Features of the Email Alerts page:   Mail Server button — Navigate to the Integration page for SMTP Server details and mail settings. Save button — Click to commit changes made to the settings. The settings are divided into the following sections:   Registrations  Enquiries  Eligibilities   Each section has an option to enable email alerts for the activity type related to the section. When enabled, the email address where the alert should be sent must be entered. Multiple email addresses for the one type can be included by separating each address with a semi-colon. In the case of the Registrations section, there is also an option for Staff Member Alerts where an email will be sent to the staff member(s) assigned to the occurrence in VETtrak each time someone registers.

Automated email notifications for new VETenrol registrations are not being received

If you are not receiving alerts for new registrations:   Check the email alerts setting is enabled in your VETenrol Admin. Check the email address specified for alerts is still current. Check your junk/spam and clutter folders in your mail client. Try sending a test email using the Test SMTP Settings button from the Mail tab of the Integrations page, available from the Configuration page. If you do not receive the test email, there may be an issue with the credentials entered for your SMTP server.

[VT_Informational] VETenrol SMTP FAQ

Where to access SMTP Settings

For when it comes to emailing out of VETenrol, there is a separate area for managing SMTP settings from what is used in VETtrak, which

will need to be filled in if you would like to send emails out of VETenrol.

Depending on the version of VETenrol you are using, the ways to get there will vary, however both versions we support will be listed below

to cover all bases;

1. New Client Admin VETenrol;

Once signed into the Client Admin Portal for VETenrol, click on the Configuration Cog wheel in the top-right corner

Select the Integration Panel

Under SMTP Server, enter the same details as featured in VETtrak, ensuring 'Use SSL/TLS secure connection?' is also ticked to

indicate the SSL/TLS Method is Explicit

Click Save

Click Test SMTP Settings to confirm whether the test email goes through.

2. Old Client Admin VETenrol;

Along the top row, click Settings -> General Settings

224

Scroll down to the SMTP Settings panel, enter the same details as featured in VETtrak, ensuring 'Use SSL/TLS secure

connection?' is also ticked to indicate the SSL/TLS Method is Explicit.

Click Save

Click Test SMTP Settings to confirm whether the test email goes through.

SMTP Server Set up with Office 365

You will need to use authentication (tick secure checkbox, use port 587) and also provide the username/password of a licensed Office 365

user - it is also possible to set up an email address for this purpose.

[VT_Error] Trainer Portal Email Troubleshooting

Trainer Portal email errors typically do not give any information as to what causes them, there are a few things that can be checked in order

to get to the bottom of the issue quickly.

First, the email preferences will need to be checked within VETtrak, within there you’ll be able to check whether the SMTP server details are

misconfigured. If the customer is using Office365 or Gmail, you can compare the details they’ve got configured with the examples in the

Cloud Service Email Settings article to see whether anything is off. In the majority of cases you would expect that either an Office365 or

Gmail server setup would adhere to the details listed in that article as they are standardised.

In cases where a customer is using an SMTP Relay or a mail service other than Gmail or Office365, it is hard to tell whether the details they

have configured are correct. This usually calls for getting their IT team or Mail server admin involved but there are a few things you can in

order to troubleshoot this.

The example below shows an SMTP relay set up for Office365, typically a set up like this would be sending from port 25, port 587 usually

requires the SSL/TLS connection method to be set to explicit and also requires the mail to be authenticated.

55

In essence, even without standardised details it is worth keeping an eye out for anything that may be off within an SMTP configuration as a

first point of call.

If everything seems to be in order with their SMTP details, the next step is to send a test email from within VETtrak - this will bring up an

Portal SMTP override options

Must be running VETtrak version 18.3.0.x (or higher)  and Trainer Portal v18.3.0.2 (or higher)  or Student Portal v18.3.0.2 (or higher)  It is important that an experienced IT resource is available to manage this process. Version 19.2 (or higher) of the portals and onwards will not need this over-ride, unless using NTLM email. Feature summary  As from version 18.3.0.2 there is an option to override the VETtrak configured SMTP provider. The override allows configuration to be sourced from the Web.config file, instead of the settings stored in VETtrak. Note: The default configuration set up in VETtrak is generally sufficient for most customer's email needs, and this override option covers some edge cases for where the VETtrak configuration works for VETtrak desktop software but does not work with the Trainer Portal such as NTLM with individual account authorisation. Web Config options explained. OverrideSmtpSettings  Enables or disables mail server settings configured in this file. The SMTP Settings:   SmtpServerHostname,  SmtpServerPort,  SmtpServerSslMode,  SmtpServerAuthType, SmtpServerUsername and SmtpServerPassword   must be provided if this option is set to "true". true: The SMTP server settings in the web.config file will be used for sending email false: The SMTP server settings configured in VETtrak will be used for sending email  <add key="UseLegacySmtpClient" value="false" /   SmtpServerHostname  The hostname of the SMTP server for sending email.

ticket_content.ticket_description: I want to change the default email address under the Global Reference/Email Preference and want to know the steps in setting up the email login password. Thank you.

response.answer:
Hi there,

To set up the email login password in VETtrak's Global Preferences, follow these steps:

1. Go to File > Global Preferences > Email Preferences [1]
2. Enable the "Use built-in VETtrak email client" option [4]
3. Enter the email server details like Mail server address (SMTP), Email port, SSL/TLS connection method, and Authentication type [2][4]
4. For the Authentication type, select the appropriate option based on your email service [2]
5. Enter the Email login username as the full email address you want to use for sending emails from VETtrak [1]
6. Enter the Email login password for that email account [1][3]

Make sure the email account you use allows less secure apps or you may need to generate an app password if two-factor authentication is enabled [3]. If you face any error messages related to authentication, you can refer to the troubleshooting tips provided in our documentation [3].

Let me know if you need any further assistance in configuring the email settings.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding changing the default email address and setting up the email login password in VETtrak's Email Preferences.

To change the default email address:
1. Go to File > Global Preferences > Email Preferences
2. In the "Settings" tab, enter the new email address in the "Default from address" field [2]

To set up the email login password for the new email address:
1. In the "Mail Server" tab, enter the email address in the "Email login username" field
2. Enter the password for that email account in the "Email login password" field [1]

Make sure the other email server settings like the mail server address, port number, connection method, etc. are correctly configured for the new email account [4]. If you are using Gmail, you can refer to the specific settings outlined in reference 1.

Let me know if you need any further assistance in configuring the email preferences.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your request regarding setting up the email login password in VETtrak. To configure the email login credentials under the Global Preferences > Email Preferences:

1. Go to File > Global Preferences > Email Preferences
2. On the Mail Server tab, select "Use built-in VETtrak email client"
3. For the Authentication Type, select "User/Password" [2]
4. Enter your full email address as the "Email login username" 
5. Enter your email account password as the "Email login password" [1]

Make sure the other mail server settings like the server address and port number are correct for your email service. If you are using Gmail, refer to the recommended settings in reference [1].

If you encounter any errors like authentication failures (535 5.7.3) or inability to relay (550 5.7.1) after entering the credentials, double check that the username and password are correct [3]. For Gmail accounts, you may need to allow "less secure apps" in your Google account settings.

Let me know if you have any other questions!

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content: Email Preferences  To configure VETtrak to send email via Gmail, go to File > Global preferences > Email preferences, and use the following settings:   Mail server address: smtp.gmail.com  Email port: 587  SL/TLS connection method: Explicit  Authentication type: User/Password  Email login username: Your full email address to your Google account  Email login password: Your password to your Google account  Default from address: The same as the Email login username      If you have VETtrak Security and want each VETtrak user to send email using their own Gmail account, you can instead tick Use individual staff member email logins and clear the Default from address:  Then go to the Staff Manager, find each staff member who logs into VETtrak, right-click the Personal node, select Edit staff member, and enter their email username and password on the third page of the Client Wizard:      NOTES:   When sending email, the From address of the email must match the Email Login Username, otherwise Gmail will discard the email as spam. If you are using Google or Microsoft's two-step verification feature (also known as "multi-factor authentication), you will need to generate an application-specific password for VETtrak. You would then use this password as the Email Login Password when setting up your email in VETtrak.

Authentication type  If authentication is required when connecting to the mail server, select the type. If you do not choose to Use individual staff member logins, you will need to specify an Email login username and the Email login password. If Use individual staff member logins is selected, you will be required to enter the Email Username

and Password for each VETtrak user intending to send emails (This can be located within their Staff Member Wizard). For more information on this, see the article below:   Email: Using Individual Staff Member Logins

Wait time between emails  Depending on your Mail Server settings, you may be required to set a particular wait time between emails in order for the outgoing traffic to be successful, Enter an amount of time (In Milliseconds) here to specify this.

Once connection information is complete, the preferences in the Settings tab should also be reviewed. Choose the Settings tab:    The Settings preferences are:   Default from address  Default reply-to address  For bulk email, send CC/BCC for  Email address separator  Display name in "from" address when sending email from staff member

Default from address  This is the From address that will be used for emails sent from VETtrak.

Note: You can edit the display name of this email address for email recipients to show an 'Alias' name, by formatting the name in quotes, followed by the full email in the correct brackets. "Alias Name" <full_email_address@your_email_domain.com>         Default reply-to address  This is the reply-to address that will be used for emails sent from VETtrak. If there is only one VETtrak user, or if all email replies should go to a single email regardless of who actually sends them from VETtrak, then enter that address here. For example: admin@org.com.au

if your

email server could be blocking emails or if

you need to enter different details into 'File', 'Global preferences', 'Email preferences' to send mail successfully. 530 5.5.1 OR 530 5.7.14  https://support.google.com/mail/answer/14257 (or similar)  This message is typically issued by Gmail indicating that authentication failed. If you are certain the details are correct, they may need to enable less secure apps in their Gmail settings. See Cloud Service Email Settings for more information about configuring VETtrak for Gmail. 535 5.7.3  Authentication unsuccessful  This indicates the authentication settings are not correct. Check the settings entered in 'File', 'Global preferences', 'Email preferences'. If 'Use individual staff member email logins' is ticked, go into the Client Wizard for the affected staff member and ask them to verify the details listed against 'Email username' and 'Email password'. 550 5.7.1  Unable to relay  The user does not have permission to send emails to an external domain. This is usually caused by missing user credentials in 'File', 'Global preferences', 'Email preferences'. 276  Server certificate verification failed. Connection Aborted. This error indicates that the certificate received from the mail server isn't valid.

Email Preferences

The Email preferences section allows users to configure how VETtrak sends emails - this includes additional products that make use of the same email settings, such as the Trainer Portal.

It is possible to use a third-party email client (the default email client for the operating system, such as Microsoft Outlook), or to specify mail server settings for VETtrak to connect to and send without involving another email client. Note: If a third-party email client is used, mail server settings will need to have been configured in that program. Choose File

> Global Preferences. Select Email preferences from the Preference items list. The primary setting is Outgoing Email Preferences, which allows the choice between using VETtrak's built-in email client or an external mail client. If the Use built-in VETtrak email client option is disabled, all other settings will be disabled with the exception of the Email address separator, which is the only applicable setting for external email clients. When Use built-in VETtrak email client is enabled, further preferences can be configured within two tabs:   Mail server  Settings     The Mail server

tab will be chosen by default:    The Mail server preferences are:   Mail server address (SMTP)  Email port  SSL/TLS connection method  Authentication type  Wait time between emails   Note: when configuring Mailserver settings it may be useful to direct your IT team to the Cloud Service Email Settings page: Cloud Service Email Settings. Mail server address (SMTP)  The address used to connect to the mail server needs to be entered here.

Email port  This is the port used. It defaults to the standard 25.

SSL/TLS connection method  If a secure connection is required to the mail server, select the method. Note: The Implicit method has been depreciated and is not recommended for use.

Student Portal preferences setup

VETtrak 17.1.3.0

Once installed, the Student Portal has some additional preferences that can be set up in the File > Global Preferences area of VETtrak. Click on Student Portal to access the specific preferences page of the wizard. Standard Preferences:   Enable account recovery - This tickbox will turn on the ability for students to use a 'forgot password' link from the login page of the Student Portal. The process will generate a new password which will be automatically emailed to the student. Enter an email address that the automatically generated password will be sent from. This address must have the rights to send mail through the mail server setup in Email Preferences. The Account recovery contact phone number will be displayed to the student, in case they have forgotten their username or are unable to reset their password for any reason. External link - The Student Portal also allows you to add a 'custom link' to the menu bar, after student's have logged in. To add this link, simply turn on this checkbox. Enter the Name and URL for the preferred link. The name is what will be visible, and clickable for your students. The URL should be the full address for the site you are linking to (eg: http://www.vettrak.com.au). AVETMISS details - This tickbox will turn on the ability for students to view and edit additional personal details relating to AVETMISS fields on the Personal Details page.

The Your Email Address (from) email address will be automatically filled in here according to which staff member is selected. Note: If a default email address has been specified under File > Global preferences > Email preferences, it will default to that address if no staff member is selected. If you want the From field to display a name as well as the email address, click on the link for instructions on how to do this. If you click the buttons, the Reply To address will be automatically copied into the CC address and/or BCC address field, ensuring that the sender also receives a copy of the message. The Reply to address field can be used to specify an email address to reply to. This can also be set to a default under File > Global preferences > Email preferences. The email addresses of the client(s) / employer(s) you have selected will appear on the left hand side already ticked. You can untick the box of any you wish to exclude. The Recipient types area lists types of related recipients that you can send the email to. Ticking or unticking these will add or remove related recipients of that type to/from the recipient list. The list of recipient types will vary depending on the type of record you're sending the email for.

Email Troubleshooting - Setting up an SMTP Relay

Microsoft and Google are deprecating basic SMTP authentication for Office365 and Gmail. VETtrak and all associated products currently only support SMTP (username and password) authentication so workarounds are needed in order to get past the requirement for Multi Factor Authentication. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Outlook/Office365  Gmail  OAuth 2.0      Outlook/Office365  If you use Office365 as well as the email function within the Trainer and Student Portal/VETenrol, an SMTP relay will need to be set up to get around the need for multi factor authentication. This will need to be configured by your IT team or Mail server admin using the steps in this Microsoft article. Within the article, Option 3 is the easiest to follow, depending on how the relay is set up the VETtrak email preferences can be filled out similarly to the below. SMTP Server: your mx endpoint  SSL/TLS: Automatic  Authentication Type: Not Required          Once this has been set up, you will also need to create a SPF Record, details of this are provided in the article here. Gmail  For Gmail/G Suite users, an application password can be configured within the privacy settings on the admin account, this will allow you to continue using SMTP without having to set up a relay. This is set up within the 2-Step verification options as detailed in this Google article.

If you are using individual staff member email logins or no default from address, it is recommended that you use the File menu -> Security Settings option to set up VETtrak password resets on the third page. Read-only Global Preferences. Read-only users are now able to access Global Preferences. They are not able to change any settings, but they can view and update the registration key. Enrolments grid. response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding email attachment size limits in VETenrol.

VETenrol has a file size limit of 25MB for email attachments when using Google as the SMTP provider [1]. If the file being sent exceeds this limit, you will receive an error indicating "535 5.7.8 Bad Credentials" [1].

To resolve this issue, you would need to either reduce the size of the attachment file, or in the case of a report, reduce the volume of data entry to bring the file size under the 25MB limit [1].

Please let me know if you have any other questions!

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding email attachment size limits in VETenrol.

As per the information in our documentation, there is a file size limit of 25MB for attachments when using Google as the SMTP provider for sending emails [1]. Any file exceeding this limit will result in an error during the email sending process.

Additionally, the Confirmation Emails feature allows including files as attachments to the confirmation email sent to users upon successful registration [2]. However, no specific file size limit is mentioned for this particular use case.

To ensure reliable email delivery, it is generally recommended to keep attachment sizes reasonable, preferably under 10MB. If you need to send larger files, it may be better to provide a download link instead of attaching the file directly.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance regarding email attachments or have additional questions.

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding email attachment size limits in VETenrol.

Based on the information available, there is a 25MB file size limit when using Google as the SMTP provider for sending emails from VETenrol [1]. If the file being sent exceeds this limit, you will likely encounter an error during the email sending process.

Additionally, the confirmation email settings in VETenrol allow you to include a PDF version of the registration details as an attachment [2]. However, this attachment will only be included if an SMTP server has been properly configured for your VETenrol account.

If you need to send larger attachments or have any other questions, please let me know. I'll be happy to assist further.

Kind Regards,

The options are further divided into four sections:   Confirmation Settings  Student Portal Credentials  Group Registration Participants  Custom Confirmation      Confirmation Settings  This section offers the general settings for the confirmation. Do not send confirmation email Toggle this option to globally allow or prevent the sending of the confirmation email that normally goes out upon completion of the registration process. Include copy of registration details as attachment Toggle this option to include a PDF version of the complete registration details as an attachment to the notification email. This attachment will only be included if a SMTP Server has been set up for your VETenrol account. Clients Overview

Manage VETenrol accounts via the Clients > Clients menu option.230

The page consists of two areas:

1. Create/Edit Account - create new account or modify settings for an existing account.

2. Account List - Manage existing accounts.

Features of the Account list

Client ID link - click this to edit the client's account.

Client's Name link - click this to impersonate the client (logs into VETenrol Admin as a Super User).

Enrol Endpoint link - click this to test the API for the client.

eForms link - manage the eForms available from within the Admin for the account. View eForms for VT-DEMO to get eForm IDs.

Can See link - manage other accounts that can be "seen" from the Admin for this account. Use this so an RTO with multiple instances of

VETenrol can manage the Registrations and Enquiries from all of them from a single 'master' Admin.

delete link -  Delete the account and associated registrations, settings, etc.

The eID parameter isn't supported as there is no placeholder for it within VETenrol mail templates at this time. Enrolments     Select Occ enrolment for Context. Enter a meaningful Name for the template. Complete any of the optional fields, as desired, eg. Subject. Enter an appropriate message in the body that includes the VETenrol URL copied from your Admin. Adjust the copied link to include the appropriate additional parameters, such as &altCSS=1. The URL should end with the enrolment ID field from the list on the right so that this can be replaced with the relevant enrolment ID for the client on send. For example: https://enrol.vetenrol.com.au/?clientID=VT-DEMO&altCSS=1&page=SupplementaryForm.aspx&formID=2&eID={EnrolmentId}     This email template can be used by the client manager, by right-clicking an occurrence enrolment and choosing Email client, or from the programme manager via the Enrolments branch of an occurrence (all enrolments, or individually by selecting a client after expanding Enrolments). The positions of the CC and BCC Add buttons have been fixed in the Email Template wizard. Occurrence Results Wizard.

Confirmation Attachments

The Confirmation Attachments feature allows electronic files to be sent with the confirmation email received by users when they successfully register. Attachments are associated with the default confirmation, which applies globally to all registrations unless there is an override in place. Attachments can be associated with the confirmation email as per the following:   For all registrations  Only registrations into:  a specific programme  for any occurrence of that programme. where the occurrence has a specific location. with a specific occurrence. an occurrence with a specific location from any programme. Only one file can be associated with each attachment record so if the same file should also be used for another programme, a new attachment record is needed and the file re-uploaded for it. For example  You want to include a copy of a student handbook as an attachment, however training for one of your programmes is handled by a third party and needs a different file. You would have to either:   Add an attachment record for each of your programmes, except the one that doesn't require it; or  Add a global attachment record and use an override template for the exception. In this article:   Attachments in VETenrol Admin  Creating an Attachment record Managing existing records         Attachments in VETenrol Admin  Attachments is a category of the Confirmation Emails page that is used to manage attachments for the confirmation email.

This email template can be used by the client manager, by right-clicking an occurrence enrolment and choosing Email client, or from the programme manager via the Enrolments branch of an occurrence (all enrolments, or individually by selecting a client after expanding Enrolments). User Experience  The student receiving and clicking on a data completion link will be presented with a page similar to the following:    The screenshot depicts our demo branding, but your organisation's branding will be applied. Data Completion Settings to control the steps in the collection process. Show study reason on confirm step option available from Registration Steps which can help facilitate data completions. Mail Templates for VETenrol.

Site Resources

Site Resources provides online storage for files for use with VETenrol. It is accessed from the Tools menu (). The resources can be used in the VETenrol Admin for any customisable content that accepts HTML to present to users (ie. fields with Editor support ). Examples include Welcome Text, Agreements, LLNs, and within Email Templates. Additionally, resources can also be used in VETtrak for Programme and Occurrence Descriptions. Important  There is a file size limit of 10mb per upload. Choosing a file larger than allowed will result in an 'unepxected error'. The page offers the following features:   File Upload  Browse — Click Choose file or the browse button to locate a file on your computer to upload. Upload — After a file has been selected, click the upload button to transfer the file to our VETenrol servers. Resource List At least one file must be uploaded for the list to display. The URL field provides the link to the file:  Triple-click in the URL field to select the link text, or click and drag across the text. Right-click the highlighted text (or hold down CTRL and tap C on your keyboard) and choose Copy from the menu. The copied link can now be pasted into another area of VETenrol. Click the delete link to permanently remove a file. Related Topics  Some other features where Site Resources may be useful. Email Templates  Custom Agreements (Section)  Custom Question Sets (Section)  LLNs (Section)

This is a separate process Purge USI Identity data process, which has different requirements. This new Purge Documents process will allow users to permanently purge documents from the VETenrol file storage bucket. Once deleted it is not possible to recover these files. When documents are deleted a record is saved in the events logs. Users can choose the date range and the document type, which means for example Identity documents can be deleted separately to other types of documents which may require longer retention periods. ticket_content.ticket_title: Unable to send emails in Vettrak #65973

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with sending emails from VETtrak. The error message you received "SMTP protocol error. SendAsDenied" indicates that the email server is denying VETtrak permission to send emails on behalf of the specified email address [3].

Here are a few steps you can try to resolve this issue:

1. Check the email settings in VETtrak (File > Global Preferences > Email Preferences) and ensure that the correct SMTP server details, port number, authentication type (if required), and email login credentials are entered correctly [1][2][4].

2. If you are using an email account that requires authentication (e.g. Gmail, Office 365), make sure that the email login username and password are correct and have the necessary permissions to send emails from VETtrak [2][4].

3. If you are using a third-party email service, you may need to configure the account to allow VETtrak to send emails on its behalf. This may involve setting up an application-specific password or allowing access for "less secure apps" in the account settings [2].

4. Try disabling any firewall or antivirus software temporarily to check if they are blocking the SMTP connection from VETtrak [1].

If the issue persists after trying these steps, please provide the specific details of your email server configuration, and I can assist further in troubleshooting the issue.

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the email sending issue in VETtrak. Based on the error message "SendAsDenied" and "SMTP protocol error", it appears there is a problem with the SMTP server configuration or authentication in VETtrak [1][5][2].

Here are some troubleshooting steps you can try:

1. Check the email settings in VETtrak by going to File > Global Preferences > Email Preferences. Ensure the correct SMTP server address, port, SSL/TLS connection method, and authentication type are entered [4].

2. If you are using a third-party email service like Gmail or Office 365, make sure the username and password are correct and have the necessary permissions to send emails [6].

3. Try disabling any firewall or antivirus software temporarily, as they can sometimes block SMTP connections [1].

4. Check if your email server has any restrictions or IP filtering that could be blocking emails from VETtrak. If you are a hosted customer, ensure you have requested to unblock your mail server with VETtrak support [1][5].

5. Review the detailed error logs in the Email Wizard for more information on where the process failed [3].

If the issue persists after trying these steps, please let me know, and we can further investigate. Providing the specific error details from the Email Wizard can also help diagnose the root cause [3].

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out about the email sending issue in VETtrak. The error "SMTP protocol error. *** *.*.*** SendAsDenied" indicates that VETtrak is not allowed to send emails on behalf of the specified email address by the email server [2].

To resolve this, I would suggest checking the email server settings configured in VETtrak under File > Global Preferences > Email Preferences [4]. Ensure that the correct email server address, port, SSL/TLS settings, and authentication type are entered for your email server [1][5][2]. If you are using a non-standard SMTP port, you may need to whitelist VETtrak's IP address on your email server [1][2].

Additionally, check if there are any firewall or security settings on your email server that may be blocking VETtrak from sending emails [1][5]. You may need to add an exception or whitelist for VETtrak.

If the issue persists after verifying the email settings, please check the detailed error logs in the Email Wizard and provide those to us for further investigation [3].

Thank you,

related_knowledge.content:
Hosted Customers  If you are hosted with VETtrak, please note that the firewall in our hosted environment only permits email to be sent out of standard SMTP ports (25, 465, and 587). If your mail server is on a non-standard port, please send an email to support@vettrak.io requesting that your mail server be unblocked, indicating the hostname and port number for your mail server. We will only accept unblock requests which specify the mail server hostname in the request. We will not unblock a port to allow connection to all mail servers, apart from the aforementioned standard SMTP ports. Troubleshooting Email Errors  Below is a list of email errors that can occur when attempting to send email in VETtrak. These take the form of a code and a message. For server connection problems, you'll get a 5 digit code and a dialog box, for SMTP errors, you'll get a red 'Status' indicator and a 3 digit error code (and possibly a sub-error code after this). The 'Message' column is an indication only and the actual error returned for a given code will depend on the SMTP server software in use. If your

error matches a code, even if the message is slightly different, it is most likely caused by the same issue as listed in the 'Explanation/resolution' column for that code. Serve     10013  Access denied  VETtrak has been blocked from opening the connection to the mail server. Try disabling any firewall/anti-virus software as this commonly blocks SMTP to prevent viruses mass emailing. If emailing works after having disabled security software, you will likely need to

provide them with the IP address: 103.102.118.1. Note that email from VETtrak is relayed directly via their mail server by VETtrak - there is

no intermediary mail server involved (though some customers may assume there is).

Recently migrated customers

New customers who are using the hosting service, or have recently migrated to the hosting service may initially try to use details for their

local mail server. As out hosting servers are located on a different network to their mail server, this simply will not work. These can usually

be identified by the '11001: [11001] Host not found' error:

Alternatively, their mail server address may be accessible by the Internet but won't allow the user to "relay" email (i.e. deliver email to

a different email server other than itself). This will typically produce the '550 5.7.1: Unable to relay' error message (or similar) when sending

is attempted to any email address outside their own domain. In this case, it's usually possible to simply change the email preferences in

VETtrak to include authentication details for the email server, which will give the user permission to relay.

CODE MESSAGE EXPLANATION/RESOLUTION148

Troubleshooting errors

First steps

Prior to checking anything else, ensure that the following has been carried out:

1. Check 'File', 'Global preferences...', 'Email preferences' and ensure that settings are entered.

2. If the SSL setting is set to 'Automatic', try setting it to either 'None (no SSL)' or 'Explicit'. The automatic setting often chokes and it is

best to set the correct value manually. If you see errors regarding the 'STARTTLS' command - this is probably why.

Email error codes

Below is a list of email errors that can occur when attempting to send email in VETtrak. These take the form of a code and a message. For

server connection problems, you'll get a 5 digit code and a dialog box, for SMTP errors, you'll get a red 'Status' indicator and a 3 digit error

Email Issues and Troubleshooting

Types of Errors  There are two types of errors that you will see when attempting to send emails:   Dialog box

this takes the form of an error dialog that appears after a email has attempted to send. These indicate that the connection with the server was not successfully established. Status error - these show up against each email which could not be sent in the Email Wizard in the form of a red 'Status' indicator. Click the box to determine the error that occurred. If an email in the list appears with a green status indicator, this indicates the email was sent successfully, even if others in the list are marked red. The error code and message are produced by the mail server in this case. The message is provided by the email server and thus messages will vary depending on the SMTP server that is being connected to, even for the same error. When you encounter a Status Error, VETtrak does have the ability to display a more detailed breakdown of the steps your mailserver took when attempting to send the email. This is located in the bottom-right hand side of the wizard, and can be expanded like so:     These details should explain where the process failed, and if you need to send this information to VETtrak Support for troubleshooting you can press the Copy button and paste it into a VETtrak support email.

Email Preferences

The Email preferences section allows users to configure how VETtrak sends emails - this includes additional products that make use of the same email settings, such as the Trainer Portal.

It is possible to use a third-party email client (the default email client for the operating system, such as Microsoft Outlook), or to specify mail server settings for VETtrak to connect to and send without involving another email client. Note: If a third-party email client is used, mail server settings will need to have been configured in that program. Choose File

> Global Preferences. Select Email preferences from the Preference items list. The primary setting is Outgoing Email Preferences, which allows the choice between using VETtrak's built-in email client or an external mail client. If the Use built-in VETtrak email client option is disabled, all other settings will be disabled with the exception of the Email address separator, which is the only applicable setting for external email clients. When Use built-in VETtrak email client is enabled, further preferences can be configured within two tabs:   Mail server  Settings     The Mail server

tab will be chosen by default:    The Mail server preferences are:   Mail server address (SMTP)  Email port  SSL/TLS connection method  Authentication type  Wait time between emails   Note: when configuring Mailserver settings it may be useful to direct your IT team to the Cloud Service Email Settings page: Cloud Service Email Settings. Mail server address (SMTP)  The address used to connect to the mail server needs to be entered here.

Email port  This is the port used. It defaults to the standard 25.

SSL/TLS connection method  If a secure connection is required to the mail server, select the method. Note: The Implicit method has been depreciated and is not recommended for use.

add an exception to allow VETtrak to send emails. 10060  Connection timed out   VETtrak was unable to contact the mail server. Check the settings entered in 'File', 'Global preferences', 'Email preferences'. In particular, if you are a hosted customer, ensure you do not have a local address here. If you are hosted with VETtrak, and are using a non-standard SMTP port, you must contact VETtrak support to request your mail server be unblocked. See Hosted Customers above for more information. 11011  Host not found  The DNS lookup for the mail server failed. Check the settings entered in 'File', 'Global preferences', 'Email preferences'. In particular, if you are a hosted customer, ensure you do not have a local address here. 421 4.3.2  Service not available  This is an error returned by the mail server indicating that it doesn't want to service the request. This could be due to IP filtering, etc. being applied on the mail server. Check

if your

email server could be blocking emails or if

Email Preferences  To configure VETtrak to send email via Gmail, go to File > Global preferences > Email preferences, and use the following settings:   Mail server address: smtp.gmail.com  Email port: 587  SL/TLS connection method: Explicit  Authentication type: User/Password  Email login username: Your full email address to your Google account  Email login password: Your password to your Google account  Default from address: The same as the Email login username      If you have VETtrak Security and want each VETtrak user to send email using their own Gmail account, you can instead tick Use individual staff member email logins and clear the Default from address:  Then go to the Staff Manager, find each staff member who logs into VETtrak, right-click the Personal node, select Edit staff member, and enter their email username and password on the third page of the Client Wizard:      NOTES:   When sending email, the From address of the email must match the Email Login Username, otherwise Gmail will discard the email as spam. If you are using Google or Microsoft's two-step verification feature (also known as "multi-factor authentication), you will need to generate an application-specific password for VETtrak. You would then use this password as the Email Login Password when setting up your email in VETtrak.

Portal SMTP override options

Must be running VETtrak version 18.3.0.x (or higher)  and Trainer Portal v18.3.0.2 (or higher)  or Student Portal v18.3.0.2 (or higher)  It is important that an experienced IT resource is available to manage this process. Version 19.2 (or higher) of the portals and onwards will not need this over-ride, unless using NTLM email. Feature summary  As from version 18.3.0.2 there is an option to override the VETtrak configured SMTP provider. The override allows configuration to be sourced from the Web.config file, instead of the settings stored in VETtrak. Note: The default configuration set up in VETtrak is generally sufficient for most customer's email needs, and this override option covers some edge cases for where the VETtrak configuration works for VETtrak desktop software but does not work with the Trainer Portal such as NTLM with individual account authorisation. Web Config options explained. OverrideSmtpSettings  Enables or disables mail server settings configured in this file. The SMTP Settings:   SmtpServerHostname,  SmtpServerPort,  SmtpServerSslMode,  SmtpServerAuthType, SmtpServerUsername and SmtpServerPassword   must be provided if this option is set to "true". true: The SMTP server settings in the web.config file will be used for sending email false: The SMTP server settings configured in VETtrak will be used for sending email  <add key="UseLegacySmtpClient" value="false" /   SmtpServerHostname  The hostname of the SMTP server for sending email.

VETtrak can only be configured to use 1 SMTP server. It's not possible to use both your existing SMTP server and a 3rd party SMTP server at the same time for sending emails  Test your SMTP setup carefully. Send test emails to a variety of email addresses (eg. gmail, hotmail etc) and check with the recipients that they have received the emails and if there any were detected as spam or were delayed. The analytic tools provided by your SMTP server should help trace the status of email delivery. If you need assistance, please reach out to the SMTP server support team with your issue. VETtrak does not have a relationship with any SMTP provider. Please check directly with the provider about their terms and conditions of service.
