ticket_content.ticket_description: Hi I m trying to run a data insights query but can t find one of the fields. Can you let me know where I can locate Learner Unique Identifier field? It s input at the client basic details level so I would have assumed searching through the client drop down would have been the right place but I can t seem to find it. I might be looking in the wrong spot so if you can let me know how i can pull that data set that would be great. Regards

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding locating the Learner Unique Identifier field in the Data Insights Manager.

The Data Insights Manager allows you to query a wide range of data fields related to clients, enrolments, and other entities [2]. To access client-related fields like the Learner Unique Identifier, you would start by creating a new query and selecting "Client" as the "Query On" option [1]. This will populate the available fields related to client records.

However, after reviewing the documentation, I could not find any specific mention of a "Learner Unique Identifier" field. This may be a custom field that has been added to your VETtrak instance. If that is the case, custom fields are typically available for querying in the Data Insights Manager under the relevant entity (in this case, Client) [4].

If you are still unable to locate the Learner Unique Identifier field, I would suggest checking with your internal team or administrator to confirm if this is a custom field and its exact name in the system. Once you have the correct field name, you should be able to query it from the Client entity in the Data Insights Manager.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance or have additional details that could help me better understand and locate this field.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your query regarding the Data Insights Manager. To locate the "Learner Unique Identifier" field when creating a query:

1. Start by creating a new query and selecting "Client" under the "Query On" option [2]. This will allow you to query and select fields related to client records.

2. Once the Client fields are available, look for the "Learner Unique Identifier" field under the "Client Details" section [1]. It may be listed as "Learner ID" or something similar.

3. Click and drag this field into the "Query Fields" area to include it in your query output [1].

If you are still unable to locate the "Learner Unique Identifier" field, it's possible that this particular field is not currently available for querying in Data Insights. In that case, I will need to raise this internally with our development team to potentially add this field as a queryable option in a future release.

Please let me know if you have any other questions!

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your query regarding the Learner Unique Identifier field in Data Insights. Based on the information in our help documentation, the Learner Unique Identifier field is available for querying in Data Insights under the Client section [3].

Specifically, you should be able to locate it by starting a new query and selecting "Query On" as Client. Then, in the list of available fields, look for "Learner Unique Identifier" under the Client section [3].

If you are still unable to find this field after following these steps, please let me know and I will further investigate the issue. Additionally, you can try searching for "Learner Unique Identifier" in the Data Insights field list to quickly locate it [5].

Please let me know if you need any other assistance with running queries or using Data Insights.

Kind regards,

related_knowledge.content:
Process: Updating Enrolment Fields Using the Data Insights Manager

Once you have queried data within the Data Insight Manager,

you may then choose to action updates or changes to the data. There is a range of options available to update specific data within your Student Enrolments. Begin by accessing the Data Insights Manager by going to the Report menu, and selecting

Data Insights:

Start by creating a

Query on the left hand side, by right clicking on Data Insight Queries and selecting

Add Query:     The right hand side of the manager will update, with options that allow you to create your query. The query will represent what kind of data you want to look up - For this example, we will update Enrolment Statuses, so we need to select the Query On option for Client Enrolment.

Selecting Client Enrolment will provide you wish a list VETtrak data fields to select from. These represent the criteria you may wish to use for your query, or the information you wish to see.

The two windows on the right hand side are Query Fields and Query Criteria. In the Query Fields

section, you choose the details you wish to see. To do this, you can Click, and drag items from the left field into this Query Fields area, or press the  [+] button in the  query fields column. A standard set of details to check Client Enrolments would likely be the Enrolment Dates (Start Date/Finish Date), the Qualification Name and the Clients Name (Client Given Name and Client Surname). I do this by finding these fields and adding them into the Query Fields

area using the following process:  For the Qualification Name, locate Qualification

in the list and press the Follow Relationship  button to view a list of available Qualification

fields:     From this area, Click and drag Name

from the left field into the Query Fields area, or press the  [+] button in the

Data Insights Manager Overview

The

Data Insights Manager

gives you unencumbered access to the data you have entered into your VETtrak system, with a full suite of options that allow you to query and interact with your data in unique and dynamic ways. Create and amend queries: Look up information with a freedom to specify exactly what you want to see, with the option to robustly

filter

your returned results. Bulk update fields:

Introducing new functionality to amend specific fields

within your database for a number of entries, such as employers, dates and more. Contact specific clients:

Define

and retrieve particular client

sets, then contact them via whatever method you prefer. Structured report creation: Set up a looping option to create reports for a

set

of people, without needing to repeat the process – Including automatically saving the exported report for your review. To open the Data Insights Manager, choose Report

> Data Insights

from the menu. Alternatively, click the

icon on the toolbar or from the Dashboard. This will display the standard Data Insight Manager interface:     Data insight query repository - The left hand window contains all of your created Data Insights queries, and it also used to create new queries by right-clicking the Data insight queries folder and selected Add query. This are also allows you to create Folders to organise and sort your queries by right-clicking on an existing folder and selecting Add subfolder:   You can the organise queries within these folders, as well as set permissions for what folders should be accessible by what VETtrak User roles. Selected data insight query - The right hand panel is defaulted to explain the basic details of the Data Insights Manager, with links to this User Guide and the VETtrak Data Dictionary. Once a Query is created/selected, this window will change to display the Data Insights editing tools:

In the Programme Manager for an occurrence, you can now right-click the Enrolments node and select "View records in Data Insights" -> "Clients" or "Client enrolments" to automatically generate and run a simple Data Insights query that shows the clients or enrolments in that occurrence. This is useful for running bulk actions on those records. FileTrak data. In Data Insights, new "File links" relationships have been added to allow you to query metadata about the files/documents that are linked to various records. Date calculations. Additional date calculations for the start/end of the next/last week/month are now available in Data Insights. Queries with recursive relationships. An error that occurs when saving a Data Insights query that contains the same relationship repeated multiple times in the one field has been fixed. Web Portal changes   Web client matching. When matching web clients, if there are no clients in the database with a surname starting with the web client's surname, the initial search results will be empty to indicate this (you can still perform searches as normal). Also, VETtrak will warn you if you elect to match to an existing client that has a different name to the web client. Idle session expiry. The Notifications preference page has been renamed to "Portal preferences" and a new setting added to it to control how long web portal users are allowed to keep their session idle before being automatically logged out.

When changing the status type of occurrence enrolments, you will also get the option about whether to add the clients to or remove the clients from classes. VET FEE-HELP. VET FEE-HELP data is now available for querying in Data Insights. You can run bulk email, bulk generation of CANs or Invoice Notices, and bulk update of completion statuses on client's VET FEE-HELP courses of study. Hide opposite relation. To avoid confusion, when expanding relations, Data Insights will now hide the "opposite" relation that refers back to the record you just came from. For example, if you start with Client, then expand Enrolments, it will not show the Client relation within Enrolments, as that refers back to the client you started with. Error with conjunctions containing conjunctions. An error that can occur when running a query that has a conjunction (AND/OR) that contains nothing but other conjunctions, has been fixed. Custom field changes   Contracts. Custom fields are now available for contracts. They can also have values in contract profiles and their values copied to new contracts created from the profile. They are also available for querying in Data Insights. Placements. Custom fields are now available for placements. They can also have values in placements within contract profiles and their values copied to new placements created from the profile. They are also available for querying in Data Insights. VET FEE-HELP client courses of study.

When units are automatically started due to task activity or class attendance, and the unit has a training plan end date that is after the start date, then the end date of the unit will be set to the training plan end date. Unit result importer enrolment ID. If an Enrolment ID has been specified in the spreadsheet being used in the Unit Result Importer, the importer will use this to identify the enrolment to update, and the qualification is not required to be in the spreadsheet. Data Insights changes   Pricing, Invoices, Payments. Enrolment pricing, invoices and payments are now available to be queried in Data Insights. You can run invoice reports and receipt reports in bulk for found invoices or payments. Bulk add event. A new bulk action to add event is now available when querying clients, staff, employers, client enrolments and occurrences in Data Insights. This allows you to add the same event in bulk to the found records. Staff credential notes. The Notes field for a staff credential is now available in Data Insights. FileTrak changes   File size warning. The FileTrak wizards will now show a warning if you are uploading a file that is 50MB or more in size into the document database. Email file. An Email button has been added to the FileTrak file grids, allowing you to more easily send a standard or templated email with that file as an attachment. Report changes   High DPI support for report dialogs. Report dialogs will now scale to suit your computer's DPI setting.

Students enrolled into a

Qualification within a

Date Range. Of course you can add additional filters to shape your data further, depending on your needs. Some basic examples of how I could expand this query could include details such as:   Enrolment Status  Referral Source  Employer linked to Enrolment  Is an Award Recorded   ...and more than could be realistically listed here. Data Insights does factor in almost any data relationship that you have created via your data entry. A good rule of thumb is to always

start with limited criteria, and then build upon it to work towards your output goal. This makes troubleshooting your query easier.

Now is a good time to enter a

Name for your query at the top of this panel, and press the Save button

to record the query to your database. The query will then appear on the left hand side in the Data insight query list.

At this point, you can now press the Run Query () to display the output of your query! This will change the Query panel to display the Results tab, and show your query output:    The details you have retrieved appear in a list, and can be sorted by clicking/dragging headings into the gray bar at the top of the list. To return to the Query editor screen, press the Query tab at the top of this window.

The real strength of Data Insights at this point is that now you have this list of people, unlike a report that only displays the data - you can now choose what you wish to do with your output. This can range from simply exporting the information into a spreadsheet to be reviewed separately, contacting the listed people via SMS/Email, running additional reports or even amending particular information within the Students' enrolments. For more information about what exports/actions can be taken with your outpiut data - take a look at our Performing Actions On Your Data Insights Query Output article.

This allows you to easily assign the client access to your web portals, force the client to change their password on next login, set a new password for the client and optionally distribute it to them via email or SMS template at the end of the wizard, or trigger the web portal password reset process for the client so they can set their own password using a web portal. The username and disable login fields have also been moved to this page. This page can only be accessed by users with access to Security, or if the client does not have access to any applications other than the Student or Progress Portal. The Primary Email and Primary Mobile Number fields have been added to the first page of the Client wizard, so they can be used to distribute the password to a new client. Bulk reset passwords in Data Insights. A new Reset Passwords bulk action has been added to Data Insights when querying clients or client enrolments. This allows you to force password change on next login, set and distribute new passwords via email or SMS template, or trigger the web portal password reset process for many clients in bulk that match whatever criteria you require. Note that the Password field is no longer available in Data Insights, as it is impossible to retrieve a client's existing password.

New options are now available for the TCSI Course Outcome Code (E599). TCSI Highest Attainment. A Highest Attainment code of "000" will now be reported to TCSI instead of blank if the client does not have any prior education and the start date is 2020 or later. Data Insights   Save as new query. A new "Save as new query" button has been added to Data Insights. Pressing this will ask you to enter a name, and will then save your query as a new query. This is useful if you have made changes to a query and want to save your changes as a new query instead of updating the original query. Calculated date adjustment. When using calculated date criteria in Data Insights, you can now apply an adjustment to add or subtract a specified number of days, weeks, months or years to the calculated date. Payment plan data. Information about invoice payment plans is now available in Data Insights. You can start a query from Payment Plan Account, or access Payment Plans from Client, Employer or Invoice. File link changes. Several changes have been made around file links:  A new Query On option of “File link” has been added, to now make it possible to report (and to perform bulk actions) on File link records. A new updateable field, Review date has been added. A relationship has been added from File Link to File Information.

When an importer layout includes fields for a sub-ordinate record, but all of these fields are empty for a row in the import files, then the subordinate record is now ignored completely and the import record is shown as Valid for Import (Green). For example, if importing a client and all employment fields are empty, the import row is valid to import (without any employment record). Data Insights   Created and last updated user. You can now access the created user and last updated user for Awards, Clients, Client Enrolments, Employer Enrolments, Enrolled Units, Invoices, Payments, Staff and Task Enrolments in Data Insights. Web enrolment ID. The "Web enrolment ID" field is now available in the Client Enrolment and Employer Enrolment tables in Data Insights. Invoice report bulk action. An issue in the Email Template Wizard when bulk emailing a mixture of client and employer invoices has been fixed. Select Groups error. An error that occurs when attempting to assign clients to groups in Data Insights has been fixed. General   Select Groups error. An error that occurs when attempting to assign clients to groups in Data Insights has been fixed. Backup wizard timestamp. The VETtrak version number and the current time is now included in the filenames of Firebird database backup files created in the Backup wizard. Images. New images have been introduced for contracts, enrolments, states, and holidays.

The Organisation Wizard and Employer Wizard image fields have also been updated, supporting more image formats and the `Fit` option. LMS   Moodle course content access.

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for your request regarding reporting on commencing status in VETtrak. Unfortunately, there does not appear to be a dedicated standard report for this purpose [1][2]. However, VETtrak does provide some functionality related to tracking commencing status:

- The Training Plan Wizard allows entering "Not started" results for units from a spreadsheet import, which could indicate units or enrolments that have not yet commenced [1].

- For Smart and Skilled reporting in NSW, VETtrak supports recording units as "not yet started" with indicative start/end dates to meet reporting requirements [2].

So while there is no specific commencing status report, you can use the above methods to track and report on units or enrolments that have not yet started. I would suggest exploring the Training Plan Wizard and Smart and Skilled reporting options to see if they meet your needs for reporting on commencing status.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance or have additional requirements around this.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your request regarding finding a report to show the commencing status in VETtrak. There is no specific standard report for this, but there are a few options to get this information:

1. The Record Results wizard allows you to enter future dated results with no result type selected. This can be used to indicate units that have not yet commenced [2].

2. In Data Insights, you can build a query on the Enrolled Unit table and filter/report on fields like the Unit Result Finish Date or Unit Result Start Date to identify units that have not commenced based on those dates being empty or in the future [1].

3. The Training Plan Wizard allows you to populate training plan details like indicative start and end dates at the enrolment or unit level. You can then report on those fields through Data Insights queries or custom reports [1].

I would suggest exploring those options to meet your reporting needs around commencing status. If you need any other assistance or have additional requirements, please let me know.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for your request regarding a report for showing commencing status in VETtrak. Unfortunately, there does not appear to be a standard report specifically designed to show the commencing status of students [1][2]. 

However, there are a few potential workarounds that may help track commencing status:

1. You can use the Training Plan Wizard from Data Insights to perform bulk actions on fields related to commencing, such as setting indicative start/end dates for units that have not yet commenced [1].

2. For Smart and Skilled reporting in NSW, you can enter indicative start/end dates with no result for units that have not commenced yet. These will then be reported accordingly [2].

3. You could potentially create a custom report request to design a report specifically for showing commencing status based on certain criteria.

If none of those options are suitable, I would suggest exploring the creation of a custom report tailored to your needs for tracking commencing status. Please let me know if you need any assistance with submitting a custom report request.

Thank you,

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for your request regarding accessing the VETtrak SQL database directly. To allow direct database access for reporting and data analysis, we would need to provide you with a copy of your VETtrak database on our secure server [1]. Our infrastructure team can mount a copy of your database and grant you the necessary permissions to connect to it directly using a SQL client tool.

For connecting to the SQL Server database, you would need the connection string details which include the server name, database name, and authentication credentials [2]. Our team can provide you with these connection details once the database copy is ready on the secure server.

Please note that while the Data Insights feature in VETtrak allows some querying and analysis capabilities [3], direct database access would give you more flexibility to run custom queries and extract data as needed for your reporting requirements.

I would suggest providing more details on the specific reporting or analysis needs you have, so we can better understand the requirements and ensure appropriate database access is set up for you. Please let me know if you need any other information from our side.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry about accessing the VETtrak SQL database directly for reporting and data analysis purposes.

VETtrak has a built-in Data Insights Manager feature that allows you to query and analyze the data in your VETtrak system [3]. This provides a robust set of options to interact with your data and generate custom reports and analyses without needing direct database access.

If the Data Insights Manager does not meet your specific reporting needs, you can also submit custom report requests to have reports designed and exported in an Excel-friendly format like XML or CSV [5]. Please provide details on the desired report layout and data requirements, and our team can assist in creating a custom solution.

Direct access to the VETtrak SQL database is generally restricted, as this contains sensitive client data. However, if you have a specific use case that cannot be addressed through the built-in reporting tools or custom reports, please let me know the details and I can explore potential options [4][2].

I would recommend starting with the Data Insights Manager and custom report requests, as these are designed to provide secure and user-friendly access to your VETtrak data for analysis purposes. But if you have any other questions or needs around reporting and data access, feel free to reach out.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding accessing the VETtrak SQL database directly for reporting and data analysis. VETtrak does allow direct access to the SQL database, however there are some important considerations:

- The database connection details can be configured through the VTConfig tool as outlined in reference [2]. This will allow you to point VETtrak to your SQL Server instance and database.

- For reporting within VETtrak, the recommended approach is to use the built-in Data Insights feature [3]. This provides a robust querying tool to analyze your VETtrak data without needing direct database access.

- If you require custom reports or data exports beyond what Data Insights offers, you can submit a request through the custom report process outlined in [5]. Our team can then assist with extracting the needed data in an Excel-friendly format.

- While direct database access is possible, we recommend exercising caution as any changes made directly in the database could potentially cause issues within VETtrak [1][4]. The database should be treated as read-only unless you have specific guidance from our team.

If you still need direct database access for advanced reporting needs after exploring Data Insights and the custom report process, please let me know and I can provide the specific connection details for your SQL Server instance. However, I would suggest first evaluating if the built-in tools can meet your requirements to avoid any unintended consequences from direct database modifications [1][4].

Please let me know if you have any other questions!

Video: VETtrak Training Webinar - Data Insights

This webinar was delivered by Kurt Druzynski on the 27th of April, 2018. The

Data Insights Manager is a robust feature for VETtrak that gives you unencumbered access to the data you have entered into your VETtrak system, with a full suite of options that allow you to query and interact with your data in new and dynamic ways. The following webinar was developed to introduce you to the strengths of the Data Insights Manager:

Should you wish to utilise the queries created alongside this webinar, you can do so via the links below:   Webinar Query 2 Clients to be archived (from before 2018).vtdq (3 KB)  Webinar Query 1 Clients who finished a year ago (With awards issued).vtdq (3 KB)

To import these queries into your VETtrak system, navigate to the

Data Insights Manager by going to the

Reports menu, and select

Data Insights. Right-click

the

Data Insight queries option, and select

Import query from file:

Within the wizard that appears, press the Browse button, and locate the files you have downloaded to your computer, so that your window appears like so:      Press Next and Finish to complete the process. The query will now appear in your Query Repository ready to use!

prioritised over archived or occasionally used reports. The objective is to get the list of manually converted reports down to the feasible

quantity of 40 or less.

To identify which reports the customer actually uses the below query can be run on their database. VETtrak stores a record whenever a

report is run and this query identifies reports that have been run within the last year. This will need to be run by the infrastructure team

member who is handling the migration as they will have access to the database.

Note that recording report runs were only added in VETtrak version 20.2 on.

Some notes and additional information

The database conversion requires an RTO to completely go offline for the duration. This has the potential to be an entire day of

business. Murray will do this on the weekend if necessary. Clear with him first before raising it with the client.

Some leading questions to ask:

How long has this been happening?

Is this for all trainers or only a single one?

If you run a speed test, what results do you get? (www.speedtest.net)

How many active enrolments do you have for year?

How many total enrolments?

How many employer records are listed in your database?

identify slowness

expiration in order for them to test their migration to the other provider. They will also be sent a copy of their database after their

subscription has expired to account for any further data entry they perform while still within their subscription period.

Run Reports in Bulk

VETtrak has the ability to run reports in bulk, either for a group of people or an individual. You can then choose how you wish for the reports to be output, whether they are saved to a folder or attached to an email and sent to the student referenced in the report. This option is accessed by either Right-Clicking an Enrolment and selecting Run Reports:     Or by selecting Run Report from the Action Menu after running a Data Insights Query: This will display the Bulk Run Reports Wizette:     In the first dropdown you can select the reports you wish to run on this data - This allows you to select any number of relevant reports via a tickbox selection:     You can then choose the Output for the reports, including:   Email - This will prompt for the reports to be exported to a PDF file format and attached to an email addressed to the client. Save to folder - This will process the export of the reports to a PDF file to be saved to a folder of your choice. Save to document database - If you have the FileTrak document database functionality, this will prompt for the reports to be saved to a PDF file and saved within your document database. These can then be accessed remotely by a tool such as VTDocs if it has been configured, or within the VETtrak system. Select as many output options as you would require. When you press Finish, this will then Run the reports in bulk and Output them as per your selection.

Setting Up A Document Database

As a local VETtrak customer, there are some steps that need to be completed in order for you to start making use of a Document Database storage solution for files, including downloading a blank database and connecting your VETtrak software to it. This document database can then be used to store documents related to your VETtrak data in a central location. For more information see our Linking Documents & Files Within VETtrak article. Contact VETtrak Support via support@vettrak.io to have these features enabled on your account    Downloading a Blank Document Database  You will need to download a blank database that can be used to store your files. The process required to set up your documentdatabase will differ depending on the database structure you make use of for VETtrak. You may need to contact your Database Administrator to assist with setting up the blank document database. Firebird database users  Download the VETtrak Document Database (blank - for Firebird) from the Downloads section in the Support Centre, then extract it into the same location as your VETtrak database, or another suitable location. A common location is in the Data folder where your VETtrak software is installed. MS-SQL database users  Download and restore VETtrak Document Database (blank - for SQL Server) from the Downloads section in the Support Centre to your SQL Server database server.

Configuring the Database Connection  Go to File > Global preferences and select Document database:     Within this area, you will need to:   Select the type of database you are using for your document database - Firebird or Microsoft SQL Server. Enter the connection information for your document database, including the user details and the location of the database. Click Test Now! to test the connection to the database. With these settings configured correctly, your document database should now be functional and ready to store documents!

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for your request. Here are the steps to retrieve the requested information from VETtrak:

1. To view all current state funding sources, go to Configuration Manager > Funding Sources. You can expand each state to see the available funding sources and their details [1].

2. For the Pre Qualified Supplier Number in QLD, this may be stored as a Purchasing Contract. Go to Configuration Manager > Purchasing Contracts > Queensland to view and add new QLD purchasing contracts [3][2].

3. The QLD purchasing contracts can also be managed from Configuration Manager > Purchasing Contracts > Queensland [3][2].

4. For SA purchasing contracts, these are required fields that RTOs receive from the government. You can add and view them under Configuration Manager > Purchasing Contracts > South Australia [3][2].

5. VIC specific funding sources are listed under Configuration Manager > Funding Sources > Victoria [1].

6. For NSW fee concession funding models, these may be set up as Funding Models which can then be selected when creating enrolments. Go to Configuration Manager > Funding Models to view and create new funding models [4].

I'd recommend exploring the Configuration areas mentioned above to locate and manage the different data fields you need. Let me know if you need any other assistance!

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding retrieving funding source information from VETtrak. Here are the details on how to access the requested fields:

For State Funding Sources, you can find and manage them under the Configuration Manager. Go to Manage > Configuration, then expand the "Funding Sources" node. Here you can view, add, edit, or archive funding sources for different states [1]. Some states like NSW use "Course Site IDs" and WA uses "Contracted Programme of Study (CPS)" numbers as their funding source codes [1].

The Pre Qualified Supplier Number is likely referring to the "Code" field when adding a new funding source in VETtrak [1].

For Queensland Purchasing Contracts, you can manage them under Configuration Manager > Purchasing Contracts > Queensland [2]. Right-click and choose "Add new purchasing contract" to add a new one with the provided code and schedule number [2].

Similarly for South Australia, the Purchasing Contract field is a required field that RTOs receive from the Purchasing section of DFEEST [2].

For Victoria Specific Funding, these are the various state funding sources listed under the Victoria node in the Funding Sources section of Configuration Manager [1].

For NSW Fee Concession, you can find the list of fee waiver/exemption codes like "W461: NSW Fee Free – General" under Configuration Manager > Funding Models [4]. These can then be applied when calculating fees using a selected funding model.

The Funding Models themselves allow you to set up templates for pricing items and fees charged for enrolments. You can create and manage them under Configuration Manager > Funding Models [4].

Please let me know if you need any further assistance in accessing or using these funding source related fields in VETtrak [5][1][2][4].

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for your request regarding how to view and report on state-specific funding and contract information in VETtrak.

To view the current state funding sources for your RTO, you can go to Manage > Configuration in VETtrak. Under the Funding Sources node, you will see the list of configured funding sources organized by state [1]. You can expand each state to see the individual funding source codes and descriptions. From here, you can also add new funding sources if needed for your state [1].

For Queensland purchasing contracts, these are set up under the Purchasing Contracts node in Configuration [3]. You can add new QLD purchasing contracts by right-clicking on the Queensland node [2]. The purchasing contract code and schedule number provided by the QLD government would be entered here.

Similarly for South Australia, the purchasing contract field is a required field that is provided by the DFEEST Purchasing section [3][2]. You can configure SA purchasing contracts under the Purchasing Contracts node.

For Victoria, the specific funding source identifiers (e.g. L for User Choice, T for Tender) are included in the standard VIC funding source codes [1][6]. When setting up enrolments for VIC, be sure to select the funding source with the correct national funding source code (31 or 32 for overseas students).

For NSW fee concessions and exemptions, these are configured as Fee Waiver codes in VETtrak [7]. The various fee waiver codes like W461 for Fee Free should be available to select when recording enrolments.

You can also link fee concessions to funding models in VETtrak [4]. Funding models allow you to template out the pricing structure, including any concessions or exemptions that would apply.

To generate reports showing the enrolments and their associated funding sources, purchasing contracts, fee concessions etc., you can use the Enrolments report available under each of the Funding Sources, Purchasing Contracts and Fee Waiver nodes [1][2].

Please let me know if you need any other assistance regarding reporting or configuration of these items in VETtrak.

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content:
Funding sources

A Funding Source represents the method by which an enrolment fee is paid; either from a government funding pool or the client paying a fee for the service. The state governments for ACT, NT, Qld, SA, Tas and Vic have a set of standard, government-recognised funding sources for use, many of which are available in VETtrak by default. If there are any funding sources that you need that are not included by default, you can create a corresponding Funding Source in VETtrak at your convenience. NOTE: NSW - The state funding sources in NSW are called Course Site IDs and are issued to the RTO by the NSW government. When creating a new funding source, Course Site ID goes into the Code field. NOTE: WA - The state funding sources in WA are called Contracted Programme of Study (CPS) numbers are are issued to the RTO by the WA government. When creating a new funding source, the CPS number

goes into the Code field. Open the Configuration Manager by choosing Manage > Configuration

from the menus. The Configuration Manager displays an alphabetically ordered explorer tree. Adding a new Funding source  Editing an existing Funding source  Deleting a Funding source  Archiving a Funding source  Viewing the funding source report  Viewing the enrolments report  Queensland Specific Funding Source Requirements

Adding a new Funding source  You can either right-click Funding sources and choose Add new funding source:  You can also expand Funding sources, right-click the appropriate state and choose Add new funding source. This will open the Funding Source Wizard:     Select a State

for the funding source. This will be preselected if you chose to add the new source by right-clicking a state previously. Select the National funding source, if applicable. Available National Funding Sources (As per the NCVER specifications) include:  11

Commonwealth and State general purpose recurrent  13

Commonwealth specific funding program  15

State specific funding program  20

Purchasing contracts

The NT government issues purchasing contract or Resource Agreement /Notice of Variation Numbers to RTOs for certain types of funded training. The QLD government issues purchasing contract and schedule number information to RTOs for certain types of funded training. The purchasing contract field is required in SA, the number is provided to RTOs by the Purchasing section of DFEEST and relates to the particular programme you are delivering. Skills Tasmania issues purchasing contract information to RTOs for certain types of funded training. The Victorian government issues purchasing contract numbers for training that has a state funding source of "L" (User Choice New Apprentices) or "T" (Tender). Open the Configuration Manager by choosing Manage > Configuration from the menu. The Configuration Manager displays an alphabetically ordered explorer tree. Adding a new purchasing contract  Editing an existing purchasing contract  Deleting a purchasing contract  Viewing the purchasing contract report  Viewing the enrolments report Adding a new Purchasing contract     Right-click Purchasing contracts and choose Add new purchasing contract. OR  Expand Purchasing contracts, right-click the appropriate state and choose Add new purchasing contract. This will open the Purchasing Contract Wizard:     The State will be pre-set to the state selected on toolbar, or the state branch that was right-clicked to add the new contract. Enter a Code for the purchasing contract.

Purchasing Contracts (NT, Qld, SA, Tas and Vic only)  NT: The NT govt issues purchasing contract or Resource Agreement / Notice of Variation Numbers to RTOs for certain types of funded training. To add a new one in, right-click on Northern Territory under Purchasing contracts and choose to add a new one  Qld: The Qld govt issues purchasing contract and schedule number information to RTOs for certain types of funded training. To add a new one in, right-click on Queensland under Purchasing contracts and choose to add a new one. SA: The Purchasing Contract field is now required in South Australia. This number will be provided to RTOs by the Purchasing section of DFEEST and relates to the particular programme you are delivering. Tas: Skills Tasmania issues purchasing contract information to RTOs for certain types of funded training. To add a new one in, right-click on Tasmania under Purchasing contracts and choose to add a new one. Vic: The Victorian government issues purchasing contract numbers for training that has a state funding source of "L" (User Choice New Apprentices) or "T" (Tender). To add a new one in, right-click on Victoria under Purchasing contracts and choose to add a new one. NOTE: The Target Hours field in the Purchasing Contract Wizard can be used for generating reports showing actual vs target hours. It is not used for government reporting.

QA Rejection Reasons  QA Rejection reasons provide the VETtrak administrator to offer a clarification for why a submitted item in the QA manager may have been rejected. (IE 'Insufficient Details)

Referral Sources  If you survey your clients about where they heard about your services, you can set up the various sources here, and select them when you create enrolments. Referral sources can be archived when they are no longer to be used.

Delivery Strategies  For WA users, you must choose a delivery strategy when recording results. Set up these delivery strategies here. Use of delivery strategies is optional for users in other states.

Employer Types  A standard set of employer types comes pre-loaded into VETtrak, but others can be added here if you need them. When setting up an employer, there is a field to select which type of employer they are.

Events  Events can be used for keeping records of items that happen or will happen. Events can be applied to a wide variety of items within VETtrak, such as Client, Enrolments, Occurrences and Contracts. See the Events Section for more robust details.

External Systems  External System codes are used to enter unique identifiers for clients that may have been assigned via an External System, such as Finance or HR Systems.

Funding Models  Funding models allow you to set up a template for the types of pricing items you charge for in relation to your enrolments. Funding models can be selected in the Enrolment Wizard to automatically populate the pricing grid with relevant pricing items. See Process: Creating (And Using) A New Funding Model for information about this item.

Funding Sources  A Funding Source represents the method by which an enrolment fee is paid; either from a government funding pool or the client paying a fee for the service. The state governments for ACT, NT, Qld, SA, Tas and Vic have a set of standard, government-recognised funding sources for use, many of which are available in VETtrak by default. If there are any funding sources that you need that are not included by default, you can create a corresponding Funding Source in VETtrak at your convenience. See the Funding Sources help article for more information.

Client Apprenticeships ID  Client contract ID varies for state (STA, Delta, LUI, VETA)  Study Reason Identifier  Code noting reason for study from predefined list  VET In Schools Flag  Whether subject is delivered as part of school system  Specific Funding Identifier  Commonwealth funding code for national 13 funded subjects  School Type Identifier  Classification of educational institute delivering subject  STATE SPECIFIC   RTO Outcome Identifier  Result code used by RTO for the outcome recorded  State Funding Source  State funding source code for state reported subjects  Client Tuition Fee  Total of tuition fee for subject  Fee Exemption/Concession  Indicates fee exemption or concession from predefined list  Purchasing Contract ID  Where required, this is the code of a purchasing contract  Purchasing Cont. Schedule  The purchasing contract schedule code of the above ID  Hours attended  May vary, generally attended hours of withdrawn outcomes  Associated Course ID  Varies for state, usually ties training to awards or funding  Scheduled Hours  Subject hours, usually matches hours in subject file  Predominant Delivery Mode  Indicates whether delivery is internal, external or workplace   When having multiple years of NAT files imported, enrolments will be created for each year with the results present in each year. These will then be tidied up to remove units in earlier years that were later completed, whilst preserving the final outcome.

The following changes have been made for this:  All VIC state funding sources have been updated to match VIC's "Funding Source Identifier STA Supplement" for 2019. This means that there will be no active state funding sources with national funding source 30, as this is no longer valid in VIC for 2019 - all existing ones with national funding source 30 have been updated to 31. The VIC state funding source list now has two entries for F (Fee for service - overseas full fee-paying students) - one with national funding source 31 and the other with 32. Likewise, VIC state funding source Z20 (VET in Schools) now has three entries - for national funding sources 20, 31 and 32. When dropping-down the state funding source field, VETtrak will now show the national funding source code against each entry in the list, assisting you to select the state funding source with the correct national funding when there are multiple with the same state code. In the VIC page in the Enrolment wizard, if the enrolment finishes in 2019 or later, and the client's usual address postcode is "OSPC", a validation error will be shown if the selected state funding source's national funding source is not 31 or 32. In Generate State AVETMISS for VIC for 2019, you will get a validation error if you attempt to report a state funding source with a national funding source of 30 in VIC.

The following Fee Waiver codes are now available:    W421: North Coast flood relief    W441: School holiday hospitality training for school students 16 years and over    W461: NSW Fee Free – General    W462: NSW Fee Free – NSW Veterans    W463: NSW Fee Free – NSW Veterans-Recognised Partners      Ineligibility reason. A new field "Ineligibility Reason" has been added to the NSW Provider Calculator Importer and the NSW state page in the Enrolment wizard, allowing the reason why an enrolment is not eligible for Smart and Skilled to be recorded. Contract wizard. The "STA Client No" field now disabled on Contract wizard in NSW, since it is not used. Completion payments. When the NSW Payment Importer wizard imports a payment that has the word “completion” in the Payment Instalment column, VETtrak will now automatically turn on the Complete tickbox for that enrolment, in the NSW state page in the Enrolment wizard. eCAF    eCAF middle name. When creating an enrolment in the eCAF system, the client’s given name and middle name are now transferred in separate fields. USI    Drivers licence card numbers. In the Identity Document wizard for drivers licence, the Card Number is now mandatory for all Australian states and territories. Importers    Custom field mapping. It is now possible to configure custom data mapping in the new Importers. This allows you to map field values from your import files to the field values that VETtrak requires for the field. Security    Password health check.

Occurrence Importer  A basic occurrence importer has been added which can be accessed from the Import section of the Utility menu. The new importer supports occurrence fields and some relationships. Compliance  Vic   VIC AVETMISS performance. Some performance improvements have been made to VIC AVETMISS generation when calculating client fees to report. NSW   Fee Exemption. An entry has been added for the ‘OS’ code for an outreach officer's engagement for NSW ACE, if it doesn't already exist. Provider Calculator Export - PAS number format. The NSW Provider Calculator Export Wizard has been updated to format the PAS Number as 10 digits padding the value with leading 0's as required. LMS  Unenrol from LMS. When using the unenrol from LMS enrolment menu in VETtrak, the wording of the warning has been modified to make it clearer that proceeding may cause data to be removed from the LMS. Catapult result transfer - Unit start date. The Catapult results transfer has been modified so that a unit start date will only be modified if the unit's existing start date is empty, or the unit's existing result is blank or Not Yet Started (outcome code 85 or 105). Finance  Finance integration. Added configurable default values for including new invoices and payments in finance system transfers. General    Email Template CC/BCC. The positions of the CC and BCC Add buttons have been fixed in the Email Template wizard. Occurrence Results Wizard.

You can now show a statement of fees report for all enrolments in an occurrence by right-clicking the Enrolments node in the Programme Manager. You can also now show a statement of fees report for all enrolments linked to an invoice by right-clicking the invoice. You must perform a report update in VETtrak before this will work. Images in employers and organisations. Employers and Organisations now have two image fields available, similar to clients. These are intended for storing logo images, which could then be included on reports. Any image added will be converted to PNG format. Converting unit to module. In the Qualification Manager, the "Remove from package" option is available when right-clicking a unit in a training package (as long as the unit is not in any qualifications in the training package). If this is the only training package that the unit is in, the unit will be converted to a module (you will be warned). You can convert a module back to a unit by dragging and dropping it onto a "Units in package" node in a training package. QLD funding calculations - indigenous status. In QLD, if a client is indigenous, concession fees will now be applied from a funding model when calculating tuition fees. Update system reports within System Report Manager. A panel has been added to the bottom-right of the System Report Manager, allowing a web update of the system reports to be performed directly from the manager. Reportability column in Award Register.

ticket_content.ticket_title: Add a field to a Standard Report #64917
ticket_content.ticket_description: Hi Team  Can we add the  Referral Source  as an extra field to the Standard Report   Invoice Export Report?          Thank you     ****

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for your request to add the "Referral Source" field to the Standard Report "Invoice Export Report".

I have reviewed the available documentation, but could not find any confirmation that the "Referral Source" field exists and can be added to reports [1]. However, this does not necessarily mean the field is unavailable - it may just not be documented in the references I have access to.

To properly investigate this request, I will need to reach out to the development team to:

1. Confirm if the "Referral Source" field exists in the VETtrak database
2. Determine if it is possible to add this field to the Invoice Export Report

Once I have more information from the development team, I will follow up with you on the status of your request. Please let me know if you need any other assistance in the meantime.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for your request to add the "Referral Source" field to the Standard Report "Invoice Export Report". I have reviewed the request and here are my findings:

The "Referral Source" field is available in VETtrak and corresponds to the CLIENT.CLIE_REFERRAL_SOURCE field in the database [1]. This field captures how the client was referred or found out about the organization.

The "Invoice Export Report" is a standard report that exports invoice data to a CSV file for importing into accounting software like MYOB [2]. It currently does not include the "Referral Source" field.

To add this field, I will need to modify the report's query to join the CLIENT table and include the CLIE_REFERRAL_SOURCE field in the field list. Then I will add a column in the report layout to display this new field. This should be a relatively straightforward change.

I will go ahead and make these updates to the "Invoice Export Report". The updated report with the "Referral Source" field will be included in an upcoming release of VETtrak's standard reports. Please let me know if you need any other fields added or have additional requirements for this report.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your request to add the "Referral Source" field to the Standard Report "Invoice Export Report". I can certainly assist with that.

The "Invoice Export Report" is designed to display invoice data at an invoice item level, including details like invoice number, invoice date, client/employer, product, amount, and payment status [1]. Adding the "Referral Source" field would provide additional context on how the client was referred or acquired.

To add this field, I will need to modify the report query to join the referral source data from the client table. Once the change is made, the new "Referral Source" column will be available for selection in the report parameters [3].

Please allow me a few business days to complete this update. I will notify you once the enhanced "Invoice Export Report" with the "Referral Source" field is available in your VETtrak instance.

Thank you for the suggestion to improve our reporting capabilities. Please let me know if you need any other fields or customizations for this or other standard reports.

Invoice/Payment Exporter - MYOB AccountRight

Using the Invoice Exporter and Payment Exporter in VETtrak it is possible to export financial information from VETtrak and import this data into MYOB AccountRight. 3 different report files have been developed matching 3 different types of exports from the MYOB Import and Export Fields web page.

These files are listed below and can be downloaded by clicking on the links to the FR3 files. Sales - Service Sales MYOB_Service_Sales_Export_Report.fr3  Cards - Custom Cards MYOB_Customer_Cards_Export_Report.fr3  Receive Payments MYOB_Receive_Payments_Export_Report.fr3   Before using these reports please review the MYOB Report Field List article to see a description of where each of the columns on this report will populate from.

If any of these columns need adjusting to meet your needs please submit a Custom Report Request within the Support Centre for a custom version of these reports.

Export from VETtrak  Once the report files have been downloaded and saved to your reports folder

following these steps:  Service Sales Export   Go to the Utility menu, Finance Utilities and Export Invoices. You will now be in the Invoice Exporter Wizard.

Click the ... button under Report template to use

and navigate to your reports folder where the MYOB_Service_Sales_Export_Report.fr3 file has been saved and select this file. The file and path will now show in this field. Click the Search button and you will see a list of invoices. These are invoices in VETtrak that have not yet been exported in an invoice export batch. Note:

If this is the first time you have used the invoice exporter you will see every invoice from VETtrak in this list.

You can export the entire list of invoices to give these invoices a batch number so that the next time you choose to export invoices using a new batch only newly created invoices that have not yet been exported will show. Select the records you want to include in the export under the Use column making sure to leave the blank lines between each record.

The blank lines are required for MYOB to recognise the separate invoices when importing.

Click Export Results

and choose a location to export the file. Once you have chosen a file location you will be asked if you want to mark these invoices as exported.

In most cases you would select yes but if you were perhaps running a test you might want to select no. The file is now ready to be imported into MYOB however if any of the clients or employers included in the invoice export do not yet exist in MYOB as Cards

it is recommended that you now run the Customer Cards Export report. Customer Cards Export   Go to Report - Custom Reports, navigate to the reports folder where the MYOB_Customer_Cards_Export_Report.fr3 file has been saved and double-click on this file to run. You will be prompted to select a batch number.

Select the number of the batch you last exported. If you are unsure what the number of this batch was open the invoice exporter again, select Re-export existing batch and drop down the list of existing batches to see the number allocated to the batch at the time you exported the invoice data. Once you have selected the batch number click Ok to generate the data then right click on the page and save as a CSV file. It is recommended to save the file to the same folder you saved your Service Sales Export file. You will now have 2 spreadsheets of data for your customer cards and invoices. Receive Payments Export   Go to the Utility menu, Finance Utilities and Export Payments. You will now be in the Payment Exporter Wizard.

Click the ... button under Report template to use

ticket_content.ticket_title: Create and update a custom field in VETtrak #65939
ticket_content.ticket_description: We wish to create a custom field for  Client Enrolment  and update it in bulk. I was hoping it can be done from the back end by you guys. We can provide you with a csv or excel that ll include a list of Enrolment ID and the custom field. Happy to do this in a different format depending on what you think is the best practice to make these changes.  I ve attached an example sheet below.

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for your request to create and update a custom field for Client Enrolments in VETtrak. Custom fields are an advanced feature in VETtrak that allow you to store additional data specific to your organization [1].

Creating a custom field can be done through the Configuration Manager in VETtrak. You can define the custom field name, type (text, date, number, etc.), and specify if it should be applied to Clients and/or Enrolments [1][2]. Once created, the custom field will be available to fill out in the relevant wizards.

Regarding updating the custom field values in bulk, VETtrak does not currently have a built-in way to do this from the backend. The recommended approach would be to update the custom field values individually for each enrolment through the VETtrak interface [4]. Alternatively, if you have a large number of enrolments to update, you could explore using the VETtrak API to automate updating the custom field values programmatically.

To create the custom field for you, I would need the following information:

- Custom field name 
- Custom field type (text, date, number, etc.)
- Whether it should be applied to Clients, Enrolments, or both
- Any other settings like minimum/maximum length, list of options, etc.

Once the custom field is created, you can then update the values through the VETtrak interface or potentially via the API if needed for bulk updates. Please let me know if you need any clarification or have additional requirements.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for your request to create a new custom field for client enrolments and update it in bulk in VETtrak. I can certainly assist with this.

Creating a new custom field:
VETtrak allows defining custom fields to store additional data specific to your organization [1]. To create a new custom field for client enrolments, I will go to the Configuration Manager > Custom Fields section and define the new field there [2][4]. This involves specifying details like the field name, data type (text, number, date etc.), any validation rules, and setting it as applicable to the Client Enrolment entity [4].

Updating the custom field values in bulk:
Once the new custom field is created, I can then update its values in bulk for existing enrolments using the VETtrak API [3][6][5]. The API provides functions to query and update the additional data fields, including custom fields, for different entities like enrolments.

To do this bulk update, I will first query the enrolments you want updated using the EnrolmentID values provided in the attached spreadsheet. I can then use the UpdateAdditionalDataForWebRecord API function to set the new custom field value for each of those enrolment records [3][6][5].

Please confirm if you would like me to proceed with creating the new custom field and performing the bulk update as described. If so, I'll need the following information:

1. The desired name and data type for the new custom field
2. Any specific validation rules or settings needed for the field 
3. A spreadsheet/CSV with the EnrolmentID and desired custom field value for each enrolment to update

Let me know if you need any other details! I'm happy to walk through the process or provide additional confirmation once the updates are completed [7].

Hi,

Thank you for your request to create and update a custom field in VETtrak for client enrolments. Based on the information provided, I can assist you with this process.

Creating a Custom Field:
VETtrak allows you to configure custom fields to record additional information specific to your organization [1]. To create a new custom field for client enrolments, follow these steps:

1. Go to the Configuration Manager in VETtrak
2. Under the "Custom fields" node, define a new custom field by providing a name, unique code, data type (text, date, number, etc.), and any other settings [2]
3. Apply the custom field to the "Client" entity to make it available for client enrolments [2]

Once created, the custom field will be available in the relevant wizards within VETtrak for data entry during client enrolments.

Updating Custom Field Values in Bulk:
To update the values of the custom field in bulk using a CSV/Excel file, you can leverage the VETtrak API (web connector) [3]. The API provides functions like UpdateAdditionalDataForWebRecord and UpdateClientAdditionalFields that allow you to set custom field values for client enrolments [3][5].

The process would involve:

1. Preparing a CSV/Excel file with columns for the enrolment ID and the custom field value
2. Using the VETtrak API to iterate through the file and update the custom field value for each enrolment ID

Please note that there may be some limitations on how custom fields can be used, such as in reporting or integration with other systems [1]. It's recommended to consult with the VETtrak support team if you have specific requirements or need further assistance with the bulk update process [8][9].

Let me know if you need any clarification or have additional requirements regarding custom fields in VETtrak.

related_knowledge.content:
Custom Fields

VETtrak also allows you to configure Custom Fields for recording additional information that is specific to your organisation. You can create your own custom fields that allow you to enter information in the appropriate wizard and store it within the VETtrak database. Custom fields simply store additional data. VETtrak does not know the meaning of your custom fields, and cannot take any action based on these fields. Custom fields should be used sparingly and only for information that is specific to your organisation. If you use custom fields for data that is widely applicable to many RTOs, they may be added to VETtrak in the future and there may be a service charge to migrate the data across. Please contact VETtrak support if you are uncertain whether the field you want to add is widely used. Any request to transfer data from a custom field to a VETtrak standard field will be reviewed and a quote provided to complete the work. Custom fields can be used in custom reports, but there may be technical and practical limitations on how they can be used. Custom fields for enrolments only apply to client enrolments, they cannot be used with employer enrolments. Custom fields are applied to data types in VETtrak, referred to as Entities.

Click a red status to see the details of the errors, and use the on-the-fly buttons to edit the VIC foundation skills assessment data. Click Export to export the valid rows to a CSV file. Custom fields  Functionality has been added allowing you to configure custom fields, and assign them to be collected for clients and/or employers. This allows you to store additional data in VETtrak that is specific to your organisation. Please note that there are restrictions on how custom fields can be used, VETtrak will explain these when you first open the Custom Field wizard. Define custom fields. A new "Custom fields" node in the Configuration Manager allows you to define custom fields. This includes giving it a name, a unique code for identification, a type (such as text, date, number, tickbox, single selection from a list of options, and multiple selection from a list of options), settings that vary depending on the type (such as, for text, a minimum and/or maximum length), and optionally a description that will be shown in an Info link. If the type is a list of options, you then enter the available options, order them, and can set a default selection. Finally, you can apply the custom field to clients and/or employers, and indicate whether the field is mandatory for users to fill out. Custom field applicability.

VETtrak API - Additional Data Documentation (20.4.X and 21.1.X)

This is a list of fields that can be used with the QueryAdditionalData, UpdateAdditionalDataForWebRecord, UpdateClientAdditionalFields or UpdateEmployerAdditionalFields functions in the VETtrak API (web connector). This list is for the latest VETtrak API (web connector) version, and VETtrak database version 20.4 and 21.1.

Using the UpdateAdditionalDataForWebRecord function, you can set only Client or Employer entity fields from this list on web enrolments. You can set these fields for a web client, web employer, web employee in a web employer enrolment, web contact in a web employer enrolment, a "loose" web employer, or a waitlisted client. You can retrieve back what you have set in a web enrolment using GetAdditionalDataForWebRecord. Using the UpdateClientAdditionalFields or UpdateEmployerAdditionalFields functions, you can set only Client or Employer entity fields from this list on real clients or employers directly. Using the QueryAdditionalData function, you can query any of these entities and fields. You pick an entity to query, and you can filter on, sort by, and/or retrieve any of the fields for that entity. The definitions of the entities can be retrieved using the GetAdditionalDataEntityNames function. The definitions of all the fields for an entity can be retrieved using the GetAdditionalDataFieldsForEntity function.

Available entities

Title The title of the client (Mr, Mrs, Miss, Ms, Dr etc) String 10

Surname The surname (or single name) of the client String 50

GivenName The given name of the client. For a single name client, this field must be empty String 50

Custom Field Applicability

Located within the Configuration Manager, Custom Field Applicability defines where the data defined by your Custom Fields is to be collected, defining what particular wizard within VETtrak will prompt you to collect the data. These cannot be customised, but are routinely updated to include more areas as VETtrak is continuously developed. Please refer to the article Custom Fields for more details on using this advanced feature. RELATED: Custom Fields (Advanced Feature)

ticket_content.ticket_description: Good morning Can I ask for some assistance in creating a data insight please. I m not sure data insights is sophisticated enough to get the information I need, but I will give a bit of an outline and you can point me in the right direction. We have a number of units probably around *** that are superseded but equivalent to current units. I need to locate students that have completed the superseded unit that have a current enrolment. At the moment we do this manually by running a report one at a time for each unit. Which as you can imagine is incredibly time consuming. The data insight I am trying to set up is to locate students with a current enrolment that also have had a completed enrolment in a previous year, I figure it will probably be quicker to look per student than per unit. This is the data insight I have set up but I am not getting any results, so something is obviously not quite right, or is it more the case of the data insight cannot perform this functionality? cid:image***.png@**DA*A**.D*E**D** Kind Regards ****** cid:flexirtologoforemail b***cbf* *e** **** **e* ***b**d*dc*c.png              ************** Manager Flexi RTO  RTO ***** Phone: ************ Mobile: ************ Email: ***************************** Web: ****************** *************************** We respectfully acknowledge the traditional owners, past and present, of the land on which we work and live. response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding your Data Insights query. Based on the information provided, it appears that you are trying to locate students who have completed a superseded unit in a previous year and also have a current enrolment [2]. This can certainly be achieved using Data Insights.

Here are the steps you can follow:

1. Create a new Data Insights query and select "Client Enrolment" as the query type [1].
2. In the Query Fields section, add the following fields:
   - Client Given Name and Client Surname (to identify the students)
   - Enrolment Start Date and Enrolment End Date (to filter for current and previous enrolments)
   - Qualification Name (to filter for specific qualifications containing the superseded units)
   - Unit Name (to filter for the specific superseded units) [3][2]
3. In the Query Criteria section, add the following criteria:
   - Enrolment End Date is in the previous year(s) you want to check for completed superseded units
   - Enrolment Status is "Complete" (to filter for completed enrolments) [3]
   - Unit Name contains the superseded unit codes or names
4. Also add a criteria for Enrolment Start Date is the current year (or date range) to filter for current enrolments [4][5].

By setting up the query in this way, you should be able to retrieve a list of students who have completed the specified superseded units in previous years and also have a current enrolment [1][7]. You can then choose to export the results or perform further actions on the retrieved data as needed.

If you need any further assistance or have trouble setting up the query, please let me know. I'll be happy to provide more guidance.

Kind Regards,

Hi [Ticket Sender],

Thank you for reaching out regarding using Data Insights to find students with completed enrolments in superseded units who also have current enrolments. This is certainly possible to achieve using Data Insights [1].

Here are the steps you can follow:

1. In the Data Insights Manager, create a new query on the "Client Enrolment" table [1].
2. In the Query Fields, add the fields you want to retrieve such as Client Name, Enrolment Start/End Dates, Qualification Name, Enrolment Status, etc. [1][6]
3. In the Query Criteria, set the following filters:
   - Add a criteria for Enrolment Status = "Complete" [2]
   - Add another criteria for Enrolment Status = "Continuing" [2] 
   - Add a criteria to filter for the superseded unit codes/names
   - Add a criteria to check if the end date of the completed (superseded) enrolment is before the start date of the continuing enrolment [4][5]
4. You can further refine the criteria based on enrolment years if needed [4][5]
5. Save and run the query

This should retrieve a list of students who have completed enrolments in the specified superseded units from previous years, and also have current continuing enrolments.

Once you have the results, you can perform various actions like sending emails, updating enrolment status, or generating reports for these students [6].

Please let me know if you need any clarification or assistance in setting up this Data Insights query.

Kind Regards,
[Your Name]

Hi [name],

Thank you for your request regarding setting up a Data Insights query. Based on the information provided, it does seem possible to achieve what you need using Data Insights [1][7][3].

To find students who have completed a superseded unit and also have a current enrolment, you would need to set up a query on the Client Enrolment table. This would allow you to retrieve a list of students and their enrolments.

Then, you can add a relationship to the Enrolled Units table and filter to only include:

1. Enrolments with a unit where the ResultType = 2 (Complete) [2][8]. This will give you students who have completed a unit.

2. Add an additional filter to only include units that are superseded/equivalent to other units based on the unit codes.

3. Finally, add a filter to only include enrolments that have a current start/end date to get current enrolments.

By combining these filters, you should be able to retrieve a list of students meeting your criteria of having completed a superseded unit and having a current enrolment.

If you're still not getting the expected results after setting up the query this way, I'd suggest double checking the specific field names and filter values based on your data. You can also try adding the query criteria one by one to narrow down where the issue may be.

Once you have the list of students, you can then optionally perform actions like updating a field, sending notifications, or running reports for that group [6][9][10].

Let me know if you need any further assistance in setting up this query or have additional requirements. I'd be happy to provide more specific guidance.

Kind regards,
[Your name]

Students enrolled into a

Qualification within a

Date Range. Of course you can add additional filters to shape your data further, depending on your needs. Some basic examples of how I could expand this query could include details such as:   Enrolment Status  Referral Source  Employer linked to Enrolment  Is an Award Recorded   ...and more than could be realistically listed here. Data Insights does factor in almost any data relationship that you have created via your data entry. A good rule of thumb is to always

start with limited criteria, and then build upon it to work towards your output goal. This makes troubleshooting your query easier.

Now is a good time to enter a

Name for your query at the top of this panel, and press the Save button

to record the query to your database. The query will then appear on the left hand side in the Data insight query list.

At this point, you can now press the Run Query () to display the output of your query! This will change the Query panel to display the Results tab, and show your query output:    The details you have retrieved appear in a list, and can be sorted by clicking/dragging headings into the gray bar at the top of the list. To return to the Query editor screen, press the Query tab at the top of this window.

The real strength of Data Insights at this point is that now you have this list of people, unlike a report that only displays the data - you can now choose what you wish to do with your output. This can range from simply exporting the information into a spreadsheet to be reviewed separately, contacting the listed people via SMS/Email, running additional reports or even amending particular information within the Students' enrolments. For more information about what exports/actions can be taken with your outpiut data - take a look at our Performing Actions On Your Data Insights Query Output article.
