Then, if I run my query with this filter I will have

Filtered Results, resulting in a smaller sample of people that

Match my criteria.

With this filtered set of results, I can then choose to perform an Action on these results:       Actions allow you to do something with the results you have retrieved, such as

Update Fields,

Send an Email or Run a Report as a few options. For example,

to update the

Status of the

Enrolment, you would need to select

Update Enrolment Status.

Within the wizette, you can then choose which Status

you wish to

Apply:

If you then press Finish, this will update the status to your selected item for all Enrolments that your query has retrieved. You will receive a message notifying you that the change will take place.

You can also save your query to use again in future - so to save you a lot of time doing this again, should you wish to update a group of people again in future you can enter a

Name at the top of the query and press the

Save for your query to appear in the left hand side to be used again in future.

Specialist Bulk Update Options  Besides the Update Enrolment Status option, there are a range of specialist update options within Data Insights:     These include:   Update Assessment Modes  Update Dates  Update Delivery Modes  Update Enrolment Status  Update Field

Update Assessment Modes  The

Update Assessment Modes option allows a user to associate one or many

Assessment Modes within Student Enrolments.

Update Dates  The

Update Dates option allows a user to amend the Start and Finish dates within their Student Enrolments. Note: This function can only be used in bulk if the retrieved Enrolments have the same Start and Finish dates

Data Insights changes   MUST NOT match criteria. A new "Include MUST NOT match criteria" tickbox has been added to the bottom of Data Insight queries. Ticking this shows an additional criteria panel where you can specify criteria that must not match in order for a record to be found. This is useful to find, for example, clients that do not have a particular type of event etc. Bulk replace enrolment staff. A new "Replace enrolment staff" bulk action has been added to Data Insights when running Client Enrolment queries. This allows you to replace all staff associated with the selected enrolments with the new set of staff you specify. Client referral source. The "Referral source" relationship is now available in the "Client" table, allowing you to access the client's referral source. Contact records. You can now access contact records for enrolments and enrolled units in Data Insights. The ability to run the Enrolment Contact Record report in bulk when querying client enrolments has been added. Querying issues. An issue causing queries for contracts to not find any contracts that were created from profiles has been fixed. An issue with the "Invoice item" relationship in the "Enrolment pricing" table has been fixed. An issue causing the "Web published/Privacy release signed" field in the "Client" table to show the opposite value has been fixed. Bulk update field to not stated.

Process: Updating Enrolment Fields Using the Data Insights Manager

Once you have queried data within the Data Insight Manager,

you may then choose to action updates or changes to the data. There is a range of options available to update specific data within your Student Enrolments. Begin by accessing the Data Insights Manager by going to the Report menu, and selecting

Data Insights:

Start by creating a

Query on the left hand side, by right clicking on Data Insight Queries and selecting

Add Query:     The right hand side of the manager will update, with options that allow you to create your query. The query will represent what kind of data you want to look up - For this example, we will update Enrolment Statuses, so we need to select the Query On option for Client Enrolment.

Selecting Client Enrolment will provide you wish a list VETtrak data fields to select from. These represent the criteria you may wish to use for your query, or the information you wish to see.

The two windows on the right hand side are Query Fields and Query Criteria. In the Query Fields

section, you choose the details you wish to see. To do this, you can Click, and drag items from the left field into this Query Fields area, or press the  [+] button in the  query fields column. A standard set of details to check Client Enrolments would likely be the Enrolment Dates (Start Date/Finish Date), the Qualification Name and the Clients Name (Client Given Name and Client Surname). I do this by finding these fields and adding them into the Query Fields

area using the following process:  For the Qualification Name, locate Qualification

in the list and press the Follow Relationship  button to view a list of available Qualification

fields:     From this area, Click and drag Name

from the left field into the Query Fields area, or press the  [+] button in the

If you do not have Multi-RTO, all organisation drop-downs will be visible but will select the organisation and be disabled automatically. Enrolled unit expiry date. A new "Expiry" column has been added to the state grid in the Unit/Module Wizard in the Qualification Manager. This allows you to specify the number of months, per state, after which a competency in the unit should expire. When a completed result is recorded for an enrolment in the unit, an expiry date is automatically recorded against the enrolled unit, calculated as the result finish date plus that number of months. This date can be viewed and edited in the Enrolment Results Wizard when "Show claims columns" is ticked. It can then be used in custom reports to find clients that have unit competencies that are expiring. It is intended to be used for units that need to be recertified, such as First Aid or CPR. Not granted result types. The "RPL not granted" and "RCC not granted" results have been changed to a continuing result, instead of a final result. Continuing result display. In lists of enrolled units, units that have a continuing result now have a yellow icon. Linked units display in awards. The units under an enrolment that is under an award will now show the link icon if they have come from linked enrolments. Location drop-downs. The location drop-down in the Enrolment and Award Wizards now only show locations that are in the state which is selected at the top of the screen.

ticket_content.ticket_description: Morning VETtrak team I would like to include a query field into an existing data insights report. The field I would like to include is the clients username as generated in the client wizard under the security tab. We are removing the VETtrak authentication plug in that talks with our LMS. response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for your request to include the Client Username field in an existing Data Insights query. To add this field, follow these steps:

1. Open the Data Insights Manager and select the existing query you want to modify [4].
2. In the "Query Fields" section, click the "Follow Relationship" button next to the "Client" field to view the available client fields [1].
3. Locate the "Username" field in this list and drag it into the "Query Fields" area, or click the [+] button to add it [1].

Note that as of a recent update, the Client Username field has been moved from the main Client details page to the Security Access page of the Client Wizard [2]. This is why it may not be immediately visible in the Data Insights field list.

Once you have added the Username field, you can run the query and it will include the usernames generated for each client in the results. Let me know if you need any further assistance!

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your request. To include the client's username field from the client wizard's security tab in an existing Data Insights report, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the Data Insights Manager and select the existing query you want to modify.
2. In the "Available Fields" list, locate the "Client" table and expand it by clicking the "Follow Relationship" button [1][3].
3. Look for the "Username" field under the Client table and drag it into the "Query Fields" area to add it to your report [1][3].

Alternatively, you can add a new query specifically for retrieving client usernames:

1. In the Data Insights Manager, right-click on the "Data Insight Queries" folder and select "Add Query".
2. Set the "Query On" field to "Client".
3. In the "Available Fields" list, locate the "Client" table and expand it.
4. Drag the "Username" field into the "Query Fields" area [1][3].
5. You can also include other relevant fields like "Client Given Name" and "Client Surname" to identify the clients easily.

Please note that the "Username" field was recently moved to the "Security Access" page of the Client wizard, along with options to reset passwords and distribute them via email or SMS [2]. So the username you're looking for should be available through the "Client" table in Data Insights.

Let me know if you need any further assistance with including the username field or running the Data Insights query.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding adding the client's username field to an existing Data Insights report. The client's username generated in the Client Wizard under the Security tab should be accessible in the Data Insights Manager for querying and reporting purposes [2].

To include the username field in your report, you'll need to locate it in the Available Fields list when creating or modifying your Data Insights query. The username field is likely stored in a table related to the Client table, possibly a separate Security or Login table [5].

Here are the steps to add the username field to your query:

1. Open the Data Insights Manager and select your existing query.
2. In the Available Fields list, look for a table related to Security or Login information. You may need to follow relationships from the Client table.
3. Once you locate the username field, drag and drop it into the Query Fields area or click the [+] button to add it.
4. Save your query, and the username field should now be available in the report output.

If you have trouble locating the username field, feel free to provide me with some additional details about your existing query, and I'll try to provide more specific guidance.

Please let me know if you have any other questions!

Kind Regards,

Selecting Client Enrolment will provide you wish a list VETtrak data fields to select from. These represent the criteria you may wish to use for your query, or the information you wish to see.

The two windows on the right hand side are Query Fields and Query Criteria. In the Query Fields

A standard set of details to check Client Enrolments would likely be the Enrolment Dates (Start Date/Finish Date), the Qualification Name and the Clients Name (Client Given Name and Client Surname). The username and disable login fields have also been moved to this page. This page can only be accessed by users with access to Security, or if the client does not have access to any applications other than the Student or Progress Portal. The Primary Email and Primary Mobile Number fields have been added to the first page of the Client wizard, so they can be used to distribute the password to a new client. Bulk reset passwords in Data Insights. A new Reset Passwords bulk action has been added to Data Insights when querying clients or client enrolments. This allows you to force password change on next login, set and distribute new passwords via email or SMS template, or trigger the web portal password reset process for many clients in bulk that match whatever criteria you require. Note that the Password field is no longer available in Data Insights, as it is impossible to retrieve a client's existing password.

area using the following process:  For the Qualification Name, locate Qualification

in the list and press the Follow Relationship  button to view a list of available Qualification

fields:     From this area, Click and drag Name

from the left field into the Query Fields area, or press the  [+] button in the

Data Insights Manager Overview

The

Data Insights Manager

gives you unencumbered access to the data you have entered into your VETtrak system, with a full suite of options that allow you to query and interact with your data in unique and dynamic ways. Create and amend queries: Look up information with a freedom to specify exactly what you want to see, with the option to robustly

filter

your returned results. Bulk update fields:

Introducing new functionality to amend specific fields

within your database for a number of entries, such as employers, dates and more. Contact specific clients:

Define

and retrieve particular client

sets, then contact them via whatever method you prefer. Structured report creation: Set up a looping option to create reports for a

set

of people, without needing to repeat the process – Including automatically saving the exported report for your review. To open the Data Insights Manager, choose Report

> Data Insights

from the menu. Alternatively, click the

icon on the toolbar or from the Dashboard. This will display the standard Data Insight Manager interface:     Data insight query repository - The left hand window contains all of your created Data Insights queries, and it also used to create new queries by right-clicking the Data insight queries folder and selected Add query. This are also allows you to create Folders to organise and sort your queries by right-clicking on an existing folder and selecting Add subfolder:   You can the organise queries within these folders, as well as set permissions for what folders should be accessible by what VETtrak User roles. Selected data insight query - The right hand panel is defaulted to explain the basic details of the Data Insights Manager, with links to this User Guide and the VETtrak Data Dictionary. Once a Query is created/selected, this window will change to display the Data Insights editing tools:

If required, clarify what Type of Employment applies to the Client, such as 'Full Time' or 'Part Time'. Employment types are set up in the Configuration Manager. Additional

HR fields are available if required.

Press

Ok to return to the previous window and save this information against the Client. Press the Next button to progress the wizard, this will display the Security Access details for the client:     This box will display an automatically generated Username. NOTE: You can change how this username is generated under File > Security Settings   If you require to quickly disable log-in access to various VETtrak products (Such as the Trainer or Student Portal) you can tick this box to immediate revoke access. You can manage what web portals a Client has access to here, by ticking / unticking the Use

box. A newly generated password will display here when a client is being created. Once the client is set up, you will need to generate a NEW password for a Client if they forget their old one. Use these tickboxes to Email or SMS the Client password directly to your Client. Press the Next button to progress the wizard, this will display the option to assign the client to a

Group:    (Optional) Within this wizard you can place a client into a

Group that may have been created earlier, or create a group on the fly by pressing thebutton in the top right hand side.

Press the Next button to progress the wizard, this will display the Description

field for the client:    (Optional) On this page you can choose to record a

Referral source for your Client

and assign

Credit Terms if required. There is also a large field to add additional

Client Notes if relevant, which can contain any text based information you require.

In the Programme Manager for an occurrence, you can now right-click the Enrolments node and select "View records in Data Insights" -> "Clients" or "Client enrolments" to automatically generate and run a simple Data Insights query that shows the clients or enrolments in that occurrence. This is useful for running bulk actions on those records. FileTrak data. In Data Insights, new "File links" relationships have been added to allow you to query metadata about the files/documents that are linked to various records. Date calculations. Additional date calculations for the start/end of the next/last week/month are now available in Data Insights. Queries with recursive relationships. An error that occurs when saving a Data Insights query that contains the same relationship repeated multiple times in the one field has been fixed. Web Portal changes   Web client matching. When matching web clients, if there are no clients in the database with a surname starting with the web client's surname, the initial search results will be empty to indicate this (you can still perform searches as normal). Also, VETtrak will warn you if you elect to match to an existing client that has a different name to the web client. Idle session expiry. The Notifications preference page has been renamed to "Portal preferences" and a new setting added to it to control how long web portal users are allowed to keep their session idle before being automatically logged out.

An "Include completed events" tickbox, ticked by default, has been added to the "Upcoming events assigned to me" section on the dashboard. Unticking this will hide any events marked as completed. Show new events in calendar. A new tickbox to "Show new events in calendar" has been added to the Event wizard. If this is ticked, when a new event of this type is created, the "Show in calendar" tickbox will be ticked by default. This setting is also used for events created through the Trainer Portal, where the "Show in calendar" tickbox is not available. Finance changes   Part-paying multiple negative invoices. An issue that could cause incorrect disbursals to be recorded when part-paying negative invoices using the Pay Invoices wizard has been fixed. Removed credit card details. For security reasons, sensitive credit card detail fields have been removed from the VETtrak database. The Purge Credit Card Details wizard has also been removed. Data Insights changes   Filtering/grouping information. When you apply column filtering in the Results tab in Data Insights, the top of the screen will now indicate how many records match your current filter criteria. When you group result columns, the number of rows in each group is now indicated in the group header. Reorder multiple query fields. In the Query Fields grid, you can now hold CTRL or SHIFT when clicking to select multiple fields.

Various relationships and fields have been added to Data Insights allowing you to query and export information about capabilities for clients and positions. The Capabilities report is now available when bulk-running reports for clients. Locate, duplicate or swap field. You can now right-click a query field to locate that field in the Available Fields list (which will automatically navigate the relationships to that field), duplicate the field, or quickly swap the field with another one in the same table. These options are also available in the Importers, and in Triggers and Actions. Validation errors. Validation errors for "must not match" criteria fields have been improved. Triggers and Actions changes   Invoice and Payment triggers. You can now set up triggers and actions to run when invoices or payments are added or edited. The actions available are Run Report, Send Email, and Show Alert Message. These may be particularly useful when processing web enrolments in VETtrak that create invoices or payments, as you can use triggers to generate an invoice or receipt report and email it to the student. Run Report action. In Award triggers, the Run Report pop-up will now let you know if criteria for the Award Type is missing, as this is required before being able to select a report. An issue when using multiple Run Report actions in the same trigger has been fixed. Report changes   Report version on dashboard.

When an importer layout includes fields for a sub-ordinate record, but all of these fields are empty for a row in the import files, then the subordinate record is now ignored completely and the import record is shown as Valid for Import (Green). For example, if importing a client and all employment fields are empty, the import row is valid to import (without any employment record). Data Insights   Created and last updated user. You can now access the created user and last updated user for Awards, Clients, Client Enrolments, Employer Enrolments, Enrolled Units, Invoices, Payments, Staff and Task Enrolments in Data Insights. Web enrolment ID. The "Web enrolment ID" field is now available in the Client Enrolment and Employer Enrolment tables in Data Insights. Invoice report bulk action. An issue in the Email Template Wizard when bulk emailing a mixture of client and employer invoices has been fixed. Select Groups error. An error that occurs when attempting to assign clients to groups in Data Insights has been fixed. General   Select Groups error. An error that occurs when attempting to assign clients to groups in Data Insights has been fixed. Backup wizard timestamp. The VETtrak version number and the current time is now included in the filenames of Firebird database backup files created in the Backup wizard. Images. New images have been introduced for contracts, enrolments, states, and holidays.

The Organisation Wizard and Employer Wizard image fields have also been updated, supporting more image formats and the `Fit` option. LMS   Moodle course content access.

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for your request regarding AVETMISS reporting. AVETMISS stands for the Australian Vocational Education and Training Management Information Statistical Standard, which is a national data standard that ensures consistent capture and reporting of VET information about students [1].

To generate AVETMISS reports in VETtrak, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to Administration > Funding > AVETMISS Reporting to access the National AVETMISS menu [2].
2. Use the AVETMISS Reporting wizard to generate the required NAT files for the relevant reporting period [1][2]. 
3. Validate the NAT files using VETtrak's built-in validations as well as the NCVER AVETMISS Validation Software (AVS) [3][2].
4. Once validated, submit the final NAT files to the appropriate government body based on your location and funding sources [1][4].

Some key points to remember:

- RTOs must report all accredited training activity at least annually to NCVER via the AVETMISS standard [1][3].
- The submission process and specific reporting requirements can vary by state/territory [4].
- Utilize the NCVER AVS integration in VETtrak for a seamless validation experience [3].
- Check our knowledge base for updated tips, common errors, reporting deadlines, and guidance specific to your state [3][2].

Please let me know if you need any other assistance with AVETMISS reporting in VETtrak. I'm happy to provide further details or clarification.

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding AVETMISS reporting. AVETMISS stands for the Australian Vocational Education and Training Management Information Statistical Standard, which is a national data standard that ensures consistent and accurate capture and reporting of Vocational Education and Training (VET) information about students [1]. As a Registered Training Organization (RTO), you are required to report all accredited training activity to the National Centre for Vocational Education Research (NCVER) at least annually, which is known as Total VET Activity reporting [2].

To assist you with AVETMISS reporting in VETtrak, we have compiled a comprehensive National AVETMISS Reporting Starter Pack [3]. This pack includes helpful resources such as:

- VETtrak Government Reporting Knowledge Base Articles: These articles provide detailed information on VETtrak's AVETMISS reporting capabilities and how to navigate the reporting process.
- NCVER AVETMISS Validation Software (AVS): This is where you will upload your AVETMISS files exported from VETtrak for validation before submitting them to NCVER.
- VETtrak's NCVER AVS Integration: We recommend using this integration for a seamless experience when uploading your AVETMISS files to the AVS.
- Extend Unit Dates Wizard: This tool allows you to update multiple units with continuing results ending in the current year, saving you time from editing each unit individually.
- RTO Fact Sheets: These fact sheets from NCVER provide a comprehensive understanding of your AVETMISS reporting obligations as an RTO.

Additionally, our Knowledge Base article "AVETMISS Reporting - General Information" [1] provides an overview of AVETMISS reporting, including the different reportability options in VETtrak, a flow chart to guide you through the reporting process, and how your VETtrak data is included in the AVETMISS files. Furthermore, the article "AVETMISS FAQ & Errors" [5] addresses common questions and errors related to AVETMISS reporting in various states, including New South Wales.

If you require specific guidance on exporting AVETMISS files from VETtrak and uploading them to the AVS, you can refer to the article "Using the AVETMISS Validation Software (AVS)" [4]. This article covers preliminary data checks and the steps involved in validating your AVETMISS files through the AVS.

We also have a dedicated article for Victorian AVETMISS reporting [6], which includes information on tuition fee reporting, updating Victorian enrolment identifiers, and other state-specific requirements.

Please take some time to review these resources, and feel free to reach out if you have any further questions or need assistance with the AVETMISS reporting process in VETtrak [7].

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding AVETMISS reporting. AVETMISS stands for the Australian Vocational Education and Training Management Information Statistical Standard, which is a national data standard that ensures consistent reporting of VET information about students [1]. All accredited training in Australia must be reported to the National Centre for Vocational Education Research (NCVER) through AVETMISS files [1].

To assist you with AVETMISS reporting in VETtrak, I would recommend reviewing our National AVETMISS Reporting Starter Pack [3]. This guide covers helpful resources like:

- Knowledge base articles explaining VETtrak's AVETMISS reporting capabilities
- How to use the NCVER AVETMISS Validation Software (AVS) to validate your files
- The Extend Unit Dates wizard to quickly update units with continuing results
- Links to NCVER fact sheets on understanding AVETMISS reporting obligations

Additionally, our knowledge base has an article specifically on using the AVETMISS Validation Software for reporting in New South Wales, which walks through the required preliminary data checks and using the AVS summary file [4].

For a comprehensive overview of AVETMISS reporting, including where and when to submit files, fixing errors, and more, I'd suggest reviewing our AVETMISS reporting training videos [2]. These cover the full reporting process step-by-step.

Let me know if you need any other assistance as you work through your AVETMISS reporting! I'm happy to clarify any part of the process or provide additional resources.

related_knowledge.content:
AVETMISS Reporting - General Information

AVETMISS stands for the Australian Vocational Education and Training Management Information Statistical Standard. It is a national data standard that ensures consistent and accurate capture and reporting of Vocational Education and Training (VET) information about students. VETtrak provides the facility to generate AVETMISS (NAT files) for both a State Reporting Body and the National Centre for Vocational Education Research (NCVER),

across currently supported AVETMISS standards.

The Total VET Activity (TVA) legislation defines that all accredited training in Australia must be reported to the National Centre for Vocational Education Research (NCVER).

Within VETtrak the Reportability options section of the enrolment wizard defines which government body the enrolment is reported to;   Report to state body – if you deliver any training funded by a State Body, all funded accredited enrolments must be reported to that funding body, who then forward the data to NCVER. *If you have a state funding contract in VIC, QLD, SA, ACT, TAS and NT you may choose this reportability option for all accredited enrolments regardless of funding eligibility. Report to national body (NCVER) – Any accredited enrolments that are not reported to your state body

are instead reported to NCVER. Do not report this enrolment – this should only be used for non-accredited training, as it will entirely

stop this enrolment from being reported in AVETMISS.

Where, when and how do I report my AVETMISS data? This flow chart serves as a quick reference guide to the common types of reporting an RTO will need to action, and where the resulting generated AVETMISS data will need to be submitted:

National AVETMISS Reporting Starter Pack

Welcome to our National AVETMISS Reporting Starter Pack! If you're navigating the intricacies of AVETMISS (Australian Vocational Education and Training Management Information and Statistical Standard) reporting, you're in the right place. In this guide, we'll provide you with essential steps and insights to streamline your data reporting process. Let's dive in and ensure your AVETMISS reporting journey is smooth and successful. Helpful Resources     VETtrak Government Reporting Knowledge Base Articles: We encourage you to explore our comprehensive Knowledge Base articles to enhance your understanding of VETtrak's AVETMISS reporting capabilities. Our dedicated team has diligently updated and refined this content to ensure its relevance and usefulness to you!

NCVER AVETMISS Validation Software (AVS): If you are unsure where to upload your National AVETMISS files once you’ve exported them from VETtrak, this is the place!

VETtrak’s NCVER AVS Integration: We demonstrated uploading your AVETMISS files through NCVER AVS, however, we highly recommend using our integration for a more seamless experience.

Extend Unit Dates: Do you have many units with Continuing results ending this year but don’t want to edit the finish dates one by one? Then this is the tool for you! Update some or all of these units at once with the Extend Unit Dates Wizard.

RTO Fact Sheets: New to AVETMISS reporting or just want to brush up on your understanding? This NCVER page provides a fantastic breakdown of all the information you need to help you understand your AVETMISS reporting obligations as a Registered Training Organisation.

This will also include other enrolled units within the same Commitment ID regardless of their result dates provided at least one unit under the Commitment ID falls in the collection year. Include past units linked to reported awards: Reports all units linked to a Reportable award even if the result dates of those units are before the current collection year. NSW ACE reporting: Includes all enrolments that are Nationally or State reported if they have a location in New South Wales. These are included regardless of Funding or the Commitment ID on the Enrolment. Using the AVETMISS Validation Software (AVS)  A unique requirement of Smart and Skilled reporting is that all State AVETMISS Files (NAT files) must be validated using the AVETMISS Validation Software on the NCVER website prior to submission. Once this Validation is completed, you can then save an AVS Validation Summary File to include with your NAT file submission to State Training Services.

Preliminary Data Checks  Preliminary checks are conditions that you can set prior to validating the AVETMISS files with the NCVER websites AVETMISS Validation Software. There are three boxes you need to select to accommodate NSW specific requirements:   "Exclude all validations relating to Activity End Date on NAT00120"  "Exclude all validations relating to Activity Start Date on NAT00120"  "Exclude validations relating to Blank Outcome Identifier - National on NAT00120"   Not ticking these boxes will result in errors that will stop you from exporting the required AVS Summary File.

AVETMISS FAQ & Errors

New South Wales

FAQ   What is the name of the AVETMISS Reporting Body for New South Wales? Training Services NSW is the name of the reporting body. NSW Smart and Skilled is a NSW Government program. How are AVETMISS files reported to Smart and Skilled? The NAT files are validated through NCVER AVETMISS Validation Software (AVS). You can use the VETtrak NCVER integration to validate your AVETMISS files through the AVS. After validating the files, they are uploaded by the provider to Smart and Skilled - NSW along with the Collection Processing Summary file. Where can I find more information about NSW Smart and Skilled reporting requirements? Visit the Smart and Skilled - For Providers page for documentation. You can also sign into STS Online for further documentation. How do I contact NSW Smart and Skilled? Visit the Contact Training Services NSW page on the NSW Government website to see contact information. Additional contact information: Customer Service and Operations: Phone: 1300 772 104 Email: TSNSWCust.Service@det.nsw.edu.au  Training Services NSW Regional Office: Phone: 13 28 11  How often should I report to Smart and Skilled? Smart and Skilled Reporting is conducted every 28 days as per section 4.2 a of the Smart and Skilled Contract Terms and Conditions on the Smart and Skilled NSW Contracts and Policies for Training Providers page, of the NSW Government website.

https://www.nsw.gov.au/education-and-training/vocational/funding/policies-smart-skilled  Adult Community Education (ACE) Reporting take place every quarter, with the reporting period starting at the beginning of the year and up to the end of the current or requested quarter as per the How Does Quarterly Submission Work? question of the FAQs: ACE Reporting of VET Data page.

and other helpful information. AVETMISS FAQ & Errors - Victoria: This recently published article includes FAQs with links to relevant Victorian AVETMISS pages as well as common Errors/Warnings we have seen our customers encounter. We will continue to add content to this article to ensure it is a reliable resource for our Victorian VETtrak customers. Tuition Fee Reporting: Reporting of Tuition Fees is mandatory in Victoria. This article will help you understand how to set up your enrolment pricing to best represent the fees you charge your students in your Skills Victoria AVETMISS reporting. How to Supersede a Qualification in VETtrak: Has a qualification on your scope been superseded by a newer version? This article outlines the steps to transition your Victorian students from the superseded qualification to the superseding. Victorian Student Numbers (VSN): Want to connect your VETtrak to the VSR web service to utilise VETtrak’s VSN functionality? This article is for you! Updating Victorian Enrolment Identifiers: It isn’t often that you will need to update your Victorian Enrolment Identifiers, but when you do it’s handy to know how. This article will help guide you through how to update your Program Enrolment Identifiers and Subject Enrolment Identifiers. According to the AVETMISS Reporting Guideline SA Document, data must be submitted representing the current year's data to date, as listed below  1st January - 31st March before 7th April  1st January - 7th July before 7th July  1st January - 30th September before 13th October  1st January - 31st December before 31st January in the following Calendar Year     Errors/Warnings  File  Error/Warning Message  Solution  NAT00120   Outcome reported in NAT00120 record for client with Id {ClientID} and non-accredited subject {SubjectID} is not valid. When reporting non-accredited training, the only accepted outcomes are 70 (Continuing), 81 (Non-assessable activity - satisfactorily completed), 82 (Non-assessable activity - withdrawn or not satisfactorily completed), 85 (Not Yet Started) or Blank. You can find more information on recording results or updating existing result types in the following articles:  Process: Recording Results in VETtrak Result types   NAT00130   The NAT00130 record for the client with Id {ClientID} and program {ProgramID} failed validation. There are duplicate completions for these details in this attempt. If you record an Award for a Client such as a Statement of Attainment partway through their Enrolment in a Qualification, ensure that you are only reporting the Award indicating the completion of the Qualification. You can check the reportability of an Award by right-clicking the Award in the Programme or Client Manager and selecting Edit Award.

In the Wizard that appears, the Reportability options can be found next to the date fields. Process: Recording an Award in VETtrak      Other AVETMISS Errors and Warnings for South Australia can be found in the STELA 8.0 - AVETMISS Validations document in the Skills SA Toolkit.

ticket_content.ticket_description: Dear VET ****,      I am new to NAISDA and have just noticed that they are using superseded CUA unit codes for current unit enrolments in the Certificate IV and Diploma courses.  The enrolments in these units have been tracked for classes and attendance.  Is there a way to transfer the enrolments and attendance statistics across to the updated unit codes?  The codes are   Certificate IV  CUADAN*** to CUADAN***  CUAWHS*** to CUAWHS***  CUAMCP*** to CUAMCP***  CUAIND*** to CUAIND***  DIPLOMA  CUADAN*** to CUADAN***  CUAWHS*** to CUAWHS***  CUAMCP*** to CUAMCP***  CUAPRF*** to CUAPRF***  CUAIND*** to CUAIND***     please let me know what the best solution is  cheers  ******

response.answer:
Hi ******,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the superseded CUA unit codes. When a qualification is superseded and students need to transition to the new units, there are a few steps that need to be taken in VETtrak [1]:

First, you will need to update the outcomes for the superseded units by right-clicking on the enrolment and selecting "Record Results" [2]. For units that were granted a credit transfer, RPL, or marked as competent, report the superseded units. For units that were started but not completed and being transitioned in the following calendar year, update the outcome to "Superseded Subject (61)" and set the finish date to when the unit was superseded [2][1].

Next, you can prevent the superseded units from reporting by resetting the result if not required to report them [2]. 

Then, create a new enrolment with the current superseding units and qualification for each student [2][1]. When adding the new superseding units, use the Change AVETMISS Values wizard to reduce the scheduled hours by the hours attended for the superseded unit [3].

Finally, link the commitment ID from the superseded enrolment to the new enrolment [2].

This process will allow you to transfer the enrolment and attendance data to the new updated unit codes while properly reporting the superseded units. Let me know if you need any further assistance!

Kind Regards,

Hi *****,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the superseded CUA unit codes. When a qualification is superseded and students need to transition to the new units, there are a few steps involved in VETtrak:

1. For the superseded units where students were granted a Credit Transfer, RPL, or marked as Competent, you will need to update the outcome to "Superseded Subject" (code 61) and set the Unit Finish Date to the date the unit was superseded [1]. This will ensure these units are reported correctly.

2. For any superseded units that were started but not completed, and the student is transitioning to the new units in the following calendar year, you should also update the outcome to "Superseded Subject" and set the Finish Date [1].

3. If units were not started at all, you do not need to report the superseded units [1].

4. To record the attendance hours for the superseded units before transitioning, use the Bulk Enrolment Results Wizard and record the "Hours (actual)" against each superseded unit [3]. The new superseding units should have their Scheduled Hours reduced by these recorded attendance hours.

5. Create a new enrolment with the current superseding units and qualification for each student [1]. You can then use the Change AVETMISS Values Wizard to adjust the Hours on the new units based on the attendance hours recorded for the superseded units [3].

6. Ensure you link the new enrolment to the same Commitment ID as the superseded enrolment [1]. This will allow reporting on the full student journey.

By following these steps, you can transition students to the new units while ensuring accurate reporting and maintaining attendance data. Let me know if you need any further assistance with this process.

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the superseded CUA unit codes. When a qualification is superseded, VETtrak provides a way to transition students from the old superseded units to the new updated units while retaining their attendance and progress data [1].

For the units that were granted a competent outcome or credit transfer, you will need to report the superseded units with their final outcome [1]. For units that were started but not completed, and the student is transitioning to the new units in the following calendar year, you should update the outcome to "Superseded Subject" (code 61) and set the finish date to when the unit was superseded [2][1]. This will allow you to report the superseded units as required.

Then, you can create a new enrolment with the current updated units and link it to the same Commitment ID as the superseded enrolment [2][1]. When adding the new units, use the Bulk Enrolment Results Wizard to record the "Hours (actual)" attended for the superseded units [3]. Reduce the scheduled hours for the new units by the hours attended in the old units [3].

This process will ensure that the student's attendance and progress in the superseded units is carried over to the new units. Please let me know if you need any further assistance with this transition process.

Kind Regards,

NSW - Superseding an Enrolment

When a Qualification is Superseded in NSW and a client is transitioned into the Current (Superseding) Qualification, you will need to update your Enrolments and Units in VETtrak for Smart and Skilled Reporting Purposes. This process will involve amending the Superseded Units and Commitment ID as well as ensuring they need to be reported. TABLE OF CONTENTS   When to Report the Superseded Units  Reporting the Superseded Units  Outcomes for Superseded Units  Preventing the Superseded Units from Reporting  Reporting the new units  Linking the Commitment ID   When to Report the Superseded Units  There are a few scenarios that will determine if you need to report a superseded unit, the scenarios listed in NSW Smart and Skilled documentation are as follows:  The Unit was granted a Credit Transfer (60), Recognition of prior learning (51) or Competent (20) outcome  Report the Superseded Units  The Unit was Started but Not Completed and is being transitioned within the Following Calendar Year. Report the Superseded Units  The Unit was Not Started  Do not Report the Superseded Units  The Unit was Started but Not Completed and is being transitioned within the Current Calendar Year   Do not Report the Superseded Units    Note This process is aligned with the information found on Page 18 of the Smart and Skilled eReporting Technical Specifications

and Business Validations documentation found within STS Online. Reporting the Superseded Units  Once you have determined which units need to be reported, you will need to adjust the outcomes for the superseded units. You can do this by right-clicking

on the enrolment

and selecting

on the enrolment

and selecting

Record Results. Outcomes for Superseded Units  If you were required to report the Superseded Units from the previous section, the outcome may need to be updated. The Unit was granted a Credit Transfer (60), Recognition of prior learning (51) or Competent (20) outcome   No Change   The Unit was Started but Not Completed and is being transitioned within the Following Calendar Year. Update the Unit Outcome to Superseded Subject (61)

When updating the unit result to Superseded Subject then set the Unit Finish Date to reflect the date the Unit was superseded into the New Unit. You will need to Report the superseded Qualification Code, Unit Code and Superseded Start Date as they are in VETtrak. Note This process is aligned with the information found on Page 18 of the Smart and Skilled eReporting Technical Specifications and Business Validations documentation found within STS Online. Preventing the Superseded Units from Reporting  If you are not required to report the units as per the instructions above, you can reset the result of any Superseded Unit to prevent it from Reporting, this is because VETtrak will not include Units in the NAT Files with no Start and Finish date. Navigate to the Superseded Unit, right-click on the Superseded Unit and select Reset Unit/Module Result. Reporting the Current (Superseding) Units  Once the old units have been adjusted, you can create a new enrolment with the Current Units and Qualification under the client. You can follow the article below to create a new enrolment:   Process: Creating a Client Enrolment  Linking the Commitment ID  If you are reporting Superseded Units after following the steps above, you will need to use the same Commitment ID for both the Superseded Enrolment and the Current Enrolment.

(defined on page 106) against the superseded unit to represent how many hours the student participated in training before transitioning to the new superseding unit. The new superseding unit will need to have its Scheduled Hours reduced by the Hours Attended of the old superseded unit. We recommend following these steps to achieve this…    Use the Bulk Enrolment Results Wizard to record the Superseded Subject Result Type against the superseded unit. When this Result Type is selected this wizard enables an additional column called Hours (actual) to allow you to record the Hours Attended. The Finish Date of the unit should represent the date the student will transition into the new superseding unit. Add the new superseding unit to the existing enrolment by following one of the below processes. Adding a Unit/Module to an Enrolment Adding Unit/Modules to an Occurrence    Use the Change AVETMISS Values Wizard to adjust the Hours of the new superseding unit by reducing these hours by the Hours Attended you recorded against the superseded unit in step 1. response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about the AVS upload issue after updating VETtrak. Let me provide some information that may help resolve this:

Reference [1] outlines the steps to set up the AVS integration in VETtrak by connecting to the AVS website to obtain a User Code Token. Please ensure you have followed these steps correctly after the update.

If you are still encountering errors after verifying the setup, reference [2] suggests that certain AVS errors can sometimes be ignored when submitting files, as long as they are the only errors appearing. However, it's best to double check your compliance requirements with the relevant authority.

Please try the troubleshooting steps mentioned above. If the issue persists, I recommend checking the release notes for the updated VETtrak version you installed to see if there are any specific changes or known issues related to the AVS integration [no relevant reference found].

If none of these suggestions work, please feel free to provide more details about the exact error messages you're receiving, and I'll be happy to further investigate the issue.

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out about the issues with the AVS (AVETMISS Validation Service) upload function after updating VETtrak. The AVS integration allows you to send AVETMISS files directly to the AVS system for validation, eliminating the need for manual upload [1].

Based on the error messages you provided, it seems there could be an issue with obtaining the AVS API access token or with the upload process itself. Here are a few troubleshooting steps you can try:

1. Ensure that the AVS login details and URLs are correctly configured in the AVS Compliance Preferences (File > Global Preferences > Compliance Preferences > AVS tab) [1].

2. Try reconnecting the AVS integration by pressing the "Connect" button in the AVS Compliance Preferences. This will generate a new User Code Token that you can use to log in to the AVS website and allow VETtrak access [1].

3. If you continue to receive errors during the AVS upload process, there could be an issue with the new VETtrak version you updated to. In some cases, you may need to ignore certain AVS errors and continue with the submission, as long as they are not critical errors [2].

4. Check the release notes for the specific VETtrak version you updated to, as there may be information on any known issues or changes related to the AVS upload process [3].

If you have followed these steps and are still unable to resolve the issue, please let me know the specific error messages you are receiving, and I'll investigate further. Alternatively, you can try reverting to the previous VETtrak version temporarily until a solution is available.

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issues with the AVS Upload function after updating VETtrak. Let me provide some guidance on troubleshooting this:

The process to set up the AVS integration and obtain the access token is outlined in reference [1]. Please ensure you have followed all the steps correctly, including:

1. Entering the correct AVS login details in the AVS Compliance Preferences
2. Generating and copying the User Code Token within the 10-minute validity period
3. Logging into the AVS website and entering the token to allow access

If you have already tried these steps and are still getting errors, there could be an issue with your AVS account or the new VETtrak version. Reference [2] mentions that certain AVS errors can sometimes be ignored when submitting files to Skills Tasmania, depending on their compliance requirements [2].

However, if the errors persist after trying the recommended steps, I would suggest contacting the VETtrak support team for further assistance, as they may be aware of any specific issues or additional troubleshooting required for the latest version. Please provide them with the error details and screenshots for better analysis.

Let me know if you have any other questions!

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content:
Process: Set Up NCVER AVETMISS Validation Service Integration

VETtrak can integrate with the NCVER Web Service, allowing a VETtrak user to send AVETMISS files directly to the AVS system - eliminating the requirement to manually save and upload them for validation. This process will need to be completed for each unique VETtrak log in account that has been configured within your VETtrak Security Manager    To configure this option, choose File > Global Preferences. Select Compliance preferences from the Preference items list, then choose the AVS tab:     Within this area, there are a standard set of details used for the service to function. In order to link your AVS login to the web service, press the Connect button. The following Authentication Wizette will appear:     A User Code Token will be generated, and will remain live for 10 minutes. After this time has elapsed, if not used, the User Code Token will expire. Once the code has been generated, press the Copy button, then press Login to AVS. A web browser will open, displaying the AVS website. If you are not already logged in, it will prompt you to do so, otherwise it will continue to the User Code Token entry step:     Log in with your AVS Website Details, and the following page will ask for your Generated VETtrak User Code Token:     Enter your code, and press Submit - from here, you should see the following screen confirming the access. Press Allow to confirm the process.

Solution  You should be able to ignore these errors and continue to submit your files to Skills Tasmania (as long as these are the only errors that appear in AVS). Note If you are unsure what your compliance requirements are, you can contact Skills Tasmania for clarification. If you know your compliance requirements but need help using the VETtrak software, you can contact VETtrak Support for assistance on 1800 838 872, email support@vettrak.io or submit a support ticket here. Additional Reading  Here is some additional reading on this topic:   AVETMISS FAQ & Errors - Tasmania

[VT_Error] Firebird Troubleshooting

TROUBLESHOOTING STEPS

1. Make sure the user is on the host computer (server) where VETtrak is installed.

2. Within the VETtrak database configuration utility (VTConfig.exe) change the ‘Select driver type’ to ‘Embedded’ and click the button with 3

dots and browse to the VETtrak.gdb file – always check that the date modified is current if not it could be the wrong database. Make sure

that they are browsing to the database via ‘Devices and drives’ and not a ‘Network locations’

3. Click ‘Test Now!’ and confirm the database connects.

4. If correct change the ‘Select driver type’ to ‘Firebird’ and enter the IP address of this computer before the drive letter.

5. Click ‘Test Now!’ and confirm the database connects

6. Try running VETtrak on any local computers that use VETtrak to confirm that they can connect to the database.

and we have been informed that the older USI web service will not support machine credentials.

For a local install customer running VETtrak 19.1 or later, but before 20.1, to transition to a machine credential, they follow all the same

setup steps as above for local install customers with one additional step:

In the File menu -> Global Preferences -> Compliance Preferences -> USI tab, change the URLs to:

Reporting unverified USIs

As another last-resort, if after March 27 a customer is not yet able to complete the AUSkey transition process but needs to report unverified

USIs, a work-around is to temporarily turn on the "Organisation is exempt from all USI requirements" tickbox on the USI page in the

Organisation wizard. This will allow them to perform AVETMISS generations containing unverified USIs. To avoid issues in future, they must

turn this tickbox off again once they have completed the transition to RAM.131

[VT_Error] VETtrak Version Minor Update Issues

Minor VETtrak software updates are able to be applied under File - Global Preferences by clicking Check web for updates.

VETtrak will close and the following window will then appear to allow the user to download the update and apply the patch.

If this window does appear but does not apply the update after clicking the Start download button this could mean that the user doesn't

have write access to the VETtrak folder.

If this window does not appear it could be caused by a number of reasons.

When the user clicks Check web for updates VETtrak copies the AutoUpdater.exe file from the VETtrak folder to the user's temp folder

and runs it from there, passing command-line parameters into it.

VETtrak support on 03 6333 0166. The most significant changes are:   New software licencing model. New role-based security system and Security Manager. New multi-level division structure. New address fields to prepare for AVETMISS 7 compliance in 2014. New dashboard concept replacing the roadmap. In Queensland, support for reporting tuition fees for Certificate 3 Guarantee funded training in AVETMISS.

Important upgrading notes   As the VETtrak licencing model has changed, to complete the upgrade, you will need a new VETtrak version 4.4 registration key from VETtrak support. The database update utility has a button to contact

VETtrak servers over the internet to obtain your new key automatically. If you will be running the upgrade on a server that will not have access to the internet, or if it has trouble obtaining your key automatically, you must contact

VETtrak support to obtain your new registration key, preferably before you start the upgrade to avoid any VETtrak downtime. The software updater that you download has changed. When you run it, at the top, use the Browse button to select the folder where VETtrak is installed. Press the extract button to clear out all the old files from your VETtrak folder and copy all the new VETtrak files to your VETtrak folder. If the updater is unable to remove all old files, it will show a message, and you must ensure you are running the updater as a user with sufficient permissions to delete the files, or you can delete the files manually. VETtrak API Security Changes for VETtrak 18.1

Introduction  To better protect access to VETtrak data, security rules across the entire API have been tightened in version 1.16 of the VETtrak API, which has been released alongside VETtrak 18.1 in January 2018. These changes will likely impact existing third-party applications that are using the API to integrate with VETtrak. The changes do not affect most VETtrak-produced integrations such as VETsurvey, VETnet, Trainer Portal, Student Portal, VTDocs and Progress Portal, but VETenrol is affected by the changes. For VETtrak administrators  After upgrading to VETtrak 18.1, to continue to use the API, you must have a new "VETtrak API" feature in your VETtrak registration key. To update your registration key, in VETtrak, go to the File menu -> Global Preferences -> Registration key -> Update Key Automatically button. If this is not done, the following error will occur when calling nearly every API function: The registration key does not contain a valid registration for the "VETtrak API" feature. In VETtrak, go to the File menu -> Global Preferences -> Registration Key to view the registration information, and press "Update key automatically" to update it. Contact VETtrak Support if you need to obtain a valid registration for this feature. In the Security Manager in VETtrak, a new "API VETtrak" application will then be available. This contains a role called "VETtrak API default role" that has access to the new "VETtrak API" feature.

ticket_content.ticket_description: Dear VETtrak Support Team,     I am hoping you can help me here. We are trying to develop a new enrolment form. There is a section in VETtrak about 'Proficiency in Spoken English'.  NCVER standard enrolment form and  Victorian Student Statistical collection guidelines do not require this data. I just checked QLD data collection guidelines as well and could not find anything about the profeciency. I am curious if this data element on language profeciency is required under any state/territory data requirements or is it just for the RTO information?     Can you please advise if this data element is extrected and submitted to any state/territory as part of AVETMISS data submission?  I have attached the relevant section (highlighted) from VETtrak for reference.     Thanks  *************

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the "Proficiency in Spoken English" data element in VETtrak.

The "Proficiency in Spoken English" field is part of the AVETMISS data collection options in VETtrak. As per reference [1], when enabled, this will include a question in the enrolment form regarding how well the participant speaks English.

Regarding whether this data element is required for AVETMISS reporting, based on the NCVER AVETMISS guidelines in reference [3], collecting information on the main language spoken at home is a mandatory data element. However, the specific question on English proficiency is noted as only being relevant for Western Australia [1].

Reference [2] provides the standard AVETMISS enrolment question related to language: "Do you speak a language other than English at home? (If more than one language, indicate the one that is spoken most often.)". It does not mention a separate question on English proficiency.

So in summary:
- The "Proficiency in Spoken English" field is an optional VETtrak setting related to AVETMISS data collection
- It is not a mandatory data element for AVETMISS reporting to NCVER or most states/territories
- It may be required for reporting in Western Australia based on their specific guidelines

Unless you are delivering training in Western Australia, you likely do not need to include the English proficiency question on your enrolment form for AVETMISS purposes. However, you can choose to collect this additional information for your own RTO records if desired.

Let me know if you need any other details!

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the "Proficiency in Spoken English" data element in VETtrak.

After reviewing the AVETMISS data specifications, I can confirm that this field is only relevant for Western Australia [2]. The AVETMISS Data Element Definitions state that the "Collect English proficiency question" option "will include a question regarding how well the participant speaks English. This question was previously required nationally, but is now only known to be relevant for Western Australia."

For other states/territories, this data element is not mandated as part of the AVETMISS reporting requirements [3]. The AVETMISS VET Provider Collection specifications outline the required data to be collected and reported nationally, which does not include English proficiency.

Therefore, if you are not delivering training in Western Australia, you do not need to collect this information as it will not be extracted and submitted through your AVETMISS data submissions to other states/territories or NCVER.

I hope this clarifies the requirements around the "Proficiency in Spoken English" field. Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the "Proficiency in Spoken English" data element in VETtrak. Based on the AVETMISS Data Element Definitions [2], this data element is only known to be relevant for Western Australia.

The AVETMISS standard states: "Collect English proficiency question When enabled (), will include a question regarding how well the participant speaks English. This question was previously required nationally, but is now only known to be relevant for Western Australia." [1]

So while this data element is not required for NCVER or other state/territory AVETMISS reporting [4], it is still collected in VETtrak to meet the requirements for Western Australia. The AVETMISS VET Provider Collection specifications also mention that this data needs to be collected by training providers delivering to domestic students [5].

If you are not operating or submitting data in Western Australia, then you can likely exclude this data element from your enrolment form. However, if you have students located in WA, you would need to collect their English proficiency details.

Please let me know if you need any further clarification on this.

Kind Regards,

Scope  and reporting requirements

The AVETMISS VET Provider Collection specifications enable  the collection of information  from

training providers who deliver nationally recognised vocational education and training  (VET) to

domestic and international students at onshore and offshore locations. VET in Schools programs

provide credit towards a nati onally recognised VET qualification and therefore are included in this

collection. This document is also used by training providers who deliver government -funded locally

recognised training to domestic students.

The National VET Data Policy , 2017 enforce s the collection of  AVETMISS -compliant data and

outlines the reporting timeframes for all accredited training, from all training providers

AVETMISS Reporting - General Information

AVETMISS stands for the Australian Vocational Education and Training Management Information Statistical Standard. It is a national data standard that ensures consistent and accurate capture and reporting of Vocational Education and Training (VET) information about students. VETtrak provides the facility to generate AVETMISS (NAT files) for both a State Reporting Body and the National Centre for Vocational Education Research (NCVER),

across currently supported AVETMISS standards.

The Total VET Activity (TVA) legislation defines that all accredited training in Australia must be reported to the National Centre for Vocational Education Research (NCVER).

Within VETtrak the Reportability options section of the enrolment wizard defines which government body the enrolment is reported to;   Report to state body – if you deliver any training funded by a State Body, all funded accredited enrolments must be reported to that funding body, who then forward the data to NCVER. *If you have a state funding contract in VIC, QLD, SA, ACT, TAS and NT you may choose this reportability option for all accredited enrolments regardless of funding eligibility. Report to national body (NCVER) – Any accredited enrolments that are not reported to your state body

are instead reported to NCVER. Do not report this enrolment – this should only be used for non-accredited training, as it will entirely

stop this enrolment from being reported in AVETMISS.

AVETMISS FAQ & Errors - Victoria: This recently published article includes FAQs with links to relevant Victorian AVETMISS pages as well as common Errors/Warnings we have seen our customers encounter. We will continue to add content to this article to ensure it is a reliable resource for our Victorian VETtrak customers. Tuition Fee Reporting: Reporting of Tuition Fees is mandatory in Victoria. This article will help you understand how to set up your enrolment pricing to best represent the fees you charge your students in your Skills Victoria AVETMISS reporting. How to Supersede a Qualification in VETtrak: Has a qualification on your scope been superseded by a newer version? This article outlines the steps to transition your Victorian students from the superseded qualification to the superseding. Victorian Student Numbers (VSN): Want to connect your VETtrak to the VSR web service to utilise VETtrak’s VSN functionality? This article is for you! Updating Victorian Enrolment Identifiers: It isn’t often that you will need to update your Victorian Enrolment Identifiers, but when you do it’s handy to know how. This article will help guide you through how to update your Program Enrolment Identifiers and Subject Enrolment Identifiers. Q&A  Q: Do we need to report other fees to Skill Victoria such as Admin Fees?

Total VET Activity Reporting (National AVETMISS) Overview

This is your one-stop resource to complete your Total VET Activity obligations! All RTOs must collect a range of data from their students and report all their delivery activity (known as Total VET activity) to the

National Centre for Vocational Education Research (NCVER), at least annually. This will require a specific generation process be completed from your VETtrak software, detailed in the video below and within this Help Centre article.

What do I need to collect and report on? You must collect AVETMISS-compliant records for all students, and all competency enrolments delivered and outcomes achieved throughout the calendar year. Early in the following year (February), you must report this data to NCVER unless you have previously done so through existing contractual arrangements - effectively, all of your State Reported data will be forwarded to NCVER on your behalf, and any remaining Nationally Reported data will need to be captured and submitted via a National AVETMISS Generation to the NCVER AVETMISS Validation Software website.

What do I need to do to generate my Total VET Data? VETtrak provides the facility to generate AVETMISS (NAT files) for both a

State Reporting Body

and the

National Centre for Vocational Education Research (NCVER),

across currently supported AVETMISS standards. To generate records for NCVER, located the Generate National AVETMISS option

under the

AVETMISS

menu:      The following wizard will appear:      Very few options need to be changed or amended in this area. The Submission Period should reflect the Entire Year  Enforce end of year validation

SVTS: Update VIC Subject Enrolment Identifier

Warning: This function may impact your claiming and should not be used unless you have been instructed to do so by SVTS or VETtrak Support. VETtrak has the capacity to amend or update the VIC Subject Enrolment Identifier for a particular unit. This Identifier is generated when a unit appears in an AVETMISS File Generation, and is reported to SVTS. Within the Victorian VET Student Statistical Guidelines, the Subject Enrolment Identifier is explained as such:  Element description:   Value that uniquely identifies a student’s enrolment in a Subject (Known in VETtrak as a Unit or Module)   Exists in NAT files:   Training Activity (NAT00120)   Purpose:  To provide a mechanism for linking information relating to individual enrolments at subject level. Business rules:  The Subject Enrolment Identifier is a unique identifier on the Training Activity (NAT00120) file which relates to;  a student’s enrolment in training, or  assessment in a standalone subject, or  a subject forming part of a program       The Subject Enrolment Identifier should remain unchanged throughout the history of a students reporting - however, in unique circumstances, you may be required to amend or replace your Subject Enrolment Identifier. This is done via a unique utility within VETtrak. We stress that this is a process that should only be utilised when you have been advised by either SVTS or VETtrak Support.

Accessing the Update VIC Subject Enrolment Identifier Wizette  To access the tool to amend/update VIC Subject Enrolment Identifiers, locate the enrolment in question, and

ticket_content.ticket_description: Good afternoon.  We have received funding for units that were completed in ****. We regenerated a Subject enrollment identifier this year due to a change in enrollment status however some units were already complete and the updated identifier did not automatically populate to these units.  Could you please advise how we rectify this issue as we should not have received this funding.  Thank you

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with receiving funding for units completed in a previous year. I understand the concern, and we can rectify this situation.

To update the Subject Enrollment Identifiers for the completed units that did not get the new identifier automatically, you can use the "Update Subject Enrollment Identifier" utility [1]. This will allow you to either generate a new identifier or manually change the existing one for those specific unit enrolments.

As for the incorrect funding claims, we can address that by using the "Change Occurrence Enrolled Units" wizard [3]. Here, you can update the "Reportability" field for those completed units to mark them as non-reportable. This will prevent them from being included in future funding claims.

By taking these steps, the Subject Enrollment Identifiers will be updated for the completed units, and they will be marked as non-reportable to avoid receiving incorrect funding. Please let me know if you need any further assistance with this process.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with funding claims for units completed in a previous year. I understand the concern, as funding should not be claimed for units already completed [2].

To rectify this situation, you can use the Update Subject Enrolment Identifier utility to manually update the subject enrollment identifiers for the completed units [1]. This will ensure the updated identifiers are applied to those units.

After updating the identifiers, any future AVETMISS reporting should correctly reflect that these units were completed in the previous year. The system will then generate a negative claim to retrieve the funding amounts that were incorrectly paid for those units [2].

Please let me know if you need any assistance with using the Update Subject Enrolment Identifier utility or have any other questions.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about this funding issue. To rectify the situation where some completed units did not get the updated subject enrollment identifier after it was regenerated:

1. Go to the AVETMISS page for the enrollment and locate the completed units that still have the old subject enrollment identifier [1].
2. For each of those units, click the Edit button next to the Subject Enrolment Identifier field [1].
3. In the Update Subject Enrolment Identifier window, select the "Change VIC Subject Enrolment Identifier" option and enter the new identifier value that should have been applied [1].

After updating the subject enrollment identifiers on those completed units, you will need to generate a new AVETMISS file to report the changes to the funding body. This should trigger a negative claim (reject 19) [2][4] to retrieve the funding amounts that were incorrectly paid for those units with the old identifiers.

Please let me know if you need any other assistance with this process. I'd be happy to provide more details or clarification.

Report qualification as subject-only enrolment.A new “Report enrolments as subject-only” checkbox has been added to the Qualification wizard. This allows you to use a qualification/course as normal, but have it reported in AVETMISS as a subject-only enrolment. This is useful for LMS integrations etc that require a qualification on the enrolment, but need to be reported in AVETMISS without a qualification. This checkbox has the following effects:  On the AVETMISS page in the Enrolment wizard, when a qualification with "Report enrolments as subject-only" on is selected:  The Commencing status flag is automatically set to 8 (subject-only)  The Program Enrolment information will not be available in VIC or TAS  The "Subject-only training cannot be selected when a qualification is selected" validation error will not occur  If the enrolment is reportable, a new wizard side-bar alert is shown to indicate the enrolment will be reported as subject-only    Generate AVETMISS will report any enrolment with a qualification that has "Report enrolments as subject-only" on with:  No entry in the NAT30 file  An empty Program Identifier in the NAT120 file  An empty Program Enrolment Identifier in the NAT120 file, for VIC or TAS generations  No entry in the NAT130 file       If you use this to change a unit that has already been successfully reported to SVTS with a program enrolment identifier, you will need to generate a new subject enrolment identifier for the unit   Special characters.
