When updating the unit result to Superseded Subject then set the Unit Finish Date to reflect the date the Unit was superseded into the New Unit. You will need to Report the superseded Qualification Code, Unit Code and Superseded Start Date as they are in VETtrak. Note This process is aligned with the information found on Page 18 of the Smart and Skilled eReporting Technical Specifications and Business Validations documentation found within STS Online. Preventing the Superseded Units from Reporting  If you are not required to report the units as per the instructions above, you can reset the result of any Superseded Unit to prevent it from Reporting, this is because VETtrak will not include Units in the NAT Files with no Start and Finish date. Navigate to the Superseded Unit, right-click on the Superseded Unit and select Reset Unit/Module Result. Reporting the Current (Superseding) Units  Once the old units have been adjusted, you can create a new enrolment with the Current Units and Qualification under the client. You can follow the article below to create a new enrolment:   Process: Creating a Client Enrolment  Linking the Commitment ID  If you are reporting Superseded Units after following the steps above, you will need to use the same Commitment ID for both the Superseded Enrolment and the Current Enrolment.

Recalculate Enrolment Pricing

If you make any changes to the figures for a Funding Model, these changes will not be automatically reflected in enrolments that use the Funding Model - the pricing for each enrolment will need to be recalculated. Rather than editing each enrolment individually, this can be done using the Recalculate Enrolment Pricing Wizard. To open the Recalculate Enrolment Pricing Wizard, go to Utility > Recalculate enrolment pricing. This will display the Recalculate Enrolment Pricing Wizard. Select the State. Select the Funding Source that you want to update enrolments for. Tick the box if you only want to search for enrolments that started within a particular date range, and set the dates. Alternatively, tick this box if you want to find the enrolments from your most recent AVETMISS generation. This will disable all the other search criteria fields. Click Search for enrolments. The grid will fill with all enrolments in the selected state with the selected funding source. If you click on an enrolment, you can see its current pricing here. This is for information purposes only and cannot be changed here. Drag the dotted bar if you need to change the size of the panels to see more clearly. Tick the enrolments that you want to change, or click the Use heading to tick them all. Click Update pricing for selected enrolments.

NOTE: If you have left the Recalculate pricing for units with a claimed date box unticked under Global Preferences > Result Unit and Award Preferences, this process will NOT recalculate pricing for any unit that has already been claimed.

The Commitment ID will link the 2 Enrolments together for Smart and Skilled reporting, this can be found on Page 12 of the Smart and Skilled eReporting Technical Specifications and Business Validations documentation.

You can adjust the Commitment ID by right-clicking on the new

enrolment

and selecting

Edit Enrolment, the Commitment ID can be found on the AVETMISS

page. Paste the Commitment ID of the Superseded Enrolment in this section to link the 2 Enrolments.

Warning  You will only need to link the 2 Enrolments through the Commitment ID if you are reporting Superseded Units, if you are not reporting any Superseded Units, you will need to generate a new Commitment ID for the Current Enrolment and the Superseded Commitment ID will need to be cancelled on the STS Portal. This is in line with

Page 12

of the Smart and Skilled eReporting Technical Specifications and Business Validations documentation on STS Online. With this, your Superseded Enrolments should be ready for reporting!

(defined on page 106) against the superseded unit to represent how many hours the student participated in training before transitioning to the new superseding unit. The new superseding unit will need to have its Scheduled Hours reduced by the Hours Attended of the old superseded unit. We recommend following these steps to achieve this…    Use the Bulk Enrolment Results Wizard to record the Superseded Subject Result Type against the superseded unit. When this Result Type is selected this wizard enables an additional column called Hours (actual) to allow you to record the Hours Attended. The Finish Date of the unit should represent the date the student will transition into the new superseding unit. Add the new superseding unit to the existing enrolment by following one of the below processes. Adding a Unit/Module to an Enrolment Adding Unit/Modules to an Occurrence    Use the Change AVETMISS Values Wizard to adjust the Hours of the new superseding unit by reducing these hours by the Hours Attended you recorded against the superseded unit in step 1. response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for your enquiry regarding the Workforce Training Innovation Fund initiative. Based on the Victorian VET Student Statistical Collection guidelines, state-specific funding programs like the Workforce Training Innovation Fund should be reported using the 'Funding Source Identifier - National' code '15 - State specific funding program' [1].

For state-specific funding programs, you may also need to provide a 'Specific Funding Identifier' code if directed by the Victorian Department of Education and Training [3]. However, I could not find any specific code listed for the Workforce Training Innovation Fund in the guidelines.

If you are granting any fee waivers or exemptions for students under this initiative, you would report that using the appropriate 'Fee Exemption/Concession Type Identifier' [2]. Please refer to the guidelines for the specific codes to use.

Let me know if you need any other assistance regarding reporting for this initiative.

Kind regards,

Hi,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the Workforce Training Innovation Fund initiative. Based on the Skills First guidelines from the Victorian Government [1], there does not appear to be a specific Funding Source Identifier or Fee Exemption/Concession Type Identifier code for reporting enrolments under this initiative.

The guidelines outline the reporting requirements for other Victorian government initiatives like JobTrainer, Free TAFE for Priority Courses, and Free TAFE Short Courses, but do not mention any special reporting codes for the Workforce Training Innovation Fund [2][1].

Unless further guidance is provided by the Victorian Government on how to report this funding source, you would likely need to report these enrolments under the standard Funding Source Identifier and Fee Exemption/Concession Type values based on the student's eligibility and funding source.

I would recommend checking for any recent updates or communications from the Victorian Skills Authority regarding potential new reporting requirements for this initiative. If you need any clarification or have additional details about how this fund should be reported, please let me know.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the Workforce Training Innovation Fund. Based on the information in the references:

The Workforce Training Innovation Fund is not listed as a specific funding source identifier under the Skills First program in Victoria [4]. This suggests there is no dedicated funding field or code to report training under this initiative.

For Victorian Skills First reporting, you would likely need to use one of the general funding source identifiers such as:

- 30 - The Skills Fund - Existing Workers Skill Sets
- 31 - The Skills Fund - Existing Workers - Full Qualification
- 32 - The Skills Fund - Job Seekers - Full Qualification
- 33 - The Skills Fund - Mind the Gap Skill Sets [5][6]

The appropriate code would depend on whether the training is for existing workers, job seekers, a full qualification or a skill set. Please let me know if you need any clarification on selecting the right funding source for reporting purposes.

Kind Regards,

Victorian VET Student Statistical Collection Guidelines 2024 v1.0  Page | 99

Funding Eligibility Key

Element description

A key that identifies a student’s funding eligibility.

File

Training Activity (NAT00120)

Purpose

Funding Eligibility Keys  are issued to students by the Department and allow identified students to be funded. These are

often used alongside fee-waivers or eligibility exemptions.

Business rules

General:

Applicable students will provide their Training Organisation with the Funding Eligibility Key  when enrolling in a government

subsidised Program. The Funding Eligibility Key  will be documented on the referral letter or equivalent type of letter that

the student needs to present to the RTO before their enrolment.

Specific:

The Funding Eligibility Key  will need to remain consistent for the same Client ID,  Program Identifier  and Program

Commencement Date  combination.

This field may be blank.

Field format

Value  Description

Length  10

Type  Alphanumeric

Justification  Left

Fill character  Space

Field value

File

Training Activity (NAT00120)

Purpose

Specific Funding Identifier  allows for analysis of data by specific Australian Government programs relevant to vocational

education and training.

Business rules

General:

This field is only for use by state or territory training authorities or by training organisations as directed by the Departm ent

of Jobs, Skills, Industry and Region. It must only be used w hen Funding Source Identifier  - National  is ’13 - Commonwealth

specific purpose programs’.

Specific Funding Identifier  must not be blank if Funding Source Id entifier - National  is ‘13 - Commonwealth specific funding

program’.

Specific:

This field is for use by state or territory training authorities or those training organisations receiving funding directly f rom

the Commonwealth.

While most programs are administered by the Department of Jobs , Skills, Industry and Region  other Commonwealth

departments may offer funding for training. For example, job search incentives on training programs provided by Centrelink

or health training initiatives funded by the Commonwealth. Programs can be administered by state and territory tr aining

authorities or by a direct contract between the Commonwealth and the training organisation.

Please refer to the NCVER Portal  for an up-to -date list of Specific Funding Identifier  values as codes are updated when

new programs are introduced or discontinued.

This field may be blank subject to rules above.

Funding Source  Identifier - National

Element description

A code that uniquely identifies the predominant national source of funding for the delivery of a Subject Enrolment.

File

Training Activity (NAT00120)

Purpose

To analyse VET activity by source of funding.

Business rules

Specific:

‘11 - Commonwealth and State general purpose recurrent ’ is funding provided under the National Agreement on

Skills and Workforce Development (NASWD) or succeeding agreement for general and recurrent purposes; or

funding provided for recurrent purposes by the state or territory training authority.

‘13 - Commonw ealth specific funding program’ is funding provided by the Commonwealth to provide training for a

specific purpose or initiative.

Funding may come from a Commonwealth department other than the Department of Jobs, Skills, Industry and Region, for

example, job search incentives on training provided by Centrelink or health training initiatives funded by the

Commonwealth. Programs can be administered by state and territory training authorities or by a direct contract with the

Commonwealth.

Note:  selecting Funding Source Identifier - National  ‘13’ will require a subsequent entr y in the data element Specific

Funding Identifier . The Specific Funding Identifier  reference list is available from the NCVER website.

‘15 - State specific funding program’ is funding provided by state or territory governments to provide training for

specific purposes.

‘20 - Domestic client - other revenue’ is revenue provided by or for a student to undertake education and training,

JobTrainer Funding Requirements

The JobTrainer initiative (JobTrainer) is a joint Commonwealth and State initiative which provides additional funding to increase access to free or low fee training places for young people and job seekers. This requires some unique details be set up in VETtrak to meet these requirements, detailed within this article. JobTrainer Funding Sources  You may be required to enter unique Funding Sources to reflect JobTrainer needs. The process to add a funding source is linked below, with details regarding what information to enter a little further down the page. For information on entering a new funding source:   Adding a new Funding source   These JobTrainer specific funding source detail are sourced from SVTS:     The above details were sourced from the Funding source identifier STA supplement - 2021 v1 (xlsx - 29 (xlsx - 29.1kb) document, located on the Training data collection section of Victorian state government page. Using the details from the above example, when adding a new Funding Source, you can enter the information like so to accurately capture the funding details required:     This can then be used within appropriate enrolments. Process: Creating a Client Enrolment

JobTrainer Concession/Waiver Set Up  An SVTS sourced document explains the specific requirement of using a unique Fee Concession/Fee Waiver structure when reporting a particular JobTrainer funding type. This clarification is as follows:     The document clarifying this information is the JobTrainer_fact_sheet_version_2.0.pdf  An example of this unique Fee Concession/Fee Waiver structure being used is shown in the screenshot below:     By entering the first Fee Concession as Z - None, and setting the Fee Waiver to R - JobTrainer Skill Sets Initiative, this will report the desired combined Exemption code of ZR as detailed above.

Note that, while tuition fees are entered in dollars-and-cents format in the Funding Model Wizard and Edit AVETMISS Values Wizard, they will be rounded up to a whole dollar amount when reported in AVETMISS in Queensland. The following new state funding sources have been added if they didn't already exist: "Pre-apprenticeship Initiative No Fees" (PSI), "Higher Level Training Subsidies" (HLS), "VET In Schools" (VIS), "Certificate III Guarantee" (ENT), "Certificate III Guarantee (student fees paid by a JSA)" (ENJ) and "Single and Teenage Parent Program (STPP)" (STJ). The following new fee exemptions have been added if they didn't already exist: "Non-concessional student not accessing an ICL" (N), "Non-concessional student accessing an ICL" (L), "Concessional student not accessing an ICL" (C), "Exemption (CLP clients only)" (E) and "Fees paid by an Australian Government agency (usually a JSA)" (F). A new outcome code 65 for "Transferring participant to a superseding qualification (Qld)" has been added. If you want to use this outcome, you will need to create a result type linked to it. Tasmania   The following new state funding sources have been added if they didn't already exist: "The Skills Fund - Existing Workers - Skill Sets" (30), "The Skills Fund - Existing Workers - Full Qualification" (31), "The Skills Fund - Job Seekers - Full Qualification" (32) and "The Skills fund - Mind the Gap" (33). Client and employer changes   Parent employer hierarchy.

Skills First Program Step

Victorian Skills First Program is a category of the Funding Steps page, which is accessed from the Configuration () page in the VETenrol Admin. These settings apply to the Skills First Program (SFP) step in the standard registration process, which facilitates the user's application for the Victorian Skills First Program should they wish to apply. In addition, a pdf version of the declaration form including the user's details will be attached to the RTO alert notification if a Mail Server is specified and the include attachment(s) option is ticked. This same pdf can also be downloaded from the Registration Details using the download link for the Skills First Program Declaration section. Key aspects of the page:   Navigate to related pages:  Default Steps — navigate to the Registration Steps: Default page. Optional Steps — navigate to the Registration Steps: Optional page. Industry Steps — navigate to the Registration Steps: Industry-specific page. SFP step options section. Save This button commits any changes to the settings. It appears to the right of the navigation area and at the bottom of the page. Saving will keep changes to settings made across tabs. SFP step options    Enable Skills First Program step This option enables the step in the registration process. If the option is ticked () other settings relating to the step will become available. If the option is unticked () the step will not be part of the registration process.

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding ACFE reporting in VETtrak. Based on the release notes, VETtrak does have support for generating various government reporting files for different states and territories, including AVETMISS compliance [1].

Specifically for ACFE reporting requirements, VETtrak has the ability to generate AVETMISS files for the ACT with their specific requirements [1]. The optional units in occurrences now show with a blue icon, which may be relevant for ACFE courses [2].

However, I could not find explicit mention of dedicated ACFE reporting capabilities. I would suggest checking with your VETtrak account manager or ReadyTech support to confirm if the existing AVETMISS reporting meets your ACFE requirements or if any additional configuration is needed.

Please let me know if you need any other assistance regarding reporting in VETtrak.

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding ACFE reporting in VETtrak. Based on the release notes, I could not find any specific mentions of built-in ACFE reporting functionality [1][3]. However, VETtrak does include comprehensive compliance reporting capabilities for various states and territories, including Victoria.

I would recommend checking the VETtrak knowledge base or contacting our support team to confirm if ACFE reporting is covered under the general Victorian compliance reporting, or if there are any plans to introduce dedicated ACFE reporting features in future releases.

In the meantime, you may be able to utilize VETtrak's custom reporting tools or data export capabilities to generate reports that meet your ACFE reporting requirements. Our support team would be happy to assist you with setting up any custom reporting solutions.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance regarding ACFE reporting or VETtrak's compliance reporting capabilities.

Kind regards,

Hi ******,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding ACFE reporting in VETtrak.

Unfortunately, I could not find any specific information about ACFE reporting capabilities within VETtrak in the available documentation. It seems that the current version of VETtrak does not have built-in features for generating ACFE reports or meeting ACFE reporting requirements [].

However, I understand that ACFE reporting is important for organizations like yours that provide Adult, Community and Further Education programs. I will raise this with our product team to explore the possibility of adding ACFE reporting functionality in future releases of VETtrak [].

In the meantime, you may need to use separate tools or processes to meet your ACFE reporting obligations. If you have any specific requirements or use cases related to ACFE reporting, please feel free to share them with us, and we can evaluate how VETtrak could potentially support those needs [].

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We appreciate your feedback, as it helps us improve VETtrak to better serve the needs of our customers.

Kind regards,

VETtrak 23.3 Release Notes - 02/08/2023 (updated 8/09/2023)

TABLE OF CONTENTS   VETtrak Desktop 23.3.0.1  Email  Other Changes    VETtrak Desktop 23.3.0.0  Compliance  Email  Relationships  Finance  Enrolments  Importers  Data Insights  General  LMS    VTDocs Portal  VTDocs portal 23.3.0.1  VTDocs portal 23.3.0.0    Student Portal  Student portal 23.3.0.1  Student portal 23.3.0.0    Trainer Portal  Trainer portal 23.3.0.2  Trainer portal 23.3.0.1  Trainer portal 23.3.0.0    Progress Portal  Progress portal 23.3.0.1  Progress portal 23.3.0.0    VETenrol  VETenrol 23.3.0.2  VETenrol 23.3.0.1  VETenrol 23.3.0.0           VETtrak Desktop 23.3.0.1  Version released Aug 25th, 2023. Email   File Attachments for secondary recipients.

An issue where, sometimes, a secondary recipient (on the second level of the recipients grid) was not receiving the set of file attachments being emailed to the related primary recipient, has been fixed. Secondary Email Address. An issue has been fixed where emails were not being sent to the secondary email addresses of clients who were configured to receive them. Other Changes   AVETMISS ACT - NAT85 single name reporting. After clarification from Skills Canberra, we have updated the treatment of single-name reporting for students so that all single names will now be reported in both the Client family name AND Client first given name fields in the NAT85. Catapult LMS. When retrieving unit results from Catapult, any Catapult edition code is now ignored when matching the Catapult unit to a VETtrak unit. Finance integrations - Update contact details. An 'Allow updating contact details' setting has been added to the finance configuration Wizard. This setting can be turned off to stop VETtrak from automatically updating the details of contacts in your finance system. VETtrak Desktop 23.3.0.0  Version released Aug 2nd, 2023. Compliance   ACT

Optional units in an occurrence in the Programme Manager now show with a blue icon instead of green. Hosting VTDocs document previewing. If your VETtrak is hosted and you have VTDocs, it is no longer necessary for your user to have access to VTDocs to be able to preview documents within the document database in a web browser in VETtrak. Staff manager class text truncation. An issue that could cause the text in classes nodes in the Staff Manager to be truncated has been fixed. Delete Occurrence Classes Use header. An issue that caused clicking the Use column header in the Delete Occurrence Classes wizard to not do anything when the top row is disabled has been fixed. Foundation skills assessment ACSF indicators. "Digital Literacy .12" and "Digital Literacy .13" ACSF indicators have been added to the Foundation Skills Assessment wizard. Self-service award reports verification QR code. You can now show a verification QR code on award reports you design in the Self-Service Reports Manager. This utilises the VETenrol award verification service. Self-service reports issue. An issue that can cause report options not to show when switching between reports of the same kind has been fixed. Client Importer employment matches. An issue causing the Client Importer to incorrectly match an existing employment record with a different employer has been fixed. QA rejection notification issue.

Added new 'Progress' tab for each Course on the 'Courses' page    Shows Tasks completed percentage, Units completed percentage and Course delivered percentage      Improved ease of use of 'Courses' page, remembering which courses and tabs were recently viewed. Trainer Portal  Trainer Portal 24.2.0.0  Compatibility release for VETtrak 24.2.0.0  Version released Mar 25, 2024. Enhancements  Employer Manager: Added a new Employer Manager. Calendar Subscriptions: We have implemented an improvement when subscribing to a calendar in the Trainer portal to allow the user to specify their Time Zone when the URL is generated. Bug fixes  My Students Pagination:

We have resolved an issue when searching for students records on the My Students page when applying a filter to the page, that filter would be lost after navigating beyond the first page of results.

Auto start unit from attendance:

We have updated the behaviour when auto-starting a unit from recording attendance in the Trainer Portal to add a note "Result due to class attendance recorded in Trainer portal"  Auto start units:

We have updated the auto start behaviour triggered from the Trainer Portal to update Units recorded as Not Yet Started

to Continuing.

The terminology of "built-in" reports has been replaced by "right click" reports to better describe what they are. Report scheduler. The Report Scheduler will now log the full path of the report file being run, and all email attachments, including those from the merge template, to assist with diagnosing issues. When selecting a report file, only .fr3 files will be shown. A new version 1.1 of the Report Scheduler Windows Service is also now available for download in the Support Centre to fix an issue when running it with a VETtrak.ini file created by VETtrak 19.2 or later. New importer changes   Payment Importer default layout. In the default layout file for the Payment Importer, the Recorded Date field has been changed from an Update operation to a Match operation to better detect existing payments. Payment Importer first invoice. An issue with using the "First invoice" relationship in the Payment Importer has been fixed. Sort by status. An issue causing sorting by status to not work correctly in the new importers has been fixed. Assess2Educate (A2E) changes   Coaching guide. The "Open results" button has been replaced with a "Coaching guide" button when viewing a completed A2E assessment, which opens the assessment's coaching guide PDF in a web browser. Probability percentage. When downloading A2E assessment results, the probability of success percentage will now be stored in VETtrak. This can be seen when viewing a completed assessment.

Other Changes   Staff manager - Staff search personal menu. An issue that caused the staff manager staff search right-click menu to disappear has been fixed. You can now access the personal menu by right-clicking staff in the staff search. Staff manager - Selected item information. An issue causing the staff manager's selected item information panel to remain disabled has been fixed. Duplicate classes. An issue that would sometimes cause duplicate classes to appear under the Future classes and Today and past classes has been fixed.

LLN Robot integration.

An issue that would sometimes cause an error message when downloading the learner or learner summary reports has been fixed. Configuration manager - Tree filter. An issue causing the current filter to clear after adding or editing a record in the configuration manager has been fixed.

Attendance manager. The old style attendance manager has been removed. Public API  Public API 24.2.0.0  Compatibility release for VETtrak 24.2.0.0  Version released Mar 25, 2024. A rare problem that could cause the reporter to fail to connect to the database has been fixed. Release 4.4.1.0 - 13/01/2014  Version 4.4.1 is a major update from 4.4.0.x and includes database upgrades. Ensure you have a backup of your database before upgrading. If at all unsure please contact VETtrak support on 03 6333 0166. The most significant changes are:   AVETMISS 7 Compliance. SMS Replies and Delivery Receipts. Email Enhancements and SSL/TLS Support. High Windows Font Size (DPI) Support. AVETMISS CHANGES   AVETMISS 7 support. VETtrak now generates files that comply with the AVETMISS 7 format for 2014, including every Australian state and territory's specific requirements. Total VET Activity reporting. The "Reportable enrolment/award" tickbox on the Enrolment and Award Wizards has been changed to three options: "Report to state body", "Report to national body (NCVER)" and "Do not report this enrolment/award". A new "Generate National AVETMISS files" option has been added to the Utility menu, allowing you to generate files to send to NCVER, which will only include enrolments and awards that have the reportability option set to "Report to national body (NCVER)", and validate the data according to the national rules. As student (client) information is the only data which can be edited through the Student Portal, the only

controllable options are the Add, Edit and Delete privileges for client data. Files:   When students upload documents through the Student Portal, a checkbox will appear for the student to acknowledge a declaration.

The text of that declaration comes from this preference. Use plain text and keep your text to a brief sentence. The text appearing in an unedited preference will default to "I declare that this file is my own work".

Survey:   Enable VET Survey integration into the Student Portal. Note: requires separate product VETSurvey. To add this link, simply turn on this checkbox. Choose the VETSurvey URL from the drop down list of your available VET surveys (predefined list). Enter a Link Name for the preferred link. The name is what will be visible, and clickable for your students. Link:   Show external link in portal menu

The Student Portal also allows you to add a 'custom link' to the menu bar, after student's have logged in. To add this link, simply turn on this checkbox. Enter the Name and URL for the preferred link. The name is what will be visible, and clickable for your students. The URL should be the full address for the site you are linking to (eg: http://www.vettrak.com.au). Messages:   Messaging permissions - can view messages

To allow the students to view direct messages in the student portal, select this box.

Note:

A complimentary setting in the Trainer Portal global preferences for "can send messages" would also need to be enabled for this functionality to work between portals. This will be on by default. Messaging permissions - can send messages

New permissions have been added in the Security Manager under “VETtrak → Import/Export” to control user access to the Occurrences, Client Events, Classes, and Positions importers. Enrolment VETenrol menu. A VETenrol submenu has been added to the right-click menu of enrolments that have a VETenrol registration recorded against that record. This menu gives options to view the registration, diary notes, or mail logs in VETenrol. LLN Assessment FileType. A system-managed FileTrak File Type has been added for LLN Assessment files. VETtrak Help Pages. Links to the VETtrak help pages have been fixed. From anywhere within VETtrak you can now continue to use the F1 key or the ? button at the top of a wizard or the application to open the VETtrak knowledge base. ticket_content.ticket_description: Scheduling is being done for students and then a call up notice issued but then some of the classes are disappearing and somehow removed.  We have at least * examples recently where this is happening for students and is causing issues with their attendance and employers. Your advise is appreciated.  In the example attached some of the April classes are missing.

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with scheduled classes disappearing for students. This can certainly cause issues with attendance tracking and communication with employers [1].

Based on the information provided, it seems that classes are being properly scheduled initially, but then some of them disappear unexpectedly. There could be a few potential reasons for this:

1. Classes cannot be deleted if attendance has already been recorded for them. If someone tries to delete a class with recorded attendance, it will not actually be deleted but may appear to be missing [1]. To resolve this, you would need to first remove any recorded attendance before deleting the class.

2. An issue or bug could be causing scheduled classes to be unintentionally removed from the system [3]. VETtrak releases regular updates to fix bugs, so ensuring you are on the latest version may resolve the issue.

3. User permissions and security settings could be preventing certain users from viewing or accessing scheduled classes [2]. Double check that all relevant users have the appropriate permissions to view and manage classes.

To troubleshoot this issue, I would recommend the following steps:

1. Check if any attendance has been recorded for the missing classes. If so, remove that attendance first before attempting to reschedule or delete the class.

2. Ensure you are using the latest version of VETtrak by checking for any available updates.

3. Review user permissions and security settings to confirm relevant staff can properly view and manage scheduled classes.

4. Try rescheduling or recreating the missing classes to see if the issue persists.

If the problem continues after trying these steps, please let me know and I can further investigate potential causes or workarounds. Keeping an accurate class schedule is crucial for attendance tracking and communication with students and employers [1][2].

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about the issue with scheduled classes disappearing unexpectedly. This can certainly cause disruptions in attendance tracking and create issues for students and employers [1].

Classes in VETtrak are typically scheduled within an Occurrence by either adding them individually or using the Class Wizard to schedule multiple classes at once [2]. Once scheduled, classes should remain in the system unless they are intentionally deleted or moved.

There could be a few potential reasons why scheduled classes are disappearing:

1. Classes may have been accidentally deleted, either one-by-one or in bulk using the "Delete Selected Classes" option [1]. Deleting classes with recorded attendance is not allowed, so this is likely not the cause if attendance was already recorded.

2. The entire Occurrence containing the classes may have been moved to a different date using the "Move Occurrence" function [4]. This would reschedule all classes to the new dates, so the original class dates would no longer appear.

3. There could be an issue or bug in the system causing scheduled classes to be unexpectedly removed [3].

To prevent accidental removal, I would recommend double-checking that no one is deleting or moving classes unintentionally. You can also check the global preferences to see if any settings related to class management have been changed recently [3].

If the issue persists after verifying the above, I suggest contacting our support team to further investigate this unexpected behavior and determine if there is an underlying issue that needs to be addressed. Please provide specific examples and details to help troubleshoot the problem more effectively.

Let me know if you need any other assistance!

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with classes disappearing from students' schedules. This can indeed cause issues with attendance tracking and employer notifications [5].

Classes are typically scheduled for an occurrence (batch of students) through the Programme Manager by adding class details like dates, times, staff, rooms, etc. [2] These scheduled classes then appear on the individual students' schedules in the Student Portal [6].

There are a few potential reasons why scheduled classes may go missing:

1. Classes were deleted or removed from the occurrence schedule [1]. Once attendance is recorded for a class, it cannot be deleted, so this could explain some but not all missing classes.

2. The occurrence itself was moved to different dates, which would shift all associated classes [4]. However, this should still maintain the classes, just on the new dates.

3. A bug or system issue caused classes to be unexpectedly removed [5]. Our team regularly releases fixes for any such issues found.

To resolve the immediate issue, I would suggest reviewing the occurrence schedule in the Programme Manager to verify if the missing classes are still present [2]. If not, you may need to re-add them to the schedule.

Going forward, here are some best practices to prevent this issue:

- Avoid deleting or removing scheduled classes unless absolutely necessary [1]
- Exercise caution when moving occurrences to new dates [4] 
- Keep systems updated to the latest version which includes bug fixes [5]
- Routinely cross-check student schedules against the master occurrence schedule [6][7]

Please let me know if the issue persists after taking these steps. I'm happy to further investigate the specific examples you mentioned. [8]

Kind Regards,

button in the top right. Set a start and end time for your break. This Break time in your class will be deducted from the class duration minutes if the Ded box on the right hand side is ticked.

Changing Classes  Class details can be amended within an Occurrence by right-clicking on the Classes

heading and choosing Change Selected Classes:     This will open the Change Occurrence Classes Wizard:     Within here you can amend many of the details that are entered against a class for as many classes as you require. These details include:   The

Room associated with the class  The assigned

Staff Member  The

Start and

Finish times for the class   You can tick the classes required to be change and select your changed details, press

Next and

Finish to process the change.

Deleting Classes  A class can be removed from an Occurrence by right-clicking on the item and choosing

Delete Occurrence Class. If you require to remove many classes, perhaps due to an error during class creation, you can right-click on the

Classes

heading and select Delete selected classes:     This will open the Delete Occurrence Classes Wizard:     Tick the classes you require to delete, and press Finish to process the deletion. Classes with Attendance

recorded are unable to be deleted - the attendance will need to be removed beforehand.

RELATED: Process: Recording Attendance

Classes

Often you will want to show that an Occurrence is made up of one or more attendance sessions or classes. Classes are useful in that they allow you to record attendance, and allocate a staff member and a room. Adding Classes to an Occurrence  There are several ways to create Occurrence Classes, the simplest way to add a single class is to right-click the

Classes

heading in the Occurrence Details panel, and select

Add class to occurrence:  You can add multiple classes at once by selecting Schedule classes using calender. This will display the standard Class Wizard:      Class starts and finishes on the same day.

This box is ticked by default. Only untick it if you want to record a class that spans more than one day. Set the Class Date for the class itself to occur. The Start and Finish times will be automatically filled in based off the default Class Start and Finish times set up in your Programme Preferences - Adding section of Global Preferences. If you wish, enter a Code to serve as a unique identifier for the Class. Enter a particular Staff Member to be responsible for the class. If you require, you can indicate a particular Room where the Class takes place. Enter a Capacity to communicate the maximum number of people who can attend. Online Class Link is an area where an online learning environment link can be entered if the class is being performed remotely. Class Type can be selected to indicate what kind of class delivery may be used. A Description can be entered for additional information. Once this area is filled out as needed, press

Next.

The next part of the wizard will allow you to configure associate Units with the class:     Tick the units you require, then press Next.

The next part of the wizard will allow you to configure Class Breaks:     Add breaks to your class by using the [+] Add

The pop-ups for action data in the Triggers and Actions Manager will now be scaled if you are using high DPI settings. Triggers on single attendance. An issue causing triggers to not fire when recording a single attendance in the Attendance wizard has been fixed. Report Scheduler changes   Missing "from" email address. If no "Default address to send email from" preference has been set in VETtrak, the email will now be sent "from" the client that the email is being sent to. If the email address is missing, an error will be logged. Email CC/BCC. The Report Scheduler will now also send the report output email to any CC or BCC email addresses that have been specified in the email merge template. Other changes   Licence information. The Registration Key page in Global Preferences will now retrieve and show the type and count of VETtrak licences you have. Quality Assurance signatures. The Quality Assurance manager will now show all signatures that have been added to the QA item for a client event, employer event, attendance, client, training plan unit or unit result recorded in the Trainer Portal. Edit class in Calendar Manager. An "Invalid field name" error that occurs when editing a class in the Calendar Manager has been fixed. The calendar will also now show the class type and capacity. Move classes. You can now move classes, and change the start date of a class, that has attendance recorded, but you still can't change its duration.

Classes with attendance in Foundation Skills programmes still cannot be moved, to prevent issues with previous claims. Staff with type report. A new option to "Show staff with type report" has been added when right-clicking an individual staff type in the Configuration Manager. Notes tab. An issue causing the updated notes not to appear in the Notes tab when changing the notes and then changing tabs has been fixed.

Moving an Occurrence

It may be useful to move an occurrence, along with its enrolments, classes and events, to a different date. VETtrak provides a method of moving an existing occurrence. To do this, locate the occurrence to be moved in the Programme Manager, right-click on the Details node and choose Move occurrence. This will open the Move Occurrence Wizard:       Set the new start date for the occurrence. Tick this box if you want to change the days of the week that the rescheduled classes are held. If you have ticked the box above, select the days of the weeks that the classes can be moved to. If this box is ticked, no classes will be scheduled for the dates listed in the grid below. These dates are set up in the Configuration Manager. The dates listed in the grid are those set up in the Configuration Manager for national holidays, and holidays in the state in which the occurrence is located. Click the Add button to add an extra day that classes are to be excluded from. If you want to schedule classes on any of the excluded days, delete that day from the list. Click Preview class moves to see a list comparing the old and new class dates. Press Next and Finish to process the Occurrence Move. NOTES:   If dates are excluded when moving classes, all classes will be pushed back to the next available date. This may result in an occurrence that has classes scheduled after the end date of the occurrence.

Adding or removing public holidays in the grid only affects the dates of classes for this occurrence. If your organisation has different or extra days that you want classes to always be excluded from, you will need to set these up in the Configuration Manager. Moving an occurrence will also move any enrolled clients to the new occurrence dates.

These reports will now include the Client's Preferred Name if applicable. Capacity. The Class Attendance Report has now been modified, so the Capacity column will display the Capacity set per Class, rather than count Clients per Class. Class Endorsed Date. The Class Roll Report will now include the date the Class was Endorses next to the Trainer Signature field if the 'Trainer Endorsement' checkbox is ticked prior to clicking OK.

Student Portal Schedule

The Schedule shows your classes and events, both past and present. Your schedule details can be imported into your own personal calendar. To do this, click the Subscribe button. Import instructions are provided for Google Calendar, Outlook and Apple iCloud. The Schedule offers three different views:   Calendar - shows both classes and events in a traditional calendar style. Classes - lists only classes occurring during the selected month. Events - lists only events occurring during the selected month. The Calendar is the default view, however your choice is remembered during your session. If you view Classes in the Schedule and then briefly visit your Dashboard, Classes will still be selected when you return to the Schedule. Each of the three views provided by the Schedule can be navigated by month using the buttons for previous , Current month and next . The selected view is remembered while browsing months. In all views, clicking a class or event will open a pop-up containing further details. Schedule - Calendar     Features of the Calendar:   Today is highlighted on the calendar, typically in a pale yellow. Click an event or class to view further details. Schedule - Classes       The number of classes for the month are displayed in parentheses by the heading. Click on a course, or click Actions and choose View class from the menu to show the Class Details pop up.

Schedule - Events The number of events for the month are displayed in parentheses by the heading. Click on an event to show the Event Details pop up. Click Actions to view files or notes and, if enabled, upload files to the event. Pop-ups  Class Details      Details for the class are displayed by default. Map - shows a google map of the location. Units - lists the units associated with the class. Tasks - list of tasks related to the class. Event Details       Actions are available from the Event Details pop up, and function the same as from the Events list.

Viewing the Student Schedule in the Trainer Portal

Click on the Schedule tab in the Student overview screen to see the student's calendar, classes and events. Calendar  The Calendar tab shows a calendar with all of the student's classes and events, a month at a time. Colour coding is used to make it easy to distinguish between classes and events. Click the arrows to go to the previous or next month, or click Current month to return to this month. Classes  The Classes tab shows a chronological listing of the student's classes, a month at a time. Click the arrows to go to the previous or next month, or click Current month to return to this month. Tick one or more classes to record attendance against those classes, or  Click the Actions link to see actions available to perform on a single class. Events  The Events tab shows a chronological listing of the student's events, a month at a time. Click the arrows to go to the previous or next month, or click Current month to return to this month. Click the Actions link to view event details or edit the event.

Record attendance for clients:

This will display the Occurrence Class Attendance

wizard:        The specific Class you are entering details for currently will be displayed here. Select your Attendance Type to indicate the type of attendance to be recorded (Absent, Present, etc). If you have configured Attendance Reasons you can now select the appropriate one here. The Fill Down button  is designed to apply a change in bulk based off what you have selected in a particular area. For example, if you press the Fill Down button next to the current selected Attendance Type, it will enter that particular Attendance Type against all ticked Clients in the bottom grid. Enter the Time and Dates that reflect the attendance period. For classes that begin and end on the same day, you will be prompted to make sure the Start and Finish dates match. NOTE: If the start and finish time of the attendance overlap a Break time in the class the portion of the overlapping time will be deducted from the duration minutes. The Status Summary will display a key of any errors that need amending  Bulk Select allows you to choose particular clients you wish to apply an Attendance update to, by way of using the following preselected criteria:     Fill all fields down to ticked rows will apply all selected items (Attendance Type/Reason, Dates and Times) to all valid Clients in the bottom grid. Clear ticked rows will remove pending entered items (Attendance Type/Reason, Dates and Times) from any Client ticked in the bottom grid.

The bottom grid will display all Clients that are attached to this class that can/will be updated. Review Error details within this area by expanding the coloured Status box on the left hand side. You can then commit the changes by pressing Next.

Recording attendance: Prevent the accidental navigation away from recording student attendance with a prompt. Extend logout: A new modal prompt to continue the session will now appear before session automatically logging you out. Ignoring the modal will result in a logout at the end of the count down period. Showing Classes information on dashboard: Greater control of the classes that are shown on the dashboard is now configurable through the Trainer portal global preferences View tab. Help info box content:    Distributed files action menu: Where an action menu contains both a standard file/web link and the distributed version. The menu is now separated to prevent confusion. Bug fixes    Class manager: Unit results and result tasks modal checkbox object for "Select all class" includes units/tasks checkboxes that are at the occurrence level. QA entity security settings when off and QA global settings on causes portal failure. Choose a file type when adding files to a client event. Edit training plan not showing unit information. Merge template SMS sending multiple messages. Default file type not pre-selected in upload file modal. Can not edit existing class attendance. Class lists are now filtered to active enrolments by default.

to selected students. Record attendance for selected students. Record task status for selected students. Record results for selected students. Flag these students for follow-up. Record an Event for select Students. If no students are selected, these buttons will by greyed out, and will not function. Student List  Within this section, you can view the list of student(s) within this class, whether they are direct attendants, or managed as an 'Ad Hoc' attendee. Recorded Attendance

will be displayed here under the 'Attendance' heading. The Signed section will display whether or not a Signature has been recorded for this student. Click on Actions

next to a student

to perform a number of functions on an individual student:

ticket_content.ticket_title: extra units in occurrence - trying to remove them. #38286
ticket_content.ticket_description:
Good morning

We have an occurrence that has extra units in it that are not required. This was discovered on a previous call I placed for support with VETTrak support.
I was advised to remove these units from any students that have been granted them through this occurrence and then remove them from the occurrence.
I cant remove them from * students because they have received these units as credit transfers.
In the image below you can see that units BSBWHS***, PSPGEN*** and PSPGEN*** are all listed under the occurrence for Group **B. The only unit should be PSPWPI***.

[cid:image***.png@**D****C.********]

I have been able to remove these extra units from Group **B students by clicking on the units that shouldn't be attached to PSPWPI*** and selecting Remove unit/module.
However, in the student example below the unit BSBWHS*** cant be removed probably because it says Credit Transfer linked enro. The option to Remove unit/module is greyed out.

[cid:image***.png@**D****C.CE**CFC*]

[cid:image***.png@**D****C.CE**CFC*]

Can you please advise how I can remove this unit from this occurrence for this student?
[cid:image***.png@**D****C.F*D*****]

Please let me know if you require any further information.
Thank you & kind regards

******************
a/RTO Services Officer | SafeWork NSW RTO | Business Capability Team
Regulatory Engagement  | Better Regulation Division
Department of Customer Service

***********************<*******************************>

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the extra units in the occurrence. I understand your need to remove these units from both the occurrence and any students who have received them, including those granted as credit transfers [1].

To remove units from an occurrence, you can follow the steps outlined in reference [2]. This will allow you to remove any units that were mistakenly added to the occurrence.

For students who have received the extra units as credit transfers, the option to remove the units directly may be greyed out. In this case, you can utilize the process of linking and unlinking units from the student's award [1]. By unlinking the extra units from the award, they will no longer be associated with that student's enrolment, effectively removing them.

If you encounter any difficulties during this process, you can also consider transferring the student's enrolment to a new occurrence that contains only the correct units [3]. This will create a fresh enrolment without the extra units carried over.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance or have additional questions.

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the extra units added to the occurrence. I understand the concern about having unnecessary units listed, especially if new students may get enrolled into them accidentally.

To remove units from an occurrence that have already been credit transferred to some students, you can follow these steps:

1. Open the occurrence and go to the Units tab [1].
2. Select the units you want to remove and click "Unlink selected units" [1]. This will remove the link between the units and the occurrence, but will not affect any existing enrolments.
3. For any new enrolments created after this, the unlinked units will not be included by default [2].

As for the students who have already received the units through credit transfer, those enrolments will remain as-is [1]. However, by unlinking the units from the occurrence, you can prevent any new accidental enrolments into those units.

Please note that if you need to completely remove the credit transferred units from certain students' records, you would need to follow a separate process of resetting or withdrawing those unit enrolments. But for now, unlinking from the occurrence should address the immediate issue.

Let me know if you have any other questions!

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the extra units in the occurrence. I understand the situation where unwanted units were added to an occurrence, and you need to remove them, particularly the BSBWHS*** unit that is marked as a credit transfer.

To remove the credit transfer unit from the student's enrolment, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to the student's enrolment in the occurrence and right-click on it.
2. Select "Transfer enrolment" from the menu [3].
3. In the Transfer Enrolment Wizard, select the same occurrence that the student is currently enrolled in.
4. On the next screen, untick the BSBWHS*** unit so that it is not included in the transfer.
5. Complete the wizard to finalize the transfer.

This will essentially create a new enrolment for the student in the same occurrence, but without the BSBWHS*** unit. The original enrolment with the credit transfer unit will be cancelled.

Alternatively, you can use the "Link and un-link units from this enrolment" option [1] to remove the BSBWHS*** unit from just that student's enrolment, without affecting other students.

If you face any issues or have further questions, please let me know. I'll be happy to assist you further.

Thank you,

related_knowledge.content:
Linking and Unlinking Units to an Award

Within VETtrak you may wish to only associate specific units from an Enrolment to a particular client Award. This can be done to affect what units display on a particular Award Report when it is generated. You can add or remove units from the award by clicking on the linked award enrolment and selecting Link and un-link units from this enrolment: This will display the Award unit link wizard:      Within here you can tick or untick particular units to add/remove them from the association with the award.

The Withdrawal wizard will now show an error if you attempt to withdraw a unit that has a completed-type result. If you need to do this, you should reset the result first. Delete linked unit. The "Delete unit" option is now disabled when right-clicking a linked unit. The unit should be deleted from the main enrolment. XSLX files in Unit Result Importer. The Unit Result Importer can now import data from XLSX files. Training package field of education. When importing training packages, the field of education for new units is now populated from the TGA data, without having to use the "Update AVETMISS details" wizard. Other changes   Archiving options in Configuration Manager.The following records in the Configuration Manager can now be archived:  Delivery strategies  Classifications (for positions)  Employer types  Location loadings  Task categories    Moved Utility menu options.Some options in the Utility menu have been moved:  "Report Mapping" has been moved to the Report menu. "Setup Invoice and Receipt Reports" has been moved to the Report menu. "Sent email register", "Sent SMS register" and "Retrieve SMS replies and receipts" have been moved to a new "Messaging" submenu in the Utility menu. State in Contract wizard. The state field in the Contract wizard has been moved. The Contract wizard will now reconfigure itself to suit the state selected in the wizard (instead of the state selected at the top of the VETtrak screen). Duplicate qualification.

Process: Transfer an Occurrence Enrolment (inc. Payments)

There may be a situation where a student has enrolled to complete training via a particular Occurrence, but their situation changes and they require to move to another occurrence within your VETtrak. There is a short list of processes that need to correctly performed to ensure that all information is migrated correctly.

Transferring an Occurrence Enrolment  Here is an example of an Occurrence Enrolment, that has had an Invoice created - this invoice has had a payment processed for $100.00 - this amount will need to be migrated during the process. To begin the process of transferring the enrolment, right click on the students Enrolment and select the Transfer enrolment option:     If the student has results recorded, you will receive a message stating the following:

Results can not be transferred.

You will need to remove the existing results in order to proceed. If you require to re-enter the results once the transfer is completed, you can run and save an Enrolment Report for the client prior to transferring them to have an on-hand record of what was previously entered. This will open the Transfer Enrolment Wizard. This displays a list of valid future dated

occurrences that can be selected to move the Student to.

Filter the available Occurrences using the Date Range options  The Transfer Date will mark the official date the student is considered transferred, and can be used to remove the student from any future scheduled classes they are enrolled in from the current occurrence. Select the Occurrence you wish to transfer the student to

from the generated list. Once you have finalised the details in this area, press

next and

finish to progress.

Occurrence Importer  A basic occurrence importer has been added which can be accessed from the Import section of the Utility menu. The new importer supports occurrence fields and some relationships. Compliance  Vic   VIC AVETMISS performance. Some performance improvements have been made to VIC AVETMISS generation when calculating client fees to report. NSW   Fee Exemption. An entry has been added for the ‘OS’ code for an outreach officer's engagement for NSW ACE, if it doesn't already exist. Provider Calculator Export - PAS number format. The NSW Provider Calculator Export Wizard has been updated to format the PAS Number as 10 digits padding the value with leading 0's as required. LMS  Unenrol from LMS. When using the unenrol from LMS enrolment menu in VETtrak, the wording of the warning has been modified to make it clearer that proceeding may cause data to be removed from the LMS. Catapult result transfer - Unit start date. The Catapult results transfer has been modified so that a unit start date will only be modified if the unit's existing start date is empty, or the unit's existing result is blank or Not Yet Started (outcome code 85 or 105). Finance  Finance integration. Added configurable default values for including new invoices and payments in finance system transfers. General    Email Template CC/BCC. The positions of the CC and BCC Add buttons have been fixed in the Email Template wizard. Occurrence Results Wizard.

Removing VETtrak Enrolments from FinPa

A VETtrak enrolment that has been transferred to FinPa can later be removed from FinPa by right-clicking on the enrolment and selecting Remove enrolment from FinPa LMS. (This option will only appear in the menu if the enrolment has been transferred to FinPa.) The wizard will automatically have "entire qualification" or "individual units" selected, depending on which was transferred to FinPa to begin with. A validation error will occur if you try to select the option that was not transferred to FinPa. When removing individual units, you can select one or more units to remove.

When duplicating occurrences, a new tickbox allows you to choose whether to duplicate all FileTrak links, and document database documents, associated with the occurrence and training plan, and any classes, costs and events in the occurrence. Move occurrence changing end date. If you use the Move Occurrence wizard to move classes beyond the end date of the occurrence, VETtrak will now ask whether you wish to also update the occurrence's end date to the new end date of the last class. Deleting enrolments with payment history. You can now delete enrolments, or enrolled units, that have any payment history recorded against it. QLD PAS number. The "Contract/schedule number" field in the QLD Enrolment wizard has been renamed to "Pre-qualified Supplier No (PAS)". Create contracts from profile. The menu option Create -> "Profile Contracts" has been renamed to "Contracts from Profile". Profile enrolled unit history. Enrolled unit history is no longer duplicated when creating contracts from profiles. Rounding errors. An issue that could, on rare occasions, cause the payment flag of an enrolment to be set to "paid in full" when it has multiple positive and negative payments that should add up to 0, has been fixed. A similar rounding error that could cause $0 amounts to be sent to holding has also been fixed. USI changes   Locate USI improvements.The Locate USI function has been improved to make it much easier to use.

When recording occurrence results for a unit, VETtrak will now validate that you are not recording the same result more than once for the same client in the same unit. This can occur if you are using linked enrolments, causing the same client to appear more than once in the wizard. This is to assist when recording results for dual qualifications. Changing occurrence status. When marking an occurrence complete and applying this status change to the enrolments in the occurrence, the status of cancelled enrolments will no longer be changed. Similarly, using the tickbox on the last page of the occurrence wizard to apply all the occurrence settings to the enrolments will no longer update the status of any cancelled or complete enrolments in the occurrence. Programme Manager filtering. In the Programme Manager, displaying occurrences by employer (available in Premium modules) now also includes occurrences where the employer is linked (not just bookings). An issue with the location filter has also been fixed. Enrolling from waitlist with notes. When enrolling a client into an occurrence from the waitlist, any notes that were entered against the waitlist entry will now be carried forward onto the new enrolment. Publishing cancelled occurrences. It is no longer possible to web-publish a cancelled occurrence in the Programme Manager. Adding occurrence units with points.

Selecting this shows a new Link Occurrence Units and Classes wizard that has a grid of all classes and all units in the occurrence, with a tickbox for each combination, and allows you to easily link or unlink units and classes by toggling the tickboxes. Link units to classes from training plan. A new "Reassign all units to classes based on the planned dates of the training plan" tickbox has been added to the last page of the Training Plan wizard for an occurrence. Ticking this will change/replace the links between all units and classes in the occurrence so that any classes that overlap the training plan date range of a unit will be linked together, and those that do not are not linked together. VETtrak will show the Link Occurrence Units and Classes wizard so you can review the proposed links and make adjustments (note though that those manual adjustments will not be retained if you tick the box again in future). This is useful if you make extensive use of training plans for occurrences and want it to reflect in the unit/class links, especially if you are using the Trainer Portal. Bulk update occurrence dates. When querying for Occurrences in Data Insights, you can now perform the "Update dates" bulk action. This has an additional tickbox to "Update all active enrolments in the occurrences to the same dates". This allows you to change the start and/or end date of all the selected occurrences, and optionally all the active enrolments in them by ticking the box.

Process: Adding Units to VETtrak

Units

can be

imported into VETtrak by way of importing the Training Package that contains them. This serves to

access range of units as dictated by the Training Package itself, and allows you to then create a qualification to utilise these units. You can also manually add individual units should you require. Adding Units via Importing a Training Package  Adding a Unit to VETtrak Manually     Adding

Units via Importing a Training Package  To start, select the Manage menu within VETtrak, and select Qualifications:  Within here, right click on the heading that says Training Packages and select the option Import/Update Packages from TGA:   This will display the Import Package from TGA Wizard - And will load a list of available Training Packages:    To select a Training Package to import, put a tick in the box on the left-hand side:    If you are unsure what Training Package you require to import the specific units you require, we recommend utilising an online resource like the website training.gov.au to search for the unit and view it's parent Training Package. Once you have selected the Training Package you require, press the Import/Update Selected Packages button to begin the process:    Once this has completed, you will see the following message:    Within your Qualification Manager, if you expand your Training Packages heading, you will see your newly imported package:    If you expand

this heading, and then expand the units in package heading, you will see your imported units:   You can also quickly search for units on the right hand side of the manager via the Unit Search option:     Adding a Unit to VETtrak Manually  If the unit still does not appear in VETtrak, that would mean that the unit is not yet available to import via this process. To solve this, you can manually input a unit by right clicking on the Units in Package heading and selecting

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about the issue with applying purchasing contracts to occurrences. I understand your concern about the "apply to all enrolments" option applying the contract to cancelled or transferred enrolments as well as current enrolments.

Based on the information in the help documentation, there does not appear to be a specific setting to exclude cancelled or transferred enrolments when applying a purchasing contract to an occurrence [1][2][3]. The "apply to all enrolments" option seems to apply the contract to all enrolments in the occurrence, regardless of their status.

However, you may be able to work around this issue by:
1. Not ticking the "apply to all enrolments" box when applying the purchasing contract. This will allow you to manually select only the current enrolments to apply the contract to [1][2][3].

2. After applying the contract, you can remove it from any cancelled or transferred enrolments by editing those enrolments individually and clearing the contract field [1][2][3].

While not an ideal solution, these workarounds should allow you to apply the purchasing contract only to the desired current enrolments in an occurrence.

I will pass along your feedback to our development team to consider adding a setting or option to exclude cancelled/transferred enrolments when applying purchasing contracts in the future. Please let me know if you have any other questions!

Kind Regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out about the issue with applying purchasing contracts to occurrences. 

Based on the information in the help articles, when applying a purchasing contract to an occurrence and ticking the "apply to all enrolments" box, it will apply the contract to all enrolments in that occurrence regardless of their status (current, cancelled, transferred, etc.) [1][2]. There does not appear to be a setting to limit this to only apply to current/active enrolments.

The suggested approach would be to only tick the "apply to all enrolments" box if you want the contract applied to all enrolments, including cancelled/transferred ones. If you only want it applied to current enrolments, do not tick that box and instead manually select the current enrolments to apply the contract to [1][2].

I understand this may not be the ideal solution, but based on the current functionality it does not seem possible to automatically apply a contract only to current enrolments when using the "apply to all" option. Please let me know if you need any other assistance with this.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with applying purchasing contracts to enrolments in an occurrence.

The references indicate that when applying a purchasing contract to an occurrence, there is an option to apply it to all enrolments within that occurrence [3][1][2]. However, there does not appear to be a specific setting to exclude cancelled or transferred enrolments from having the contract applied.

By default, the "Apply to all enrolments" option will apply the purchasing contract to all enrolments in the occurrence, regardless of their status (current, cancelled, or transferred) [3][1][2].

To work around this, I would suggest applying the purchasing contract individually to each current/active enrolment instead of using the "Apply to all enrolments" option. This will ensure that the contract is only applied to the intended enrolments and not to any cancelled or transferred enrolments.

Alternatively, you could apply the purchasing contract using the "Apply to all enrolments" option, and then manually remove the contract from any cancelled or transferred enrolments afterward.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance or have additional questions.

Kind regards,

If this is ticked, the Enrolment Wizard and Generate AVETMISS will report an error if the funding source for an enrolment says that it requires a purchasing contract, but the enrolment does not have a purchasing contract assigned. Qualification award based on. If you are using Multi-RTO, there is a new validation in Generate AVETMISS to ensure that, if you are reporting a qualification that has an "award based on" qualification set in the Qualification Wizard, that the "award based on" qualification also belongs to the organisation that you are generating AVETMISS for. Large AVETMISS exports. The Excel button on the Generate AVETMISS wizard will now export to a HTML format that supports more than 65,536 rows. You can still open these files from within Excel, as well as opening them in a web browser. Programme manager changes   Ad-hoc clients in classes. It is now possible to add any client to a class in an occurrence and record attendance for them, even if that client is not enrolled in the occurrence. To do so, use the new "Ad-hoc clients" tab in the Add Clients to Occurrence Class Wizard. On this tab, you can search for and select any clients and add them to the class. Clients added in this way are shown with a red person icon and an "(Ad-hoc)" note under the class. Transfer occurrence enrolments. The mechanism for transferring an occurrence enrolment to a new occurrence has been improved.

Recalculate Enrolment Pricing

If you make any changes to the figures for a Funding Model, these changes will not be automatically reflected in enrolments that use the Funding Model - the pricing for each enrolment will need to be recalculated. Rather than editing each enrolment individually, this can be done using the Recalculate Enrolment Pricing Wizard. To open the Recalculate Enrolment Pricing Wizard, go to Utility > Recalculate enrolment pricing. This will display the Recalculate Enrolment Pricing Wizard. Select the State. Select the Funding Source that you want to update enrolments for. Tick the box if you only want to search for enrolments that started within a particular date range, and set the dates. Alternatively, tick this box if you want to find the enrolments from your most recent AVETMISS generation. This will disable all the other search criteria fields. Click Search for enrolments. The grid will fill with all enrolments in the selected state with the selected funding source. If you click on an enrolment, you can see its current pricing here. This is for information purposes only and cannot be changed here. Drag the dotted bar if you need to change the size of the panels to see more clearly. Tick the enrolments that you want to change, or click the Use heading to tick them all. Click Update pricing for selected enrolments.

NOTE: If you have left the Recalculate pricing for units with a claimed date box unticked under Global Preferences > Result Unit and Award Preferences, this process will NOT recalculate pricing for any unit that has already been claimed.

Any NSW Smart and Skilled information from an occurrence is now included when duplicating an occurrence or enrolling into an occurrence. Primary key constraint violation error. A primary key constraint violation error that could occur when changing a NSW enrolment between Smart and Skilled and APL reporting has been fixed. ACT AVETMISS reporting   Reporting contract enrolments. To report contract enrolments in ACT, fill in both the Sequence No and Student File No fields in the Contract wizard. These will be reported in the "Training contract identifier" and "Client identifier - apprenticeships" fields in the NAT120, and the "Purchasing contract identifier" field will be reported empty. Reporting "Skilled Capital" non-contract enrolments. To report non-contract enrolments in ACT, fill in the new "Student File Identifier" field in the Enrolment wizard. This will be reported as the "Purchasing contract identifier" field in the NAT120, and the "Training contract identifier" and "Client identifier - apprenticeships" fields will be reported empty. Purchasing contract in Enrolment wizard. The purchasing contract field in the Enrolment wizard is now disabled in ACT, as it is not used for reporting. Client Personal wizard. The "Student File No" field in ACT has been renamed to "STA Client No", and is no longer used for reporting. Other changes   Statement of fees by occurrence or invoice.

This screenshot is an example of

Nationally Reportable Fields, showing information such as

Delivery Type and (National) Funding Source. Commencing status is used to communicate the Commencing Program Identifier of the enrolment. This serves to identify if the student started their enrolment in the current collection year or in the previous collection year. It can also be used to communicate that enrolment in question is a Unit/Module only enrolment. Press Next to continue. This will display the Enter Pricing Information window. Pricing Information     This area of the Wizard is designed to set up the pricing items that are to be charged for the client enrolments, and may be utilised in your AVETMISS reporting depending on State Requirements. You can Right-click an appropriate heading (Enrolment, Unit/Module, Inventory) to choose an item to be created against that heading, where you can then enter the Amount and GST if you require. An example of the kind of information entered here could be a Course Fee

for the enrolment itself, or Tuition Fee details for the associated units. Pricing Items can be customised to suit whatever requirements you may have, and you can utilise Funding Models to create template based pricing details. These amounts can then be represented on an Invoice should you require. This area can be used in a very broad and flexible manner. Please see our dedicated Help Centre article for more in-depth information: Assigning Pricing And Inventory Items   Press Next to continue. This will display the Enter

Optional Information window. Occurrence Information     Occurrence specific fields:   All Occurrences must belong to a Programme.

If you have already created a Programme for this occurrence, choose it
