Enrolment/result changes   Enrolment profiles. Support for enrolment profiles (without contracts) has been added. Enrolment profiles allow you to take an existing enrolment (with associated units, training plan, tasks, pricing, invoice schedule, events, placements etc) as a template, make modifications to it, and then create new enrolments in bulk from that template. You can right-click a client's non-contract, non-occurrence enrolment (that has a qualification) to create a profile from that enrolment. Enrolment profiles work the same as contract profiles, except they contain one enrolment and do not contain a contract. Enrolment profiles are shown and are editable alongside any contract profiles when expanding a qualification in the Qualification Manager, and the "From profile" option in the Create menu can be used to create enrolments or contracts from the corresponding type of profile. Award eligibility suggestion. When recording results for an individual enrolment, that has a qualification that has "Core units" and/or "Elective units" counts entered, and the total number of completed units is at least the sum of the "Core units" and "Elective units", a message on the Finish page will appear to suggest that the client may be eligible for an award. Pricing surcharges. Basic support for per-pricing item percentage surcharges/discounts has been added.

A new tickbox to "Use Training Plan planned finish date when auto starting unit", ticked by default, has been added to Global Preferences -> Programme Preferences -> Attendance tab -> Automatically start units. If ticked, when auto-starting units due to attendance, VETtrak will use the planned finish date of the unit for the finish date of the result, if it is set and is in the future, instead of calculating a finish date using the "Months in future" setting. Deleting enrolments when deleting contract. When deleting a contract, you can now tick a box in the confirmation message to have VETtrak also delete all enrolments in that contract. If not ticked, the enrolments are detached from the deleted contract as usual. Deleting enrolment invoice check. When deleting an enrolment, VETtrak will now tell you if it cannot be deleted because any part of it has already been invoiced. Enrolment ID display. The title of the Enrolment and Occurrence wizards will now include the enrolment ID in square brackets, when editing an enrolment/occurrence. Finance changes   Schedule Invoice fill down. In the Schedule Invoices wizard, you can now fill the same schedule information to multiple rows in the pricing grid by entering it in the fields at the top of the wizard, ticking Fill on the rows to apply it to, and pressing the Fill Down button. You can tick/untick Fill at the enrolment or unit level to change the tickbox for all price items in the enrolment or that unit.

ticket_content.ticket_title: Article Feedback - Process: Removing/Resetting a Unit/Module Result #39795
ticket_content.ticket_description: Feedback for:  Process: Removing/Resetting a Unit/Module Result  Inaccurate/irrelevant content   I wanted to remove * units from an occurrence and want to know if this can be done without affecting the other results within the occurrence. The article is called "how to remove...." but it doesn't cover that, just how to reset an occurrence

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for the feedback on the article "Process: Removing/Resetting a Unit/Module Result". I understand your concern that the article does not cover how to remove units from an occurrence without affecting other results.

Based on the information available, removing units from an occurrence can be done by following these steps:

1. Go to the occurrence details and right-click on the Units/Modules node [1].
2. Select "Add Unit to Occurrence" and remove the units you want from the occurrence [1].

Alternatively, you can drag and drop units from the Units/Modules node to remove them from the classes they are associated with [3].

Removing units from an occurrence will not affect the results of other units in the same occurrence [2]. The results are specific to each unit, so removing a unit will only remove the data related to that particular unit [4].

However, if you need to completely remove a unit and its associated results from all enrolments within an occurrence, you may need to follow a different process which is not covered in the current article. I will pass your feedback to the documentation team to update the article with more comprehensive information on removing units from occurrences.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance or have additional questions.

Kind regards,

Hi there,

Thank you for your feedback regarding the article "Process: Removing/Resetting a Unit/Module Result". I understand your concern that the article does not cover how to remove units from an occurrence without affecting the other results within that occurrence.

After reviewing our documentation, I could not find a straightforward way to remove units from an occurrence while preserving the existing results for the other units [1]. The closest information is on changing unit types at the program level to allow removing units from enrolments, but this does not directly apply to occurrences [2].

It seems this capability to selectively remove units from an occurrence without impacting other unit results is not currently supported. I will pass your feedback along to our product team for consideration in future updates. In the meantime, if you need to remove units from an occurrence, you may have to reset the results for all units in that occurrence.

Please let me know if you need any other assistance. I'm happy to provide more details or look into alternatives if needed.

Thank you,

Hi there,

Thank you for your feedback on the article "Process: Removing/Resetting a Unit/Module Result". I understand your concern - the article does not cover how to remove units from an occurrence while preserving other unit results.

To remove a unit from an occurrence without affecting other results:
1. Right-click on the Units/Modules node in the occurrence and select "Add Unit to Occurrence" [1]. This will open the Add Unit wizard.
2. In the wizard, select the units you want to remove from the occurrence by dragging them from the list on the left to the right panel [1].
3. Click Finish to complete removing the units.

Alternatively, you can drag and drop units from the Units/Modules node to remove them from specific classes within the occurrence [3]. This allows you to selectively remove units from certain classes while keeping them in others.

The process outlined in the article is for resetting or removing results for a unit, not for removing the unit itself from the occurrence [2]. I understand the title was misleading in this case.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance with removing units from occurrences.

Kind regards,

related_knowledge.content:
Adding Unit/Modules to an Occurrence

Should you require to add additional Units/Modules to an Occurrence after its creation, you can do so by right-clicking on the Units/Modules heading, and selecting Add Unit to Occurrence:     This will open the Add Unit Wizard:     This wizard is very similar to the Add Unit step in the Enrolment Process. Unit Search  To search, type the first few characters of the Unit Code, OR  Tick the checkbox to Expand the Qual Tree and identify the unit this way. Unit/Modules List - This displays the units returned from the search. You can then click and drag units from this list to the right-hand area to select the unit. If you want to select multiple units, hold the CTRL key while left-clicking each unit, or hold SHIFT to select a range. Grouped Unit Type Selection - You can drop down the box and select the relevant grouped units to have them added to the selection Unit list. Selected units/modules - The currently select units. Press Next to continue to the Unit Pricing area:     Within here you can add pricing details if you wish, or you can instead choose to defer adding these details and instead process a Funding Model calculation within the Occurrence instead. Press Next to continue to the Finish Page:     On this page, you can opt to have the Unit(s) Automatically Added to all Enrolments with an Active status within the enrolment. There is also the option to Automatically link enrolments should you wish, with an info box provided to explain this functionality more.

Finish the wizard for the units to be added to the Occurrence.

Process: Removing Core Units From an Enrolment

After you have created an enrolment, you may want to remove some Core units after it has been finalised. This article will go over the process of removing Core units from an enrolment. TABLE OF CONTENTS   Changing the Unit Type  Removing the Unit from the Enrolment     Changing the Unit Type  Under normal circumstances, it is not possible to remove Core units from an enrolment. You will need to change them to Elective units at the Program level to achieve this. To easily get to the Program level of the enrolment that you would like to change, go to the enrolment and click on the link to the Program. Click on the Units option on the left side of the page. There will be a list of units that are used in courses under this Program. You will need to change the Type to Elective on the units that you would like to remove from the enrolment. Click on the Edit button to make changes to the units in the Program. Change the Type on the desired units to Elective and click on the Save button. Removing the Units from the Enrolment  Now that the desired units have been changed to Electives, they can be removed from the enrolment. Go back to the enrolment page and hover over the More tab, click on Electives. This page will contain all Elective units are part of the enrolment, click on the Edit button. There will a list of Available units and a list of Selected units. The ones under the Selected heading are the units that will be part of the enrolment.

Dragging and Dropping Units  If you wish to distribute Units across many classes, a simple way to do this is within the Occurrence Details Panel, by Dragging and Dropping units on to the class they are associated with:       Link Occurrence Units and Classes Wizard  The Link Occurrence Units and Classes wizard allows you to choose which units should be associated with particular classes, by displaying them in a simple grid layout. You can access the Link Occurrence Units and Classes wizard by right-clicking on either the Units/Modules heading or the Classes heading after selecting an Occurrence, and selecting Link Units and Classes. The wizard will display like so:     To associate a Unit with a particular Class, tick the corresponding box within the generated grid. Multiple Units/Classes can be linked in this way. The Use column can associate all units with a particular class. Press Next and Finish to complete the wizard.

Next until you reach the

Select Unit Clusters section:   Within here, tick the

Use box for any Unit Cluster that you wish to be utilised within this Qualification. If a Unit Cluster currently has units assigned to it, you will be unable to deselect the Unit Cluster from this area.

Press

Next and

Finish to apply these Unit Clusters. The

Unit Clusters will now appear under the

Qualification in the Qualification Manager:

Adding Units to Clusters  In the

Qualification Manager, locate the

Qualification you wish to utilise  Expand Units in Package or use the Unit Search to find the relevant units. To search, type the first few characters of the unit code, OR  Tick the checkbox to expand the qual tree and identify the unit this way. Drag and drop the unit(s) onto the relevant Unit Cluster:    If you want to select multiple units, hold the CTRL key while left-clicking each unit, or hold SHIFT to select a range of units. This will associate the Units with the appropriate cluster. You can then select these Units via the cluster at the time of Student Enrolment:

Moving Units Between Clusters  You can move individual Units between clusters by click+dragging them from one cluster to another, however there is also a tool that will allow you to move all units within a cluster to another cluster should you require. Right-click

on the Unit Cluster that you wish to move the units

from, and select

Move All Cluster Units:    In the wizette that appears, select the Unit Cluster that you wish to move the units

to, in the

Move To selection:    This will move all the units to the selected

Unit Cluster:    This functionality can be useful if you are making some fairly drastic changes to the structure of your Clusters. You can

Remove a cluster entirely by right-clicking and selecting the Remove cluster option:    A message will display, explaining that all Units will be removed should you continue:

A new preference for "Only link completed units when creating awards" has been added to the Result Unit and Award Preferences page in Global Preferences. If this is ticked, when adding an award for an enrolment, the unit selection page will only tick units that have a successfully completed result in the enrolment by default. To avoid confusion, the unit selection page has been removed when creating awards for an occurrence, but if the preference is on, only units completed in each enrolment will be linked to the corresponding award. Fee exemption in invoice item merge templates. A new merge field for the fee exemption name has been added to the invoice item enrolment, client occurrence enrolment and enrolled unit pricing merge contexts. Changing Organisation without AVETMISS Values access. If a user does not have Edit access to AVETMISS Values in their Security role, and you have Multi-RTO, the Organisation field is no longer editable in the Enrolment wizard. Inactive staff members in training plan. If you have assigned a staff member in the Training Plan wizard or Enrolment Results wizard and later make that staff member inactive, an issue causing the inactive staff member to not appear in those wizards has been fixed. Occurrence result dates. The Occurrence Results wizard will now give an error in the grid if you untick "Start date" and attempt to record unit results where the existing start date on the unit is after the new "Finish date" entered.

The last-saved filter and display mode will be restored the next time the Programme Manager is opened. Click the "Clear filters" button to turn each filter off and show everything. Clicking "Save filters" after clicking "Clear filters" will cause all filters to be turned off when next opening the Programme Manager. Occurrence Training Plan. The menu option for editing the default training plan for the units in an occurrence has been moved from the Details node to the Units/Modules node. Change classes. When right-clicking the Classes node for an occurrence in the Programme Manager, the "change classroom" and "change staff" wizards have been combined into one "change classes" wizard. A third option has also been added to this wizard, allowing the start and/or finish times of multiple classes to be updated. Change status of occurrence enrolments. A new "Change status of enrolments" option has been added to the menu when right-clicking the Enrolments node for an occurrence in the Programme Manager. This opens a new wizard allowing you to change the status of multiple selected enrolments in the occurrence in bulk. This wizard will also allow you to remove selected clients from, or add selected clients to, the classes in the occurrence if cancelling or re-activating enrolments. Change status in Occurrence wizard.

Process: Adding Tasks to an Occurrence

Tasks can be used to break down particular goals a student may need to achieve in order to progress their training. These can be associated with particular units as a way to track a units completion, and are often representative of assessments. In order for an Occurrence to utilise Tasks, it must first be part of a Programme that is configured to allow tasks. For more information on this option, please view the following article:   Allow Occurrence to have Tasks    To associate tasks with an Occurrence, right-click on the Tasks node within the Occurrence Details panel and select Configure occurrence tasks:     The Occurrence Task Wizard allows you to select tasks for the occurrence and specify which tasks are linked to which units, if required. The first page of the wizard allows you to select tasks for the occurrence, and works in a similar way to the unit selection page of the Enrolment Wizard:       Search for the tasks by code or name, or  Tick the box to search according to the task category. Double-click on the tasks you want to add to the occurrence, or drag and drop them to the right hand panel. When you have selected all the tasks for the occurrence, click Next to move on.

The second page of the wizard allows you to specify which Tasks are linked to which Units:       Click on the Unit View tab, and  Tick the tasks that are to be associated with that unit, or   Alternatively, you can click on the Task View tab, and select the units to associate the task with if this is more efficient - depending on the number of Tasks/Units you may be managing. The tasks associated with the occurrence can now be seen under the Tasks heading:     If you wish to remove a task from the occurrence, this can only be done if there is no activity recorded against that task. If activity has been recorded, you will need to remove that activity before deleting the task (by clearing all fields in the Task Activity Wizard).

This is particularly useful for extending out the end date of occurrences and the enrolments in them. Auto-commence unit after attendance warning. If the "Automatically start units in class when recording attendance" preference is on, and the class is outside the date range of the enrolment, the Attendance wizards will now show a warning message that the units will not be automatically started. Duplicate class. When you are duplicating a class and have a "Copy clients" action of "Enrolment" selected, only clients whose occurrence enrolment has an active-type status are added to the new class. Sorting. You can now correctly sort the "Class start" and "Class finish" columns in the Delete Occurrence Classes wizard. The Occurrence Results wizard now shows the last result type at the start of the "Last result" column, instead of at the end of the "Client" column, so you can sort the grid by last result type. Enrolment/unit changes   Unit expected duration. You can now set an expected duration in days against units in the Unit wizard. If this is entered, when entering a start date for a result or training plan entry for the unit, and the finish date has not been entered, the finish date will be automatically calculated and set based on the start date and expected duration. This may be particularly useful for units that you normally deliver in one day. The Trainer Portal will also use this to default the finish date when recording results.

When recording occurrence results for a unit, VETtrak will now validate that you are not recording the same result more than once for the same client in the same unit. This can occur if you are using linked enrolments, causing the same client to appear more than once in the wizard. This is to assist when recording results for dual qualifications. Changing occurrence status. When marking an occurrence complete and applying this status change to the enrolments in the occurrence, the status of cancelled enrolments will no longer be changed. Similarly, using the tickbox on the last page of the occurrence wizard to apply all the occurrence settings to the enrolments will no longer update the status of any cancelled or complete enrolments in the occurrence. Programme Manager filtering. In the Programme Manager, displaying occurrences by employer (available in Premium modules) now also includes occurrences where the employer is linked (not just bookings). An issue with the location filter has also been fixed. Enrolling from waitlist with notes. When enrolling a client into an occurrence from the waitlist, any notes that were entered against the waitlist entry will now be carried forward onto the new enrolment. Publishing cancelled occurrences. It is no longer possible to web-publish a cancelled occurrence in the Programme Manager. Adding occurrence units with points.

If this is unticked, VETtrak will not update the start dates on any existing results. If it is unticked, you can only select units that already have a start date. Optional occurrence events. You can now right-click an event in an occurrence in the Programme Manager and choose to make it optional or not. An optional event is shown with a green icon and is not copied to new enrolments in the occurrence by default. This allows you to setup some events as belonging to the occurrence, and others that are copied to enrolments in the occurrence. Occurrence unit ordering. When expanding the Units/Modules node for an occurrence in the Programme Manager, the units will now be listed in the sequence order of the training plan for the occurrence (if there is one). Recording unit results from unit in class. In the Programme Manager, you can now right-click a unit that is in a class and record results. This works the same as if you had right-clicked the unit in the occurrence, except that the list of clients is restricted to only those clients that are in the class. Show inactive programmes. If you tick the new "Show archived programmes in the Programme Manager" tickbox in Global Preferences -> Programme Preferences, the Programme Manager will show any programmes that have been archived. Task results for cancelled enrolments. The Occurrence Task Activity wizard will no longer list cancelled enrolments in the occurrence. Count of waitlisted clients.

ticket_content.ticket_title: How to undo an enrolment transfer #41451
ticket_content.ticket_description: Hi,  I hope all is well!   Is it possible to undo a transfer of a session enrolment? We have tried deleting the new 'transferred' enrolment, making the old occurrence active and more.  Kind regards,  *******

response.answer:
Hi there,

Thank you for reaching out regarding undoing an enrolment transfer in VETtrak. Based on the information in our help documentation, it is possible to undo or revert an enrolment transfer [1].

The process for undoing a transferred enrolment involves first cancelling the new "transferred" enrolment, and then reactivating the original enrolment in the old occurrence [2]. Here are the steps:

1. Locate the new transferred enrolment and cancel/remove it.
2. Go to the original occurrence where the enrolment was previously, and reactivate the enrolment there.
3. If the student had any attendance or results recorded in the original occurrence, those will remain intact after reactivating the enrolment.
4. Any payments or invoices associated with the original enrolment will also be reinstated when you reactivate it.

Please note that if the student had results recorded in the new transferred enrolment, those results will be lost when cancelling that enrolment [1]. It is recommended to run an enrolment report before undoing the transfer to have a record of any results entered.

Let me know if you need any further assistance with this process.

Kind regards,

Hi,

Thank you for your enquiry regarding undoing an enrolment transfer in VETtrak.

While VETtrak allows you to transfer an enrolment from one occurrence to another [1], there does not appear to be a built-in function to undo or revert such a transfer after it has been completed [2].

If you need to effectively undo an enrolment transfer, I would suggest the following steps:

1. Create a new enrolment for the client in the original occurrence.
2. Transfer any payments from the enrolment in the new occurrence back to the original enrolment [1][2].
3. Manually re-enter any attendance records or other data from the new occurrence into the original enrolment.
4. Once all data has been transferred back, you can cancel or delete the enrolment in the new occurrence.

Please let me know if you need any assistance with carrying out these steps or have any other questions.

Kind Regards,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out about undoing an enrollment transfer. Currently, there does not appear to be a built-in way to fully undo or revert an enrollment transfer after it has been completed [3]. 

The transfer process seems to be designed as a one-way operation, where the student's enrollment data, attendance records, and any payments are moved from the original occurrence to the new transferred occurrence [1][2]. Any results data does not get transferred over.

To effectively "undo" a transfer, you would likely need to:
1. Cancel the transferred enrollment in the new occurrence
2. Reactivate the original enrollment in the old occurrence 
3. Manually re-enter any attendance, results, or other data in the original occurrence

However, this process does not automatically revert any payment data that was moved during the transfer.

I would suggest reaching out to our support team to get their guidance on the proper way to handle this scenario, as there may be additional complexities depending on your specific situation [3]. They can also log a feature request if the ability to properly undo enrollment transfers in a more streamlined way would be useful.

Please let me know if you need any other assistance!

Kind Regards,

related_knowledge.content: It is now possible to transfer a client who has attendance recorded in classes in the occurrence. When transferring, you are shown the Add Occurrence Enrolment Wizard with the fields pre-populated, allowing you to customise the new enrolment. The client's enrolment in the original occurrence is automatically cancelled, the client is automatically removed from any future classes in the old occurrence, and any existing attendance records in the old occurrence remain. In addition, if the client has an invoice in the old occurrence, it is automatically credited out and the funds moved to holding, which could then be applied to an invoice in the new occurrence. Re-transferring occurrence enrolments. It is no longer possible to transfer an enrolment again that was used as the source of a previous transfer (you can of course still transfer the new enrolment that was the result of the previous transfer). View occurrence in programme manager. A new right-click menu option has been added to occurrences shown in the Client Manager to "View occurrence in programme manager". This will bring up the Programme Manager and automatically search for the occurrence in it. Note that it will show a message if it cannot find the occurrence because the date range in the Programme Manager does not cover the dates of the occurrence. Auto-creating invoices.

Process: Transfer an Occurrence Enrolment (inc. Payments)

There may be a situation where a student has enrolled to complete training via a particular Occurrence, but their situation changes and they require to move to another occurrence within your VETtrak. There is a short list of processes that need to correctly performed to ensure that all information is migrated correctly.

Transferring an Occurrence Enrolment  Here is an example of an Occurrence Enrolment, that has had an Invoice created - this invoice has had a payment processed for $100.00 - this amount will need to be migrated during the process. To begin the process of transferring the enrolment, right click on the students Enrolment and select the Transfer enrolment option:     If the student has results recorded, you will receive a message stating the following:

Results can not be transferred.

You will need to remove the existing results in order to proceed. If you require to re-enter the results once the transfer is completed, you can run and save an Enrolment Report for the client prior to transferring them to have an on-hand record of what was previously entered. This will open the Transfer Enrolment Wizard. This displays a list of valid future dated

occurrences that can be selected to move the Student to.

Filter the available Occurrences using the Date Range options  The Transfer Date will mark the official date the student is considered transferred, and can be used to remove the student from any future scheduled classes they are enrolled in from the current occurrence. Select the Occurrence you wish to transfer the student to

from the generated list. Once you have finalised the details in this area, press

next and

finish to progress.

Right-clicking a unit in a class and pressing R will now record results for the unit in the class, instead of removing the unit from the class. Fill down. An issue causing "filled down" values to not be saved, when clicking the heading of a training plan column in the Enrolment Results wizard, has been fixed. Enrolment changes   Client's enrolments quick view. The "Funding" display has been removed from the client info panel in the Client Manager, and replaced with a button that, when clicked, shows a popup grid listing all the client's enrolments (regardless of type) with important details for each. You can use the buttons in the grid to edit enrolments, record enrolment results, and open an enrolment's occurrence in the Programme Manager. Only add to classes between enrolment dates. A new preference has been added to Programme Preferences -> Adding tab, "Only add clients to classes between enrolment dates". When ticked, when enrolling in an occurrence, any classes that are outside the date range of the new enrolment will be unticked by default on the Classes page. Employee enrolment name filter. When adding employee enrolments to an employer enrolment, a new filter field is available allowing you to search the employee names in the list. Duplicate profiles. A new menu option has been added when right-clicking a contract profile or a VET FEE-HELP profile, to allow you to duplicate the profile. Duplicate occurrence documents.

Transferring Occurrence Enrolments to Moodle

To initiate a manual transfer of enrolments, right click on the Enrolments node of the Occurrence when viewing in the Programme Manager and choose Transfer enrolments to Moodle: Enrolments that have a green Status are able to be transferred to Moodle, the white status indicates that the enrolment has already been transferred and red indicates an issue is preventing that enrolment from being transferred. Clicking on the Status box will provide more details for the Client's transfer status, such as any errors that are preventing them from being Transferred. You are able to fix issues at either the client or enrolment level directly from here by choosing the appropriate option from the Open

dropdown list. Once corrected, the status will be updated to reflect the changes, turning green if the Enrolment is able to be transferred. Use the Transfer button to initiate the push of the enrolment to Moodle. Client Enrolments can also be pushed to Moodle by using the Automatically send new enrolments in this occurrence to Moodle option, when linking the Occurrence to Moodle:

Transferring enrolments to Moodle  Enrolments can be automatically pushed to Moodle when the automatically send has been enabled on an occurrence. To initiate a manual transfer of enrolments, right click on the Enrolments node of the Occurrence when viewing in the Programme Manager and choose Transfer enrolments to Moodle:     Enrolments that have a green Status are able to be transferred to Moodle, the white status indicates that the enrolment has already been transferred and red indicates an issue is preventing that enrolment from being transferred. You are able to fix issues at either the client or enrolment directly from here by choosing the appropriate option form the Open dropdown list. Once corrected the status will be updated if the record is able to be pushed. Use the Transfer button to initiate the push of the enrolment to Moodle. To match an existing student already enrolled into Moodle. Add the VETtrak Client Code to the Moodle User ID field for the student by Editing their profile in Moodle.

Then transfer the enrolment as above, VETtrak will find that users enrolment based on the Client Code and User ID matching:   The following Client Fields will sync with Moodle when a linked client is edited within VETtrak:  Moodle field  VETtrak Field  idnumber  Client Code (CLIE_CODE)  username  Client Username (CLIE_USERNAME)  firstname  Client Given Name (CLIE_GIVEN)  middlename  Client Middle/Other Name (CLIE_OTHER)  lastname  Client Surname (CLIE_SURNAME)  email  Client Email (CLIE_EMAIL)  suspended  Client Is Inactive (CLIE_ARCHIVED)  Note: Upon Editing a Client and making it inactive, the clients Moodle user will be suspended

Removing VETtrak Enrolments from FinPa

A VETtrak enrolment that has been transferred to FinPa can later be removed from FinPa by right-clicking on the enrolment and selecting Remove enrolment from FinPa LMS. (This option will only appear in the menu if the enrolment has been transferred to FinPa.) The wizard will automatically have "entire qualification" or "individual units" selected, depending on which was transferred to FinPa to begin with. A validation error will occur if you try to select the option that was not transferred to FinPa. When removing individual units, you can select one or more units to remove.

Transferring Enrolments from VETtrak to FinPa

Once an enrolment has been created in VETtrak, you then need to transfer it to FinPa so the client can undertake their training in the LMS. This can be done in three ways:   Transfer individual enrolments one at a time. Transfer multiple enrolments in the same occurrence at once. Automatically transfer all new enrolments in an occurrence (web enrolments only).

The last-saved filter and display mode will be restored the next time the Programme Manager is opened. Click the "Clear filters" button to turn each filter off and show everything. Clicking "Save filters" after clicking "Clear filters" will cause all filters to be turned off when next opening the Programme Manager. Occurrence Training Plan. The menu option for editing the default training plan for the units in an occurrence has been moved from the Details node to the Units/Modules node. Change classes. When right-clicking the Classes node for an occurrence in the Programme Manager, the "change classroom" and "change staff" wizards have been combined into one "change classes" wizard. A third option has also been added to this wizard, allowing the start and/or finish times of multiple classes to be updated. Change status of occurrence enrolments. A new "Change status of enrolments" option has been added to the menu when right-clicking the Enrolments node for an occurrence in the Programme Manager. This opens a new wizard allowing you to change the status of multiple selected enrolments in the occurrence in bulk. This wizard will also allow you to remove selected clients from, or add selected clients to, the classes in the occurrence if cancelling or re-activating enrolments. Change status in Occurrence wizard.

The recording of learning outcome results in the Record Results Manager has been fixed. Archive client security. When archiving a client, the availability of the Archive Client dialog options (to remove the client from groups, classes or waitlists) are now properly controlled by security access levels. The same also occurs when changing an enrolment status, in the options to add or remove the client to or from their classes. Employer booking corporate pricing. Employer bookings that are using the "actual employees" calculation method for corporate pricing will now not include cancelled employee enrolments when calculating the actual number of employees in the booking. Add client personal details security. Users who have Add but not Edit access to Client are now able to enter personal details when creating a new client if "Edit personal information for this client" is ticked on the last page of the Client Wizard. Schedule Type Wizard Test button. The Test button on the Schedule Type Wizard will now perform the test with a contract, an enrolment, both a contract and enrolment, or an occurrence, depending on which merge fields are used. Transfer enrolment to booking. VETtrak now allows a client enrolment to be transferred to a booking, as well as to an occurrence. Award report mapping. Clicking the Add button on the award report mappings screen now opens a wizette to fill out. Bulk Staff Changer Use column.

Transferring Enrolled Units from VETtrak to Catapult

Once we have enrolled our clients within VETtrak, we need to tell Catapult that the client is enrolled in the units, and give the client access to the learning materials for those units within Catapult. To start, right-click an Enrolment within VETtrak and select Transfer Enrolment to Catapult LMS:  For an Individual Client:  Within an Occurrence:       Doing this will display the Transfer Enrolment to Catapult LMS Wizard:     Within the wizard that appears, the following fields/options will appear:   Enrolling Client:The name of the enrolled client is shown here. This cannot be changed. Note: If you need to edit the client's details, click the Open button to access the Client Wizard. Assessing Trainer:Select the staff member who will be assess the enrolled units. Note: If you need to edit the staff member, click the handy-button to open the Client Wizard. This button can also be used to add a new staff member. Catapult Username of Enrolling Client/Assessing Trainer: If the student or trainer has a Catapult username, or data is available to generate one, it will be displayed here. If this is the first time this person has been transferred to Catapult, this field will be editable. If the person has already been transferred to Catapult, it will not be possible to edit this field. In the example above, this is the first time that we are transferring an enrolment to Catapult for our student Arthur Bishop, so this field is editable for him.

Good Afternoon

We enrol our students into a rolling occurrence then connect a Training Contract to the occurrence enrolment.  We have had a student that cancelled their training contract but within * months re-enrolled into the same qualification.  Although the original enrolment has been cancelled it won't allow us to enrol her into the occurrence a second time.  I thought I could transfer the original enrolment into an inactive occurrent but where it has units recorded it won't let you.  Do you have any suggestions on the best way to deal with this situation?

Kind Regards,

Student Services Manager

response.answer:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with re-enrolling a student into the same occurrence after their original enrolment was cancelled. I understand the situation and can provide some guidance.

When a student's enrolment is cancelled in an occurrence, the system prevents re-enrolling them into the same occurrence to avoid duplicate enrolments [2]. However, there is a process to transfer the cancelled enrolment to a new occurrence, which will allow re-enrolling the student [1].

Here are the steps to transfer the cancelled enrolment:

1. Open the occurrence and right-click on the student's cancelled enrolment.
2. Select "Transfer enrolment" to launch the Transfer Enrolment Wizard.
3. In the wizard, select a new future-dated occurrence to transfer the enrolment to.
4. Complete the wizard, ensuring any attendance records, payments, etc. are carried over.

This will cancel the original enrolment, transfer it to the new occurrence, and allow you to re-enroll the student into that new occurrence [1].

If the transfer was unsuccessful due to recorded units in the original enrolment, you can try the following:

1. Run an Enrolment Report for the student to save their existing results.
2. Remove any recorded results from the original enrolment.
3. Then attempt the transfer process again.

You can re-enter the results in the new transferred enrolment after completing the transfer [1][4].

If you have any other questions or need further assistance, please let me know.

Thank you,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with re-enrolling a student into the same occurrence after their previous enrolment was cancelled. I understand the situation and have a potential solution for you.

Based on the references [2][1], it seems that the best approach would be to transfer the student's previous enrolment to a new occurrence. This will allow you to create a fresh enrolment for the student in the original occurrence without any conflicts.

Here are the steps you can follow:

1. Create a new occurrence for the same qualification [3]. This can be an inactive or dummy occurrence, as it's only meant to hold the previous enrolment data temporarily.

2. Use the "Transfer Enrolment" option to move the student's previous enrolment from the original occurrence to the newly created occurrence [1].

3. Once the transfer is complete, you should be able to enroll the student into the original occurrence without any issues.

By transferring the previous enrolment to a separate occurrence, you are essentially clearing the way for a new enrolment in the original occurrence without any conflicting data.

Please note that if the student had any results recorded in the previous enrolment, those results will not be transferred to the new enrolment [1]. You may need to re-enter those results manually or run an enrolment report to have a record of the previous results [1].

Let me know if you have any further questions or need assistance with this process.

Thank you,

Hi,

Thank you for reaching out regarding the issue with re-enrolling a student into the same occurrence after their previous enrolment was cancelled. I understand the situation where a student cancels their training contract but wants to resume the same qualification after some time.

Based on the information provided in references [2] and [1], it is possible to transfer an occurrence enrolment to a new occurrence, even if the student has attendance and completed units recorded in the original occurrence. The process involves using the "Transfer Enrolment" option from the right-click menu on the student's enrolment. This will open the Transfer Enrolment Wizard, allowing you to select a new occurrence to transfer the enrolment to.

During the transfer process, any existing attendance records and completed units in the old occurrence will remain intact. However, the student will be automatically removed from any future classes in the old occurrence [2]. If the student had an invoice in the old occurrence, it will be automatically credited out and the funds moved to a holding account, which can then be applied to an invoice in the new occurrence [2][1].

It's important to note that if the student has results recorded in the original enrolment, you will need to remove those results before proceeding with the transfer [1]. You can run and save an Enrolment Report for the client to have a record of the previously entered results, which can be re-entered after the transfer is complete.

Additionally, reference [3] mentions that when recording occurrence results for a unit, VETtrak will validate that you are not recording the same result more than once for the same client in the same unit, which can occur if you are using linked enrolments. This validation helps when recording results for dual qualifications or re-enrolments.

In summary, to re-enroll the student into the same occurrence after their previous enrolment was cancelled, you can use the Transfer Enrolment feature to move the enrolment to a new occurrence, even if the student had completed units in the original enrolment. This will allow you to continue their training from where they left off while creating a new enrolment record.

Please let me know if you need any further assistance or have additional questions.

Kind regards,

related_knowledge.content:

There may be a situation where a student has enrolled to complete training via a particular Occurrence, but their situation changes and they require to move to another occurrence within your VETtrak. There is a short list of processes that need to correctly performed to ensure that all information is migrated correctly.

To begin the process of transferring the enrolment, right click on the students Enrolment and select the Transfer enrolment option:     If the student has results recorded, you will receive a message stating the following:

Results can not be transferred.

You will need to remove the existing results in order to proceed. If you require to re-enter the results once the transfer is completed, you can run and save an Enrolment Report for the client prior to transferring them to have an on-hand record of what was previously entered. This will open the Transfer Enrolment Wizard. This displays a list of valid future dated

occurrences that can be selected to move the Student to.

Filter the available Occurrences using the Date Range options  The Transfer Date will mark the official date the student is considered transferred, and can be used to remove the student from any future scheduled classes they are enrolled in from the current occurrence. Select the Occurrence you wish to transfer the student to

from the generated list. Once you have finalised the details in this area, press

next and

finish to progress.

It is now possible to transfer a client who has attendance recorded in classes in the occurrence. When transferring, you are shown the Add Occurrence Enrolment Wizard with the fields pre-populated, allowing you to customise the new enrolment. The client's enrolment in the original occurrence is automatically cancelled, the client is automatically removed from any future classes in the old occurrence, and any existing attendance records in the old occurrence remain. In addition, if the client has an invoice in the old occurrence, it is automatically credited out and the funds moved to holding, which could then be applied to an invoice in the new occurrence. Re-transferring occurrence enrolments. It is no longer possible to transfer an enrolment again that was used as the source of a previous transfer (you can of course still transfer the new enrolment that was the result of the previous transfer). View occurrence in programme manager. A new right-click menu option has been added to occurrences shown in the Client Manager to "View occurrence in programme manager". This will bring up the Programme Manager and automatically search for the occurrence in it. Note that it will show a message if it cannot find the occurrence because the date range in the Programme Manager does not cover the dates of the occurrence. Auto-creating invoices.

If you have already created a Programme for this occurrence, choose it

from the selection box. If the Programme you want is not in the list, you can click the handy button to the left of the selection box to make a new one. Select a colour to represent the timeline for this Occurrence within the Programme manager. As occurrences are often designed to take place over a set period of time, customising the colour of a particular occurrence can serve to make it easily recognisable at a glance:     Enter a Short Code for the occurrence. This is often an abbreviated identifier of the particular course. (up to 20 characters). This will also display alongside the Occurrence ID in the Programme manager:     You can use this field to enter a longer, more descriptive name specific to this occurrence. The Enrolled field will populate based off the number of Clients enrolled into the occurrence, and will remain blank during the creation process. Once an Occurrence is created, it will generate a unique Occurrence ID that is used to identify this occurrence specifically. The Minimum

and Maximum Clients section can be used to communicate what the required/maximum numbers of students may be for this occurrence. The system will also present an alert should you attempt to enrol more than the maximum number of students into the occurrence. Online Class Link is an area where an online learning environment link can be entered if the occurrences classes are being performed remotely. The rest of this wizard page is dedicated to

Optional Information. This area can be used to enter additional details that are relevant to the occurrence and may serve to benefit your own administration processes. Noteworthy fields in here include details such as the ability to

attach an Employer with a Contact to the Occurrence,

the option to record a Referral Source and

an area that can be used to attach Enrolment Staff to the occurrence. In the bottom left hand side of this window, press the

When recording occurrence results for a unit, VETtrak will now validate that you are not recording the same result more than once for the same client in the same unit. This can occur if you are using linked enrolments, causing the same client to appear more than once in the wizard. This is to assist when recording results for dual qualifications. Changing occurrence status. When marking an occurrence complete and applying this status change to the enrolments in the occurrence, the status of cancelled enrolments will no longer be changed. Similarly, using the tickbox on the last page of the occurrence wizard to apply all the occurrence settings to the enrolments will no longer update the status of any cancelled or complete enrolments in the occurrence. Programme Manager filtering. In the Programme Manager, displaying occurrences by employer (available in Premium modules) now also includes occurrences where the employer is linked (not just bookings). An issue with the location filter has also been fixed. Enrolling from waitlist with notes. When enrolling a client into an occurrence from the waitlist, any notes that were entered against the waitlist entry will now be carried forward onto the new enrolment. Publishing cancelled occurrences. It is no longer possible to web-publish a cancelled occurrence in the Programme Manager. Adding occurrence units with points.

This is particularly useful for extending out the end date of occurrences and the enrolments in them. Auto-commence unit after attendance warning. If the "Automatically start units in class when recording attendance" preference is on, and the class is outside the date range of the enrolment, the Attendance wizards will now show a warning message that the units will not be automatically started. Duplicate class. When you are duplicating a class and have a "Copy clients" action of "Enrolment" selected, only clients whose occurrence enrolment has an active-type status are added to the new class. Sorting. You can now correctly sort the "Class start" and "Class finish" columns in the Delete Occurrence Classes wizard. The Occurrence Results wizard now shows the last result type at the start of the "Last result" column, instead of at the end of the "Client" column, so you can sort the grid by last result type. Enrolment/unit changes   Unit expected duration. You can now set an expected duration in days against units in the Unit wizard. If this is entered, when entering a start date for a result or training plan entry for the unit, and the finish date has not been entered, the finish date will be automatically calculated and set based on the start date and expected duration. This may be particularly useful for units that you normally deliver in one day. The Trainer Portal will also use this to default the finish date when recording results.

that it is not clear that the second enrolment in the unit occurs after the first enrolment in the unit has been

completed.

This reject will generate a negative claim to retrieve any amounts previously paid for this instance of the

unit of competency/subject enrolment.Yes

18 TOID on the DELTA agreement does not exist or does not match the TOID of the RTO on the enrolment

record.

This Reject replaces previous content validations 120309, 120310 and 120531.No

10 Claim amount is zero because maximum allocation has been exceeded.

Skills for Victoria and ATTP claims: - The claim has a zero dollar figure associated with it as the maximum

hours paid for this program or unit of competency/subject has either already been claimed and paid or has

a status of Pending.

PETP claims: - All the Scheduled Hours funded for either the submission or the unit of competency/subject

has either already been claimed and paid or has a status of Pending.

This reject will generate a negative claim to retrieve any amounts that have been overpaid previously for

this claim before changes to the underlying data triggered this Reject.No

28 Associated Program ID has been reported but there is no previous claim for the same student, associated

program and Contract ID

This reject will get triggered when an RTO reports a superseding enrolment but the superseded enrolment

was not funded under VTGYes

27 A valid outcome hasn’t been reported in required time frame (90 days from completion).

This reject will get triggered when an RTO does not report a valid outcome Identifier and more than 90 days

have pass since the subject end date.Yes

30 A superseded Program has been reported for which the training activity is past the STED.

As Programs are superseded or deleted, Victoria will set a maximum funded transition period within which

providers need to transition the enrolment into the new superseding Program. If providers chose not to do

This should be set as the date when the student is scheduled to complete, or did complete, supervised training and assessment. This is mandatory for non fee-for-service reportable enrolments continuing into 2016 or later. It defaults to the enrolment end date. It is reported in a new field in the NAT130 file. Bulk update PUSH/PSTACD. A new Utility menu -> VIC utilities -> "Bulk update PUSH/PSTACD" option has been added. This allows you to find a set of enrolments using a range of search criteria, and then update or recalculate the PUSH, and/or update the PSTACD, for individual enrolments or in bulk for selected enrolments in the grid. Before your first 2016 AVETMISS generation, you can use this to set the PUSH and PSTACD for 2016 enrolments in bulk. Superseded qualifications.When a qualification is superseded and a client is transitioned to a superseding qualification, it is now required for you to report that the enrolment in the new qualification supersedes the enrolment in the old qualification. In addition, units that were partially completed in the old qualification, and continue in the new qualification, need to be reported as withdrawn in the old enrolment, and the hours for the same unit in the new enrolment adjusted to subtract the withdrawn hours. To do this:  Create the new qualification in the Qualification Manager if it doesn't already exist. Edit the old qualification in the Qualification Manager, and set the status field to "Non-current".

Change Occurrence Enrolled Units

Occurrences are designed to manage details in across a group - the option to change enrolled unit fields allows you to have more control over details that may differ from unit to unit, or enrolment to enrolment within your Occurrence. This specifically allows you to update the unit hours, delivery modes, release number, or reportability for that unit in selected enrolments in the occurrence in bulk. To access this option, Expand the Units/Modules Heading and Right-click on a Unit:     This will display the Change Occurrence Enrolled Units Wizard:      Select the Field to Change, including the unit hours, delivery modes, release number, or reportability for that unit. Select the new value for the chosen field. This will be applied upon finishing the wizard. Select the applicable Student Enrolments in the particular unit. Press Next to progress the wizard. If you require for this change to be applied to the Occurrence itself, you can tick the Make the same change to the occurrence unit (to apply to future enrolmnets) option. Press Finish to complete the process.

If this is ticked, the Enrolment Wizard and Generate AVETMISS will report an error if the funding source for an enrolment says that it requires a purchasing contract, but the enrolment does not have a purchasing contract assigned. Qualification award based on. If you are using Multi-RTO, there is a new validation in Generate AVETMISS to ensure that, if you are reporting a qualification that has an "award based on" qualification set in the Qualification Wizard, that the "award based on" qualification also belongs to the organisation that you are generating AVETMISS for. Large AVETMISS exports. The Excel button on the Generate AVETMISS wizard will now export to a HTML format that supports more than 65,536 rows. You can still open these files from within Excel, as well as opening them in a web browser. Programme manager changes   Ad-hoc clients in classes. It is now possible to add any client to a class in an occurrence and record attendance for them, even if that client is not enrolled in the occurrence. To do so, use the new "Ad-hoc clients" tab in the Add Clients to Occurrence Class Wizard. On this tab, you can search for and select any clients and add them to the class. Clients added in this way are shown with a red person icon and an "(Ad-hoc)" note under the class. Transfer occurrence enrolments. The mechanism for transferring an occurrence enrolment to a new occurrence has been improved.

Press Next to continue. This will display the second page

of the Add Occurrence Enrolment Wizard:      It is important to note: This page, and many others within this wizard will not prompt you to enter any details. This is because the information displayed in these fields is being derived from the Occurrence itself. As you progress through the wizard you need only check to make sure the details are correct as you continue, or enter additional information should you require.

Press Next to continue. If the Show unit list box is ticked, This will display the Unit Selection window. If you want tailor the Units to be added to the enrolment(s), you can tick and untick them as required. The unit list will display all units that were attached to the Occurrence. If a particular unit is not present in this list, it will first need to be added to the occurrence prior to enrolling.

Press Next to continue. If the Show class list box is ticked, This will display the Select classes window. Within this screen you can now choose to add/remove classes from the particular occurrence enrolments should you require. To add/remove classes entirely, this will need to be managed within the occurrence itself.

Press Next to continue. If the Show event list box is ticked, This will display the Select events window. Within this screen you can now choose to add/remove events from the particular occurrence enrolments should you require. To add/remove events entirely, this will need to be managed within the occurrence itself.

Press Next to continue. This will display the Set State Based Fields window. As mentioned above, the State Based information in this area will be pre-filled as per the Occurrence settings already entered. You can change details within the screen should you require, and it will only impact the people being enrolled - not the occurrence itself.

I have tried the usual ways to add a unit to both the student and the occurrence, but because it has already been allocated, it s not allowing me to re add. My compliance team have advised the students needs to re enrolled so they can be resulted again as the first result as was competent Could you please assist with how to do this? Ticket Subject: Link the same unit to the original occurrence

Hi Team, We need an urgent support regarding adding the same unit into an enrolment. Scenario: Student *****  **************  has withdrawn the course in **** and now he wished to re engage to the course. All units have been withdrawn in **** so that we could not un withdraw units in the different calendar year. Therefore, I am sending inquiry to see if there is any way we can add those units into the same enrolment again OR should we create a new unreported enrolment, add those units in and link them with the **** enrolment? I am not sure if we do by this way, whether those new units can be reported to SVTS when we link them with the old enrolment? I am looking forward to hearing from you soon.
